ayah.translation: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa Nahnu nazalnaz Zikra wa Innaa lahoo lahaa fizoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa min qablika fee shiya'il awwaleen
ayah.translation: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yaateehim mir Rasoolin illaa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

ayah.transliteration: kazaalika naslukuhoo fee quloobil mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yu'minoona bihee wa qad khalat sunnatul awwaleen
ayah.translation: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law fatahnaa 'alaihim baabam minas samaaa'i fazaloo feehi ya'rujoon
ayah.translation: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

ayah.transliteration: Laqaaloo innamaa sukkirat absaarunaa bal nahnu qawmum mashooroon
ayah.translation: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ja'alnaa fissamaaa'i buroojanw wa zaiyannaahaa linnaazireen
ayah.translation: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hafiznaahaa min kulli Shaitaanir rajeem
ayah.translation: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]

ayah.transliteration: Illaa manis taraqas sam'a fa atba'ahoo shihaabum mubeen
ayah.translation: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

ayah.transliteration: Wal arda madadnaahaa wa alqainaa feehaa rawaasiya wa ambatnaa feehaa min kulli shai'im mawzoon
ayah.translation: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa lakum feehaa ma'aayisha wa mal lastum lahoo biraaziqeen
ayah.translation: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa im min shai'in illaa 'indanaa khazaaa 'inuhoo wa maa nunazziluhooo illaa biqadarim ma'loom
ayah.translation: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.

ayah.transliteration: Wa arsalnar riyaaha la waaqiha fa anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa asqai naakumoohu wa maaa antum lahoo bikhaazineen
ayah.translation: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innnaa la nahnu nuhyee wa numeetu wa nahnul waarisoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la qad 'alimnal mustaqdimeena minkum wa laqad 'alimnal mustaakhireen
ayah.translation: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka Huwa yahshuruhum; innahoo Hakeem 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnal insaana min salsaalim min hama im masnoon
ayah.translation: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

ayah.transliteration: Waljaaanna khalaqnaahu min qablu min naaris samoom
ayah.translation: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qaala Rabbuka lilmalaaa' ikati innee khaaliqum basharam min salsaalim min hama im masnoon
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when your Lord said to the angels, "I will create a human being out of clay from an altered black mud.

ayah.transliteration: Fa izaa sawwaituhoo wa nafakhtu feehi mir roohee faqa'oo lahoo saajideen
ayah.translation: And when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

ayah.transliteration: Fasajadal malaaa'ikatu kulluhum ajma'oon
ayah.translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

ayah.transliteration: Illaaa ibleesa abaaa ai yakoona ma'as saajideen
ayah.translation: Except Iblees, he refused to be with those who prostrated.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala yaaa Ibleesu maa laka allaa takoona ma'as saajideen
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, O Iblees, what is [the matter] with you that you are not with those who prostrate?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lam akul li asjuda libasharin khalaqtahoo min salsaalim min hama im masnoon
ayah.translation: He said, "Never would I prostrate to a human whom You created out of clay from an altered black mud."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fakhruj minhaa fa innaka rajeem
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Then get out of it, for indeed, you are expelled.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna 'alikal la'nata ilaa Yawmid Deen
ayah.translation: And indeed, upon you is the curse until the Day of Recompense."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi fa anzirneee ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fa innaka minal munzareen
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

ayah.transliteration: Ilaa Yawmil waqtil ma'loom
ayah.translation: Until the Day of the time well-known."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi bimaaa aghwaitanee la uzayyinaana lahum fil ardi wa la ughwiyan nahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: [Iblees] said, "My Lord, because You have put me in error, I will surely make [disobedience] attractive to them on earth, and I will mislead them all

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadaka minhumul mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala haaza Siraatun 'alaiya Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "This is a path [of return] to Me [that is] straight.

ayah.transliteration: Inna 'ibaadee laisa laka 'alaihim sultaanun illaa manittaba'aka minal ghaaween
ayah.translation: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna jahannama lamaw'iduhum ajma'een
ayah.translation: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

ayah.transliteration: Lahaa sab'atu abwaab; likulli baabim minhum juz'um maqsoom
ayah.translation: It has seven gates; for every gate is of them a portion designated."

ayah.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee Jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

ayah.transliteration: Udkhuloohaa bisalaamin aamineen
ayah.translation: [Having been told], "Enter it in peace, safe [and secure]."

ayah.transliteration: Wa naza'naa ma fee sudoorihim min ghillin ikhwaanan 'alaa sururim mutaqaabileen
ayah.translation: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yamas suhum feehaa nasabunw wa maa hum minhaa bimukhrajeen
ayah.translation: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

ayah.transliteration: Nabbi' 'ibaadeee annneee anal Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anna 'azaabee uwal 'azaabul aleem
ayah.translation: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nabbi'hum 'an daifi Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

ayah.transliteration: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala innaa minkum wajiloon
ayah.translation: When they entered upon him and said, "Peace." [Abraham] said, "Indeed, we are fearful of you."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo la tawjal innaa nubashshiruka bighulaamin 'aleem
ayah.translation: [The angels] said, "Fear not. Indeed, we give you good tidings of a learned boy."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala abashshartumoonee 'alaaa am massaniyal kibaru fabima tubashshiroon
ayah.translation: He said, "Have you given me good tidings although old age has come upon me? Then of what [wonder] do you inform?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo bashsharnaaka bilhaqqi falaa takum minal qaaniteen
ayah.translation: They said, "We have given you good tidings in truth, so do not be of the despairing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala wa mai yaqnatu mir rahmati Rabbiheee illad daaaloon
ayah.translation: He said, "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord except for those astray?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala famaa khatbukum aiyuhal mursaloon
ayah.translation: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen
ayah.translation: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals,

ayah.transliteration: Illaaa Aala Loot; innaa lamunajjoohum ajma'een
ayah.translation: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

ayah.transliteration: Illam ra atahoo qaddarnaaa innahaa laminal ghaabireen
ayah.translation: Except his wife." Allah decreed that she is of those who remain behind.

ayah.transliteration: Falamma jaaa'a Aala Lootinil mursaloon
ayah.translation: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innakum qawmum munkaroon
ayah.translation: He said, "Indeed, you are people unknown."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo bal ji'naaka bimaa kaanoo feehi yamtaroon
ayah.translation: They said, "But we have come to you with that about which they were disputing,

ayah.transliteration: Wa atainaaka bilhaqqi wa innaa lasaadiqoon
ayah.translation: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Fa asri bi ahlika biqit'im minal laili wattabi' adbaarahum wa laa yaltafit minkum ahadunw wamdoo haisu tu'maroon
ayah.translation: So set out with your family during a portion of the night and follow behind them and let not anyone among you look back and continue on to where you are commanded."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qadainaaa ilaihi zaalikal amra anna daabira haaa'ulaaa'i maqtoo'um musbiheen
ayah.translation: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a ahlul madeenati yastabshiroon
ayah.translation: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala inna haaa'ulaaa'i daifee falaa tafdahoon
ayah.translation: [Lot] said, "Indeed, these are my guests, so do not shame me.

ayah.transliteration: Wattaqul laaha wa laa tukhzoon
ayah.translation: And fear Allah and do not disgrace me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo awalam nanhaka 'anil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: They said, "Have we not forbidden you from [protecting] people?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala haaa'ulaaa'i banaateee in kuntum faa'ileen
ayah.translation: [Lot] said, "These are my daughters - if you would be doers [of lawful marriage]."

ayah.transliteration: La'amruka innahum lafee sakratihim ya'mahoon
ayah.translation: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhazat humus saihatu mushriqeen
ayah.translation: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

ayah.transliteration: Faja'alnaa 'aaliyahaa saafilahaa wa amtamaa 'alaihim hijaaratam min sjijjeel
ayah.translation: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil lilmutawassimeen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahaa labi sabeelim muqeem
ayah.translation: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayatal lilmu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in kaana Ashaabul Aikati lazaalimeen
ayah.translation: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Fantaqamnaa minhum wa innahumaa labi imaamim mubeen
ayah.translation: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad kazzaba ashaabul Hijril mursaleen
ayah.translation: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaahum Aayaatinaa fakaanoo 'anhaa mu'rideen
ayah.translation: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaanoo yanhitoona minal jibaali buyootan aamineen
ayah.translation: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhazat humus saihatu musbiheen
ayah.translation: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

ayah.transliteration: Famaaa aghnaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqnas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaaa illaa bilhaqq; wa innas Saa'ata la aatiyatun fasfahis safhal jameel
ayah.translation: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Rabbaka Huwal khallaaqul 'aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaaka sab'am mnal masaanee wal Qur-aanal 'azeem
ayah.translation: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

ayah.transliteration: Laa tamuddanna 'ainaika ilaa maa matta 'naa biheee azwaajam minhum wa laa tahzan 'alaihim wakhfid janaahaka lilmu 'mineen
ayah.translation: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers

ayah.transliteration: Wa qul inneee anan nazeerul mubeen
ayah.translation: And say, "Indeed, I am the clear warner" -

ayah.transliteration: Kamaaa anzalnaa 'alal muqtasimeen
ayah.translation: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena ja'alul Quraana'ideen
ayah.translation: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

ayah.transliteration: Fawa Rabbika lanas'a lannahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

ayah.transliteration: 'Ammaa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: About what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Fasda' bimaa tu'maru wa a'rid anil mushrikeen
ayah.translation: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kafainaakal mustahzi'een
ayah.translation: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yaj'aloona ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhar; fasawfa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad na'lamu annak yadeequ sadruka bimaa yaqooloon
ayah.translation: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

ayah.transliteration: Fasbbih bihamdi Rabbika wa kum minas saajideen
ayah.translation: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

ayah.transliteration: Wa'bud Rabbaka hattaa yaatiyakal yaqeen
ayah.translation: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).

ayah.transliteration: Ataaa amrullaahi falaa tasta'jilooh; Subhaanahoo wa Ta'aalaa 'ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: The command of Allah is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Yunazzilul malaaa 'ikata birroohi min amrihee 'alaa mai yashaaa'u min 'ibaadiheee an anzirooo annahoo laaa ilaaha illaaa ana fattaqoon
ayah.translation: He sends down the angels, with the inspiration of His command, upon whom He wills of His servants, [telling them], "Warn that there is no deity except Me; so fear Me."

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqas samaawaati wal arda bilhaqq; Ta'aalaa 'ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqal insaana min nutfatin fa izaa huwa khaseemum mubeen
ayah.translation: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.

ayah.transliteration: Wal an 'amaa khalaqahaa; lakum feehaa dif'unw wa manaafi'u wa minhaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lakum feehaa jamaalun heena tureehoona wa heena tasrahoon
ayah.translation: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].

ayah.transliteration: Wa tahmilu asqaalakum ilaa baladil lam takoonoo baaligheehi illaa bishiqqil anfus; inna Rabbakum la Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Walkhaila wal bighaala wal hameera litarkaboohaa wa zeenah; wa yakhluqu maa laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'alal laahi qasdus sabeeli wa minhaa jaaa'ir; wa law shaaa'a lahadaakum ajma'een
ayah.translation: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among the various paths are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazeee anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'al lakum minhu sharaabunw wa minhu shajarun feehi tuseemoon
ayah.translation: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].

ayah.transliteration: Yumbitu lakum bihiz zar'a wazzaitoona wanna kheela wal-a'naaba wa min kullis samaraat, inna fee zaalika la Aayatal liqawminy yatafakkaroon
ayah.translation: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Wa sakkhkhara lakumul laila wannahaara wash shamsa walqamara wannujoomu musakhkharaatum bi amrih; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil liqawminy ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa zara a lakum fil ardi mukhtalifan alwaanuh; inna fee zaalika la Aayatal liqawminy yazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee sakhkharal bahra litaakuloo minhu lahman tariyyanw wa tastakhrijoo minhu hilyatan talbasoonahaa wa taral fulka mawaakhira feehi wa litabtaghoo min fadlihee wa la'allakum tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa alqaa fil ardi rawaasiya an tameeda bikum wa anhaaranw wa sublulal la 'allakum tahtadoon
ayah.translation: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'alaamaat; wa bin najmi hum yahtadoon
ayah.translation: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.

ayah.transliteration: Afamany yakhluqu kamallaa yakhluq; afalaa tazak karoon
ayah.translation: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?

ayah.transliteration: Wa in ta'uddoo ni'matal laahi laa tuhsoohaa; innal laaha la Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu ya'lamu maa tusirroona wa maa tu'linoon
ayah.translation: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yad'oona min doonil laahi laa yakhluqoona shai'anw wa hum yukhlaqoon
ayah.translation: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.

ayah.transliteration: Amwaatun ghairu ahyaaa'inw wa maa yash'uroona aiyaana yub'asoon
ayah.translation: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: Illahukum Ilaahunw Waahid; fallazeena laa yu'minoona bil Aakhirati quloobuhum munkiratunw wa hum mustakbiroon
ayah.translation: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.

ayah.transliteration: Laa jarama annal laaha ya'lamu maa yusirrona wa ma yu'linoon; innahoo laa yuhibbul mustakbireen
ayah.translation: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahum maazaaa anzala Rabbukum qaaloo asaateerul awwaleen
ayah.translation: And when it is said to them, "What has your Lord sent down?" They say, "Legends of the former peoples,"

ayah.transliteration: Liyahmilooo awzaarahum kaamilatany Yawmal Qiyaamati wa min awzaaril lazeena yudilloonahum bighairi 'ilm; alaa saaa'a maa yaziroon
ayah.translation: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

ayah.transliteration: Qad makaral lazeena min qablihim fa atal laahu bunyaa nahum minal qawaa'idi fakharra 'alaihimus saqfu min fawqihim wa ataahumul 'azaabu min haisu laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Those before them had already plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

ayah.transliteration: Summa Yawmal Qiyaamati yukhzeehim wa yaqoolu aina shurakaaa'iyal lazeena kuntum tushaaaqqoona feehim; qaalal lazeena ootul 'ilma innal khizyal Yawma wassooo'a 'alal kaafireen
ayah.translation: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena tatawaf faahu mul malaaa'ikatu zaalimeee anfusihim fa alqawus salama maa kunnaa na'malu min sooo'; balaaa innal laaha 'aleemum bimaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: The ones whom the angels take in death [while] wronging themselves, and [who] then offer submission, [saying], "We were not doing any evil." But, yes! Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what you used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Fadkhulooo abwaaba jahannama khaalideena feeha falabi'sa maswal mutakab bireen
ayah.translation: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeela lillazeenat taqaw maazaaa anzala Rabbukum; qaaloo khairaa; lillazeena absanoo fee haazihid dunyaa hasanah; wa la Daarul Aakhirati khair; wa lani'ma daarul muttaqeen
ayah.translation: And it will be said to those who feared Allah, "What did your Lord send down?" They will say, "[That which is] good." For those who do good in this world is good; and the home of the Hereafter is better. And how excellent is the home of the righteous -

ayah.transliteration: Jannaatu 'Adniny yadkhuloonahaa tajree min tahtihal anhaaru lahum feehaa maa yashaaa'oon; kazaalika yajzil laahul muttaqeen
ayah.translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena tatawaf faahumul malaaa'ikatu taiyibeena yaqooloona salaamun 'alai kumud khulul Jannata bimaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: The ones whom the angels take in death, [being] good and pure; [the angels] will say, "Peace be upon you. Enter Paradise for what you used to do."

ayah.transliteration: Hal yanzuroona illaaa an taatiyahumul malaaa'ikatu aw yaatiya amru Rabbik; kazaalika fa'alal lazeena min qablihim; wa maa zalamahumul laahu wa laakin kaanoo anfusahum yazlimoon
ayah.translation: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Fa asaabahum saiyi aatu maa 'amiloo wa haaqa bihim maa kaano bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena ashrakoo law shaaa'al laahu ma 'abadnaa min doonihee min shai'in nahnu wa laaa aabaaa'unaa wa laa harramnaa min doonihee min shai'; kazaalika fa'alal lazeena min qablihim fahal 'alar Rusuli illal balaaghul mubeen
ayah.translation: And those who associate others with Allah say, "If Allah had willed, we would not have worshipped anything other than Him, neither we nor our fathers, nor would we have forbidden anything through other than Him." Thus did those do before them. So is there upon the messengers except [the duty of] clear notification?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ba'asnaa fee kulli ummatir Rasoolan ani'budul laaha wajtanibut Taaghoota faminhum man hadal laahu wa minhum man haqqat 'alaihid dalaalah; faseeroo fil ardi fanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mukazzibeen
ayah.translation: And We certainly sent into every nation a messenger, [saying], "Worship Allah and avoid Taghut." And among them were those whom Allah guided, and among them were those upon whom error was [deservedly] decreed. So proceed through the earth and observe how was the end of the deniers.

ayah.transliteration: In tahris 'alaa hudaahum fa innal laaha laa yahdee mai yudillu wa maa lahum min naasireen
ayah.translation: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muhammad], indeed, Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqsamoo billaahi jahda aimaanihim laa yab'asul laahu mai yamoot; balaa wa'dan 'alaihi haqqanw wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Liyubaiyina lahumul lazee yakhtalifoona feehi wa liya'lamal lazeena kafarooo annahum kaanoo kaazibeen
ayah.translation: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa qawlunaa lisha y'in izaa aradnaahu an naqoola lahoo kun fa yakoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, Our word to a thing when We intend it is but that We say to it, "Be," and it is.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena haajaroo fil laahi mim ba'di maa zulimoo lanubawwi' annahum fiddunyaa hasanatanw wa la ajrul Aakhirati akbar; law kaanoo ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena sabaroo wa 'alaa Rabbihim yatawak kaloon
ayah.translation: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa min qablika illaa rijaalan nooheee ilaihim; fas'alooo ahlaz zikri in kuntum laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Bilbaiyinaati waz Zubur; wa anzalnaaa ilaikaz Zikra litubaiyina linnaasi maa nuzzila ilaihim wa la'allahum yatafakkaroon
ayah.translation: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Afa aminal lazeena makarus saiyi aati ai yakhsifal laahu bihimul arda aw yaaa tiyahumul 'azaabu min haisu laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?

ayah.transliteration: Aw yaakhuzahum fee taqallubihim famaa hum bi mu'jizeen
ayah.translation: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure?

ayah.transliteration: Aw yaakhuzahum 'alaa takhawwuf; fa inna Rabbakum la Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ilaa maa khalaqal laahu min shai'iny-yatafaiya'u zilaaluhoo 'anil yameeni washshamaaa' ili sujjadal lillaahi wa hum daakhiroon
ayah.translation: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah, while they are humble.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi yasjudu maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi min daaabbatinw walma laaa'ikatu wa hum laa yastakbiroon
ayah.translation: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.

ayah.transliteration: yakhaafoona Rabbahum min fawqihim wa yaf'aloona maa yu'maroon
ayah.translation: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal laahu laa tatta khizooo ilaahainis naini innamaa Huwa Ilaahunw Waahid; fa iyyaaya farhaboon
ayah.translation: And Allah has said, "Do not take for yourselves two deities. He is but one God, so fear only Me."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahoo maa fis samaawaati wal ardi wa lahud deenu waasibaa; afaghairal laahi tattaqoon
ayah.translation: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa bikum minni'matin faminal laahi summa izaa massakumud durru fa ilaihi taj'aroon
ayah.translation: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.

ayah.transliteration: Summaa izaa kashafad durra 'ankum izaa fareequm minkum bi Rabbihim yushrikoon
ayah.translation: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

ayah.transliteration: Liyakfuroo bimaa aatainaahum; fatamatta'oo, faswfa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaj'aloona limaa laa ya'lamoona naseebam mimmaa razaqnnaahum; tallaahi latus'alunaa 'ammaa kuntum taftaroon
ayah.translation: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaj'aloona lillaahil banaati Subhaanahoo wa lahum maa yashtahoon
ayah.translation: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa bushshira ahaduhum bil unsaa zalla wajhuhoo muswaddanw wa huwa kazeem
ayah.translation: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

ayah.transliteration: yatawaaraa minal qawmimin sooo'i maa bushshira bih; a-yumsikuhoo 'alaa hoonin am yadussuhoo fit turaab; alaa saaa'a maa yahkumoon
ayah.translation: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

ayah.transliteration: Lillazeena laa yu'minoona bil Aakhirati masalus saw'i wa lillaahil masalul a'laa; wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law yu'aakhizul laahun naasa bizulminhim maa taraka 'alaihaa min daaabbatinw wa laakiny yu'akhkhiruhum ilaaa ajalim musamman fa izaa jaaa'a ajaluhum laa yastaakhiroona saa'atanw wa laa yastaqdimoon
ayah.translation: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaj'aloona lillaahi maa yakrahoona wa tasifu alsinatuhumul kaziba anna lahumul husnaa laa jarama anna lahumun Naara wa annahum mufratoon
ayah.translation: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.

ayah.transliteration: Tallaahi laqad arsalnaaa ilaaa umamim min qablika fazayyana lahumush Shaitaanu a'maalahum fahuwa waliyyuhumul yawma wa lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa anzalnaa 'alaikal Kitaaba illaa litubaiyina lahumul lazikh talafoo feehi wa hudanw wa rahmatal liqawminy yu'minoon
ayah.translation: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa ahyaa bihil arda ba'da mawtihaa; inna fee zaalika la aayatal liqaw miny yasma'oon
ayah.translation: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna lakum fil an'aami la'ibrah; nusqeekum mimmmaa fee butoonihee mim baini farsinw wa damil labanann khaalisan saaa'ighallish shaaribeen
ayah.translation: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min samaraatin nakheeli wal a'nnaabi tattakhizoona minhu sakaranw wa rizqann hasanaa; inna fee zaalika la Aayatal liqawminy ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

ayah.transliteration: Wa awhaa Rabbuka ilannnabli anit takhizee minal jabaali buyootanw wa minash shajari wa mimmaa ya'rishoon
ayah.translation: And your Lord inspired to the bee, "Take for yourself among the mountains, houses, and among the trees and [in] that which they construct.

ayah.transliteration: Summma kulee min kullis samaraati faslukee subula Rabbiki zululaa; yakhruju mim butoonihaa sharaabum mukh talifun alwaanuhoo feehi shifaaa'ul linnaas, innna fee zaalika la Aayatal liqawminy yatafakkaroon
ayah.translation: Then eat from all the fruits and follow the ways of your Lord laid down [for you]." There emerges from their bellies a drink, varying in colors, in which there is healing for people. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu khalaqakum suma tatawaffaakum; wa minkum many-yuradu ilaaa arzalil 'umuri likai laa ya'lama ba'da 'ilmin shai'aa; innal laaha 'Aleemun Qadeer
ayah.translation: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu faddala ba'dakum 'alaa ba'din fir rizq; famal lazeena fuddiloo biraaaddee rizqihim 'alaa maa malakat aimaanuhum fahum feehi sawaaa'; afabini'matil laahi yajhadoon
ayah.translation: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu ja'ala lakum min anfusikum azwaajanw wa ja'ala lakum min azwaajikum baneena wa hafadatanw wa razaqakum minat yaiyibaat; afabil baatili yu'minoona wa bini'matil laahi hum yakkfuroon
ayah.translation: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

ayah.transliteration: Wa ya'budoona min doonil laahi maa laa yamliku lahum rizqam minas samaawaati wal ardi shai'anw wa laa yastatee'oon
ayah.translation: And they worship besides Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa tadriboo lillaahil amsaal; innal laaha ya'lamu wa antum laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: So do not assert similarities to Allah. Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Darabal laahu masalan 'abdam mammlookal laa yaqdiru 'alaa shai'inw wa marrazaqnaahu mminnaa rizqan hasanan fahuwa yunfiqu minhu sirranw wa jahra; hal yasta-woon; alhamdu lillaah; bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa darabal laahu masalar rajulaini ahaduhumaaa abkamu laa yaqdiru 'alaa shai'inw wa huwa kallun 'alaa mawlaahu ainamaa yuwajjihhu laa yaati bikhairin hal yastawee huwa wa many-yaamuru bil'adli wa huwa 'alaa Siraatim MMustaqeem
ayah.translation: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi ghaibus samaawaati wal ard; wa maaa amrus Saa'ati illaa kalamhil basari aw huwa aqrab; innal laaha 'alaaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu akhrajakum mim butooni ummahaatikum laa ta'lamoona shai'anw wa ja'ala lakumus sam'a wal absaara wal af'idata la'allakum tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Alam yaraw ilat tairi musakhkharaatin fee jawwis samaaa'i maa yumsikuhunna illal laah; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil liqawminy yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu ja'ala lakum min juloodil an'aami buyootan tastakhif foonahaa yawma za'nikum wa yawma iqaamatikum wa min aswaafihaa wa awbaarihaa wa ash'aarihaaa asaasanw wa mataa'an ilaa been
ayah.translation: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu ja'ala lakum mimmaa khalaqa zilaalanw wa ja'ala lakum minal jibaali aknaananw wa ja'ala lakum saraabeela taqeekumul harra wa saraabeela taqeekum baasakum; kazaalika yutimmu ni'matahoo alaikum la'allakum tuslimoon
ayah.translation: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

ayah.transliteration: Fa in tawallaw fa innamaa 'alaikal balaaghul mubeen
ayah.translation: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'rifoona ni'matal laahi summa yunkiroonahaa wa aksaruhumul kaafiroon
ayah.translation: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yawma nab'asu min kulli ummatin shaheedan summa laa yu'zanu lillazeena kafaroo wa laa hum yusta'taboon
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra al lazeena zalamul 'azaaba falaa yukhaf fafu 'anhum wa laa hum yunzaroon
ayah.translation: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra al lazeena ashrakoo shurakaaa'ahum qaaloo Rabbana haaa'ulaaa'i shurakaaa'unal lazeena kunnaa nad'oo min doonika fa alqaw ilaihimul qawla innakum lakaaziboon
ayah.translation: And when those who associated others with Allah see their "partners," they will say," Our Lord, these are our partners [to You] whom we used to invoke besides You." But they will throw at them the statement, "Indeed, you are liars."

ayah.transliteration: Wa alqaw ilal laahi yawma'izinis salama wa dalla 'anhum maa kaanoo yaftaroon
ayah.translation: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena kafaroo wa saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi zidnaahum 'azaaban fawqal 'azaabi bimaa kaanoo yufsidoon
ayah.translation: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yawma nab'asu fee kulli ummmatin shaheedan 'alaihim min anfusihim wa ji'naa bika shaheedan 'alaa haaa'ulaaa'; wa nazzalnaa 'alaikal Kitaaba tibyaanal likulli shai'inw wa hudanw wa rahmatanw wa bushraa lilmuslimeen
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yaamaru bil 'adli wal ihsaani wa eetaaa'i zil qurbaa wa yanhaa 'anil fahshaaa'i wal munkari walbagh-i' ya'izukum la'allakum tazakkkaroon
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa awfoo bi Ahdil laahi izaa 'aahattum wa laa tanqudul aimaana ba'da tawkeedihaa wa qad ja'altumul laaha 'alaikum kafeelaa; innal laaha ya'lamu maa taf'aloon
ayah.translation: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa takoonoo kallatee naqadat ghazlahaa mim ba'di quwwatin ankaasaa; tattakhizoona aimaanakum dakhlalam bainakum an takoona ummatun hiya arbaa min ummah; innnamaa yablookumul laahu bih; wa la yubaiyinanna lakum yawmal Qiyaamati maa kuntum fee takhtalifoon
ayah.translation: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law shaaa'al laahu laja'alakum ummmatanw waahidatanw wa laakiny yudillu many-yashaaa'u wa yahdee many-yashaaa'; wa latus'alunna 'ammaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tattakhizooo aimaanakum dakhalam bainakum ftazilla qadamum ba'da subootihaa wa tazooqus sooo'a bimmaa sadattum 'an sabeelil laahi wa lakum 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allah, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tashtaroo bi 'ahdil laahi samanan qaleelaa; innamaa 'indal laahi huwa khairul lakum in kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.

ayah.transliteration: maa 'indakum yanfadu wa maa 'indal laahi baaq; wa lanajziyannal lazeena sabarooo ajjrahum bi ahsani maa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Man 'amila saaliham min zakarin aw unsaa wa huwa mu'minun falanuhyiyannahoo hayaatan taiiyibatanw wa lanajzi yannnahum ajrahum bi ahsani maa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Fa izaa qara tal Quraana fasta'iz billaahi minashh Shai taanir rajeem
ayah.translation: So when you recite the Qur'an, [first] seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo laisa lahoo sultaanun 'alal lazeena aamanoo wa 'alaa Rabbihim yatawakkaloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.

ayah.transliteration: Innnamaa sultaanuhoo 'alal lazeena yatawallawnahoo wallazeena hum bihee mushrikoon
ayah.translation: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa baddalnaaa Aayatam makaana Aayatinw wal laahu a'lamu bimaa yunazzilu qaalooo innamaa anta muftar; bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And when We substitute a verse in place of a verse - and Allah is most knowing of what He sends down - they say, "You, [O Muhammad], are but an inventor [of lies]." But most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Qul nazzalahoo Roohul Qudusi mir Rabbika bilhaqqi liyusabbital lazeena aamanoo wa hudanw wa bushraa lilmuslimeen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "The Pure Spirit has brought it down from your Lord in truth to make firm those who believe and as guidance and good tidings to the Muslims."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad na'lamu annahum yaqooloona innamaa yu'allimuhoo bashar; lisaanul lazee yulhidoona ilaihi a'ja miyyunw wa haaza lisaanun 'Arabiyyum mubeen
ayah.translation: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena laa yu'minoona bi Aayaatil laahi laa yahdehimul laahu wa lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa yaftaril kazibal lazeena laa yu'minoona bi Aayaatil laahi wa ulaaa'ika humul kaaziboon
ayah.translation: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah, and it is those who are the liars.

ayah.transliteration: man kafara billaahi mim ba'di eemaanihee illaa man ukriha wa qalbuhoo mutmma'innum bil eemaani wa laakim man sharaha bilkufri sadran fa'alaihim ghadabum minal laahi wa lahum 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment;

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahumus tahabbul hayaatad dunyaa 'alal Aakhirati wa annal laaha laa yahdil qawmal kaafireen
ayah.translation: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena taba'al laahu 'alaa quloobihim wa sam'ihim wa absaarihim wa ulaaa'ika humul ghaafiloon
ayah.translation: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.

ayah.transliteration: Laa jarama annnahum fil Aakhirati humul khassiroon
ayah.translation: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.

ayah.transliteration: Summa inna Rabbaka lillazeena haajaroo mim ba'dimaa futinoo summma jaahadoo wa sabaroo inna Rabbaka mim ba'dihaa la Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to renounce their religion] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

ayah.transliteration: Yawma taatee kullu nafsin tujaadilu 'an nafsihaa wa tuwaffaa kullu nafsim maa 'amilat wa hum laa yuzlamoon
ayah.translation: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

ayah.transliteration: Wa darabal laahu masalan qaryatan kaanat aaminatam mutma'innatany yaaateehaa rizquhaa rghadam min kulli makaanin fakafarat bi an'umil laahi fa azaaqahal laahu libaasal joo'i walkhawfi bimaa kaanoo yasna'oon
ayah.translation: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'ahum Rasoolum minhum fakazzaboohu fa akhazahumul 'azaabu wa hum zaalimoon
ayah.translation: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Fakuloo mimmaa razaqa kumul laahu halaalan taiyibanw washkuroo ni'matal laahi in kuntum iyyaahu ta'budoon
ayah.translation: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa harrma 'alai kumul maitata waddama wa lahmal khinzeeri wa maaa uhilla lighairil laahi bihee famanid turra ghaira baaghinw wa laa 'aadin fa innal laaha Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqooloo limaa tasifu alsinatukumul kaziba haaza halaalunw wa haazaa haraamul litaftaroo 'alal laahil kazib; innal lazeena yaftaroona 'alal laahil kaziba laa yuflihoon
ayah.translation: And do not say about what your tongues assert of untruth, "This is lawful and this is unlawful," to invent falsehood about Allah. Indeed, those who invent falsehood about Allah will not succeed.

ayah.transliteration: Mata'un qaleelunw wa lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'alal lazeena haadoo harramnaa ma qasasnaa 'alaika min qablu wa maa zalamanaahum wa laakin kaanoo anfusahum wa laakin kaanoo anfusahum yazlimoon
ayah.translation: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Summma inna Rabbaka lillazeena 'amilus sooo'a bijahaalatin summa taaboo mim ba'di zaaalika wa aslahoo inna Rabbaka mim ba'dihaa la Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Ibraaheema kaana ummatan qaanital lillaahi Haneefanw wa lam yakuminal mushrikeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Shaakiral li an'umih; ijtabaahu wa hadaahu ilaa Siraatim Muustaqeem
ayah.translation: [He was] grateful for His favors. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaahu fid dunyaa hasanah; wa innahoo fil Aakhirati laminas saaliheen
ayah.translation: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Summma awhainaa ilaika anit tabi' Millata Ibraaheema haneefaa; wa maa kaana minal mushrikeen
ayah.translation: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Innnamaa ju'ilas Sabtu 'alal lazeenakhtalafoo feeh; wa inna Rabbaka la yahkumu bainahum Yawmal Qiyaamati feemaa kaanoo feehi yakhtalifoon
ayah.translation: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

ayah.transliteration: Ud'u ilaa sabeeli Rabbika bilhikmati walmaw 'izatil hasanati wa jaadilhum billatee hiya ahsan; inna Rabbaka huwa a'almu biman dalla 'an sabeelihee wa Huwa a'lamu bilmuhtadeen
ayah.translation: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in 'aaqabtum fa'aaqiboo bimisli maa 'ooqibtum bihee wa la'in sabartum lahuwa khairul lissaabireen
ayah.translation: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.

ayah.transliteration: Wasbir wa maa sabruka illaa billaah; wa laa tahzan 'alaihim wa laa taku fee daiqim mimmaa yamkuroon
ayah.translation: And be patient, [O Muhammad], and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha ma'al lazeenat taqaw wal lazeena hum muhsinoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Subhaanal lazeee asraa bi'abdihee lailam minal Masjidil Haraami ilal Masjidil Aqsal-lazee baaraknaa haw lahoo linuriyahoo min aayaatinaa;innahoo Huwas Samee'ul-Baseer
ayah.translation: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaa Moosal-Kitaaba wa ja'alnaahu hudal-liBaneee Israaa'eel;
ayah.translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

ayah.transliteration: Zurriyyata man hamalnaa ma'a Nooh innahoo kaana 'abdan shakooraa
ayah.translation: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qadainaaa ilaa Baneee Israaa'eela fil Kitaabi latufsidunna fil ardi marratain; wa lata'lunna'uluwwan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: And We conveyed to the Children of Israel in the Scripture that, "You will surely cause corruption on the earth twice, and you will surely reach [a degree of] great haughtiness.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-izaa jaaa'a wa'duoolaahumaa ba'asnaaa 'alykurr 'ibaadai-lanaaa ulee baasin shadeedin fajaasoo khilaalad diyaar; wa kaana wa'dam maf'oolaa
ayah.translation: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.

ayah.transliteration: Summa radadnaa lakumul karrata 'alaihim wa amdad-naakum-bi amwaalinuw wa baneen; wa ja'alnaakum aksara nafeeraa
ayah.translation: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower

ayah.transliteration: In ahsantum ahsantum li anfusikum wa in asaatum falahaa; fa izaa jaaa'a wa'dul aakhirati liyasooo'oo wujoo hakum wa liyadkhulul masjida kamaa dakhaloohu awwala marratinw wa liyutabbiroo mass'alaw tatbeera
ayah.translation: [And said], "If you do good, you do good for yourselves; and if you do evil, [you do it] to yourselves." Then when the final promise came, [We sent your enemies] to sadden your faces and to enter the temple in Jerusalem, as they entered it the first time, and to destroy what they had taken over with [total] destruction.

ayah.transliteration: 'Asaa rabbukum anyyarhamakum; wa in 'uttum 'udnaa; wa ja'alnaa jahannama lilkaafireena haseera
ayah.translation: [Then Allah said], "It is expected, [if you repent], that your Lord will have mercy upon you. But if you return [to sin], We will return [to punishment]. And We have made Hell, for the disbelievers, a prison-bed."

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazal Quraana yahdee lillatee hiya aqwamu wa yubashshirul mu'mineenal lazeena ya'maloonas saalihaati anna lahum ajran kabeeraa
ayah.translation: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Wa annal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil aakhirati a'tadnaa lahum 'azaaban aleemaa
ayah.translation: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yad'ul insaanu bishsharri du'aaa 'ahoo bilkhayr; wa kaanal insaanu 'ajoola
ayah.translation: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnal laila wannahaara Aayatayni famahawnaaa Aayatal laili wa ja'alnaaa Aayatan nahaari mubsiratal litabtaghoo fadlam mir Rabbikum wa lita'lamoo 'adadas sineena walhisaab; wa kulla shai'in fassalnaahu tafseelaa
ayah.translation: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kulla insaanin alzamnaahu taaa'irahoo fe 'unuqihee wa nukhriji lahoo Yawmal Qiyaamati kitaabany yalqaahu manshooraa
ayah.translation: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.

ayah.transliteration: Iqra kitaabak kafaa binafsikal Yawma 'alaika haseebaa
ayah.translation: [It will be said], "Read your record. Sufficient is yourself against you this Day as accountant."

ayah.transliteration: Manihtadaa fa innamaa yahtadee linafsihee wa man dalla fa innamaa yadillu 'alaihaa; wa laa taziru waaziratunw wizra ukhraa; wa maa kunnaa mu'azzibeena hatta nab'asa Rasoola
ayah.translation: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaaa aradnaaa an nuhlika qaryatan amarnaa mutrafeehaa fafasaqoo feehaa fahaqqa 'alaihal qawlu fadammarnaahaa tadmeeraa
ayah.translation: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa minal qurooni mim ba'di Nooh; wa kafaa bi Rabbika bizunoobi 'ibaadihee Khabeeram Baseeraa
ayah.translation: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Man kaana yureedul 'aajilata 'ajjalnaa lahoo feehaa maa nashaaa'u liman nureedu summa ja'alnaa lahoo Jahannama yaslaahaa mazmoomammad hooraa
ayah.translation: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man araadal Aakhirata wa sa'aa lahaa sa'yahaa wa huwa mu'minun fa ulaaa'ika kaana sa'yuhum mashkooraa
ayah.translation: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Kullan numiddu haaa 'ulaaa'i wa haaa'ulaaa'i min 'ataaa'i rabbik; wa maa kaana 'ataaa'u rabbika mahzooraa
ayah.translation: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

ayah.transliteration: Unzur kaifa faddalnaa ba'dahum 'alaa ba'd; wa lal Aakhiratu akbaru darajaatinw wa akbaru tafdeelaa
ayah.translation: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

ayah.transliteration: Laa taj'al ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fataq'uda mazoomam makhzoolaa
ayah.translation: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qadaa Rabbuka allaa ta'budooo illaaa iyyaahu wa bilwaalidaini ihsaanaa; immaa yablughanna 'indakal kibara ahaduhumaaa aw kilaahumaa falaa taqul lahumaaa uffinw wa laa tanharhumaa wa qullahumaa qawlan kareemaa
ayah.translation: And your Lord has decreed that you not worship except Him, and to parents, good treatment. Whether one or both of them reach old age [while] with you, say not to them [so much as], "uff," and do not repel them but speak to them a noble word.

ayah.transliteration: Wakhfid lahumaa janaahaz zulli minar rahmati wa qur Rabbir hamhumaa kamaa rabbayaanee sagheera
ayah.translation: And lower to them the wing of humility out of mercy and say, "My Lord, have mercy upon them as they brought me up [when I was] small."

ayah.transliteration: Rabbukum a'lamu bimaa fee nufoosikum; in takoonoo saaliheena fa innahoo kaana lil awwaabeena Ghafoooraa
ayah.translation: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aati zal qurbaa haqqahoo walmiskeena wabnas sabeeli wa laa tubazzir tabzeeraa
ayah.translation: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

ayah.transliteration: Innal mubazzireena kaanoo ikhwaanash shayaateeni wa kaanash shaytaanu li Rabbihee kafooraa
ayah.translation: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa immaa turidanna 'anhumub tighaaa'a rahmatim mir rabbika tarjoohaa faqul lahum qawlam maisooraa
ayah.translation: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taj'al yadaka maghloolatan il 'unuqika wa laa tabsut haa kullal basti fataq'uda maloomam mahsooraa
ayah.translation: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Rabbaka yabsuturrizqa limai yashaaa'u wa yaqdir; innahoo kaana bi'ibaadihee Khabeeram Baseera
ayah.translation: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqtulooo awlaadakum khashyata imlaaq; nahnu narzuquhum wa iyyaakum; inna qatlahum kaana khitan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqrabuz zinaaa innahoo kaana faahishatanw wa saaa'a sabeelaa
ayah.translation: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqtulun nafsal latee harramal laahu illaa bilhaqq; wa man qutila mazlooman faqad ja'alnaa liwaliyyihee sultaanan falaa yusrif fil qatli innahoo kaana mansooraa
ayah.translation: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqraboo maalal yateemi illaa billatee hiya ahsanu hattaa yablugha ashuddah; wa awfoo bil'ahd, innal 'ahda kaana mas'oolaa
ayah.translation: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa awful kaila izaa kiltum wa zinoo bilqistaasil mustaqeem; zaalika khairunw wa ahsanu taaweelaa
ayah.translation: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqfu maa laisa laka bihee 'ilm; innas sam'a walbasara walfu'aada kullu ulaaa'ika kaana 'anhu mas'oolaa
ayah.translation: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tamshi fil ardi marahan innaka lan takhriqal arda wa lan tablughal jibaala toola
ayah.translation: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.

ayah.transliteration: Kullu zaalika kaana sayyi'uhoo inda Rabbika makroohaa
ayah.translation: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika mimmaaa awhaaa ilaika Rabbuka minal hikmah; wa laa taj'al ma'allaahi ilaahan aakhara fatulqaa fee Jahannama maloomam mad hooraa
ayah.translation: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

ayah.transliteration: Afa asfaakum rabbukum bilbaneena wattakhaza minal malaaa'ikati inaasaa; innakum lataqooloona qawlan 'azeema
ayah.translation: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad sarrafnaa fee haazal Quraani liyazzakkaroo wa maa yazeeduhum illaa nufooraa
ayah.translation: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.

ayah.transliteration: Qul law kaana ma'ahooo aalihatun kamaa yaqooloona izal labtaghaw ilaa zil 'Arshi Sabeela
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "If there had been with Him [other] gods, as they say, then they [each] would have sought to the Owner of the Throne a way."

ayah.transliteration: Subhaanahoo wa Ta'aalaa 'ammaa yaqooloona 'uluwwan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

ayah.transliteration: Tusabbihu lahus samaawaatus sab'u wal ardu wa man feehinn; wa im min shai'in illaa yusabbihu bihamdihee wa laakil laa tafqahoona tasbeehahum; innahoo kaana Haleeman Ghafooraa
ayah.translation: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qaraatal Quraana ja'alnaa bainaka wa bainal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil aakhirati hijaabam mastooraa
ayah.translation: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa 'alaa quloo bihim akinnatan any yafqahoohu wa feee aazaanihim waqraa; wa izaa zakarta Rabbaka fil Quraani wahdahoo wallaw 'alaaa adbaarihim nufooraa
ayah.translation: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.

ayah.transliteration: nahnu a'lamu bimaa yastami'oona biheee iz yastami'oona ilaika wa iz hum najwaaa iz yaqooluz zaalimoona in tattabi'oona illaa rajulam mas hooraa
ayah.translation: We are most knowing of how they listen to it when they listen to you and [of] when they are in private conversation, when the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

ayah.transliteration: Unzur kaifa daraboo lakal amsaala fadalloo falaa yastatee'oona sabeelaa
ayah.translation: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalooo'a izaa kunnaa 'izaamanw wa rufaatan 'a innaa lamab'oosoona khalqan jadeedaa
ayah.translation: And they say, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected as a new creation?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul koonoo jijaaratan aw hadeedaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Be you stones or iron

ayah.transliteration: aw khalqam mimmaa yakburu fee sudoorikum; fasa yaqooloona mai yu'eedunaa qulil lazee fatarakum awwala marrah; fasa yunghidoona ilaika ru'oosahum wa yaqooloona mataa huwa qul 'asaaa any yakoona qareeba
ayah.translation: Or [any] creation of that which is great within your breasts." And they will say, "Who will restore us?" Say, "He who brought you forth the first time." Then they will nod their heads toward you and say, "When is that?" Say, "Perhaps it will be soon -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yad'ookum fatastajeeboona bihamdihee wa tazunnoona il labistum illaa qaleela
ayah.translation: On the Day He will call you and you will respond with praise of Him and think that you had not remained [in the world] except for a little."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qul li'ibaadee yaqoolul latee hiya ahsan; innash shaitaana yanzaghu bainahum; innash shaitaana kaana lil insaani 'aduwwam mubeenaa
ayah.translation: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbukum a'lamu bikum iny yashaaa yarhamkum aw iny yashaa yu'azzibkum; wa maaa arsalnaaka 'alaihim wakeelaa
ayah.translation: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Rabbuka a'lamu biman fis samaawaati wal lard; wa laqad faddalnaa ba'dan Nabiyyeena 'alaa ba'dinw wa aatainaaa Daawooda Zabooraa
ayah.translation: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

ayah.transliteration: Qulid 'ul lazeena za'amtum min doonihee falaa yamlikoona kashfad durri'ankum wa laa tahweelaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Invoke those you have claimed [as gods] besides Him, for they do not possess the [ability for] removal of adversity from you or [for its] transfer [to someone else]."

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena yad'oona yabtaghoona ilaa Rabbihimul waseelata ayyuhum aqrabu wa yarjoona rahmatahoo wa yakhaafoona 'azaabah; inna 'azaaba rabbika kaana mahzooraa
ayah.translation: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

ayah.transliteration: Wa im min qaryatin illaa Nahnu muhlikoohaa qabla Yawmil Qiyaamati aw mu'az ziboohaa 'azaaban shadeedaa; kaana zaalika fil Kitaabi mastooraa
ayah.translation: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa mana'anaaa an nursila bil aayaati illaaa an kazzaba bihal awwaloon; wa aatainaa Samoodan naaqata mubsiratan fazalamoo bihaa; wa maa nursilu bil aayaati illaa takhweefaa
ayah.translation: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qulnaa laka inna rabbaka ahaata binnaas; wa maa ja'alnar ru'yal lateee arainaaka illaa fitnatal linnaasi washshajaratal mal'oonata fil quraan; wa nukhaw wifuhum famaa yazeeduhum illa tughyaanan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qulnaa lilma laaa'ikatis judoo li Aadama fasajadooo illaaa Ibleesa qaala 'a-asjudu liman khalaqta teena
ayah.translation: And [mention] when We said to the angles, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He said, "Should I prostrate to one You created from clay?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala ara'aytaka haazal lazee karramta 'alaiya la'in akhhartani ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati la-ah tanikanna zurriyyatahooo illaa qaleelaa
ayah.translation: [Iblees] said, "Do You see this one whom You have honored above me? If You delay me until the Day of Resurrection, I will surely destroy his descendants, except for a few."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalaz hab faman tabi'aka minhum fa inna Jahannama jazaaa'ukum jazaaa'am mawfooraa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Go, for whoever of them follows you, indeed Hell will be the recompense of you - an ample recompense.

ayah.transliteration: Wastafziz manis tat'ta minhum bisawtika wa ajlib 'alaihim bikhailika wa rajilika wa shaarik hum fil amwaali wal awlaadi wa 'idhum; wa maa ya'iduhumush Shaitaanu illaa ghurooraa
ayah.translation: And incite [to senselessness] whoever you can among them with your voice and assault them with your horses and foot soldiers and become a partner in their wealth and their children and promise them." But Satan does not promise them except delusion.

ayah.transliteration: Inna 'ibaadee laisa laka 'alaihim sultaan; wa kafaa bi Rabbika Wakeelaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbukumul lazee yuzjee lakumul fulka fil bahri litabtaghoo min fadlih; innahoo kaana bikum Raheemaa
ayah.translation: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa massakumuddurru fil bahri dalla man tad'oona illaaa iyyaahu falammaa najjaakum ilal barri a'radtum; wa kaanal insaanu kafooraa
ayah.translation: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Afa amintum any yakhsifa bikum jaanibal barri aw yursil 'alaikum haasiban summa laa tajidoo lakum wakeelaa
ayah.translation: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

ayah.transliteration: Am amintum any yu'eedakum feehi taaratan ukhraa fa yursila 'alaikum qaasifam minar reehi fa yugh riqakum bimaa kafartum summa laa tajidoo lakum 'alainaa bihee tabee'aa
ayah.translation: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad karramnaa Baneee aadama wa hamalnaahum fil barri walbahri wa razaqnaahum minat taiyibaati wa faddalnaahum 'alaa kaseerim mimman khalaqnaa tafdeelaa
ayah.translation: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma nad'oo kulla unaasim bi imaamihim faman ootiya kitaabahoo bi yameenihee fa ulaaa'ika yaqra'oona kitaabahum wa laa yuzlamoona fateelaa
ayah.translation: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

ayah.transliteration: Wa man kaana fee haaziheee a'maa fahuwa fil aakhirati a'maa wa adallu sabeelaa
ayah.translation: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in kaadoo la yaftinoonaka 'anil lazeee awhainaaa ilaika litaftariya 'alainaaa ghairahoo wa izallat takhazooka khaleelaa
