ayah.translation: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa an sabbatnaaka laqad kitta tarkanu ilaihim sha'an qaleela
ayah.translation: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

ayah.transliteration: Izal la azaqnaaka di'falhayaati wa di'fal mamaati summa laa tajidu laka 'alainaa naseeraa
ayah.translation: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in kaadoo la yastafizzoonaka minal ardi liyukhri jooka minhaa wa izal laa yalbasoona khilaafaka illaa qaleelaa
ayah.translation: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.

ayah.transliteration: Sunnata man qad arsalnaa qablakamir Rusulinaa wa laa tajidu lisunnatinaa tahhweelaa
ayah.translation: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.

ayah.transliteration: Aqimis Salaata liduloo kish shamsi ilaa ghasaqil laili wa quraanal Fajri inna quraa nal Fajri kaana mashhoodaa
ayah.translation: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minal laili fatahajjad bihee naafilatal laka 'asaaa any yab'asaka Rabbuka Maqaamam Mahmoodaa
ayah.translation: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qur Rabbi adkhilnee mudkhala sidqinw wa akhrijnee mukhraja sidqinw waj'al lee milladunka sultaanan naseeraa
ayah.translation: And say, "My Lord, cause me to enter a sound entrance and to exit a sound exit and grant me from Yourself a supporting authority."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qul jaaa'al haqqu wa zahaqal baatil; innal baatila kaana zahooqaa
ayah.translation: And say, "Truth has come, and falsehood has departed. Indeed is falsehood, [by nature], ever bound to depart."

ayah.transliteration: Wa nunazzilu minal quraani maa huwa shifaaa'unw wa rahmatul lilmu;mineena wa laa yazeeduz zaalimeena illaa khasaaraa
ayah.translation: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaaa an'amnaa 'alal insaani a'rada wa na-aa bijaani bihee wa izaa massahush sharru kaana ya'oosaa
ayah.translation: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.

ayah.transliteration: Qul kulluny ya'malu 'alaa shaakilatihee fa rabbukum a'lamu biman huwa ahdaa sabeelaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Each works according to his manner, but your Lord is most knowing of who is best guided in way."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yas'aloonaka 'anirrooh; qulir roohu min amri rabbee wa maaa ooteetum minal 'ilmi illaa qaleelaa
ayah.translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about the soul. Say, "The soul is of the affair of my Lord. And mankind have not been given of knowledge except a little."

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'in shi'naa lanaz habanna billazeee awhainaaa ilaika summa laa tajidu laka bihee 'alainaa wakeelaa
ayah.translation: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

ayah.transliteration: Illaa rahmatam mir Rabbik; inna fadlahoo kaana 'alaika kabeeraa
ayah.translation: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

ayah.transliteration: Qul la'inij tama'atil insu waljinnu 'alaaa any yaatoo bimisli haazal quraani laa yaatoona bimislihee wa law kaana ba'duhum liba 'din zaheeraa
ayah.translation: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."

ayah.transliteration: Qa laqad sarrafnaa linnaasi fee haazal quraani min kulli masalin fa abaaa aksarun naasi illaa kufooraa
ayah.translation: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo lan nu'mina laka hattaa tafjura lanaa minal ardi yamboo'aa
ayah.translation: And they say, "We will not believe you until you break open for us from the ground a spring.

ayah.transliteration: Aw takoona laka jannatum min nakheelinw wa 'inabin fatufajjiral anhaara khilaalahaa tafjeeraa
ayah.translation: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]

ayah.transliteration: Aw tusqitas samaaa'a kamaa za'amta 'alainaa kisafan aw taatiya billaahi walma laaa'ikati qabeelaa
ayah.translation: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]

ayah.transliteration: Aw yakoona laka baitum min zukhrufin aw tarqaa fis samaaa'i wa lan nu'mina liruqiyyika hatta tunazzila 'alainaa kitaaban naqra'uh; qul Subhaana Rabbee hal kuntu illaa basharar Rasoolaa
ayah.translation: Or you have a house of gold or you ascend into the sky. And [even then], we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book we may read." Say, "Exalted is my Lord! Was I ever but a human messenger?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa mana'an naasa any yu'minooo iz jaaa'ahumul hudaaa illaaa an qaalooo aba'asal laahu basharar Rasoolaa
ayah.translation: And what prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them except that they said, "Has Allah sent a human messenger?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul law kaana fil ardi malaaa 'ikatuny yamshoona mutma'inneena lanazzalnaa 'alaihim minas samaaa'i malakar Rasoolaa
ayah.translation: Say, "If there were upon the earth angels walking securely, We would have sent down to them from the heaven an angel [as a] messenger."

ayah.transliteration: Qul kafaa billaahi shaheedam bainee wa bainakum; innahoo kaana bi'ibaadihee Khabeeram Baseeraa
ayah.translation: Say, "Sufficient is Allah as Witness between me and you. Indeed he is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing."

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yahdil laahu fahuwal muhtad; wa mai yudlil falan tajida lahum awliyaaa'a min doonih; wa nahshuruhum Yawmal Qiyaamati 'alaa wujoohihim umyanw wa bukmanw wa summaa; maa waahum Jahannamu kullamaa khabat zidnaahum sa'eeraa
ayah.translation: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika jazaa'uhum biannahum kafaroo bi aayaatinaa wa qaalooo 'a izaa kunnaa 'izaamanw wa rufaatan'a innaa lamaboosoona khalqan jadeedaa
ayah.translation: That is their recompense because they disbelieved in Our verses and said, "When we are bones and crumbled particles, will we [truly] be resurrected [in] a new creation?"

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaraw annal laahal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda qaadirun 'alaaa any yakhluqa mislahum wa ja'ala lahum ajalal laa raiba fee; fa abaz zaalimoona illaa kufooraa
ayah.translation: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.

ayah.transliteration: Qul law antum tamlikoona khazaaa'ina rahmati Rabbeee izal la amsaktum khash yatal infaaq; wa kaanal insaanu qatooraa
ayah.translation: Say [to them], "If you possessed the depositories of the mercy of my Lord, then you would withhold out of fear of spending." And ever has man been stingy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosaa tis'a Aayaatim baiyinaatin fas'al Baneee Israaa'eela iz jaaa'ahum faqaala lahoo Fir'awnu inee la azunnuka yaa Moosaa mas hooraa
ayah.translation: And We had certainly given Moses nine evident signs, so ask the Children of Israel [about] when he came to them and Pharaoh said to him, "Indeed I think, O Moses, that you are affected by magic."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laqad 'alimta maaa anzala haaa'ulaaa'i illaa Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi basaaa'ira wa innee la azun nuka yaa Fir'awnu masbooraa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "You have already known that none has sent down these [signs] except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as evidence, and indeed I think, O Pharaoh, that you are destroyed."

ayah.transliteration: Fa araada any yastafizzahum minal ardi fa aghraqnaahu wa mam ma'ahoo jamee'aa
ayah.translation: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qulnaa mim ba'dihee li Baneee Israaa'eelas kunul arda faizaa jaaa'a wa'dulaakhirati ji'naa bikum lafeefaa
ayah.translation: And We said after Pharaoh to the Children of Israel, "Dwell in the land, and when there comes the promise of the Hereafter, We will bring you forth in [one] gathering."

ayah.transliteration: Wa bilhaqqi anzalnaahu wa bilhaqqi nazal; wa maaa arsalnaaka illaa mubash shiranw wa nazeeraa
ayah.translation: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

ayah.transliteration: Wa quraanan faraqnaahu litaqra ahoo 'alan naasi 'alaa muksinw wa nazzalnaahu tanzeelaa
ayah.translation: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.

ayah.transliteration: Qul aaaniminoo biheee aw laa tu'minoo; innal lazeena ootul 'ilma min qabliheee izaa yutlaa 'alaihim yakhirroona lil azqaani sujjadaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Believe in it or do not believe. Indeed, those who were given knowledge before it - when it is recited to them, they fall upon their faces in prostration,

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona Subhaana Rabbinaaa in kaana wa'du Rabbinaa lamaf'oolaa
ayah.translation: And they say, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yakhirroona lil azqaani yabkoona wa yazeeduhum khushoo'aa
ayah.translation: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.

ayah.transliteration: Qulid'ul laaha awid'ur Rahmaana ayyam maa tad'oo falahul asmaaa'ul Husnaa; wa laa tajhar bi Salaatika wa laa tukhaafit bihaa wabtaghi baina zaalika sabeela
ayah.translation: Say, "Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Merciful. Whichever [name] you call - to Him belong the best names." And do not recite [too] loudly in your prayer or [too] quietly but seek between that an [intermediate] way.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qulil hamdu lillaahil lazee lam yattakhiz waladanw wa lam yakul lahoo shareekun fil mulki wa lam yakul lahoo waliyyum minaz zulli wa kabbirhu takbeeraa
ayah.translation: And say, "Praise to Allah, who has not taken a son and has had no partner in [His] dominion and has no [need of a] protector out of weakness; and glorify Him with [great] glorification."

ayah.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil lazeee anzala 'alaa 'abdihil kitaaba wa lam yaj'al lahoo 'iwajaa
ayah.translation: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.

ayah.transliteration: Qaiyimal liyunzira baasan shadeedam mil ladunhu wa yubashshiral mu'mineenal lazeena ya'maloonas saalihaati anna lahum ajran hasanaa
ayah.translation: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward

ayah.transliteration: Maakiseena feehi abadaa
ayah.translation: In which they will remain forever

ayah.transliteration: Wa yunziral lazeena qaalut takhazal laahu waladaa
ayah.translation: And to warn those who say, "Allah has taken a son."

ayah.transliteration: Maa lahum bihee min 'ilminw wa laa li aabaaa'ihim; kaburat kalimatan takhruju min afwaahihim; iny yaqooloona illaa kazibaa
ayah.translation: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.

ayah.transliteration: Fala'allaka baakhi'un nafsaka 'alaaa aasaarihim illam yu;minoo bihaazal hadeesi asafaa
ayah.translation: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa ja'alnaa ma 'alal ardi zeenatal lahaa linabluwahum ayyuhum ahsanu 'amalaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaa lajaa 'iloona maa 'alaihaa sa'aeedan juruzaa
ayah.translation: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

ayah.transliteration: Am hasibta anna Ashaabal Kahfi war Raqeemi kaanoo min Aayaatinaa 'ajabaa
ayah.translation: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?

ayah.transliteration: Iz awal fityatu ilal Kahfi faqaaloo Rabbanaaa aatinaa mil ladunka rahmatanw wa haiyi' lanaa min amrinaa rashadaa
ayah.translation: [Mention] when the youths retreated to the cave and said, "Our Lord, grant us from Yourself mercy and prepare for us from our affair right guidance."

ayah.transliteration: Fadarabnaa 'alaaa aazaanihim fil Kahfi seneena 'adadaa
ayah.translation: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.

ayah.transliteration: Summa ba'asnaahum lina'lama ayyul hizbaini ahsaa limaa labisooo amadaa
ayah.translation: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu naqussu 'alaika naba ahum bilhaqq; innahum fityatun aamanoo bi Rabbihim wa zidnaahum hudaa
ayah.translation: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

ayah.transliteration: Wa rabatnaa 'alaa quloo bihim iz qaamoo faqaaloo Rabbunaa Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi lan nad'uwa min dooniheee ilaahal laqad qulnaaa izan shatataa
ayah.translation: And We made firm their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. Never will we invoke besides Him any deity. We would have certainly spoken, then, an excessive transgression.

ayah.transliteration: Haaa'ulaaa'i qawmunat takhazoo min dooniheee aalihatal law laa yaatoona 'alaihim bisultaanim baiyin; faman azlamu mimmaniftaraa 'alal laahi kazibaa
ayah.translation: These, our people, have taken besides Him deities. Why do they not bring for [worship of] them a clear authority? And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah a lie?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa izi'tazal tumoohum wa maa ya'budoona illal laaha faawooo ilal kahfi yanshur lakum Rabbukum mir rahmatihee wa yuhaiyi' lakum min amrikum mirfaqa
ayah.translation: [The youths said to one another], "And when you have withdrawn from them and that which they worship other than Allah, retreat to the cave. Your Lord will spread out for you of His mercy and will prepare for you from your affair facility."

ayah.transliteration: Wa tarash shamsa izaa tala'at tazaawaru 'an kahfihim zaatal yameeni wa izaa gharabat taqriduhum zaatash shimaali wa hum fee fajwatim minh; zaalika min Aayaatillaah; mai yahdil laahu fahuwal muhtad, wa mai yudlil falan tajida lahoo waliyyam murshidaa
ayah.translation: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tahsabuhum ayqaazanw wa hum ruqood; wa nuqallibuhum zaatal yameeni wa zaatash shimaali wa kalbuhum baasitun ziraa'ayhi bilwaseed; lawit tala'ta 'alaihim la wallaita minhum firaaranw wa lamuli'ta minhum rubaa
ayah.translation: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika ba'asnaahum liyatasaaa'aloo bainahum; qaala qaaa'ilum minhum kam labistum qaaloo labisnaa yawman aw ba'da yawm; qaaloo Rabbukum a'almu bimaa labistum fab'asooo ahadakum biwariqikum haazihee ilal madeenati falyanzur ayyuhaaa azkaa ta'aaman falyaatikum birizqim minhu walyatalattaf wa laa yush'iranna bikum ahadaa
ayah.translation: And similarly, We awakened them that they might question one another. Said a speaker from among them, "How long have you remained [here]?" They said, "We have remained a day or part of a day." They said, "Your Lord is most knowing of how long you remained. So send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city and let him look to which is the best of food and bring you provision from it and let him be cautious. And let no one be aware of you.

ayah.transliteration: Innahum iny yazharoo 'alaikum yarjumookum aw yu'eedookum fee millatihim wa lan tuflihooo izan abadaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, if they come to know of you, they will stone you or return you to their religion. And never would you succeed, then - ever."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika a'sarnaa 'alaihim liya'lamooo anna wa'dal laahi haqqunw wa annas Saa'ata laa raiba feehaa iz yatanaaza'oona bainahum amrahum faqaalub noo 'alaihim bunyaanaa; Rabbuhum a'lamu bihim; qaalal lazeena ghalaboo 'alaaa amrihim lanat takhizanna 'alaihim masjidaa
ayah.translation: And similarly, We caused them to be found that they [who found them] would know that the promise of Allah is truth and that of the Hour there is no doubt. [That was] when they disputed among themselves about their affair and [then] said, "Construct over them a structure. Their Lord is most knowing about them." Said those who prevailed in the matter, "We will surely take [for ourselves] over them a masjid."

ayah.transliteration: Sa yaqooloona salaasatur raabi'uhum kalbuhum wa yaqooloona khamsatun saadisuhum kalbuhum rajmam bilghaib; wa yaqooloona sab'atunw wa saaminuhum kalbuhum; qur Rabbeee a'lamu bi'iddatihim maa ya'lamuhum illaa qaleel; falaa tumaari feehim illaa miraaa'an zaahiranw wa laa tastafti feehim minhum ahadaa
ayah.translation: They will say there were three, the fourth of them being their dog; and they will say there were five, the sixth of them being their dog - guessing at the unseen; and they will say there were seven, and the eighth of them was their dog. Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord is most knowing of their number. None knows them except a few. So do not argue about them except with an obvious argument and do not inquire about them among [the speculators] from anyone."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taqoolanna lishai'in innee faa'ilun zaalika ghadaa
ayah.translation: And never say of anything, "Indeed, I will do that tomorrow,"

ayah.transliteration: Illaaa any yashaaa'al laah; wazkur Rabbaka izaa naseeta wa qul 'asaaa any yahdiyani Rabbee li aqraba min haazaa rashadaa
ayah.translation: Except [when adding], "If Allah wills." And remember your Lord when you forget [it] and say, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to what is nearer than this to right conduct."

ayah.transliteration: Wa labisoo fee kahfihim salaasa mi'atin sineena wazdaadoo tis'aa
ayah.translation: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.

ayah.transliteration: Qulil laahu a'lamu bimaa labisoo lahoo ghaibus samaawaati wal ardi absir bihee wa asmi'; maa lahum min doonihee minw waliyyinw wa laa yushriku fee hukmihee ahadaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Allah is most knowing of how long they remained. He has [knowledge of] the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. How Seeing is He and how Hearing! They have not besides Him any protector, and He shares not His legislation with anyone."

ayah.transliteration: Watlu maaa oohiya ilaika min Kitaabi Rabbika laa mubaddila li Kalimaatihee wa lan tajida min doonihee multahadaa
ayah.translation: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

ayah.transliteration: Wasbir nafsaka ma'al lazeena yad'oona Rabbahum bilghadaati wal'ashiyyi yureedoona Wajhahoo wa laa ta'du 'aynaaka 'anhum tureedu zeenatal hayaatid dunyaa wa laa tuti' man aghfalnaa qalbahoo 'an zikrinaa wattaba'a hawaahu wa kaana amruhoo furutaa
ayah.translation: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qulil haqqu mir Rabbikum faman shaaa'a falyu minw wa man shaaa'a falyakfur; innaaa a'tadnaa lizzaalimeena Naaran ahaata bihim suraadiquhaa; wa iny yastagheesoo yaghaasoo bimaaa'in kalmuhli yashwil wujooh' bi'sash-sharaab; wa saaa'at murtafaqaa
ayah.translation: And say, "The truth is from your Lord, so whoever wills - let him believe; and whoever wills - let him disbelieve." Indeed, We have prepared for the wrongdoers a fire whose walls will surround them. And if they call for relief, they will be relieved with water like murky oil, which scalds [their] faces. Wretched is the drink, and evil is the resting place.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati innaa laa nudee'u ajra man ahsana 'amalaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika lahum Jannaatu 'Adnin tajree min tahtihimul anhaaru yuhallawna feehaa min asaawira min zahabinw wa yalbasoona siyaaban khudram min sundusinw wa istabraqim muttaki'eena feehaa 'alal araaa'ik; ni'mas sawaab; wa hasunat murtafaqaa
ayah.translation: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

ayah.transliteration: Wadrib lahum masalar rajulaini ja'alnaa li ahadihimaa jannataini min a'naabinw wa hafafnaahumaa binakhilinw wa ja'alnaa bainahumaa zar'aa
ayah.translation: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

ayah.transliteration: Kiltal jannataini aatat ukulahaa wa lam tazlim minhu shai'anw wa fajjarnaa khi laalahumaa naharaa
ayah.translation: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaana lahoo samarun faqaala lisaahibihee wa huwa yuhaawiruhoo ana aksaru minka maalanw wa a'azzu nafaraa
ayah.translation: And he had fruit, so he said to his companion while he was conversing with him, "I am greater than you in wealth and mightier in [numbers of] men."

ayah.transliteration: Wa dakhala jannatahoo wa huwa zaalimul linafsihee qaala maaa azunnu an tabeeda haaziheee abadaa
ayah.translation: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will perish - ever.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa azunnus Saa'ata qaaa'imatanw wa la'ir rudittu ilaa Rabbee la ajidanna khairam minhaa munqalabaa
ayah.translation: And I do not think the Hour will occur. And even if I should be brought back to my Lord, I will surely find better than this as a return."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lahoo saahibuhoo wa huwa yuhaawiruhooo akafarta billazee khalaqaka min turaabin summa min nutfatin summa sawwaaka rajulaa
ayah.translation: His companion said to him while he was conversing with him, "Have you disbelieved in He who created you from dust and then from a sperm-drop and then proportioned you [as] a man?

ayah.transliteration: Laakinaa Huwal laahu Rabbee wa laa ushriku bi Rabbeee ahadaa
ayah.translation: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa iz dakhalta jannataka qulta maa shaaa'al laahu laa quwwata illaa billaah; in tarani ana aqalla minka maalanw wa waladaa
ayah.translation: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

ayah.transliteration: Fa'asaa Rabeee any yu'tiyani khairam min jannatika wa yursila 'alaihaa husbaanam minas samaaa'i fatusbiha sa'eedan zalaqaa
ayah.translation: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

ayah.transliteration: Aw yusbiha maaa'uhaaa ghawran falan tastatee'a lahoo talabaa
ayah.translation: Or its water will become sunken [into the earth], so you would never be able to seek it."

ayah.transliteration: Wa uheeta bisamarihee faasbaha yuqallibu kaffaihi 'alaa maaa anfaqa feehaa wa hiya khaawiyatun 'alaa 'urooshihaa wa yaqoolu yaalaitanee lam ushrik bi Rabbeee ahadaa
ayah.translation: And his fruits were encompassed [by ruin], so he began to turn his hands about [in dismay] over what he had spent on it, while it had collapsed upon its trellises, and said, "Oh, I wish I had not associated with my Lord anyone."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lam takul lahoo fi'atuny yansuroonahoo min doonil laahi wa maa kaana muntasiraa
ayah.translation: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.

ayah.transliteration: Hunaalikal walaayatu lillaahil haqq; huwa khairun sawaabanw wa khairun 'uqbaa
ayah.translation: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

ayah.transliteration: Wadrib lahum masalal hayaatid dunyaa kamaaa'in anzalnaahu minas samaaa'i fakhtalata bihee nabaatul ardi fa asbaha hasheeman tazroo hur riyaah; wa kaanal laahu 'alaa kulli shai'im muqtadiraa
ayah.translation: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

ayah.transliteration: Almaalu walbanoona zeenatul hayaatid dunya wal baaqiyaatus saalihaatu khairun 'inda Rabbika sawaabanw wa khairun amalaa
ayah.translation: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yawma nusaiyirul jibaala wa taral arda baariza tanw wa hasharnaahum falam nughaadir minhum ahadaa
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'uridoo 'alaa Rabbika saffaa, laqad ji'tumoonaa kamaa khalaqnaakum awala marrah; bal za'amtum allannaj'ala lakum maw'idaa
ayah.translation: And they will be presented before your Lord in rows, [and He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time. But you claimed that We would never make for you an appointment."

ayah.transliteration: Wa wudi'al kitaabu fataral mujrimeena mushfiqeena mimmaa feehi wa yaqooloona yaa wailatanaa maa lihaazal kitaabi laa yughaadiru saghee ratanw wa laa kabeeratan illaaa ahsaahaa; wa wajadoo maa 'amiloo haadiraa; wa laa yazlimu Rabbuka ahadaa
ayah.translation: And the record [of deeds] will be placed [open], and you will see the criminals fearful of that within it, and they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What is this book that leaves nothing small or great except that it has enumerated it?" And they will find what they did present [before them]. And your Lord does injustice to no one.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qulnaa lilma laaa'ikatis judoo li Aadama fasajadooo illaaa Ibleesa kaana minal jinni fafasaqa 'an amri Rabbih; afatattakhizoonahoo wa zurriyatahooo awliyaaa'a min doonee wa hum lakum 'aduww; bi'sa lizzaalimeena badalaa
ayah.translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except for Iblees. He was of the jinn and departed from the command of his Lord. Then will you take him and his descendants as allies other than Me while they are enemies to you? Wretched it is for the wrongdoers as an exchange.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa ash hattuhum khalqas samaawaati wal ardi wa laa khalqa anfusihim wa maa kuntu muttakizal mudilleena 'adudaa
ayah.translation: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yaqoolu naadoo shurakaaa'i yal lazeena za'amtum fada'awhum falam yastajeeboo lahum wa ja'alnaa bainahum maw biqaa
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ra al mujrimoonan Naara fazannooo annahum muwaaqi'oohaa wa lam yajidoo 'anhaa masrifaa
ayah.translation: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad sarrafnaa fee haazal quraani linnaasi mn kulli masal; wa kaanal insaanu aksara shai'in jadalaa
ayah.translation: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa mana'an naasa any yu'minooo iz jaaa'ahumul hudaa wa yastaghfiroo Rabbahum illaaa an taatiyahum sunnatul awwaleena aw yaatiyahumul 'azaabu qubulaa
ayah.translation: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa nursilul mursaleena illaa mubashshireena wa munzireen; wa yujaadilul lazeena kafaroo bilbaatili liyudhidoo bihil haqqa wattakhazooo Aayaatee wa maaa unziroo huzuwaa
ayah.translation: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man azlamu mimman zukkira bi ayaati Rabbihee fa-a'rada 'anhaa wa nasiya maa qaddamat yadaah; innaa ja'alnaa 'alaa quloobihim akinnatan any yafqahoohu wa feee aazaanihim waqraa; wa in tad'uhum ilal hudaa falany yahtadooo izan abadaa
ayah.translation: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Rabbukal Ghafooru zur rahmati law yu'aakhi zuhum bimaa kasaboo la'ajala lahumul 'azaab; bal lahum maw'idul lany yajidoo min doonihee maw'ilaa
ayah.translation: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tkal quraaa ahlak nahum lammaa zulamoo wa ja'alnaa limahlikihim maw'idaa
ayah.translation: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qaalaa Moosaa lifataahu laaa abrahu hattaaa ablugha majma'al bahrayni aw amdiya huqubaa
ayah.translation: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa balaghaa majma'a bainihimaa nasiyaa hootahumaa fattakhaza sabeelahoo fil bahri sarabaa
ayah.translation: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaawazaa qaala lifataahu aatinaa ghadaaa'anaa laqad laqeena min safarinaa haazaa nasabaa
ayah.translation: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala ara'ayta iz awainaaa ilas sakhrati fa innee naseetul hoota wa maaa ansaaneehu illash Shaitaanu an azkurah; wattakhaza sabeelahoo fil bahri'ajabaa
ayah.translation: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".

ayah.transliteration: Qaala zaalika maa kunnaa nabgh; fartaddaa 'alaa aasaari him maa qasasaa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

ayah.transliteration: Fa wajadaa 'abdam min 'ibaadinaaa aatainaahu Rahmatam min 'indinaa wa 'allamnaahu mil ladunnaa 'ilmaa
ayah.translation: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lahoo Moosaa hal attabi'uka 'alaaa an tu'allimani mimmaa 'ullimta rushdaa
ayah.translation: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalaa innaka lan tastatee'a ma'iya sabraa
ayah.translation: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaifa tasbiru 'alaa maa lam tuhit bihee khubraa
ayah.translation: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala satajiduneee in shaa 'al laahu saabiranw wa laaa a'see laka amraa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fa init taba'tanee falaa tas'alnee 'an shai'in hattaaa uhdisa laka minhu zikraa
ayah.translation: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."

ayah.transliteration: Fantalaqaa hattaaa izaa rakibaa fis safeenati kharaqahaa qaala akharaqtahaa litughriqa ahlahaa laqad ji'ta shai'an imraa
ayah.translation: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala alam aqul innaka lan tastatee'a ma'iya sabraa
ayah.translation: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laa tu'aakhiznee bimaa naseetu wa laa turhiqnee min amree 'usraa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."

ayah.transliteration: Fantalaqaa hattaa izaa laqiyaa ghulaaman faqatalahoo qaala aqatalta nafsan zakiy yatam bighairi nafs; laqad ji'ta shai'an nukraa
ayah.translation: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala alam aqul laka innaka lan tastatee'a ma'iya sabraa
ayah.translation: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala in sa altuka 'an shai'im ba'dahaa falaa tusaahibnee qad balaghta mil ladunnee 'uzraa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."

ayah.transliteration: Fantalaqaa hattaaa izaaa atayaaa ahla qaryatinis tat'amaaa ahlahaa fa abaw any yudaiyifoohumaa fawajadaa feehaa jidaarany yureedu any yanqadda fa aqaamah; qaala law shi'ta lattakhazta 'alaihi ajraa
ayah.translation: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala haazaa firaaqu bainee wa bainik; sa unabi 'uka bitaaweeli maa lam tastati' 'alaihi sabraa
ayah.translation: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.

ayah.transliteration: Ammas safeenatu fakaanat limasaakeena ya'maloona fil bahri fa arattu an a'eebahaa wa kaana waraaa' ahum malikuny yaakhuzu kulla safeenatin ghasbaa
ayah.translation: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aammal ghulaamu fakaana abawaahu mu'minaini fakhasheenaaa any yurhiqa humaa tughyaananw wa kufraa
ayah.translation: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

ayah.transliteration: Faradnaa any yubdila humaa Rabbuhumaa khairam minhu zakaatanw wa aqraba ruhmaa
ayah.translation: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ammal jidaaru fakaana lighulaamaini yateemaini fil madeenati wa kaana tahtahoo kanzul lahumaa wa kaana aboohumaa saalihan fa araada Rabbuka any yablughaaa ashuddahumaa wa yastakhrijaa kanzahumaa rahmatam mir Rabbik; wa maa fa'altuhoo 'an amree; zaalika taaweelu maa lam tasti' 'alaihi sabra
ayah.translation: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yas'aloonaka 'an Zil Qarnaini qul sa atloo 'alaikum minhu zikraa
ayah.translation: And they ask you, [O Muhammad], about Dhul-Qarnayn. Say, "I will recite to you about him a report."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa makkannaa lahoo fil ardi wa aatainaahu min kulli shai'in sababaa
ayah.translation: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.

ayah.transliteration: Fa atba'a sababaa
ayah.translation: So he followed a way

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa balagha maghribash shamsi wajadahaaa taghrubu fee 'aynin hami'a tinw wa wajada 'indahaa qawmaa; qulnaa yaa Zal Qarnaini immaaa an tu'az ziba wa immaaa an tattakhiza feehim husnaa
ayah.translation: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it [as if] setting in a spring of dark mud, and he found near it a people. Allah said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, either you punish [them] or else adopt among them [a way of] goodness."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala amaa man zalama fasawfa nu'azzibuhoo summa yuraddu ilaa Rabbihee fa yu 'azzibuhoo azaaban nukraa
ayah.translation: He said, "As for one who wrongs, we will punish him. Then he will be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a terrible punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ammaa man aamana wa 'amila saalihan falahoo jazaaa'anil husnaa wa sanaqoolu lahoo min amrinaa yusraa
ayah.translation: But as for one who believes and does righteousness, he will have a reward of Paradise, and we will speak to him from our command with ease."

ayah.transliteration: Summa atba'a sababaa
ayah.translation: Then he followed a way

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa balagha matli'ash shamsi wajdahaa tatlu'u alaa qawmil lam naj'al lahum min doonihaa sitraa
ayah.translation: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika wa qad ahatnaa bimaa ladaihi khubraa
ayah.translation: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

ayah.transliteration: Summa atba'a sababaa
ayah.translation: Then he followed a way

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa balagha bainas saddaini wajada min doonihimaa qawmal laa yakaa doona yafqahoona qawlaa
ayah.translation: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa Zal qarnaini inna Yaajooja wa Maajooja mufsidoona fil ardi fahal naj'alu laka kharjan 'alaaa an taj'ala bainanaa wa bainahum saddas
ayah.translation: They said, "O Dhul-Qarnayn, indeed Gog and Magog are [great] corrupters in the land. So may we assign for you an expenditure that you might make between us and them a barrier?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala maa makkannee feehi Rabbee khairun fa-a'eenoonee biquwwatin aj'al bainakum wa bainahum radmaa
ayah.translation: He said, "That in which my Lord has established me is better [than what you offer], but assist me with strength; I will make between you and them a dam.

ayah.transliteration: Aatoonee zubaral hadeed, hattaaa izaa saawaa bainas sadafaini qaalan fukhoo hattaaa izaa ja'alahoo naaran qaala aatooneee ufrigh 'alaihi qitraa
ayah.translation: Bring me sheets of iron" - until, when he had leveled [them] between the two mountain walls, he said, "Blow [with bellows]," until when he had made it [like] fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it molten copper."

ayah.transliteration: Famas taa'ooo any yazharoohu wa mastataa'oo lahoo naqbaa
ayah.translation: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala haaza rahmatummir Rabbee fa izaa jaaa'a wa'du Rabbee ja'alahoo dakkaaa'a; wa kaana; wa du Rabbee haqqaa
ayah.translation: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa ba'dahum Yawma'iziny yamooju fee ba'dinw wa nufikha fis Soori fajama'naahum jam'aa
ayah.translation: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'aradnaa jahannama Yawma'izil lilkaafireena 'ardaa
ayah.translation: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena kaanat a'yunuhum fee ghitaaa'in 'an zikree wa kaanoo la yastatee'oona sam'aa
ayah.translation: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

ayah.transliteration: Afahasibal lazeena kafarooo any yattakhizoo 'ibaadee min dooneee awliyaaa'; innaaa a'tadnaa jahannama lilkaafi reena nuzulaa
ayah.translation: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

ayah.transliteration: Qul hal nunabbi'ukum bilakhsareena a'maalaa
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena dalla sa'yuhum fil hayaatid dunyaa wa hum yahsaboona annahum yuhsinoona sun'aa
ayah.translation: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena kafaroo bi aayaati Rabbihim wa liqaaa'ihee fahabitat a'maaluhum falaa nuqeemu lahum Yawmal Qiyaamati waznaa
ayah.translation: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika jazaaa'uhum jahannamu bimaa kafaroo wattakhazooo Aayaatee wa Rusulee huzuwaa
ayah.translation: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati kaanat lahum Jannaatul Firdawsi nuzulaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

ayah.transliteration: Khaalideena feeha la yabghoona 'anhaa hiwalaa
ayah.translation: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

ayah.transliteration: Qul law kaanal bahru midaadal lik Kalimaati Rabbee lanafidal bahru qabla an tanfada Kalimaatu Rabbee wa law ji'naa bimislihee madadaa
ayah.translation: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaaa ana basharum mislukum yoohaaa ilaiya annamaa ilaahukum Ilaahunw Waahid; faman kaana yarjoo liqaaa'a Rabbihee falya'mal 'amalan saalihanw wa laa yushrik bi'ibaadati Rabbiheee ahadaa
ayah.translation: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

ayah.transliteration: Kaaaf-Haa-Yaa-'Ayyyn-Saaad
ayah.translation: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.

ayah.transliteration: Zikru rahmati Rabbika 'abdahoo Zakariyya
ayah.translation: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

ayah.transliteration: Iz naadaa Rabbahoo nidaaa'an khafiyyaa
ayah.translation: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi innee wahanal'azmu minnee washta'alar raasu shaibanw wa lam akum bidu'aaa'ika Rabbi shaqiyyaa
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed my bones have weakened, and my head has filled with white, and never have I been in my supplication to You, my Lord, unhappy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innee khiftul mawaa liya minw waraaa'ee wa kaana tim ra atee 'aairan fahab lee mil ladunka waliyyaa
ayah.translation: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

ayah.transliteration: Yarisunee wa yarisu min aali Ya'qoob, waj'alhu Rabbi radiyya
ayah.translation: Who will inherit me and inherit from the family of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, pleasing [to You]."

ayah.transliteration: Yaa Zakariyyaaa innaa nubashshiruka bighulaami nismuhoo Yahyaa lam naj'al lahoo min qablu samiyyaa
ayah.translation: [He was told], "O Zechariah, indeed We give you good tidings of a boy whose name will be John. We have not assigned to any before [this] name."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi annaa yakoonu lee ghulaamunw wa kaanatim ra atee aaqiranw wa qad balaghtu minal kibari 'itiyyaa
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when my wife has been barren and I have reached extreme old age?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala kazaalika qaala Rabbuka huwa 'alaiya haiyinunw wa qad khalaqtuka min qablu wa lam taku shai'aa
ayah.translation: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbij 'al leee Aayah; qaala Aayatuka allaa tukalliman naasa salaasa layaalin sawiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Zechariah] said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three nights, [being] sound."

ayah.transliteration: Fakharaja 'alaa qawmihee minal mihraabi fa-awhaaa ilaihim an sabbihoo bukratanw wa 'ashiyyaa
ayah.translation: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa Yahyaa khuzil Kitaaba biquwwatinw wa aatainaahul hukma saiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "O John, take the Scripture with determination." And We gave him judgement [while yet] a boy

ayah.transliteration: Wa hanaanam mil ladunnaa wa zakaatanw wa kaana taqiyyaa
ayah.translation: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah

ayah.transliteration: Wa barram biwaalidayhi wa lam yakum jabbaaran 'asiyyaa
ayah.translation: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa salaamun 'alaihi yawma wulida wa yawma yamootu wa yawma yub'asu haiyaa
ayah.translation: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi Marya; izin tabazat min ahlihaa makaanan shariqyyaa
ayah.translation: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

ayah.transliteration: Fattakhazat min doonihim hijaaban fa arsalnaaa ilaihaa roohanaa fatamassala lahaa basharan sawiyyaa
ayah.translation: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat inneee a'oozu bir Rahmaani minka in kunta taqiyyaa
ayah.translation: She said, "Indeed, I seek refuge in the Most Merciful from you, [so leave me], if you should be fearing of Allah."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innamaa ana rasoolu Rabbiki li ahaba laki ghulaaman zakiyyaa
ayah.translation: He said, "I am only the messenger of your Lord to give you [news of] a pure boy."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat anna yakoonu lee ghulaamunw wa lam yamsasnee bashrunw wa lam aku baghiyyaa
ayah.translation: She said, "How can I have a boy while no man has touched me and I have not been unchaste?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala kazaaliki qaala Rabbuki huwa 'alaiya yaiyimunw wa linaj 'alahooo Aayatal linnaasi wa rahmatam minnaa; wa kaana amram maqdiyyaa
ayah.translation: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "

ayah.transliteration: Fahamalat hu fantabazat bihee makaanan qasiyyaa
ayah.translation: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

ayah.transliteration: Fa ajaaa 'ahal makhaadu ilaa jiz'in nakhlati qaalat yaa laitanee mittu qabla haazaa wa kuntu nasyam mansiyyaa
ayah.translation: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, I wish I had died before this and was in oblivion, forgotten."

ayah.transliteration: Fanaadaahaa min tahtihaan allaa tahzanee qad ja'ala Rabbuki tahtaki sariyyaa
ayah.translation: But he called her from below her, "Do not grieve; your Lord has provided beneath you a stream.

ayah.transliteration: Wa huzzeee ilaiki bijiz 'in nakhlati tusaaqit 'alaiki rutaban janiyyaa
ayah.translation: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

ayah.transliteration: Fakulee washrabee wa qarree 'ainaa; fa immaa tarayinnna minal bashari ahadan faqooleee innee nazartu lir Rahmaani sawman falan ukallimal yawma insiyyaa
ayah.translation: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "

ayah.transliteration: Fa atat bihee qawmahaa tahmiluhoo qaaloo yaa Maryamoo laqad ji'ti shai'an fariyyaa
ayah.translation: Then she brought him to her people, carrying him. They said, "O Mary, you have certainly done a thing unprecedented.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ukkhta Haaroona maa kaana abokim ra-a saw'inw wa maa kaanat ummuki baghiyyaa
ayah.translation: O sister of Aaron, your father was not a man of evil, nor was your mother unchaste."

ayah.transliteration: Fa ashaarat ilaih; qaaloo kaifa nukallimu man kaana fil mahdi sabiyyaa
ayah.translation: So she pointed to him. They said, "How can we speak to one who is in the cradle a child?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innee 'abdullaahi aataaniyal Kitaaba wa ja'alanee Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Jesus] said, "Indeed, I am the servant of Allah. He has given me the Scripture and made me a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alanee mubaarakan aina maa kuntu wa awsaanee bis Salaati waz Zakaati maa dumtu haiyaa
ayah.translation: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive

ayah.transliteration: Wa barram biwaalidatee wa lam yaj'alnee jabbaaran shaqiyyaa
ayah.translation: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

ayah.transliteration: Wassalaamu 'alaiya yawma wulittu wa yawma amootu wa yawma ub'asu baiyaa
ayah.translation: And peace is on me the day I was born and the day I will die and the day I am raised alive."

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika 'Eesab-nu Marya; qawlal haqqil lazee feehi yamtaroon
ayah.translation: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

ayah.transliteration: Maa kaana lillaahi ai yattakhiza minw waladin Subhaanah; izaa qadaaa amran fa innamaa yaqoolu lahoo kun fa yakoon
ayah.translation: It is not [befitting] for Allah to take a son; exalted is He! When He decrees an affair, He only says to it, "Be," and it is.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innal laaha Rabbee wa Rabbukum fa'budooh; haazaa Siraatum Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: [Jesus said], "And indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is a straight path."

ayah.transliteration: Fakhtalafal ahzaabu mim bainihim fawailul lillazeena kafaroo mim mashhadi Yawmin 'azeem
ayah.translation: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

ayah.transliteration: Asmi' bihim wa absir Yawma yaatoonanaa laakiniz zaalimoonal yawma fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anzirhum Yawmal hasrati iz qudiyal amr; wa hum fee ghaflatinw wa hum laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa NNahnu narisul arda wa man 'alaihaa wa ilainaa yurja'oon
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi Ibraaheem; innahoo kaana siddeeqan Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi yaaa abati lima ta'budu maa laa yasma'u wa laa yubsiru wa laa yughnee 'anka shai'aa
ayah.translation: [Mention] when he said to his father, "O my father, why do you worship that which does not hear and does not see and will not benefit you at all?

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa abati innee qad jaaa'anee minal 'ilmi maa lam yaatika fattabi'neee ahdika siraatan Sawiyyaa
ayah.translation: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa abati laa ta'budish Shaitaana innash Shaitaana kaana lir Rahmaani 'asiyyaa
ayah.translation: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa abati innee akhaafu ai yamssaka 'azaabum minar Rahmaani fatakoona lish Shaitaani waliyyaa
ayah.translation: O my father, indeed I fear that there will touch you a punishment from the Most Merciful so you would be to Satan a companion [in Hellfire]."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala araaghibun anta 'an aalihatee yaaa Ibraaheemu la 'il lam tantahi la arjumannaka wahjumee maliyyaa
ayah.translation: [His father] said, "Have you no desire for my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist, I will surely stone you, so avoid me a prolonged time."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala salaamun 'alaika sa astaghfiru laka Rabbeee innahoo kaana bee hafiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Abraham] said, "Peace will be upon you. I will ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Indeed, He is ever gracious to me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa a'tazilukum wa maa tad'oona min doonil laahi wa ad'o Rabbee 'asaaa allaaa akoona bidu'aaa'i Rabbee shaqiyyaa
ayah.translation: And I will leave you and those you invoke other than Allah and will invoke my Lord. I expect that I will not be in invocation to my Lord unhappy."

ayah.transliteration: Falamma' tazalahum wa maa ya'budoona min doonil laahi wahabnaa lahoo is-haaqa wa ya'qoob, wa kullan ja'alnaa Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wa wahabnaa lahum mirrahmatinaa wa ja'alnaa lahum lisaana sidqin 'aliyyaa
ayah.translation: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi Moosaaa; innahoo kaana mukhlasanw wa kaana Rasoolan Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wa naadainaahu min jaanibit Tooril aimani wa qarrabnaahu najiyyaa
ayah.translation: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

ayah.transliteration: Wa wahabnaa lahoo mir rahmatinaaa akhaahu Haaroona Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi ismaa'eel; innahoo kaana saadiqal wa'di wa kaana Rasoolan Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaana yaamuru ahlahoo bis Salaati waz zakaati wa kaana 'inda Rabbihee mardiyyaa
ayah.translation: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur fil Kitaabi Idrees; innahoo kaana siddeeqan Nabiyyaa
ayah.translation: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

ayah.transliteration: Wa rafa'naahu makaanan 'aliyyaa
ayah.translation: And We raised him to a high station.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena an'amal laahu 'alaihim minan Nabiyyeena min zurriyyati Aadama wa mimman hamalnaa ma'a Noohinw wa min zurriyyati Ibraaheema wa Israaa'eela wa mimman hadainaa wajta bainaaa; izaa tutlaa 'alaihim Aayaatur Rahmaani kharroo sujjadanw wa bukiyyaa
ayah.translation: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

ayah.transliteration: Fakhalafa mim ba'dihim khalfun adaa'us Salaata wattaba'ush shahawaati fasawfa yalqawna ghaiyaa
ayah.translation: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man taaba wa aamana wa 'amila saalihan fa ulaaa'ika yadkhuloonal jannata wa laa yuzlamoona shai'aa
ayah.translation: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

ayah.transliteration: Jannaati 'adninil latee wa'adar Rahmaanu ibaadahoo bilghaib; innahoo kaana wa'duhoo maatiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yasma'oona feehaa laghwan illaa salaamaa; wa lahum rizquhum feehaa bukratanw wa 'ashiyyaa
ayah.translation: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

ayah.transliteration: Tilkal jannatul latee oorisu min 'ibaadinaa man kaana taqiyyaa
ayah.translation: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa natanazzalu illaa bi amri Rabbika lahoo maa baina aideenaa wa maa khalfanaa wa maa baina zaalik; wa maa kaana Rabbuka nasiyyaa
ayah.translation: [Gabriel said], "And we [angels] descend not except by the order of your Lord. To Him belongs that before us and that behind us and what is in between. And never is your Lord forgetful -

ayah.transliteration: Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa fa'bud hu wastabir li'ibaadatih; hal ta'lamu lahoo samiyyaa
ayah.translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them - so worship Him and have patience for His worship. Do you know of any similarity to Him?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqoolul insaanu 'aizaa maa mittu lasawfa ukhraju haiyaa
ayah.translation: And the disbeliever says, "When I have died, am I going to be brought forth alive?"

ayah.transliteration: awalaa yazkurul insaanu annaa khalaqnaahu min qablu wa lam yaku shai'aa
ayah.translation: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

ayah.transliteration: Fawa Rabbika lanahshu rannahum wash shayaateena summa lanuhdirannahum hawla jahannama jisiyyaa
ayah.translation: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

ayah.transliteration: Summa lananzi 'anna min kulli shee'atin aiyuhum ashaddu 'alar Rahmaani 'itiyyaa
ayah.translation: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

ayah.transliteration: Summa lanahnu a'lamu billazeena hum awlaa bihaa siliyyaa
ayah.translation: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

ayah.transliteration: Wa im minkum illaa waa riduhaa; kaana 'alaa Rabbika hatmam maqdiyyaa
ayah.translation: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

ayah.transliteration: Summa nunajjil lazeenat taqaw wa nazaruz zaalimeena feehaa jisiyyaa
ayah.translation: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa tutlaa 'alaihim Aayaatunaa baiyinaatin qaalal lazeena kafaroo lillazeena aamanooo aiyul fareeqaini khairum maqaamanw wa ahsanu nadiyyaa
ayah.translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of [our] two parties is best in position and best in association?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa qablahum min qarnin hum ahsanu asaasanw wa ri'yaa
ayah.translation: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

ayah.transliteration: Qul man kaana fidda laalati falyamdud lahur Rahmaanu maddaa; hattaaa izaa ra aw maa yoo'adoona immal 'azaaba wa immas Saa'ata fasa ya'lamoona man huwa sharrum makaananw wa ad'afu jundaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Whoever is in error - let the Most Merciful extend for him an extension [in wealth and time] until, when they see that which they were promised - either punishment [in this world] or the Hour [of resurrection] - they will come to know who is worst in position and weaker in soldiers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yazeedul laahul lazeenah tadaw hudaa; wal baaqiyaatus saalihaatu khairun 'inda Rabbika sawaabanw wa khairum maraddaa
ayah.translation: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytal lazee kafara bi Aayaatinaa wa qaala la oota yanna maalanw wa waladaa
ayah.translation: Then, have you seen he who disbelieved in Our verses and said, "I will surely be given wealth and children [in the next life]?"

ayah.transliteration: Attala'al ghaiba amitta khaza'indar Rahmaani 'ahdaa
ayah.translation: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

ayah.transliteration: Kallaa; sanaktubu maa yaqoolu wa namuddu lahoo minal 'azaabi maddaa
ayah.translation: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.

ayah.transliteration: Wa narisuhoo maa yaqoolu wa yaateenaa fardaa
ayah.translation: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

ayah.transliteration: Wattakhazoo min doonil laahi aalihatal liyakoonoo lahum 'izzaa
ayah.translation: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

ayah.transliteration: Kallaa; sa yakfuroona bi'ibaadatihim wa yakoonoona 'alaihim diddaa
ayah.translation: No! Those "gods" will deny their worship of them and will be against them opponents [on the Day of Judgement].

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annaaa arsalnash Shayaateena 'alal kaafireena ta'uzzuhum azzaa
ayah.translation: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?

ayah.transliteration: Falaa ta'jal alaihim innamaa na 'uddu lahum 'addaa
ayah.translation: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma nahshurul muttaqeena ilar Rahmaani wafdaa
ayah.translation: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

ayah.transliteration: Wa nasooqul mujrimeena ilaa Jahannama wirdaa
ayah.translation: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

ayah.transliteration: Laa yamlikoonash shafaa'ta illaa manittakhaza 'indar Rahmaani 'ahdaa
ayah.translation: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalut takhazar Rahmaanu waladaa
ayah.translation: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken [for Himself] a son."

ayah.transliteration: Laqad ji'tum shai'an iddaa
ayah.translation: You have done an atrocious thing.

ayah.transliteration: Takaadus samaawaatu yatafattarna minhu wa tanshaq qul ardu wa takhirrul jibaalu haddaa
ayah.translation: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

ayah.transliteration: An da'aw lir Rahmaani waladaa
ayah.translation: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yambaghee lir Rahmaani ai yattakhiza waladaa
ayah.translation: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

ayah.transliteration: In kullu man fis samaawaati wal ardi illaaa aatir Rahmaani 'abdaa
ayah.translation: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad ahsaahum wa addahum 'addaa
ayah.translation: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kulluhum aateehi Yawmal Qiyaamati fardaa
ayah.translation: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati sa yaj'alu lahumur Rahmaanu wuddaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

ayah.transliteration: Fa innamaa yassarnaahu bilisaanika litubashshira bihil muttaqeena wa tunzira bihee qawmal luddaa
ayah.translation: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa qabla hum min qarnin hal tuhissu minhum min ahadin aw tasma'u lahum rikzaa
ayah.translation: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

ayah.transliteration: Taa-Haa
ayah.translation: Ta, Ha.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa anzalnaa 'alaikal Qur-aana litashqaaa
ayah.translation: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

ayah.transliteration: Illaa tazkiratal limany yakshaa
ayah.translation: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelam mimman khalaqal arda was samaawaatil 'ulaa
ayah.translation: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

ayah.transliteration: Ar-Rahmaanu 'alal 'Arshis tawaa
ayah.translation: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi wa maa bainahumaa wa maa tahtassaraa
ayah.translation: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in tajhar bilqawli fainnahoo ya'lamus sirra wa akhfaa
ayah.translation: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu laaa ilasha illaa Huwa lahul Asmaaa'ul Husnaa
ayah.translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hal ataaka hadeesu Moosa
ayah.translation: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

ayah.transliteration: Iz ra aa naaran faqaala li alhlihim kusooo inneee aanastu naaral la'alleee aateekum minhaa biqabasin aw ajidu 'alan naari hudaa
ayah.translation: When he saw a fire and said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire; perhaps I can bring you a torch or find at the fire some guidance."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa ataahaa noodiya yaa Moosaa
ayah.translation: And when he came to it, he was called, "O Moses,

ayah.transliteration: Inneee Ana Rabbuka fakhla' na'laika innaka bilwaadil muqaddasi Tuwaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anakhtartuka fastami' limaa yoohaa
ayah.translation: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].

ayah.transliteration: Innaneee Anal laahu laaa ilaaha illaa Ana fa'budnee wa aqimis-salaata lizikree
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

ayah.transliteration: Innas Saa'ata aatiyatun akaadu ukhfeehaa litujzaa kullu nafsim bimaa tas'aa
ayah.translation: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa yasuddannnaka 'anhaa mal laa yu'minu bihaa wattaba'a hawaahu fatardaa
ayah.translation: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa tilka bi yamee nika yaa Moosaa
ayah.translation: And what is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala hiya 'asaaya atawakka'u alaihaa wa ahushshu bihaa 'alaa ghanamee wa liya feehaa ma aaribu ukhraa
ayah.translation: He said, "It is my staff; I lean upon it, and I bring down leaves for my sheep and I have therein other uses."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala alqihaa yaa Moosaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Throw it down, O Moses."

ayah.transliteration: Fa-alqaahaa fa -izaa hiya haiyatun tas'aa
ayah.translation: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala khuzhaa wa laa ta khaf sanu'eeduhaa seeratahal oolaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Seize it and fear not; We will return it to its former condition.

ayah.transliteration: Wadmum yadaka ilaa janaahika takhruj baidaaa'a min ghairi sooo'in Aayatan ukhraa
ayah.translation: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,

ayah.transliteration: Linuriyaka min Aayaatinal Kubra
ayah.translation: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

ayah.transliteration: Izhab ilaa Fir'awna innahoo taghaa
ayah.translation: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbish rah lee sadree
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "My Lord, expand for me my breast [with assurance]

ayah.transliteration: Wa yassir leee amree
ayah.translation: And ease for me my task

ayah.transliteration: Wahlul 'uqdatam milli saanee
ayah.translation: And untie the knot from my tongue

ayah.transliteration: Yafqahoo qawlee
ayah.translation: That they may understand my speech.

ayah.transliteration: Waj'al lee wazeeram min ahlee
ayah.translation: And appoint for me a minister from my family -

ayah.transliteration: Haaroona akhee
ayah.translation: Aaron, my brother.

ayah.transliteration: Ushdud biheee azree
ayah.translation: Increase through him my strength

ayah.transliteration: Wa ashrik hu feee amree
ayah.translation: And let him share my task

ayah.transliteration: Kai nusabbihaka kaseeraa
ayah.translation: That we may exalt You much

ayah.transliteration: Wa nazkuraka kaseeraa
ayah.translation: And remember You much.

ayah.transliteration: Innaka kunta binaa baseeraa
ayah.translation: Indeed, You are of us ever Seeing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala qad ooteeta su'laka yaa Moosaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "You have been granted your request, O Moses.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad manannaa 'alaika marratan ukhraaa
ayah.translation: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,

ayah.transliteration: Iz awhainaaa ilaaa ummika maa yoohaaa
ayah.translation: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

ayah.transliteration: Aniqzifeehi fit Taabooti faqzifeehi fil yammi fal yul qihil yammu bis saahili yaakhuzhu 'aduwwul lee wa 'aduwwul lah; wa alqaitu 'alaika mahabbatam minnee wa litusna'a 'alaa 'ainee
ayah.translation: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.

ayah.transliteration: Iz tamsheee ukhtuka fataqoolu hal adullukum 'alaa mai yakfuluhoo faraja 'naaka ilaaa ummika kai taqarra 'ainuhaa wa laa tahzan; wa qatalta nafsan fanajjainaaka minal ghammi wa fatannaaka futoonaa; falabista sineena feee ahli Madyana summa ji'ta 'alaa qadariny yaa Moosa
ayah.translation: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.

ayah.transliteration: Wastana' tuka linafsee
ayah.translation: And I produced you for Myself.

ayah.transliteration: Izhab anta wa akhooka bi Aayaatee wa laa taniyaa fee zikree
ayah.translation: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.

ayah.transliteration: Izhabaaa ilaa Fir'awna innahoo taghaa
ayah.translation: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

ayah.transliteration: Faqoolaa lahoo qawlal laiyinal la allahoo yatazakkkaru 'aw yakhshaa
ayah.translation: And speak to him with gentle speech that perhaps he may be reminded or fear [Allah]."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalaa Rabbanaaa innanaa nakhaafu ai yafruta 'alainaaa aw ai yatghaa
ayah.translation: They said, "Our Lord, indeed we are afraid that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laa takhaafaaa innanee ma'akumaa asma'u wa araa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Fear not. Indeed, I am with you both; I hear and I see.

ayah.transliteration: Faatiyaahu faqoolaaa innaa Rasoolaa Rabbika fa arsil ma'anaa Banee Israaa'eela wa laa tu'azzibhum qad ji'naaka bi Aayatim mir Rabbika wassa laamu 'alaa manit taba'al hudaa
ayah.translation: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa qad oohiya ilainaaa annnal 'azaaba 'alaa man kaz zaba wa tawalla
ayah.translation: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "

ayah.transliteration: Qaala famar Rabbu kumaa yaa Moosa
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "So who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbunal lazeee a'taa kulla shai'in khalqahoo summa hadaa
ayah.translation: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave each thing its form and then guided [it]."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala famaa baalul quroonil oolaa
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Then what is the case of the former generations?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala 'ilmuhaa 'inda Rabee fee kitaab, laa yadillu Rabbee wa laa yansaa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "The knowledge thereof is with my Lord in a record. My Lord neither errs nor forgets."

ayah.transliteration: Allazee ja'ala lakumul arda mahdanw wa salaka lakum feehaa subulanw wa anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa akhrajnaa biheee azwaajam min nabaatin shatta
ayah.translation: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.

ayah.transliteration: Kuloo war'aw an'aamakum; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil li ulin nuhaa
ayah.translation: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.

ayah.transliteration: Minhaa khalaqnaakum wa feehaa nu'eedukum wa minhaa nukhrijukum taaratan ukhraa
ayah.translation: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arainaahu Aayaatinaa kullahaa fakaz zaba wa abaa
ayah.translation: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala aji'tanaa litukhri janaa min ardinaa bisihrika yaa Moosa
ayah.translation: He said, "Have you come to us to drive us out of our land with your magic, O Moses?

ayah.transliteration: Falanaatiyannaka bisihrim mislihee faj'al bainanaa wa bainaka maw'idal laa nukhlifuhoo nahnu wa laaa anta makaanan suwaa
