ayah.translation: Then we will surely bring you magic like it, so make between us and you an appointment, which we will not fail to keep and neither will you, in a place assigned."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala maw'idukum yawmuz zeenati wa ai yuhsharan naasu duhaa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Your appointment is on the day of the festival when the people assemble at mid-morning."

ayah.transliteration: Fatawallaa Fir'awnu fajjama'a kaidahoo summa ataa
ayah.translation: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lahum Moosaa wailakum laa taftaroo 'alal laahi kaziban fa yus hitakum bi 'azaab, wa qad khaaba manif taraa
ayah.translation: Moses said to the magicians summoned by Pharaoh, "Woe to you! Do not invent a lie against Allah or He will exterminate you with a punishment; and he has failed who invents [such falsehood]."

ayah.transliteration: Fatanaaza'ooo amrahum bainahum wa asarrun najwaa
ayah.translation: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo in haaazaani lasaahiraani yureedaani ai yukhrijaakum min ardikum bisihrihimaa wa yazhabaa bitareeqatikumul muslaa
ayah.translation: They said, "Indeed, these are two magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic and do away with your most exemplary way.

ayah.transliteration: Fa ajmi'oo kaidakum summma'too saffaa; wa qad aflahal yawma manis ta'laa
ayah.translation: So resolve upon your plan and then come [forward] in line. And he has succeeded today who overcomes."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa Moosaaa immaaa an tulqiya wa immaaa an nakoona awala man alqaa
ayah.translation: They said, "O Moses, either you throw or we will be the first to throw."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala bal alqoo fa izaa hibaaluhum wa 'isiyyuhum yuhaiyalu ilaihi min sihrihim annahaa tas'aa
ayah.translation: He said, "Rather, you throw." And suddenly their ropes and staffs seemed to him from their magic that they were moving [like snakes].

ayah.transliteration: Fa awjasa fee nafsihee kheefatam Moosa
ayah.translation: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

ayah.transliteration: Qulnaa laa takhaf innaka antal a'laa
ayah.translation: Allah said, "Fear not. Indeed, it is you who are superior.

ayah.transliteration: Wa alqi maa fee yamee nika talqaf maa sana'oo; innamaa sana'oo kaidu saahir; wa laa yuflihus saahiru haisu ataa
ayah.translation: And throw what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have crafted. What they have crafted is but the trick of a magician, and the magician will not succeed wherever he is."

ayah.transliteration: Fa ulqiyas saharatu sujjadan qaalooo aamannaa bi Rabbi Haaroona wa Moosa
ayah.translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration. They said, "We have believed in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala aamantum lahoo qabla an aazana lakum; innahoo lakabeerukumul lazee 'allama kumus sihra fala uqatti'anna aidiyakum wa arjulakum min khilaafinw wa la usallibannakum fee juzoo'in nakhli wa lata'lamunna aiyunaaa ashaddu 'azaabanw wa abqaa
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic. So I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you on the trunks of palm trees, and you will surely know which of us is more severe in [giving] punishment and more enduring."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo lan nu'siraka 'alaa maa jaaa'anaa minal baiyinaati wallazee fataranaa faqdi maaa anta qaad; innamaa taqdee haazihil hayaatad dunyaa
ayah.translation: They said, "Never will we prefer you over what has come to us of clear proofs and [over] He who created us. So decree whatever you are to decree. You can only decree for this worldly life.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa aamannaa bi Rabbinaa liyaghfira lanaa khataayaanaa wa maaa akrahtanaa 'alaihi minas sihr; wallaahu khairunw waabqaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord that He may forgive us our sins and what you compelled us [to do] of magic. And Allah is better and more enduring."

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo mai yaati Rabbahoo mujriman fa inna lahoo Jahannama laa yamotu feehaa wa laa yahyaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yaatihee mu'minan qad 'amilas saalihaati fa ulaaa'ika lahumud dara jaatul 'ulaa
ayah.translation: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

ayah.transliteration: Jannaatu 'Adnin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaa; wa zaalika jazaaa'ua man tazakka
ayah.translation: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa an asri bi'ibaadee fadrib lahum tareeqan fil bahri yabasal laa takhaafu darakanw wa laa takhshaa
ayah.translation: And We had inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants and strike for them a dry path through the sea; you will not fear being overtaken [by Pharaoh] nor be afraid [of drowning]."

ayah.transliteration: Fa atba'ahum Fir'awnu bijunoodihee faghashiyahum minal yammmi maa ghashi yahum
ayah.translation: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

ayah.transliteration: wa adalla fir'awnu qawmahoo wa maa hadaa
ayah.translation: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

ayah.transliteration: Yaa Baneee Israaa'eela qad anjainaakum min 'aduw wikum wa wa'adnaakum jaanibat Tooril aimana wa nazzalnaa 'alaikumul Manna was Salwaa
ayah.translation: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

ayah.transliteration: Kuloo min taiyibaati maa razaqnaakum wa laa tatghaw feehi fa yahilla 'alaikum ghadabee wa mai yahlil 'alaihi ghadabee faqad hawaa
ayah.translation: [Saying], "Eat from the good things with which We have provided you and do not transgress [or oppress others] therein, lest My anger should descend upon you. And he upon whom My anger descends has certainly fallen."

ayah.transliteration: Wa innee la Ghaffaarul liman taaba wa aamana wa 'amila saalihan summah tadaa
ayah.translation: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa a'jalaka 'an qawmika yaa Moosa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "And what made you hasten from your people, O Moses?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala hum ulaaa'i 'alaaa asaree wa 'ajiltu ilaika Rabbi litardaa
ayah.translation: He said, "They are close upon my tracks, and I hastened to You, my Lord, that You be pleased."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fa innaa qad fatannaa qawmaka mim ba'dika wa adallahumus Saamiriyy
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "But indeed, We have tried your people after you [departed], and the Samiri has led them astray."

ayah.transliteration: Faraja's Moosaaa ilaa qawmihee ghadbaana asifaa; qaala yaa qawmi alam ya'idkum Rabbukum wa'dan hasanaa; afataala 'alaikumul 'ahdu am arattum ai yahilla 'alaikum ghadabum mir Rabbikum fa akhlaftum maw'idee
ayah.translation: So Moses returned to his people, angry and grieved. He said, "O my people, did your Lord not make you a good promise? Then, was the time [of its fulfillment] too long for you, or did you wish that wrath from your Lord descend upon you, so you broke your promise [of obedience] to me?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo maaa akhlafnaa maw'idaka bimalkinna wa laakinna hummilnaaa awzaaram min zeenatil qawmi faqazafnaahaa fakazaalika alqas Saamiriyy
ayah.translation: They said, "We did not break our promise to you by our will, but we were made to carry burdens from the ornaments of the people [of Pharaoh], so we threw them [into the fire], and thus did the Samiri throw."

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhraja lahum 'ijlan jasadal lahoo khuwaarun faqaaloo haazaaa ilaahukum wa ilaahu Moosaa fanasee
ayah.translation: And he extracted for them [the statue of] a calf which had a lowing sound, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he forgot."

ayah.transliteration: Afalaa yarawna allaa yarji'u ilaihim qawlanw wa laa yamliku lahum darranw wa laa naf'aa
ayah.translation: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad qaala lahum Haaroonu min qablu yaa qawmi innamaa futintum bihee wa inna Rabbakumur Rahmaanu fattabi'oonee wa atee'ooo amree
ayah.translation: And Aaron had already told them before [the return of Moses], "O my people, you are only being tested by it, and indeed, your Lord is the Most Merciful, so follow me and obey my order."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo lan nabraha 'alaihi 'aakifeena hattaa yarji'a ilainaa Moosaa
ayah.translation: They said, "We will never cease being devoted to the calf until Moses returns to us."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Yaa Haaroonu maa mana 'aka iz ra aitahum dallooo
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "O Aaron, what prevented you, when you saw them going astray,

ayah.transliteration: Allaa tattabi'ani afa'asaita amree
ayah.translation: From following me? Then have you disobeyed my order?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala yabna'umma laa taakhuz bilihyatee wa laa biraasee innee khashetu an taqoola farraqta baina Baneee Israaa'eela wa lam tarqub qawlee
ayah.translation: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.' "

ayah.transliteration: Qaala famaa khatbuka yaa Saamiriyy
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala basurtu bimaa lam yabsuroo bihee faqabadtu qabdatam min asarir Rasooli fanabaztuhaa wa kazaalika sawwalat lee nafsee
ayah.translation: He said, "I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful [of dust] from the track of the messenger and threw it, and thus did my soul entice me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fazhab fa inna laka fil hayaati an taqoola laa misaasa wa inna laka maw'idal lan tukhlafahoo wanzur ilaaa ilaahikal lazee zalta 'alaihi 'aakifaa; lanuharriqannnahoo summa lanansifanahoo fil yammi nasfaa
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaaa ilaahukkumul laahul lazee laa ilaaha illaa Hoo; wasi'a kulla shai'in ilmaa
ayah.translation: Your god is only Allah, except for whom there is no deity. He has encompassed all things in knowledge."

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika naqussu 'alaika min ambaaa'i maa qad sabaq; wa qad aatainaaka mil ladunnaa Zikraa
ayah.translation: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.

ayah.transliteration: Man a'rada 'anhu, fa innahoo yahmilu Yawmal Qiyaamati wizraa
ayah.translation: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,

ayah.transliteration: Khaalideena feehi wa saaa'a lahum Yawmal Qiyaamati himlaa
ayah.translation: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yunfakhu fissoori wa nahshurul mujrimeena Yawma 'izin zurqaa
ayah.translation: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

ayah.transliteration: Yatakhaafatoona bainahum il labistum illaa 'ashraa
ayah.translation: They will murmur among themselves, "You remained not but ten [days in the world]."

ayah.transliteration: nahnu a'lamu bimaa yaqooloona iz yaqoolu amsaluhum tareeqatan illabistum illaa yawmaa
ayah.translation: We are most knowing of what they say when the best of them in manner will say, "You remained not but one day."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yas'aloonaka 'anil jibaali faqul yansifuhaa Rabbee nasfaa
ayah.translation: And they ask you about the mountains, so say, "My Lord will blow them away with a blast.

ayah.transliteration: Fa yazaruhaa qaa'an safsafaa
ayah.translation: And He will leave the earth a level plain;

ayah.transliteration: Laa taraa feehaa 'iwajanw wa laaa amtaa
ayah.translation: You will not see therein a depression or an elevation."

ayah.transliteration: Yawma iziny yattabi'oonad daa'iya laa 'iwaja lahoo wa khasha'atil aswaatu lir Rahmaani falaa tasma'u illaa hamsaa
ayah.translation: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

ayah.transliteration: Yawma 'izil laa tanfa'ush shafaa'atu illaa man azina lahur Rahmaanu wa radiya lahoo qawlaa
ayah.translation: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu maa bainaa aideehim wa maa khalfahum wa laa yauheetoona bihee 'ilmaa
ayah.translation: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'anatil wujoohu lil Haiiyil Qaiyoomi wa qad khaaba man hamala zulmaa
ayah.translation: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai ya'mal minas saalihaati wa huwa mu'minun falaa yakhaafu zulmanw wa laa hadmaa
ayah.translation: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika anzalnaahu Qur-aanan 'Arabiyyanw wa sarrafnaa fee hi minal wa'eedi la'allahum yattaqoona aw yuhdisu lahum zikraa
ayah.translation: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

ayah.transliteration: Fata'aalal laahul Malikul Haqq; wa laa ta'jal bil Quraani min qabli ai yuqdaaa ilaika wahyuhoo wa qur Rabbi zidnee 'ilmaa
ayah.translation: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad 'ahidnaaa ilaaa Aadama min qablu fanasiya wa lam najid lahoo 'azmaa
ayah.translation: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qulnaa lilma laaa'ikatis judoo li Aadama fasajadooo illaaa Iblees; abaa
ayah.translation: And [mention] when We said to the angels, "Prostrate to Adam," and they prostrated, except Iblees; he refused.

ayah.transliteration: Faqulnaa yaaa Aadamu inna haazaa 'aduwwul laka wa lizawjika falaa yukhrijan nakumaa minal Jannati fatashqaa
ayah.translation: So We said, "O Adam, indeed this is an enemy to you and to your wife. Then let him not remove you from Paradise so you would suffer.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa laka allaa tajoo'a feeha wa laa ta'raa
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa annaka laa tazma'u feehaa wa laa tadhaa
ayah.translation: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."

ayah.transliteration: Fa waswasa ilaihish Shaitaanu qaala yaaa Aadamu hal adulluka 'alaa shajaratil khuldi wa mulkil laa yablaa
ayah.translation: Then Satan whispered to him; he said, "O Adam, shall I direct you to the tree of eternity and possession that will not deteriorate?"

ayah.transliteration: Fa akalaa minhaa fabadat lahumaa saw aatuhumaa wa tafiqaa yakhsifaani 'alaihimaa minw waraqil jannah; wa 'asaaa Aadamu Rabbahoo faghawaa
ayah.translation: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

ayah.transliteration: Summaj tabbahu Rabbuhoo fataaba 'alaihi wa hadaa
ayah.translation: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

ayah.transliteration: Qaalah bita minhaa jamee'am ba'dukum liba'din 'aduww; fa immaa yaati yannakum minnee hudan famanit taba'a hudaaya falaa yadillu wa laa yashhqaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Descend from Paradise - all, [your descendants] being enemies to one another. And if there should come to you guidance from Me - then whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray [in the world] nor suffer [in the Hereafter].

ayah.transliteration: Wa man a'rada 'an Zikree fa inna lahoo ma'eeshatan dankanw wa nahshuruhoo Yawmal Qiyaamati a'maa
ayah.translation: And whoever turns away from My remembrance - indeed, he will have a depressed life, and We will gather him on the Day of Resurrection blind."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi lima hashar tanee a'maa wa qad kuntu baseeraa
ayah.translation: He will say, "My Lord, why have you raised me blind while I was [once] seeing?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala kazaalika atatka Aayaatunaa fanaseetahaa wa kazaalikal Yawma tunsaa
ayah.translation: [Allah] will say, "Thus did Our signs come to you, and you forgot them; and thus will you this Day be forgotten."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika najzee man asrafa wa lam yu'mim bi Aayaati Rabbih; wa la'azaabul Aakhirati ashaddu wa abqaa
ayah.translation: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yahdi lahum kam ahlaknaa qablahum minal qurooni yamshoona fee masaakinihim; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil li ulinnuhaa
ayah.translation: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laa Kalimatun sabaqat mir Rabbika lakaana lizaamanw wa ajalum musammaa
ayah.translation: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

ayah.transliteration: Fasbir 'alaa maa yaqooloona wa sabbih bihamdi Rabbika qabla tuloo'ish shamsi wa qabla ghuroobihaa wa min aanaaa'il laili fasbbih wa atraafan nahaari la 'allaka tardaa
ayah.translation: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tamuddanna 'ainaika ilaa ma matta'na biheee azwajam minhum zahratal hayaatid dunya linaftinahum feeh; wa rizqu Rabbika khairunw wa abqaa
ayah.translation: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

ayah.transliteration: Waamur ahlaka bis Salaati wastabir 'alaihaa la nas'aluka rizqaa; nahnu narzuquk; wal 'aaqibatu littaqwaa
ayah.translation: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo law laa yaateenaa bi Aayatim mmir Rabbih; awalam taatihim baiyinatu maa fis suhufil oolaa
ayah.translation: And they say, "Why does he not bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has there not come to them evidence of what was in the former scriptures?

ayah.transliteration: Wa law annaaa ahlaknaahum bi'azaabim min qablihee laqaaloo Rabbanaa law laaa arsalta ilainaa Rasoolan fanattabi's Aayaatika min qabli an nazilla wa nakhzaa
ayah.translation: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before him, they would have said, "Our Lord, why did You not send to us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses before we were humiliated and disgraced?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul kullum mutarabbisun fatarabbasoo fasta'lamoona man Ashaabus Siraatis Sawiyyi wa manih tadaa
ayah.translation: Say, "Each [of us] is waiting; so wait. For you will know who are the companions of the sound path and who is guided."

ayah.transliteration: Iqtaraba linnaasi hisaa buhum wa hum fee ghaflatim mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yaateehim min zikrim mir Rabbihim muhdasin illas tama'oohu wa hum yal'aboon
ayah.translation: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

ayah.transliteration: Laahiyatan quloobuhum; wa asarrun najwal lazeena zalamoo hal haazaa illaa basharum mislukum afataa toonas sihra wa antum tubsiroon
ayah.translation: With their hearts distracted. And those who do wrong conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is this [Prophet] except a human being like you? So would you approach magic while you are aware [of it]?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbee ya'lamul qawla fis samaaa'i wal ardi wa Huwas Samee'ul Aleem
ayah.translation: The Prophet said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the Hearing, the Knowing."

ayah.transliteration: Bal qaalooo adghaasu ahlaamim balif taraahu bal huwa shaa'irun falyaatinaa bi Aayatin kamaa ursilal awwaloon
ayah.translation: But they say, "[The revelation is but] a mixture of false dreams; rather, he has invented it; rather, he is a poet. So let him bring us a sign just as the previous [messengers] were sent [with miracles]."

ayah.transliteration: Maaa aaamanat qablahum min qaryatin ahlaknaahaa a-fahum yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa qablaka illaa rijaalan nooheee ilaihim fas'aloo ahlaz zikri in kuntum laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa ja'alnaahum jasadal laa yaakuloonat ta'aama wa maa kaanoo khaalideen
ayah.translation: And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].

ayah.transliteration: summa sadaqnaa humul wa'da fa-anjainaahum wa man nashaaa'u wa ahlaknal musrifeen
ayah.translation: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad anzalnaaa ilaikum Kitaaban feehi zikrukum afalaa ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam qasamnaa min qaryatin kannat zaalimatanw wa anshadnaa ba'dahaa qawman aakhareen
ayah.translation: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa ahassoo baasanaaa izaaa hum minhaa yarkudoon
ayah.translation: And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.

ayah.transliteration: Laa tarkudoo warji'ooo ilaa maaa utriftum feehe wa masaakinikum la'allakum tus'aloon
ayah.translation: [Some angels said], "Do not flee but return to where you were given luxury and to your homes - perhaps you will be questioned."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa wailanaaa innaa kunnaa zaalimeen
ayah.translation: They said, "O woe to us! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Famaa zaalat tilka da'waahum hattaa ja'alnaahum haseedan khaamideen
ayah.translation: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqnas samaaa'a wal arda wa maa bainahumaa laa'ibeen
ayah.translation: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.

ayah.transliteration: Law aradnaaa an nattakhiza lahwal lat takhaznaahu mil ladunnaaa in kunnaa faa'ileen
ayah.translation: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.

ayah.transliteration: Bal naqzifu bilhaqqi 'alal baatili fa yadmaghuhoo fa izaa huwa zaahiq; wa lakumul wailu mimmaa tasifoon
ayah.translation: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahoo man fis samaawaati wal ard; wa man 'indahoo laa yastakbiroona 'an 'ibaada tihee wa laa yastahsiroon
ayah.translation: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.

ayah.transliteration: Yusabbihoona laila wannahaara laa yafturoon
ayah.translation: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.

ayah.transliteration: Amit takhazooo aalihatam minal ardi hum yunshiroon
ayah.translation: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?

ayah.transliteration: Law kaana feehimaaa aalihatun illal laahu lafasadataa; fa-Subhaanal laahi Rabbil 'Arshi 'ammaa yasifoon
ayah.translation: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yus'alu 'ammaa yaf'alu wa hum yus'aloon
ayah.translation: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

ayah.transliteration: Amit takhazoo min doonihee aalihatan qul haatoo burhaanakum haaza zikru mam ma'iya wa zikru man qablee; bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoonal haqqa fahum mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa min qablika mir Rasoolin illaa nooheee ilaihi annahoo laaa ilaaha illaaa Ana fa'budoon
ayah.translation: And We sent not before you any messenger except that We revealed to him that, "There is no deity except Me, so worship Me."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalut takhazar Rahmaanu waladan Subhaanah; bal 'ibaadum mkkramoon
ayah.translation: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken a son." Exalted is He! Rather, they are [but] honored servants.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yasbiqoonahoo bil qawli wa hum bi amrihee ya'maloon
ayah.translation: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu maa baina aideehim wa maa khalfahum wa laa yashfa'oona illaa limanir tadaa wa hum min khash yatihee mushfiqoon
ayah.translation: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yaqul minhum inneee ilaahum min doonihee fazaalika najzeehi Jahannam; kazaalika najziz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And whoever of them should say, "Indeed, I am a god besides Him"- that one We would recompense with Hell. Thus do We recompense the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaral lazeena kafarooo annas samaawaati wal arda kaanataa ratqan faftaqnaahumaa wa ja'alnaa minal maaa'i kulla shai'in haiyin afalaa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa fil ardi rawaasiya an tameeda bihim wa ja'alnaa feehaa fijaajan subulal la'allahum yahtadoon
ayah.translation: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnas samaaa'a saqfam mahfoozanw wa hum 'an Aayaatihaa mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee khalaqal laila wannahaara washshamsa wal qamara kullun fee falakiny yashbahoon
ayah.translation: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa ja'alnaa libasharim min qablikal khuld; afaimmitta fahumul khaalidoon
ayah.translation: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?

ayah.transliteration: Kullu nafsin zaaa'iqatul mawt; wa nablookum bishsharri walkhairi fitnatanw wa ilainaa turja'oon
ayah.translation: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra aakal lazeena kafarooo iny-yattakhizoonaka illa huzuwaa; ahaazal lazee yazkuru aalihatakum wa hum bi zikrir Rahmaani hum kaafiroon
ayah.translation: And when those who disbelieve see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one who insults your gods?" And they are, at the mention of the Most Merciful, disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Khuliqal insaanu min 'ajal; sa ureekum Aayaatee falaa tasta'jiloon
ayah.translation: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

ayah.transliteration: Law ya'lamul lazeena kafaroo heena laa yakuffoona 'anw wujoohihimun Naara wa laa 'an zuhoorihim wa laa hum yunsaroon
ayah.translation: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...

ayah.transliteration: Bal taateehim baghtatan fatabhatuhum falaa yastatee'oona raddahaa wa laa hum yunzaroon
ayah.translation: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqadis tuhzi'a bi-Rusulim min qablika fahaaqa billazeena sakhiroo minhum maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Qul mai yakla 'ukum billaili wannahaari minar Rahmaan; bal hum 'an zikri Rabbihim mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: Say, "Who can protect you at night or by day from the Most Merciful?" But they are, from the remembrance of their Lord, turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Am lahum aalihatun tamna'ulum min dooninaa; laa yastatee'oona nasra anfusihim wa laa hum minnna yus-haboon
ayah.translation: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

ayah.transliteration: Bal matta'naa haaa'ulaaa'i wa aabaaa'ahum hattaa taala 'alaihimul 'umur; afalaa yarawna anna naatil arda nanqusuhaa min atraafihaa; afahumul ghaaliboon
ayah.translation: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaaa unzirukum bilwahyi; wa laa yasma'us summud du'aaa'a izaa maa yunzaroon
ayah.translation: Say, "I only warn you by revelation." But the deaf do not hear the call when they are warned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'im massat hum nafhatum min 'azaabi Rabbika la yaqoolunna yaawailanaaa innnaa kunnaa zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And if [as much as] a whiff of the punishment of your Lord should touch them, they would surely say, "O woe to us! Indeed, we have been wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa nada'ul mawaazeenal qista li Yawmil Qiyaamati falaa tuzlamu nafsun shai'aa; wa in kaana misqaala habbatim min khardalin atainaa bihaa; wa kafaa binaa haasibeen
ayah.translation: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosa wa haaroonal Furqaana wa diyaa'anw wa zikral lilmuttaqeen
ayah.translation: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yakhshawna Rabbahum bilghaibi wa hum minas Saa'ati mushfiqoon
ayah.translation: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

ayah.transliteration: Wa haazaa Zikrum Mubaarakun anzalnaah; afa antum lahoo munkiroon
ayah.translation: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaaa Ibraaheema rushdahoo min qablu wa kunnaa bihee 'aalimeen
ayah.translation: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maa haazihit tamaaseelul lateee antum lahee 'aakifoon
ayah.translation: When he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo wajadnaaa aabaaa'anaa lahaa 'aabideen
ayah.translation: They said, "We found our fathers worshippers of them."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laqad kuntum antum wa aabaaa'ukum fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: He said, "You were certainly, you and your fathers, in manifest error."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo aji'tanaa bil haqqi am anta minal laa'ibeen
ayah.translation: They said, "Have you come to us with truth, or are you of those who jest?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala bar Rabbukum Rabbus samaawaati wal ardil lazee fatarahunna wa ana 'alaa zaalikum minash shaahideen
ayah.translation: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them, and I, to that, am of those who testify.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tallaahi la akeedanna asnaamakum ba'da an tuwalloo mudbireen
ayah.translation: And [I swear] by Allah, I will surely plan against your idols after you have turned and gone away."

ayah.transliteration: Faja'alahum juzaazan illaa kabeeral lahum la'allahum ilaihi yarji'oon
ayah.translation: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo man fa'ala haazaa bi aalihatinaaa innahoo laminaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? Indeed, he is of the wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo sami'naa fatany yazkuruhum yuqaalu lahooo Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: They said, "We heard a young man mention them who is called Abraham."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo faatoo bihee 'alaaa a'yunin naasi la'allahum yash hadoon
ayah.translation: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people that they may testify."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo 'a-anta fa'alta haazaa bi aalihatinaa yaaa Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala bal fa'alahoo kabeeruhum haazaa fas'aloohum in kaanoo yantiqoon
ayah.translation: He said, "Rather, this - the largest of them - did it, so ask them, if they should [be able to] speak."

ayah.transliteration: Faraja'ooo ilaaa anfusihim faqaalooo innakum antumuz zaalimoon
ayah.translation: So they returned to [blaming] themselves and said [to each other], "Indeed, you are the wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Summa nukisoo 'alaa ru'oosihim laqad 'alimta maa haaa'ulaaa'i yantiqoon
ayah.translation: Then they reversed themselves, [saying], "You have already known that these do not speak!"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala afata'budoona min doonil laahi maa laa yanfa'ukum shai'anw wa laa yadurrukum
ayah.translation: He said, "Then do you worship instead of Allah that which does not benefit you at all or harm you?

ayah.transliteration: Uffil lakum wa limaa ta'budoona min doonil laah; afalaa ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: Uff to you and to what you worship instead of Allah. Then will you not use reason?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo harriqooho wansurooo aalihatakum in kuntum faa'ileen
ayah.translation: They said, "Burn him and support your gods - if you are to act."

ayah.transliteration: Qulnaa yaa naaru koonee bardanw wa salaaman 'alaaa Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: Allah said, "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Abraham."

ayah.transliteration: Wa araadoo bihee kaidan faja'alnaahumul akhsareen
ayah.translation: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa najjainaahu wa Lootan ilal ardil latee baaraknaa feehaa lil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa wahabnaa lahooo Ishaaq; wa Ya'qooba naafilah; wa kullan ja'alnaa saaliheen
ayah.translation: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaahum a'immatany yahdoona bi amrinaa wa awhainaaa ilaihim fi'lal khairaati wa iqaamas Salaati wa eetaaa'az Zakaati wa kaanoo lanaa 'aabideen
ayah.translation: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Lootan aatainaahu hukmanw wa 'ilmanw wa najjainaahu minal qaryatil latee kaanat ta'malul khabaaa'is; innahum kaanoo qawma saw'in faasiqeen
ayah.translation: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa adkhalnaahu fee rahmatinaa innahoo minas saalihee
ayah.translation: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa noohan iz naadaa min qablu fastajabnaa lahoo fanajjainaahu wa ahlahoo minal karbil 'azeem
ayah.translation: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nasarnaahu minal qawmil lazeena kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa; innahum kkaanoo qawma saw'in fa-aghraq naahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Daawooda wa Sulaimaana iz yahkumaani fil harsi iz nafashat feehi ghanamul qawmi wa kunnaa lihukmihim shaahideen
ayah.translation: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

ayah.transliteration: Fafahhamnaahaa sulaimaan; wa kullan aatainaa hukmanw wa'ilmanw wa sakh kharnaa ma'a Daawoodal jibaala yusabbihna wattayr; wa kunnaa faa'ileen
ayah.translation: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'allamanaahu san'ata laboosil lakum lituhsinakum mim baasikum fahal antum shaakiroon
ayah.translation: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?

ayah.transliteration: Wa li Sulaimaanar reeha 'aasifatan tajree bi amriheee ilal ardil latee baaraknaa feehaa; wa kunnaa bikulli shai'in 'aalimeen
ayah.translation: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minash Shayaateeni mai yaghoosoona lahoo wa ya'maloona 'amalan doona zaalika wa kunna lahum baafizeen
ayah.translation: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Ayyooba iz naadaa Rabbahooo annee massaniyad durru wa Anta arhamur raahimeen
ayah.translation: And [mention] Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, adversity has touched me, and you are the Most Merciful of the merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Fastajabnaa lahoo fakashaf naa maa bihee min durrinw wa aatainaahu ahlahoo wa mislahum ma'ahum rahmatam min 'indinaa wa zikraa lil'aabideen
ayah.translation: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa Ismaa'eela wa Idreesa wa Zal Kifli kullum minas saabireen
ayah.translation: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa adkhalnaahum fee rahmatinaa innahum minas saaliheen
ayah.translation: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Zan Nooni iz zahaba mughaadiban fazaanna al lan naqdira 'alaihi fanaanna al lan naqdira 'alaihi fanaadaa fiz zulumaati al laaa ilaaha illaaa Anta Subhaanaka innee kuntu minaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And [mention] the man of the fish, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not decree [anything] upon him. And he called out within the darknesses, "There is no deity except You; exalted are You. Indeed, I have been of the wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Fastajabnaa lahoo wa najjainaahu minal ghamm; wa kazaalika nunjil mu'mineen
ayah.translation: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Zakariyyaaa iz naadaa Rabbahoo Rabbi laa tazarnee fardanw wa Anta khairul waariseen
ayah.translation: And [mention] Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me alone [with no heir], while you are the best of inheritors."

ayah.transliteration: Fastajabnaa lahoo wa wahabnaa lahoo Yahyaa Wa aslahnaa lahoo zawjah; innahum kaanoo yusaari'oona fil khairaati wa yad'oonanaa raghabanw wa rahabaa; wa kaanoo lanaa khaashi'een
ayah.translation: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

ayah.transliteration: Wallateee ahsanat farjahaa fanafakhnaa feehaa mir roohinaa wa ja'alnaahaa wabnahaaa Aayatal lil'aalameen
ayah.translation: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haaziheee ummatukum ummatanw waahidatanw wa Ana Rabbukum fa'budoon
ayah.translation: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taqatta'ooo amrahum bainahum kullun ilainaaa raaji'oon
ayah.translation: And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.

ayah.transliteration: Famai ya'mal minas saalihaati wa huwa mu'minun falaa kufraana lisa'yihee wa innaa lahoo kaatiboon
ayah.translation: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.

ayah.transliteration: Wa haraamun 'alaa qaryatin ahlaknaahaaa annahum laa yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa futihat Yaajooju wa Maajooju wa hum min kulli hadabiny yansiloon
ayah.translation: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

ayah.transliteration: Waqtarabal wa'dul haqqu fa-izaa hiya shaakhisatun absaarul lazeena kafaroo yaawailanaa qad kunna fee ghaflatim min haaza bal kunnaa zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And [when] the true promise has approached; then suddenly the eyes of those who disbelieved will be staring [in horror, while they say], "O woe to us; we had been unmindful of this; rather, we were wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Innakum wa maa ta'budoona min doonil laahi hasabu Jahannama antum lahaa waaridoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.

ayah.transliteration: Law kaana haaa'ulaaa'i aalihatam maa waradoohaa wa kullun feehaa khaalidoon
ayah.translation: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.

ayah.transliteration: Lahum feehaa zafeerunw wa hum feehaa laa yasma'oon
ayah.translation: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena sabaqat lahum minnal husnaaa ulaaa'ika 'anhaa mub'adoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yasma'oona hasee sahaa wa hum fee mash tahat anfusuhum khaalidoon
ayah.translation: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yahzunuhumul faza'ul akbaru wa tatalaq qaahumul malaaa'ikatu haazaa Yawmukumul lazee kuntum too'adoon
ayah.translation: They will not be grieved by the greatest terror, and the angels will meet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised" -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma natwis samaaa'a kataiyis sijilli lilkutub; kamaa badaanaa awwala khalqin nu'eeduh; wa'dan 'alainaa; innaa kunna faa'ileen
ayah.translation: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad katabnaa fiz Zaboori mim ba'diz zikri annal arda yarisuhaa 'ibaadi yas saalihoon
ayah.translation: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee haaza labalaa ghal liqawmin 'aabideen
ayah.translation: Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaaka illaa rahmatal lil'aalameen
ayah.translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaa yoohaa ilaiya annamaaa ilaahukum illaahunw Waahid, fahal antum muslimoon
ayah.translation: Say, "It is only revealed to me that your god is but one God; so will you be Muslims [in submission to Him]?"

ayah.transliteration: Fa in tawallaw faqul aazantukum 'alaa sawaaa'; wa in adreee aqareebun am ba'eedum maa too'adoon
ayah.translation: But if they turn away, then say, "I have announced to [all of] you equally. And I know not whether near or far is that which you are promised.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo ya'lamul jahra minal qawli wa ya'lamu maa taktumoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in adree la'allahoo fitnatul lakum wa mataa'un ilaaheen
ayah.translation: And I know not; perhaps it is a trial for you and enjoyment for a time."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbih kum bil haqq; wa Rabbunar Rahmaa nul musta'aanu 'alaa maa tasifoon
ayah.translation: [The Prophet] has said, "My Lord, judge [between us] in truth. And our Lord is the Most Merciful, the one whose help is sought against that which you describe."

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasuttaqoo Rabbakum; inna zalzalatas Saa'ati shai'un 'azeem
ayah.translation: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tarawnahaa tazhalu kullu murdi'atin 'ammaaa arda'at wa tada'u kullu zaati hamlin hamlahaa wa tarannaasa sukaaraa wa maa hum bisukaaraa wa lakinaa 'azaabal laahi shadeed
ayah.translation: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minan naasi mai yujaadilu fil laahi bighairi 'ilminw wa yattabi'u kullaa shaitaanim mareed
ayah.translation: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.

ayah.transliteration: Kutiba 'alaihi annahoo man tawallaahu fa annahoo yudil lauhoo wa yahdeehi ilaa 'azaabis sa'eer
ayah.translation: It has been decreed for every devil that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasu in kuntum fee raibim minal ba'si fa innaa khalaqnaakum min turaabin summa min nutfatin summaa min 'alaqatin summa mim mud ghatim mukhal laqatinw wa ghairi mukhalla qatil linubaiyina lakum; wa nuqirru fil arhaami maa nashaaa'u ilaaa ajalim musam man summa nukhrijukum tiflan summa litablughooo ashud dakum wa minkum mai yutawaffa wa minkum mai yuraddu ilaaa arzalil 'umuri likailaa ya'lama mim ba'di 'ilmin shai'aa; wa taral arda haamidatan fa izaaa anzalnaa 'alaihal maaa'ah tazzat wa rabat wa ambatat min kulli zawjim baheej
ayah.translation: O People, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annal laaha Huwal haqqu wa annahoo yuhyil mawtaa wa annahoo 'alaakulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent

ayah.transliteration: Wa annas Saa'ata aatiya tul laa raiba feeha wa annal laaha yab'asuman fil quboor
ayah.translation: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minan naasi mai yujaadilu fil laahi bighairi 'ilminw wa laa hudanw wa laa Kitaabim Muneer
ayah.translation: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],

ayah.transliteration: Saaniya 'itfihee liyudilla 'an sabeelil laahi lahoo fiddun yaa khizyunw wa nuzeequhoo Yawmal Qiyaamati 'azaabal lhareeq
ayah.translation: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allah. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bimaa qaddamat yadaaka wa annal laaha laisa bizallaamil lil'abeed
ayah.translation: "That is for what your hands have put forth and because Allah is not ever unjust to [His] servants."

ayah.transliteration: Wa minan naasi mai ya'budul laaha 'alaa harfin fa in asaabahoo khairunit maanna bihee wa in asaabat hu fitnatunin qalaba 'alaa wajhihee khasirad dunyaa wal aakhirah; zaalika huwal khusraanul mubeen
ayah.translation: And of the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.

ayah.transliteration: Yad'oo min doonil laahi maa laa yadurruhoo wa maa laa yanfa'uh' zaalika huwad dalaalul ba'ed
ayah.translation: He invokes instead of Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.

ayah.transliteration: Yad'oo laman darruhooo aqrabu min naf'ih; labi'salmawlaa wa labi'sal 'asheer
ayah.translation: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yudkhilul laeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaar; innal laaha yaf'alu maa yureed
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.

ayah.transliteration: Man kaana yazunnu allai yansurahul laahu fid dunyaa wal aakhirati fal yamdud bisababin ilas samaaa'i summal yaqta' falyanzur hal yuzhibanna kaiduhoo maa yagheez
ayah.translation: Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika anzalnaahu aayaatim baiyinaatinw wa annal laaha yahdee mai yureed
ayah.translation: And thus have We sent the Qur'an down as verses of clear evidence and because Allah guides whom He intends.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wallazeena haadoo was saabi'eena wan nasaaraa wal Majoosa wallazeena ashrakooo innal laaha yafsilu bainahum yawmal qiyaamah; innal laaha 'alaa kulli shai'in shaheed
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Witness.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha yasjudu lahoo man fis samaawaati wa man fil ardi wash shamsu walqamaru wan nu joomu wal jibaalu wash shajaru wad dawaaabbu wa kaseerum minan naasi wa kaseerun haqqa 'alaihil 'azaab; wa mai yuhinil laahu famaa lahoo mim mukrim; innallaaha yaf'alu maa yashaaa
ayah.translation: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaani khasmaanikh tasamoo fee Rabbihim fal lazeena kafaroo qutti'at lahum siyaabum min naar; yusabbu min fawqi ru'oosihimul hameem
ayah.translation: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water

ayah.transliteration: Yusharu bihee maa fee butoonihim waljulood
ayah.translation: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahum maqaami'u min hadeed
ayah.translation: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.

ayah.transliteration: Kullamaa araadooo any yakhrujoo minhaa min ghammin u'eedoo feeha wa zooqoo 'azaabal hareeq
ayah.translation: Every time they want to get out of Hellfire from anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yudkhilul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru yuhallawna feehaa min asaawira min zahabinw wa lu'lu'aa; wa libaasuhum feehaa hareer
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hudooo ilat taiyibi minal qawli wa hudooo ilaaa siraatil hameed
ayah.translation: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena kafaroo wa yasuddoona 'an sabeelil laahi wal Masjidil Haraamil lazee ja'alnaahu linnaasi sawaaa'anil 'aakifu feehi walbaad; wa mai yurid feehi bi ilhaadim bizulmin nuziqhu min 'azaabin aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz bawwaanaa li Ibraaheema makaanal Baiti allaa tushrik bee shai'anw wa tahhir Baitiya litaaa'ifeena walqaaa' imeena warrukka 'is sujood
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We designated for Abraham the site of the House, [saying], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who perform Tawaf and those who stand [in prayer] and those who bow and prostrate.

ayah.transliteration: Wa azzin fin naasi bil Hajji yaatooka rijaalanw wa 'alaa kulli daamiriny yaateena min kulli fajjin 'ameeq
ayah.translation: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -

ayah.transliteration: Li yashhadoo manaafi'a lahum wa yazkurus mal laahi feee ayyaamimma'loomaatin 'alaa maa razaqahum mim baheematil an'aami fakuloo minhaa wa at'imul baaa'isal faqeer
ayah.translation: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.

ayah.transliteration: Summal yaqdoo tafasahum wal yoofoo nuzoorahum wal yattawwafoo bil Baitil 'Ateeq
ayah.translation: Then let them end their untidiness and fulfill their vows and perform Tawaf around the ancient House."

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika wa mai yu'azzim hurumaatil laahi fahuwa khairul lahoo 'inda Rabbih; wa uhillat lakumul an'aamu illaa maa yutlaa 'alaikum fajtanibur rijsa minal awsaani wajtaniboo qawlaz zoor
ayah.translation: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,

ayah.transliteration: Hunafaaa'a lillaahi ghaira mushrikeena bih; wa mai yushrik billaahi faka annamaa kharra minas samaaa'i fatakh tafuhut tairu aw tahwee bihir reehu bee makaanin saheeq
ayah.translation: Inclining [only] to Allah, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika wa mai yu'azzim sha'aaa'iral laahi fa innahaa min taqwal quloob
ayah.translation: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.

ayah.transliteration: Lakum feehaa manaafi'u ilaaa ajalim musamman summa mahilluhaaa ilal Baitil 'Ateeq
ayah.translation: For you the animals marked for sacrifice are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

ayah.transliteration: Wa likulli ummatin ja'alnaa mansakal liyazkurus mal laahi 'alaa maa razaqahum mim baheematil an'aam; failaahukum ilaahunw Waahidun falahooo aslimoo; wa bashshiril mukhbiteen
ayah.translation: And for all religion We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena izaa zukiral laahu wajilat quloobuhum wassaabireena 'alaa maaa asaabahum walmuqeemis Salaati wa mimmaa razaqnaahum yunfiqoon
ayah.translation: Who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

ayah.transliteration: Walbudna ja'alnaahaa lakum min sha'aaa'iril laahi lakum feehaa khairun fazkurusmal laahi 'alaihaa sawaaff; fa izaa wajabat junoobuhaa fakuloo minhaa wa at'imul qaani'a walmu'tarr; kazaalika sakhkharnaahaa lakum la'allakum tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols of Allah; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allah upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Lany yanaalal laaha luhoo muhaa wa laa dimaaa'uhaa wa laakiny yanaaluhut taqwaa minkum; kazaalika sakhkharhaa lakum litukabbirul laaha 'alaa ma hadaakum; wa bashshirul muhsineen
ayah.translation: Their meat will not reach Allah, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yudaafi' 'anil lazeena aamanoo; innal laaha laa yuhibbu kulla khawwaanin kafoor
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Uzina lillazeena yuqaataloona bi annahum zulimoo; wa innal laaha 'alaa nasrihim la Qaderr
ayah.translation: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena ukhrijoo min diyaarihim bighairi haqqin illaaa any yaqooloo rabbunallaah; wa law laa daf'ul laahin naasa ba'dahum biba'dil lahuddimat sawaami'u wa biya'unw wa salawaatunw wa masaajidu yuzkaru feehasmul laahi kaseeraa; wa layansurannal laahu mai yansuruh; innal laaha la qawiyyun 'Azeez
ayah.translation: [They are] those who have been evicted from their homes without right - only because they say, "Our Lord is Allah." And were it not that Allah checks the people, some by means of others, there would have been demolished monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which the name of Allah is much mentioned. And Allah will surely support those who support Him. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena im makkan naahum fil ardi aqaamus Salaata wa aatawuz Zakaata wa amaroo bilma'roofi wa nahaw 'anil munkar; wa lillaahi 'aaqibatul umoor
ayah.translation: [And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of [all] matters.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iny yukazzibooka faqad kazzabat qablahum qawmu Nooinw wa Aadunw wa Samood
ayah.translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],

ayah.transliteration: Wa qawmu Ibraaheema wa qawmu Loot
ayah.translation: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

ayah.transliteration: Wa as haabu Madyana wa kuzziba Moosaa fa amlaitu lilkaafireena summa akhaztuhum fakaifa kaana nakeer
ayah.translation: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

ayah.transliteration: Faka ayyim min qaryatin ahlaknaahaa wa hiya zaalimatun fahiya khaawiyatun 'alaa 'urooshihaa wa bi'rim mu'at talatinw wa qasrim masheed
ayah.translation: And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yaseeroo fil ardi fatakoona lahum quloobuny ya'qiloona bihaaa aw aazaanuny yasm'oona bihaa fa innahaa laa ta'mal absaaru wa laakin ta'mal quloobul latee fissudoor
ayah.translation: So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yasta'juloonaka bil'azaabi wa lany yukhlifal laahu wa'dah; wa inna yawman 'inda Rabbika ka'alfi sanatim mimmaa ta'uddoon
ayah.translation: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ka ayyim min qaryatin amlaitu lahaa wa hiya zaalimatun summa akhaztuhaa wa ilaiyal maseer
ayah.translation: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.

ayah.transliteration: Qul yaaa ayyuhan naasu innamaaa ana lakum nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: Say, "O people, I am only to you a clear warner."

ayah.transliteration: Fallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilu saalihaati lahum maghfiratunw wa rizqun kareem
ayah.translation: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena sa'aw feee Aayaatinaa mu'aajizeena ulaaa ika As-haabul jaheem
ayah.translation: But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa min qablika mir Rasoolinnw wa laa Nabiyyin illaaa izaaa tamannaaa alqash Shaitaanu feee umniy yatihee fa yansakhul laahu maa yulqish Shaitaanu summa yuhkimul laahu aayaatih; wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem
ayah.translation: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Liyaj'ala maa yulqish Shaitaanu fitnatal lillazeena fee quloobihim maradunw walqaasiyati quloobuhum; wa innaz zaalimeena lafee shiqaaqim ba'eed
ayah.translation: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in a trial for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

ayah.transliteration: Wa liya'lamal lazeena ootul 'ilma annahul haqqu mir Rabbika fa yu'minoo bihee fatukhbita ahoo quloobuhum; wa innal laaha lahaadil lazeena aamanoo ilaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yazaalul lazeena kafaroo fee miryatim minhu hattaa taatiyahumus Saa'atu baghtatan aw yaatiyahum 'azaabu Yawmin 'aqeem
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.

ayah.transliteration: Almulku Yawma'izil lillaahi yahkumu bainahum; fallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati fee jannaatin Na'eem
ayah.translation: [All] sovereignty that Day is for Allah; He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena kafaroo wa kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa fa ulaaa'ika lahum 'azaabum muheen
ayah.translation: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena haajaroo fee sabeelil laahi summa qutilooo law maatoo la yarzuqan nahumul laahu rizqan hasanaa; wa innal laaha la Huwa khairur raaziqeen
ayah.translation: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.

ayah.transliteration: La yudkhilan nahum mud khalany yardawnah; wa innal laaha la 'Aleemun Haleem
ayah.translation: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika wa man 'aaqaba bimisli maa 'ooqiba bihee summa bughiya 'alaihi la yansurannahul laah; innal laaha la 'Afuwwun Ghafoor
ayah.translation: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annal laaha yoolijul laila fin nahaari wa yoolijun nahaara fil laili wa annal laaha Samee'um Baseer
ayah.translation: That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annal laaha Huwal haqqu wa anna maa yad'oona min doonihee huwal baatilu wa annal laaha Huwal 'Aliyyul kabeer
ayah.translation: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an fatusbihul ardu mukhdarrah; innal laaha Lateefun Khabeer
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo ma fis samaawaati wa ma fil ard; wa innal laaha la Huwal Ghaniyyul Hameed
ayah.translation: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha sakhkhara lakum maa fil ardi wal fulka tajree fil bahri bi amrihee wa yumsikus samaaa'a an taqa'a 'alal ardi illaa biiznih; innal laaha binnaasi la Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee ahyaakum summa yumeetukum summma yuheekum; innal insaana lakafoor
ayah.translation: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Likulli ummatin ja'alnaa mansakan hum naasikoohu falaa yunaazi 'unnaka fil amr; wad'u ilaa Rabbika innaka la 'alaa hudam mustaqeem
ayah.translation: For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let the disbelievers not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in jaadalooka faqulil laahu a'lamu bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And if they dispute with you, then say, "Allah is most knowing of what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu yahkumu bainakum Yawmal Qiyaamati feemaa kuntum feehi takhtalifoon
ayah.translation: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which you used to differ."

ayah.transliteration: Alam ta'lam annal laaha ya'lamu maa fis samaaa'i wal ard; inna zaalika fee kitaab; inna zaalika 'alal laahi yaseer
ayah.translation: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ya'budoona min doonil laahi maa lam yunazzil bihee sultaananw wa maa laisa lahum bihee 'ilm; wa maa lizzaalimeena min naseer
ayah.translation: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa tutlaa 'laihim Aayaatunaa baiyinaatin ta'rifu fee wujoohil lazeena kafarul munkara yakaadoona yastoona bil lazeena yatloona 'alaihim Aayaatinaa; qul afa unab bi'ukum bisharrim min zaalikum; an Naaru wa 'adahal laahul lazeena kafaroo wa bi'sal maseer
ayah.translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, you recognize in the faces of those who disbelieve disapproval. They are almost on the verge of assaulting those who recite to them Our verses. Say, "Then shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire which Allah has promised those who disbelieve, and wretched is the destination."

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasu duriba masalun fastami'oo lah; innal lazeena tad'oona min doonil laahi lai yakhluqoo zubaabanw wa lawijtama'oo lahoo wa iny yaslub humuz zubbabu shai'al laa yastan qizoohu minh; da'ufat taalibu walmatloob
ayah.translation: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.

ayah.transliteration: Maa qadrul laaha haqqa qadrih; innal laaha la Qawiyyun 'Azeez
ayah.translation: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

ayah.transliteration: Allahu yastafee minal malaaa'ikati Rusulanw wa minan naas; innal laaha Samee'um Baseer
ayah.translation: Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu maa baina aydeehim wa maa khalfahum; wa ilal laahi turja'ul umoor
ayah.translation: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will be returned [all] matters.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanur ka'oo wasjudoo wa'budoo Rabbakum waf'alul khaira la'allakum tuflihoon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaahidoo fil laahi haqqa jihaadih; Huwaj tabaakum wa maa ja'ala 'alaikum fid deeni min haraj; Millata abeekum Ibraaheem; Huwa sammaakumul muslimeena min qablu wa fee haaza li yakoonar Rasoolu shaheedan 'alaikum wa takoonoo shuhadaaa'a 'alan naas; fa aqeemus salaata wa aatuz zakaata wa'tasimoo billaahi Huwa mawlaakum fani'mal mawlaa wa ni'man naseer
ayah.translation: And strive for Allah with the striving due to Him. He has chosen you and has not placed upon you in the religion any difficulty. [It is] the religion of your father, Abraham. Allah named you "Muslims" before [in former scriptures] and in this [revelation] that the Messenger may be a witness over you and you may be witnesses over the people. So establish prayer and give zakah and hold fast to Allah. He is your protector; and excellent is the protector, and excellent is the helper.

ayah.transliteration: Qad aflahal mu'minoon
ayah.translation: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena hum fee Salaatihim khaashi'oon
ayah.translation: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum 'anillaghwimu'ridoon
ayah.translation: And they who turn away from ill speech

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum liz Zakaati faa'iloon
ayah.translation: And they who are observant of zakah

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum lifuroo jihim haafizoon
ayah.translation: And they who guard their private parts

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'alaaa azwaajihim aw maa malakat aimaanuhum fa innahum ghairu maloomeen
ayah.translation: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -

ayah.transliteration: Famanib taghaa waraaa'a zaalika fa ulaaa'ika humul 'aadoon
ayah.translation: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum li amaanaatihim wa 'ahdihim raa'oon
ayah.translation: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum 'alaa Salawaatihim yuhaafizoon
ayah.translation: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika humul waarisoon
ayah.translation: Those are the inheritors

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yarisoonal Firdawsa hum feehaa khaalidoon
ayah.translation: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnal insaana min sulaalatim minteen
ayah.translation: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.

ayah.transliteration: Summa ja'alnaahu nutfatan fee qaraarim makeen
ayah.translation: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.

ayah.transliteration: Summa khalaqnan nutfata 'alaqatan fakhalaqnal 'alaqata mudghatan fakhalaq nal mudghata 'izaaman fakasawnal 'izaama lahman summa anshaanaahu khalqan aakhar; fatabaarakal laahu ahsanul khaaliqeen
ayah.translation: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.

ayah.transliteration: Summa innakum ba'da zaalika la maaiyitoon
ayah.translation: Then indeed, after that you are to die.

ayah.transliteration: Summa innakum Yawmal Qiyaamati tub'asoon
ayah.translation: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnaa fawqakum sab'a taraaa'iqa wa maa kunnaa 'anil khalqi ghaafileen
ayah.translation: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'am biqadarin fa-askannaahu fil ardi wa innaa 'alaa zahaabim bihee laqaa diroon
ayah.translation: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.

ayah.transliteration: Fa anshaanaa lakum bihee Jannaatim min nakheelinw wa a'naab; lakum feehaa fawaakihu kaseeratunw wa minhaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa shajaratan takhruju min Toori Sainaaa'a tambutu bidduhni wa sibghil lil aakileen
ayah.translation: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna lakum fil an'aami la'ibrah; nusqeekum mimmaa fee butoonihaa wa lakum feehaa manaafi'u kaseeratunw wa minhaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'alaihaa wa'alal fulki tuhmaloon
ayah.translation: And upon them and on ships you are carried.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Noohan ilaa qawmihee faqaala yaa qawmi'budul laaha maa lakum min ilahin ghairuhoo afalaa tattaqoon
