ayah.translation: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

ayah.transliteration: Faqaalal mala'ul lazeena kafaroo min qawmihee maa haazaaa illaa basharum mislukum yureedu ai yatafaddala 'alaikum wa law shaaa'al laahu la anzala malaaa'ikatam maa sami'naa bihaazaa feee aabaaa'inal awwaleen
ayah.translation: But the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "This is not but a man like yourselves who wishes to take precedence over you; and if Allah had willed [to send a messenger], He would have sent down angels. We have not heard of this among our forefathers.

ayah.transliteration: In huwa illaa rajulum bihee jinnatun fatarabbasoo bihee hattan heen
ayah.translation: He is not but a man possessed with madness, so wait concerning him for a time."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbin surnee bimaa kazzaboon
ayah.translation: [Noah] said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

ayah.transliteration: Fa awhainaaa ilaihi anis na'il fulka bi a'yuninaa wa wahyinaa fa izaa jaaa'a amrunaa wa faarat tannooru fasluk feehaa min kullin zawjainis naini wa ahlaka illaa man sabaqa 'alaihil qawlu minhum wa laa tukhaat ibnee fil lazeena zalamooo innaahum mughraqoon
ayah.translation: So We inspired to him, "Construct the ship under Our observation, and Our inspiration, and when Our command comes and the oven overflows, put into the ship from each [creature] two mates and your family, except those for whom the decree [of destruction] has proceeded. And do not address Me concerning those who have wronged; indeed, they are to be drowned.

ayah.transliteration: Fa izas tawaita ata wa mam ma'aka 'alal fulki faqulil hamdu lillaahil lazee najjaanaa minal qawmiz zalimeen
ayah.translation: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'

ayah.transliteration: Wa qur Rabbi anzilnee munzalam mubaarakanw wa Anta khairul munzileen
ayah.translation: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].' "

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaatinw wa in kunnaa lamubtaleen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

ayah.transliteration: Summaa anshaana mim ba'dihim qarnan aakhareen
ayah.translation: Then We produced after them a generation of others.

ayah.transliteration: Fa arsalnaa feehim Rasoolam minhum ani'budul laaha maa lakum min ilaahin ghairuhoo afalaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: And We sent among them a messenger from themselves, [saying], "Worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him; then will you not fear Him?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal mala-u min qawmihil lazeena kafaroo wa kazzaboo bi liqaaa'il Aakhirati wa atrafnaahum fil hayaatid dunyaa maa haazaaa illaa basharum mislukum yaakulu mimmaa taakuloona minhu wa yashrabu mimmaa tashraboon
ayah.translation: And the eminent among his people who disbelieved and denied the meeting of the Hereafter while We had given them luxury in the worldly life said, "This is not but a man like yourselves. He eats of that from which you eat and drinks of what you drink.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'in at'atum basharam mislakum innakum izal lakhaasiroon
ayah.translation: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.

ayah.transliteration: A-Ya'idukum annakum izaa mittum wa kuntum turaabanw wa izaaman annakum mukhrajoon
ayah.translation: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?

ayah.transliteration: Haihaata haihaata limaa too'adoon
ayah.translation: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.

ayah.transliteration: In hiya illaa hayaatunad dunyaa namootu wa nahyaa wa maa nahnu bimab'ooseen
ayah.translation: Life is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: In huwa illaa rajulunif taraa 'alal laahi kazibanw wa maa nahnuu lahoo bimu'mineen
ayah.translation: He is not but a man who has invented a lie about Allah, and we will not believe him."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbin surnee bimaa kazzaboon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, support me because they have denied me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala 'ammaa qaleelil la yusbihunna naadimeen
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "After a little, they will surely become regretful."

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhazat humus saihatu bilhaqqi faja'alnaahum ghusaaa'aa; fabu;dal lilqaw miz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.

ayah.transliteration: Summa anshaanaa mim ba'dihim quroonan aakhareen
ayah.translation: Then We produced after them other generations.

ayah.transliteration: Maa tasbiqu min ummatin ajalahaa wa maa yastaakhiroon
ayah.translation: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].

ayah.transliteration: Summa arsalnaa Rusulanaa tatraa kulla maa jaaa'a ummatar Rasooluhaa kazzabooh; fa atba'naa ba'dahum ba'danw wa ja'alnaahum ahaadees; fabu'dal liqawmil laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Summa arsalnaa Moosaa wa akhaahu Haaroona bi Aayaatinaa wa sultaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

ayah.transliteration: Ilaa Fir'awna wa mala'ihee fastakbaroo wa kaanoo qawman 'aaleem
ayah.translation: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.

ayah.transliteration: Faqaaloo annu'minu libasharaini mislinaa wa qawmuhumaa lanaa 'aabidoon
ayah.translation: They said, "Should we believe two men like ourselves while their people are for us in servitude?"

ayah.transliteration: Fakazzaboohumaa fakaanoo minal mmuhlakeen
ayah.translation: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba la'allahum yahtadoon
ayah.translation: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnab na Maryama wa ummahooo aayatannw wa aawainaahumaaa ilaa rabwatin zaati qaraarinw wa ma'een
ayah.translation: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhar Rusulu kuloo minat taiyibaati wa'maloo saalihan innee bimaa ta'maloona 'Aleem
ayah.translation: [Allah said], "O messengers, eat from the good foods and work righteousness. Indeed, I, of what you do, am Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna haaziheee ummatukum ummatanw waahidatanw wa Ana Rabbukum fattaqoon
ayah.translation: And indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so fear Me."

ayah.transliteration: Fataqatta'ooo amrahum bainahum zuburaa; kullu hizbim bimaa ladaihim farihoon
ayah.translation: But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

ayah.transliteration: Fazarhum fee ghamratihim hattaa heen
ayah.translation: So leave them in their confusion for a time.

ayah.transliteration: A-yahsaboona annnamaa numiduhum bihee mimmaalinw wa baneen
ayah.translation: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children

ayah.transliteration: Nusaari'u lahum fil khairaat; bal laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena hum min khashyati Rabbihim mushfiqoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum bi Aayaati Rabbihim yu'minoon
ayah.translation: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena hum bi Rabbihim laa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yu'toona maaa aataw wa quloobuhum wajilatun annahum ilaa Rabbihim raaji'oon
ayah.translation: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika yusaari'oona fil khairaati wa hum lahaa saabiqoon
ayah.translation: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa nukallifu nafsan illaa wus'ahaa wa ladainaa kitaabuny yantiqu bilhaqqi w ahum la yuzlamoon
ayah.translation: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.

ayah.transliteration: Bal quloobuhum fee ghamratim min haazaa wa lahum a'maalum min dooni zaalika hum lahaa 'aamiloon
ayah.translation: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides disbelief which they are doing,

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaaa akhznaa mutrafeehim bil'azaabi izaa hum yaj'aroon
ayah.translation: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.

ayah.transliteration: Laa taj'arul yawma innakum minnaa laa tunsaroon
ayah.translation: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.

ayah.transliteration: Qad kaanat Aayaatee tutlaa 'alaikum fakuntum 'alaaa a'qaabikum tankisoon
ayah.translation: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels

ayah.transliteration: Mustakbireena bihee saamiran tahjuroon
ayah.translation: In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yaddabbarrul qawla am jaaa'ahum maa lam yaati aabaaa'ahumul awwaleen
ayah.translation: Then have they not reflected over the Qur'an, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?

ayah.transliteration: Am lam ya'rifoo Rasoolahum fahum lahoo munkiroon
ayah.translation: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloona bihee jinnnah; bal jaaa'ahum bilhaqqi wa aksaruhum lil haqqi kaarihoon
ayah.translation: Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lawit taba'al haqqu ahwaaa'ahum lafasadatis samaawaatu wal ardu wa man feehinnn; bal atainaahum bizikrihim fahum 'an zikrihim mu'ridon
ayah.translation: But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum kharjan fakharaaju Rabbika khairunw wa Huwa khairur raaziqeen
ayah.translation: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaka latad'oohum ilaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innnal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil Aakhirati 'anis siraati lanaakiboon
ayah.translation: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law rahimnaahum wa kashafnaa maa bihim min durril lalajjoo fee tughyaanihim ya'mahoon
ayah.translation: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad akhaznaahum bil'azaabi famastakaanoo li Rabbihim wa maa yatadarra'oon
ayah.translation: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa fatahnaa 'alaihim baaban zaa 'azaabin shadeedin izaa hum feehi mublisoon
ayah.translation: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazeee ansha a-lakumus sam'a wal absaara wal af'idah; qaleelam maa tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee zara akum fil ardi wa ilaihi tuhsharoon
ayah.translation: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee yuhyee wa yumeetu wa lahukh tilaaful laili wannahaar; afalaa ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?

ayah.transliteration: Bal qaaloo misla maa qaalal awwaloon
ayah.translation: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo 'a-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa 'izaaman 'a-innaa lamab 'oosoon
ayah.translation: They said, "When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

ayah.transliteration: Laqad wu'idnaa nahnu wa aabaaa'unaa haazaa min qablu in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen
ayah.translation: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before; this is not but legends of the former peoples."

ayah.transliteration: Qul limanil ardu wa man feehaaa in kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "To whom belongs the earth and whoever is in it, if you should know?"

ayah.transliteration: Sa-yaqooloona lillaah; qul afalaa tazakkkaroon
ayah.translation: They will say, "To Allah." Say, "Then will you not remember?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul mar Rabbus samaawaatis sab'i wa Rabbul 'Arshil 'Azeem
ayah.translation: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Great Throne?"

ayah.transliteration: Sa yaqooloona lillaah; qul afalaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: They will say, "[They belong] to Allah." Say, "Then will you not fear Him?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul mam bi yadihee malakootu kulli shai'inw wa Huwa yujeeru wa laa yujaaru 'alaihi in kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: Say, "In whose hand is the realm of all things - and He protects while none can protect against Him - if you should know?"

ayah.transliteration: Sa yaqooloona lillaah; qul fa annaa tus haroon
ayah.translation: They will say, "[All belongs] to Allah." Say, "Then how are you deluded?"

ayah.transliteration: Bal atainaahum bil haqqi wa innahum lakaaziboon
ayah.translation: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.

ayah.transliteration: Mat takhazal laahu minw waladinw wa maa kaana ma'ahoo min ilaah; izal lazahaba kullu ilaahim bimaa khalaqa wa la'alaa ba'duhum 'alaa ba'd; Subhaannal laahi 'ammaa yasifoon
ayah.translation: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].

ayah.transliteration: 'Aalimil Ghaibi wash shahhaadati fata'aalaa 'ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].

ayah.transliteration: Qur Rabbi immmaa turiyannee maa yoo'adoon
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "My Lord, if You should show me that which they are promised,

ayah.transliteration: Rabbi falaa taj'alnee fil qawmiz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: My Lord, then do not place me among the wrongdoing people."

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaa 'alaaa an nuriyaka maa na'iduhum laqaadiroon
ayah.translation: And indeed, We are able to show you what We have promised them.

ayah.transliteration: Idfa' billate hiya ahsanus saiyi'ah; nahnu a'lamu bimaa yasifoon
ayah.translation: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qur Rabbi a'oozu bika min hamazaatish Shayaateen
ayah.translation: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,

ayah.transliteration: Wa a'oozu bika Rabbi ai-yahduroon
ayah.translation: And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they be present with me."

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'a ahada humul mawtu qaala Rabbir ji'oon
ayah.translation: [For such is the state of the disbelievers], until, when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back

ayah.transliteration: La'alleee a'malu saalihan feemaa taraktu kallaa; innahaa kalimatun huwa qaaa'iluhaa wa minw waraaa'him barzakhun ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon
ayah.translation: That I might do righteousness in that which I left behind." No! It is only a word he is saying; and behind them is a barrier until the Day they are resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: Fa izaa nufikha fis Soori falaaa ansaaba bainahum yawma'izinw wa laa yatasaaa'aloon
ayah.translation: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

ayah.transliteration: Faman saqulat mawaazee nuhoo fa ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon
ayah.translation: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man khaffat mawaa zeenuhoo fa ulaaa'ikal lazeena khasiroon anfusahum fee Jahannnama khaalidoon
ayah.translation: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.

ayah.transliteration: Talfahu wujoohahumun Naaru wa hum feehaa kaalihood
ayah.translation: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.

ayah.transliteration: Alam takun Aayaatee tutlaa 'alaikum fakuntum bihaa tukazziboon
ayah.translation: [It will be said]. "Were not My verses recited to you and you used to deny them?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Rabbanaa ghalabat 'alainaa shiqwatunaa wa kunnaa qawman daaalleen
ayah.translation: They will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbanaa akhrijnaa minhaa fa in 'udnaa fa innaa zaalimoon
ayah.translation: Our Lord, remove us from it, and if we were to return [to evil], we would indeed be wrongdoers."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalakh sa'oo feehaa wa laa tukallimoon
ayah.translation: He will say, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo kaana fareequm min 'ibaadee yaqooloona Rabbanaaa aamannaa faghfir lanaa warhamnaa wa Anta khairur raahimeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'

ayah.transliteration: Fattakhaztumoohum sikhriyyan hattaaa ansawkum zikree wa kuntum minhum tadhakoon
ayah.translation: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

ayah.transliteration: Inee jazaituhumul Yawma bimaa sabarooo annahum humul faaa'izoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - that they are the attainers [of success]."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala kam labistum fil ardi 'adada sineen
ayah.translation: [Allah] will say, "How long did you remain on earth in number of years?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo labisnaa yawman aw ba'da yawmin fas'alil 'aaaddeen
ayah.translation: They will say, "We remained a day or part of a day; ask those who enumerate."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala il labistum illaa qaleelal law annakum kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: He will say, "You stayed not but a little - if only you had known.

ayah.transliteration: Afahsibtum annamaa khalaqnaakum 'abasanw wa annakum ilainaa laa turja'oon
ayah.translation: Then did you think that We created you uselessly and that to Us you would not be returned?"

ayah.transliteration: Fata'aalal laahul Malikul Haqq; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa Rabbul 'Arshil Kareem
ayah.translation: So exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yad'u ma'allaahi ilaahan aakhara laa burhaana lahoo bihee fa innnamaa hisaabuhoo 'inda Rabbih; innahoo laa yuflihul kaafiroon
ayah.translation: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qur Rabbigh fir warham wa Anta khairur raahimeen
ayah.translation: And, [O Muhammad], say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the best of the merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Sooratun anzalnaahaa wa faradnaahaa wa anzalnaa feehaaa Aayaatim baiyinaatil la'allakum tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: [This is] a surah which We have sent down and made [that within it] obligatory and revealed therein verses of clear evidence that you might remember.

ayah.transliteration: Azzaaniyatu wazzaanee fajlidoo kulla waahidim minhumaa mi'ata jaldatinw wa laa taakhuzkum bihimaa raafatun fee deenil laahi in kuntum tu'minoona billaahi wal Yawmil Aakhiri wal yashhad 'azaabahumaa taaa'ifatum minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion of Allah, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Azzaanee laa yankihu illaa zaaniyatan aw mushrikatanw wazzaaniyatu laa yankihuhaaa illaa zaanin aw mushrik; wa hurrima zaalika 'alal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that has been made unlawful to the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yarmoonal muhsanaati summa lam yaatoo bi-arba'ati shuhadaaa'a fajlidoohum samaaneena jaldatanw wa laa taqbaloo lahum shahaadatan abadaa; wa ulaaa'ika humul faasiqoon
ayah.translation: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,

ayah.transliteration: Illal lazeena taaboo mim ba'di zaalika wa aslahoo fa innal laaha Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yarmoona azwaajahum wa lam yakul lahum shuhadaaa'u illaaa anfusuhum fashahaadatu ahadihim arb'u shahaadaatim billaahi innahoo laminas saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Wal khaamisatu anna la'natal laahi 'alaihi in kaana minal kaazibeen
ayah.translation: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allah be upon him if he should be among the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yadra'u anhal 'azaaba an tashhada arba'a shahaa daatim billaahi innahoo laminal kaazibeen
ayah.translation: But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Wal khaamisata anna ghadabal laahi 'alaihaaa in kaana minas saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he was of the truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laa fadlul laahi 'alaikum wa rahmatuhoo wa annal laaha Tawwaabun Hakeem
ayah.translation: And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Accepting of repentance and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena jaaa'oo bilifki 'usbatum minkum; laa tahsaboohu sharral lakum bal huwa khairul lakum; likul limri'im minhum mak tasaba minal-ism; wallazee tawallaa kibrahoo minhum lahoo 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a great punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Law laaa iz sami'tumoohu zannal mu'minoona walmu'minaatu bi anfusihim khairanw wa qaaloo haazaaa ifkum mmubeen
ayah.translation: Why, when you heard it, did not the believing men and believing women think good of one another and say, "This is an obvious falsehood"?

ayah.transliteration: Law laa jaaa'oo 'alaihi bi-arba'ati shuhadaaa'; fa iz lam yaatoo bishshuhadaaa'i fa ulaaa 'ika 'indal laahi humul kaaziboon
ayah.translation: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allah, who are the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laa fadlul laahi 'alaikum wa rahmatuhoo fiddunyaa wal aakhirati lamassakum fee maaa afadtum feehi 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment

ayah.transliteration: iz talaqqawnahoo bi alsinatikum wa taqooloona bi afwaahikum maa laisa lakum bihee 'ilmunw wa tahsaboo nahoo haiyinanw wa huwa 'indl laahi 'azeem
ayah.translation: When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allah, tremendous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa iz sami'tu moohu qultum maa yakoonu lanaaa an natakallama bihaazaa Subhaanaka haaza buhtaanun 'azeem
ayah.translation: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this. Exalted are You, [O Allah]; this is a great slander"?

ayah.transliteration: Ya'izukumul laahu an ta'oodoo limisliheee abadan in kuntum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Allah warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yubaiyinul laahu lakumul Aayaat; wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem
ayah.translation: And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yuhibboona an tashee'al faahishatu fil lazeena aamanoo lahum 'azaabun aleemun fid dunyaa wal Aakhirah; wallaahu ya'lamu wa antum laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laa fadlul laahi 'alaikum wa rahmatuhoo wa annal laaha Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Kind and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa tattabi'oo khutuwaatish Shaitaan; wa many-yattabi' khutuwaatish Shaitaani fa innahoo yaamuru bilfahshaaa'i walmunkar; wa law laa fadlul laahi 'alaikum wa rahmatuhoo maa zakaa minkum min ahadin abadanw wa laakinnal laaha yuzakkee many-yashaaa'; wallaahu Samee'un 'Aleem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yaatali ulul fadli minkum wassa'ati ai yu'tooo ulil qurbaa walmasaakeena walmuhaajireena fee sabeelillaahi walya'foo walyasfahoo; alaa tuhibboona ai yaghfiral laahu lakum; wal laahu Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yarmoonal muhsanaatil ghaafilaatil mu'minaati lu'inoo fid dunyaa wal Aakhirati wa lahum 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tashhhadu 'alaihim alsinatuhum wa aideehim wa arjuluhum bimaa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma'iziny yuwaf feehimul laahu deenahumul haqqa wa ya'lamoona annal laaha Huwal Haqqul Mubeen
ayah.translation: That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah who is the perfect in justice.

ayah.transliteration: Alkhabeesaatu lilkha beeseena walkhabeesoona lilkhabeesaati wattaiyibaatu littaiyibeena wattaiyiboona littaiyibaat; ulaaa'ika mubar ra'oona maimma yaqooloona lahum maghfiratunw wa rizqun kareem
ayah.translation: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa tadkhuloo buyootan ghaira buyootikum hatta tastaanisoo wa tusallimoo 'allaa ahlihaa; zaalikum khairul lakum la'allakum tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Fa il lam tajidoo feehaaa ahadan falaa tadkhuloohaa hattaa yu'zana lakum wa in qeela lakumurji'oo farji'oo huwa azkaa lakum; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And if you do not find anyone therein, do not enter them until permission has been given you. And if it is said to you, "Go back," then go back; it is purer for you. And Allah is Knowing of what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Laisa 'alaikum junaahun ann tadkhuloo buyootan ghaira maskoonatin feeha mataa'ul lakum; wallaahu ya'lamu maa tubdoona wa maa taktumoon
ayah.translation: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

ayah.transliteration: Qul lilmu' mineena yaghuuddoo min absaarihim wa yahfazoo furoojahum; zaalika azkaa lahum; innallaaha khabeerum bimaa yasna'oon
ayah.translation: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qul lilmu'minaati yaghdudna min absaarihinna wa yahfazna furoojahunna wa laa yubdeena zeenatahunna illaa maa zahara minhaa walyadribna bikhumurihinna 'alaa juyoobihinna wa laa yubdeena zeenatahunna illaa libu'oolatihinna aw aabaaa'i hinna aw aabaaa'i bu'oolati hinna aw abnaaa'ihinaa aw abnaaa'i bu'oolatihinnna aw ikhwaanihinnna aw baneee ikhwaanihinna aw banee akhawaatihinna aw nisaaa'i hinna aw maa malakat aimaanuhunna awit taabi'eena ghairi ilil irbati minar rijaali awit tiflillazeena lam yazharoo 'alaa 'awraatin nisaaa'i wala yadribnna bi arjulihinna min zeenatihinn; wa toobooo ilallaahi jammee'an aiyuhal mu'minoona la'allakum tuflihoon
ayah.translation: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ankihul ayaamaa minkum was saaliheena min 'ibaadikum wa imaa'kum; iny-yakoonoo fuqaraaa'a yughni himul laahu min fadlih; wal laahu Waasi'un 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wal yasta'fifil lazeena laa yajidoona nikaahan hata yughniyahumul laahu mi fadlih; wallazeena yabtaghoonal kitaaba mimmaa malakat aimaanukum fakaatiboohum in 'alimtum feehim khairanw wa aatoohum mimmaalil laahil lazeee aataakum; wa laa tukrihoo fatayaatikum 'alal bighaaa'i in aradna tahassunal litabtaghoo 'aradal hayaatid dunyaa; wa mai yukrihhunna fa innal laaha mim ba'di ikraahihinna Ghafoor Raheem
ayah.translation: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad anzalnaaa ilaikum Aayaatim mubaiyinaatinw wa masalam minnal lazeena khalaw min qablikum wa maw'izatal lilmuttaqeen
ayah.translation: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu noorus samaawaati wal ard; masalu noorihee kamishkaatin feehaa misbaah; almisbaahu fee zujaajatin azzujaajatu ka annahaa kawkabun durriyyuny yooqadu min shajaratim mubaarakatin zaitoonatil laa shariqiyyatinw wa laa gharbiyyatiny yakaadu zaituhaa yudeee'u wa law alm tamsashu naar; noorun 'alaa noor; yahdil laahu linoorihee mai yashaaa'; wa yadribul laahul amsaala linnaas; wallaahu bikulli shai'in Aleem
ayah.translation: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.

ayah.transliteration: Fee buyootin azinal laahu an turfa'a wa yuzkara feehasmuhoo yusabbihu lahoo feehaa bilghuduwwi wal aasaal
ayah.translation: [Such niches are] in mosques which Allah has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings

ayah.transliteration: Rinjaalul laa tulheehim tijaaratunw wa laa bai'un 'an zikril laahi wa iqaamis Salaati wa eetaaa'iz Zakaati yakkhaafoona Yawman tataqallabu feehil quloobu wal absaar
ayah.translation: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -

ayah.transliteration: Liyajziyahumul laahu ahsana maa 'amiloo wa yazeedahum min fadlih; wal laahu yarzuqu mai yashaaa'u bighairi hisaab
ayah.translation: That Allah may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena kafarooo a'maaluhum kasaraabim biqee'atiny yahsabuhuz zamaanu maaa'an hattaaa izaa jaaa'ahoo lam yajid hu shai'anw wa wajadal laaha 'indahoo fa waffaahu hisaabah; wallaahu saree'ul hisaab
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.

ayah.transliteration: Aw kazulumaatin fee bahril lujjiyyiny yaghshaahu mawjum min fawqihee mawjum min fawqihee mawjum min fawqihee sahaab; zulumatum ba'duhaa fawqa ba'din izaaa akhraja yadahoo lam yakad yaraahaa wa mal lam yaj'alil laahu lahoo noora famaa lahoo min noor
ayah.translation: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha yusabbihu lahoo man fissamaawaati wal ardi wat tairu saaaffaatim kullun qad 'alima Salaatahoo wa tasbeehah; wallaahu 'aleemum bimaa yaf'aloon
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allah is Knowing of what they do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi mulkus samaawaati wal ardi wa ilal laahil maseer
ayah.translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha yuzjee sahaaban summa yu'allifu bainahoo summa yaj'aluhoo rukaaman fataral wadqa yakhruju min khilaalihee wa yunazzilu minas samaaa'i min jibaalin feehaa mim barain fa yuseebu bihee mai yashaaa'u wa yasrifuhoo 'am mai yashaaa'u yakkaadu sanaa barqihee yazhabu bil absaar
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.

ayah.transliteration: Yuqallibul laahul laila wannahaar; inna fee zaalika la'ibratal li ulil absaar
ayah.translation: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu khalaqa kulla daaabbatim mim maaa'in faminhum mai yamshee 'alaa batnihee wa minhum mai yamshee 'alaa rijlaine wa minhum mai yamshee 'alaaa arba'; yakhluqul laahu maa yashaaa'; innal laaha 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad anzalnaaa Aayaatim mubaiyinaat; wallaahu yahdee mai yashaaa'u ilaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona aamannaa billaahi wa bir Rasooli wa ata'naa summa yatawallaa fareequm minhum mim ba'di zaalik; wa maaa ulaaa'ika bilmu'mineen
ayah.translation: But the hypocrites say, "We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey"; then a party of them turns away after that. And those are not believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa du'ooo ilal laahi wa Rasoolihee li yahkuma bainahum izaa fareequm minhum mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

ayah.transliteration: Wa iny-yakul lahumul haqqu yaatooo ilaihi muz'ineen
ayah.translation: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.

ayah.transliteration: Afee quloobihim ma radun amirtaabooo am yakhaafoona ani yaheefallaahu 'alaihim wa Rasooluh; bal ulaaa'ika humuz zaalimoon
ayah.translation: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa kaana qawlal mu'mineena izaa du'ooo ilal laahi wa Rasoolihee li yahkuma bainahum ai yaqooloo sami'naa wa ata'naa; wa ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon
ayah.translation: The only statement of the [true] believers when they are called to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them is that they say, "We hear and we obey." And those are the successful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yuti'il laaha wa Rasoolahoo wa yakhshal laaha wa yattaqhi fa ulaaa'ika humul faaa'izoon
ayah.translation: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqsamoo billaahi jahda aimaanihim la'in amartahum la yakhrujunna qul laa tuqsimoo taa'atum ma'roofah innal laaha khabeerum bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allah 's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do."

ayah.transliteration: Qul atee'ul laaha wa atee'ur Rasoola fa in tawallaw fa innamaa 'alaihi maa hummila wa 'alaikum maa hummiltum wa in tutee'oohu tahtadoo; wa maa'alar Rasooli illal balaaghul mubeen
ayah.translation: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away - then upon him is only that [duty] with which he has been charged, and upon you is that with which you have been charged. And if you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided. And there is not upon the Messenger except the [responsibility for] clear notification."

ayah.transliteration: Wa'adal laahul lazeena aamanoo minkum wa 'amilus saalihaati la yastakhlifan nahum fil ardi kamastakh lafal lazeena min qablihim wa la yumakkinanna lahum deenahumul lazir tadaa lahum wa la yubaddilannahum mim ba'di khawfihim amnaa; ya'budoonanee laayushrikoona bee shai'aa; wa man kafara ba'da zaalika fa ulaaa'ika humul faasiqoon
ayah.translation: Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqeemus Salaata wa aatuz Zakaata wa atee'ur Rasoola la'allakum turhamoon
ayah.translation: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.

ayah.transliteration: Laa tahsabannal lazeena kafaroo mu'jizeena fil ard; wa maawaahumun Naaru wa labi'sal maseer
ayah.translation: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo li yastaazinkumul lazeena malakat aimaanukum wallazeena lam yablughul huluma minkum salaasa marraat; min qabli Salaatil Fajri wa heena tada'oona siyaa bakum minaz zaheerati wa mim ba'di Salaatil Ishaaa'; salaasu 'awraatil lakum; laisa 'alaikum wa laa 'alaihim junaahum ba'dahunn; tawwaafoona 'alaikum ba'dukum 'alaa ba'd; kazaalika yubaiyinul laahu lakumul aayaat wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa balaghal atfaalu minkumul huluma fal yastaazinoo kamas taazanal lazeena min qablihim; kazaalika yubaiyinul laahu lakum Aayaatih; wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem
ayah.translation: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Walqawaa'idu minan nisaaa'il laatee laa yarjoona nikaahan falisa 'alaihinna junaahun ai yada'na siyaabahunna ghaira mutabar rijaatim bizeenah; wa ai yasta'fifna khairul lahunn; wallaahu Samee'un 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Laisa 'alal a'maa barajunw wa laa 'alal a'raji barajunw wa laa 'alal mareedi barajun wa laa 'alaa anfusikum an taakuloo mim buyootikum aw buyooti aabaaa'ikum aw buyooti ummahaatikum aw buyooti ikhwaanikum aw buyooti akhawaatikum aw buyooti a'maamikum aw buyooti 'ammaatikum aw buyooti akhwaalikum aw buyooti khaalaatikum aw maa malaktum mafaatihahooo aw sadeeqikum; laisa 'alaikum junaahun an taakuloo jamee'an aw ashtaata; fa izaa dakhaltum buyootan fasallimoo 'alaaa anfusikum tahiyyatam min 'indil laahi mubaarakatan taiyibah; kazaalika yubai yinul laahu lakumul Aayaati la'allakum ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.

ayah.transliteration: Innamal mu'minoonal lazeena aamanoo billaahi wa Rasoolihee wa izaa kaanoo ma'ahoo 'alaaa amrin jaami'il lam yazhaboo hataa yastaazinooh; innal lazeena yastaa zinookana ulaaa'ikal lazeena yu'minoona billaahi wa Rasoolih; fa izas taazanooka liba'di shaanihim faazal liman shi'ta minhum wastaghfir lahumul laah; innal laaha Gahfoor Raheem
ayah.translation: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: La taj'aloo du'aaa'ar Rasooli bainakum kadu'aaa'i badikum ba'daa; qad ya'lamul laahul lazeena yatasallaloona minkum liwaazaa; fal yahzaril lazeena yukhaalifoona 'an amriheee an tuseebahum fitnatun aw yuseebahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Alaaa inna lillaahi maa fis samaawaati wal ardi qad ya'lamu maaa antum 'alaihi wa Yawma yurja'oona ilaihi fa yunaabi 'uhum bimaa 'amiloo; wallaahu bikulli shai'in 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

ayah.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazee nazzalal Furqaana 'alaa 'abdihee li yakoona lil'aalameena nazeera
ayah.translation: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -

ayah.transliteration: Allazee lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ardi wa lam yattakhiz waladanw wa lam yakul lahoo shareekun filmulki wa khalaqa kulla shai'in faqaddarahoo taqdeeraa
ayah.translation: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.

ayah.transliteration: Wattakhazoo min dooniheee aahihatal laa yakhluqoona shai'anw wa hum yukhlaqoona wa laa yamlikoona li anfusihim darranw wa laa naf'anw wa laa yamlikoona mawtanw wa laa hayaatanw wa laa nushooraa
ayah.translation: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafarooo in haazaaa illaaa ifkunif taraahu wa a'aanahoo 'alaihi qawmun aakharoona faqad jaaa'oo zulmanw wa zooraa
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalooo asaateerul awwaleenak tatabahaa fahiya tumlaa 'alaihi bukratanw wa aseelaa
ayah.translation: And they say, "Legends of the former peoples which he has written down, and they are dictated to him morning and afternoon."

ayah.transliteration: Qul anzalhul lazee ya'lamus sirra fis samaawaati wal-ard; innahoo kaana Ghafoorar Raheemaa
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed by He who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. Indeed, He is ever Forgiving and Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo maa li haazar Rasooli yaakulut ta'aama wa yamshee fil aswaaq; law laaa unzila ilaihi malakun fa yakoona ma'ahoo nazeeraa
ayah.translation: And they say, "What is this messenger that eats food and walks in the markets? Why was there not sent down to him an angel so he would be with him a warner?

ayah.transliteration: Aw yulqaaa ilaihi kanzun aw takoonu lahoo jannatuny yaakulu minhaa; wa qaalaz zaalimoona in tattabi'oona illaa rajulam mas hooraa
ayah.translation: Or [why is not] a treasure presented to him [from heaven], or does he [not] have a garden from which he eats?" And the wrongdoers say, "You follow not but a man affected by magic."

ayah.transliteration: Unzur kaifa daraboo lakal amsaala fadalloo falaa yastatee'oona sabeelaa
ayah.translation: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

ayah.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazeee in shaaa'a ja'ala laka khairam min zaalika jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wa yaj'al laka qusooraa
ayah.translation: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.

ayah.transliteration: Bal kazzaboo bis Saa'ati wa a'tadnaa liman kazzaba bis Saa'ati sa'eeraa
ayah.translation: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Izaa ra'at hum mim ma kaanim ba'eedin sami'oo lahaa taghaiyuzanw wa zafeeraa
ayah.translation: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaaa ulqoo minhaa makaanan daiyiqam muqar raneena da'aw hunaalika subooraa
ayah.translation: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.

ayah.transliteration: Laa tad'ul yawma subooranw waahidanw wad'oo subooran kaseeraa
ayah.translation: [They will be told], "Do not cry this Day for one destruction but cry for much destruction."

ayah.transliteration: Qul azaalika khairun am Jannatul khuldil latee wu'idal muttaqoon; kaanat lahum jazaaa'anw wa maseeraa
ayah.translation: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity which is promised to the righteous? It will be for them a reward and destination.

ayah.transliteration: Lahum feehaa maa yashaaa'oona khaalideen; kaana 'alaa Rabbika wa'dam mas'oolaa
ayah.translation: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yahshuruhum wa maa ya'budoona min doonil lahi fa yaqoolu 'a-antum adlaltum 'ibaadee haaa'ulaaa'i am hum dallus sabeel
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day He will gather them and that which they worship besides Allah and will say, "Did you mislead these, My servants, or did they [themselves] stray from the way?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Subhaanaka maa kaana yambaghee lanaaa an nattakhiza min doonika min awliyaaa'a wa laakim matta'tahum wa aabaaa'ahum hattaa nasuz zikra wa kaanoo qawmam booraa
ayah.translation: They will say, "Exalted are You! It was not for us to take besides You any allies. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot the message and became a people ruined."

ayah.transliteration: Faqad kazzabookum bimaa taqooloona famaa tastatee'oona sarfanw wa laa nasraa; wa mai yazlim minkum nuziqhu 'azaaban kabeeraa
ayah.translation: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa qablaka minal mursaleena illaaa innahum la yaakuloonat ta'aama wa yamshoona fil aswaaq; wa ja'alnaa ba'dakum liba'din fitnatan atasbiroon; wa kaana Rabbuka Baseera
ayah.translation: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena laa yarjoona liqaaa'anaa law laaa unzila 'alainal malaaa'ikatu awnaraa Rabbanaa; laqadistakbaroo feee anfusihim wa 'ataw 'utuwwan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: And those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become arrogant within themselves and [become] insolent with great insolence.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yarawnal malaaa 'ikata laa bushraa Yawma'izil lilmujrimeena wa yaqooloona hijram mahjooraa
ayah.translation: The day they see the angels - no good tidings will there be that day for the criminals, and [the angels] will say, "Prevented and inaccessible."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qadimnaaa ilaa maa 'amiloo min 'amalin faja'alnaahu habaaa'am mansooraa
ayah.translation: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.

ayah.transliteration: As haabul jannati yawma'izin khairum mustaqar ranw wa ahsanu maqeela
ayah.translation: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma tashaqqaqus samaaa'u bilghamaami wa nuzzilal malaaa'ikatu tanzeela
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.

ayah.transliteration: Almulku Yawma'izinil haqqu lir Rahmaan; wa kaana Yawman'alal kaafireena 'aseeraa
ayah.translation: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma ya'adduz zaalimu 'alaa yadaihi yaqoolu yaa laitanit takhaztu ma'ar Rasooli sabeelaa
ayah.translation: And the Day the wrongdoer will bite on his hands [in regret] he will say, "Oh, I wish I had taken with the Messenger a way.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa wailataa laitanee lam attakhiz fulaanan khaleelaa
ayah.translation: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad adallanee 'aniz zikri ba'da iz jaaa'anee; wa kaanash Shaitaanu lil insaani khazoolaa
ayah.translation: He led me away from the remembrance after it had come to me. And ever is Satan, to man, a deserter."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalar Rasoolu yaa Rabbi inna qawmit takhazoo haazal Qur-aana mahjooraa
ayah.translation: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika ja'alnaa likulli Nabiyyin 'aduwwam minal mujrimeen; wa kafaa bi Rabbika haadiyanw wa naseeraa
ayah.translation: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo law laa nuzzila 'alaihil Quraanu jumlatanw waahidah; kazaalika linusabbita bihee fu'aadaka wa rattalnaahu tarteelaa
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yaatoonaka bimasainn illaa ji'naaka bilhaqqi wa ahsana tafseeraa
ayah.translation: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yuhsharoona 'alaa wujoohim ilaa jahannama ulaaa'ika sharrum makaananw wa adallu sabeelaa )section 3)
ayah.translation: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba wa ja'alnaa ma'ahooo akhaahu Haaroona wazeeraa
ayah.translation: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

ayah.transliteration: Faqulnaz habaaa ilal qawmil lazeena kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa fadammarnaahum tadmeeraa
ayah.translation: And We said, "Go both of you to the people who have denied Our signs." Then We destroyed them with [complete] destruction.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohil lammaa kazzabur Rusula aghraqnaahum wa ja'alnaahum linnaasi Aayatanw wa a'tadnaa lizzaalimeena 'azaaban aleemaa
ayah.translation: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'Aadanw Samooda wa As haabar Rassi wa quroonam baina zaalika kaseeraa
ayah.translation: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kullandarabnaa lahul amsaala wa kullan tabbarnaa tatbeera
ayah.translation: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ataw 'alal qaryatil lateee umtirat mataras saw'; afalam yakoonoo yarawnahaa; bal kaanoo laa yarjoona nushooraa
ayah.translation: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra awka iny yattakhizoonaka illaa huzuwan ahaazal lazee ba'asal laahu Rasoolaa
ayah.translation: And when they see you, [O Muhammad], they take you not except in ridicule, [saying], "Is this the one whom Allah has sent as a messenger?

ayah.transliteration: In kaada la yudillunaa 'an aalihatinaa law laaa an sabarnaa 'alaihaa; wa sawfa ya'lamoona heena yarawnal 'azaaba man adallu sabeela
ayah.translation: He almost would have misled us from our gods had we not been steadfast in [worship of] them." But they are going to know, when they see the punishment, who is farthest astray in [his] way.

ayah.transliteration: Ara'aita manit takhaza ilaahahoo hawaahu afa anta takoonu 'alaihi wakeelaa
ayah.translation: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?

ayah.transliteration: Am tahsabu annna aksarahum yasma'oona aw ya''qiloon; in hum illaa kal an'aami bal hum adallu sabeelan
ayah.translation: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara ilaa Rabbika kaifa maddaz zilla wa law shaaa'a laja'alahoo saakinan summa ja'alnash shamsa 'alaihe daleelaa
ayah.translation: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.

ayah.transliteration: Summa qabadnaahu ilainaa qabdany yaseeraa
ayah.translation: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee ja'ala lakumul laila libaasanw wannawma subaatanw wa ja'alan nahaara nushooraa
ayah.translation: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazeee arsalar riyaaha bushram baina yadai rahmatih; wa anzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'an tahooraa
ayah.translation: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water

ayah.transliteration: Linuhyiya bihee balda tam maitanw wa nusqiyahoo mimmaa khalaqnaaa an'aa manw wa anaasiyya kaseeraa
ayah.translation: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad sarrafnaahu bainahum li yazzakkaroo fa abaaa aksarun naasi illaa kufooraa
ayah.translation: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law shi'naa laba'asnaa fee kulli qar yatin nazeeraa
ayah.translation: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa tuti'il kaafireena wa jaahidhum bihee jihaadan kabeeraa
ayah.translation: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee marajal bahraini haazaa 'azbun furaatunw wa haazaa milhun ujaaj; wa ja'ala bainahumaa barzakhanw wa hijram mahjooraa
ayah.translation: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee khalaqa minal maaa'i basharran fa ja'alahoo nasaban wa sihraa; wa kaana Rabbuka Qadeeraa
ayah.translation: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].

ayah.transliteration: Wa ya'budoona min doonil laahi maa laa yanfa'uhum wa laa yadurruhum; wa kaanal kaafiru 'alaa Rabbihee zaheeraa
ayah.translation: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa arsalnaaka illaa mubashshiranw wa nazeeraa
ayah.translation: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

ayah.transliteration: Qul maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin illaa man shaaa'a ai yattakhiza ilaa Rabbihee sabeelaa
ayah.translation: Say, "I do not ask of you for it any payment - only that whoever wills might take to his Lord a way."

ayah.transliteration: Wa tawakkal 'alal Haiyil lazee laa yamootu wa sabbih bihamdih; wa kafaa bihee bizunoobi 'ibaadihee khabeeraa
ayah.translation: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -

ayah.transliteration: Allazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaa fee sittati aiyaamin summmmastawaa 'alal 'Arsh; ar Rahmaanu fas'al bihee khabeeraa
ayah.translation: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahumus judoo lir Rahmaani qaaloo wa mar Rahmaanu anasjudu limaa taamurunaa wa zaadahum nufooraa
ayah.translation: And when it is said to them, "Prostrate to the Most Merciful," they say, "And what is the Most Merciful? Should we prostrate to that which you order us?" And it increases them in aversion.

ayah.transliteration: Tabaarakal lazee ja'ala fis samaaa'i buroojanw wa ja'ala feehaa siraajanw wa qamaram muneeraa
ayah.translation: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.

ayah.transliteration: Wa huwal lazee ja'alal laila wannahaara khilfatal liman araada ai yazzakkara aw araadaa shookooraa
ayah.translation: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'ibaadur Rahmaanil lazeena yamshoona 'alal ardi hawnanw wa izaa khaata bahumul jaahiloona qaaloo salaamaa
ayah.translation: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yabeetoona li Rabbihim sujjadanw wa qiyaamaa
ayah.translation: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yaqooloona Rabbanas rif 'annnaa 'azaaba Jahannama inn 'azaabahaa kaana gharaamaa
ayah.translation: And those who say, "Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell. Indeed, its punishment is ever adhering;

ayah.transliteration: Innahaa saaa'at mustaqarranw wa muqaamaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is evil as a settlement and residence."

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena izaaa anfaqoo lam yusrifoo wa lam yaqturoo wa kaana baina zaalika qawaamaa
ayah.translation: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena laa yad'oona ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara wa laa yaqtuloonan nafsal latee harramal laahu illaa bilhaqqi wa laa yaznoon; wa mai yaf'al zaalika yalqa asaamaa
ayah.translation: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.

ayah.transliteration: Yudaa'af lahul 'azaabu Yawmal Qiyaamati wa yakhlud feehee muhaanaa
ayah.translation: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man taaba wa 'aamana wa 'amila 'amalan saalihan fa ulaaa'ika yubad dilul laahu saiyi aatihim hasanaat; wa kaanal laahu Ghafoorar Raheemaa
ayah.translation: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man taaba wa 'amila saalihan fa innnahoo yatoobu ilal laahi mataabaa
ayah.translation: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena laa yash hadoonaz zoora wa izaa marroo billaghwi marroo kiraamaa
ayah.translation: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena izaa zukkiroo bi Aayaati Rabbihim lam yakhirroo 'alaihaa summanw wa'umyaanaa
ayah.translation: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yaqooloona Rabbanaa hab lanaa min azwaajinaa wa zurriyaatinaa qurrata a'yuninw waj 'alnaa lilmuttaqeena Imaamaa
ayah.translation: And those who say, "Our Lord, grant us from among our wives and offspring comfort to our eyes and make us an example for the righteous."

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika yujzawnal ghurfata bimaa sabaroo wa yulaqqawna feehaa tahiyyatanw wa salaamaa
ayah.translation: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.

ayah.transliteration: Khaalideena feehaa; hasunat mustaqarranw wa muqaamaa
ayah.translation: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.

ayah.transliteration: Qul maa ya'ba'u bikum Rabbee law laa du'aaa'ukum faqad kazzabtum fasawfa yakoonu lizaamaa
ayah.translation: Say, "What would my Lord care for you if not for your supplication?" For you [disbelievers] have denied, so your denial is going to be adherent.

ayah.transliteration: Taa-Seeen-Meeem
ayah.translation: Ta, Seen, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tilka Aayaatul Kitaabil Mubeen
ayah.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.

ayah.transliteration: La'allaka baakhi'un nafsaka allaa yakoonoo mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

ayah.transliteration: In nashaa nunazzil 'alaihim minas samaaa'i Aayatan fazallat a'naaquhum lahaa khaadi'een
ayah.translation: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yaateehim min zikrim minar Rahmaani muhdasin illaa kaanoo 'anhu mu'rideen
ayah.translation: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

ayah.transliteration: Faqad kazzaboo fasa yaateehim ambaaa'u maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Awa lam yaraw ilal ardi kam ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjin kareem
ayah.translation: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

ayah.transliteration: Inn fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz naadaa Rabbuka Moosaaa ani'-til qawmaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -

ayah.transliteration: Qawma Fir'awn; alaa yattaqoon
ayah.translation: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allah?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi inneee akhaafu ai yukazziboon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me

ayah.transliteration: Wa yadeequ sadree wa laa yantaliqu lisaanee fa arsil ilaa Haaroon
ayah.translation: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahum 'alaiya zambun fa akhaafu ai yaqtuloon
ayah.translation: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala kallaa fazhabaa bi Aayaatinaaa innaa ma'akum mustami'oon
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.

ayah.transliteration: Faatiyaa Fir'awna faqoolaaa innaa Rasoolu Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

ayah.transliteration: An arsil ma'anaa Baneee Israaa'eel
ayah.translation: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala alam nurabbika feenaa waleedanw wa labista feenaa min 'umurika sineen
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?

ayah.transliteration: Wa fa'alta fa'latakal latee fa'alta wa anta minal kaafireen
ayah.translation: And [then] you did your deed which you did, and you were of the ungrateful."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fa'altuhaaa izanw wa ana minad daaaleen
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray.

ayah.transliteration: Fafarartu minkum lam maa khiftukum fawahaba lee Rabbee hukmanw wa ja'alanee minal mursaleen
ayah.translation: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tilka ni'matun tamun nuhaa 'alaiya an 'abbatta Baneee Israaa'eel
ayah.translation: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Fir'awnu wa maa Rabbul 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa in kuntum mooqineen
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala liman hawlahooo alaa tastami'oon
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbukum wa Rabbu aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala inna Rasoolakumul lazee ursila ilaikum lamajnoon
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbul mashriqi wal maghribi wa maa baina humaa in kuntum ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala la'init takhazta ilaahan ghairee la aj'alannaka minal masjooneen
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala awalw ji'tuka bishai'im mubeen
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you proof manifest?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala faati biheee in kunta minas saadiqeen
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Fa alqaa 'asaahu fa izaaa hiya su'baanum mubeen
ayah.translation: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

ayah.transliteration: Wa naza'a yadahoo faizaa hiya baidaaa'u linnaa zireen
ayah.translation: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lilmala-i hawlahooo inna haazaa lasaahirun 'aleem
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.

ayah.transliteration: Yureedu ai yukhrijakum min ardikum bisihrihee famaazaa taamuroon
ayah.translation: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo arjih wa akhaahu wab'as filmadaaa'ini haashireen
ayah.translation: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers

ayah.transliteration: Yaatooka bikulli sah haarin 'aleem
ayah.translation: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."

ayah.transliteration: Fa jumi'as saharatu limeeqaati Yawmim ma'loom
ayah.translation: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeela linnaasi hal antum mujtami'oon
ayah.translation: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate

ayah.transliteration: La'allanaa nattabi'us saharata in kaanoo humul ghaalibeen
ayah.translation: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'as saharatu qaaloo li Fir'awna a'inna lanaa la ajjran in kunnaa nahnul ghaalibeen
ayah.translation: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala na'am wa innakum izal laminal muqarrabeen
ayah.translation: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala lahum Moosaaa alqoo maaa antum mulqoon
ayah.translation: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."

ayah.transliteration: Fa alqaw hibaalahum wa 'isiyyahum wa qaaloo bi'izzati Fir'awna innaa lanahnul ghaaliboon
ayah.translation: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."

ayah.transliteration: Fa alqaa Moosaa 'asaahu fa izaa hiya talqafu maa yaafikoon
ayah.translation: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.

ayah.transliteration: Fa ulqiyas saharatu saajideen
ayah.translation: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo aamannaa bi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,

ayah.transliteration: Rabbi Moosaa wa Haaroon
ayah.translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala aamantum lahoo qabla an aazana lakum innahoo lakabeerukumul lazee 'alla makumus sihra falasawfa ta'lamoon; la uqatti'anna aidiyakum wa arjulakum min khilaafinw wa la usallibanna kum ajma'een
ayah.translation: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed Moses before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo la daira innaaa ilaa Rabbinaa munqalliboon
ayah.translation: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa natma'u ai yaghfira lanaa Rabbunna khataa yaanaaa an kunnaaa awwalal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa an asri bi'ibaadeee innakum muttaba'oon
ayah.translation: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."

ayah.transliteration: Fa arsala Fir'awnu filmadaaa'ini haashireen
ayah.translation: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

ayah.transliteration: Inna haaa'ulaaa'i lashir zimatun qaleeloon
ayah.translation: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahum lanaa laghaaa'izoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, they are enraging us,

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaa lajamee'un haaziroon
ayah.translation: And indeed, we are a cautious society... "

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhrajnaahum min Jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: So We removed them from gardens and springs

ayah.transliteration: Wa kunoozinw wa ma qaamin kareem
ayah.translation: And treasures and honorable station -

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika wa awrasnaahaa Baneee Israaa'eel
ayah.translation: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

ayah.transliteration: Fa atba'oohum mushriqeen
ayah.translation: So they pursued them at sunrise.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa taraaa'al jam'aani qaala as haabu Moosaaa innaa lamudrakoon
ayah.translation: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
