ayah.transliteration: Qaala kallaaa inna ma'iya Rabbee sa yahdeen
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

ayah.transliteration: Fa awhainaaa ilaa Moosaaa anidrib bi'asaakal bahra fanfalaqa fakaana kullu firqin kattawdil 'azeem
ayah.translation: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.

ayah.transliteration: Wa azlafnaa sammal aakhareen
ayah.translation: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anjainaa Moosaa wa mam ma'ahooo ajma'een
ayah.translation: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

ayah.transliteration: Summa aghraqnal aakhareen
ayah.translation: Then We drowned the others.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaah; wa maa kaana aksaru hu mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Watlu 'alaihim naba-a Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maa ta'budoon
ayah.translation: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo na'budu asnaaman fanazallu lahaa 'aakifeen
ayah.translation: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala hal yasma'oona kum iz tad'oon
ayah.translation: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?

ayah.transliteration: Aw yanfa'oonakum aw yadurroon
ayah.translation: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo bal wajadnaaa aabaaa 'anaa kazaalika yaf'aloon
ayah.translation: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala afara 'aitum maa kuntum ta'budoon
ayah.translation: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,

ayah.transliteration: Antum wa aabaaa'ukumul aqdamoon
ayah.translation: You and your ancient forefathers?

ayah.transliteration: Fa innahum 'aduwwwul leee illaa Rabbal 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,

ayah.transliteration: Allazee khalaqanee fa Huwa yahdeen
ayah.translation: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee Huwa yut'imunee wa yasqeen
ayah.translation: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa mardtu fahuwa yashfeen
ayah.translation: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee yumeetunee summa yuhyeen
ayah.translation: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeee atma'u ai yaghfira lee khateee' atee Yawmad Deen
ayah.translation: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."

ayah.transliteration: Rabbi hab lee hukmanw wa alhiqnee bis saaliheen
ayah.translation: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Waj'al lee lisaana sidqin fil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.

ayah.transliteration: Waj'alnee minw warasati Jannnatin Na'eem
ayah.translation: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

ayah.transliteration: Waghfir li abeee innahoo kaana mind daalleen
ayah.translation: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tukhzinee Yawma yub'asoon
ayah.translation: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma laa yanfa'u maalunw wa laa banoon
ayah.translation: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man atal laaha biqalbin saleem
ayah.translation: But only one who comes to Allah with a sound heart."

ayah.transliteration: Wa uzlifatil Jannatu lilmuttaqeen
ayah.translation: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa burrizatil Jaheemu lilghaaween
ayah.translation: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeela lahum aina maa kuntum ta'budoon
ayah.translation: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship

ayah.transliteration: Min doonil laahi hal yansuroonakum aw yantasiroon
ayah.translation: Other than Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?"

ayah.transliteration: Fakubkiboo feehaa hum walghaawoon
ayah.translation: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators

ayah.transliteration: Wa junoodu Ibleesa ajma'oon
ayah.translation: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo wa hum feehaa yakkhtasimoon
ayah.translation: They will say while they dispute therein,

ayah.transliteration: Tallaahi in kunnaa lafee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: "By Allah, we were indeed in manifest error

ayah.transliteration: Iz nusawweekum bi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa adallanaaa illal mujrimoon
ayah.translation: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Famaa lanaa min shaa fi'een
ayah.translation: So now we have no intercessors

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa sadeeqin hameem
ayah.translation: And not a devoted friend.

ayah.transliteration: Falaw anna lanaa karratan fanakoona minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers... "

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayatanw wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qawmu Noohinil Mursaleen
ayah.translation: The people of Noah denied the messengers

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Noohun alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqullaaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo anu'minu laka wattaba 'akal arzaloon
ayah.translation: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala wa maa 'ilmee bimaa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

ayah.transliteration: In hisaabuhum illaa 'alaa Rabbee law tash'uroon
ayah.translation: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa ana bitaaridil mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

ayah.transliteration: In ana illaa nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: I am only a clear warner."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa Noohu latakoonanna minal marjoomeen
ayah.translation: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi inna qawmee kazzaboon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.

ayah.transliteration: Faftab bainee wa bai nahum fat hanw wa najjinee wa mam ma'iya minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."

ayah.transliteration: Fa anjainaahu wa mamma'ahoo fil fulkil mashhoon
ayah.translation: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

ayah.transliteration: Summa aghraqnaa ba'dul baaqeen
ayah.translation: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayaah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat 'Aadunil mursaleen
ayah.translation: 'Aad denied the messengers

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Hoodun alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqullaaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Atabnoona bikulli ree'in aayatan ta'basoon
ayah.translation: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,

ayah.transliteration: Wa tattakhizoona masaani'a la'allakum takhludoon
ayah.translation: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa batashtum batashtum jabbaareen
ayah.translation: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wattaqul lazeee amad dakum bimaa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

ayah.transliteration: Amaddakum bi an'aa minw wa baneen
ayah.translation: Provided you with grazing livestock and children

ayah.transliteration: Wa jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: And gardens and springs.

ayah.transliteration: Innee akhaafu 'alaikum 'azaaba Yawmin 'azeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo sawaaa'un 'alainaaa awa 'azta am lam takum minal waa'izeen
ayah.translation: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.

ayah.transliteration: In haazaaa illaa khuluqul awwaleen
ayah.translation: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa nahnu bimu 'azzabeen
ayah.translation: And we are not to be punished."

ayah.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa ahlaknaahum; inna fee zaalika la aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat Samoodul mursaleen
ayah.translation: Thamud denied the messengers

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Saalihun alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When their brother Salih said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Atutrakoona fee maa haahunnaaa aamineen
ayah.translation: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],

ayah.transliteration: Fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: Within gardens and springs

ayah.transliteration: Wa zuroo inw wa nakhlin tal 'uhaa hadeem
ayah.translation: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

ayah.transliteration: Wa tanhitoona minal jibaali buyootan faariheen
ayah.translation: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tutee'ooo amral musrifeen
ayah.translation: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yufsidoona fil ardi wa laa yuslihoon
ayah.translation: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo innamaa anta minal musahhareen
ayah.translation: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa faati bi Aayatin in kunta minas saadiqeen
ayah.translation: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala haazihee naaqatul lahaa shirbunw w alakum shirbu yawmim ma'loom
ayah.translation: He said, "This is a she-camel. For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tamassoohaa bisooo'in fa yaakhuzakum 'azaabu Yawmin 'Azeem
ayah.translation: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."

ayah.transliteration: Fa'aqaroohaa fa asbahoo naadimeen
ayah.translation: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhazahumul 'azaab; inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum m'mineen
ayah.translation: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: kazzabat qawmu Lootinil mursaleen
ayah.translation: The people of Lot denied the messengers

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum akhoohum Lootun alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Innee lakum rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Ataatoonaz zukraana minal 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Do you approach males among the worlds

ayah.transliteration: Wa tazaroona maa khalaqa lakum Rabbukum min azwaajikum; bal antum qawmun 'aadoon
ayah.translation: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaloo la'il lam tantahi yaa Lootu latakoonanna minal mukhrajeen
ayah.translation: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innee li'amalikum minal qaaleen
ayah.translation: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].

ayah.transliteration: Rabbi najjjinee wa ahlee mimmmaa ya'maloon
ayah.translation: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."

ayah.transliteration: Fanajjainaahu wa ahlahooo ajma'een
ayah.translation: So We saved him and his family, all,

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ajoozan filghaabireen
ayah.translation: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.

ayah.transliteration: Summa dammarnal aa khareen
ayah.translation: Then We destroyed the others.

ayah.transliteration: Wa amtarnaa 'alaihim mataran fasaaa'a matarul munzareen
ayah.translation: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la Huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzaba As haabul Aykatil mursaleen
ayah.translation: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala lahum Shu'aybun alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Innee lakum Rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: So fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrin in ajriya illaa 'alaa Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Awful kaila wa laa takoonoo minal mukhsireen
ayah.translation: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.

ayah.transliteration: Wa zinoo bilqistaasil mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And weigh with an even balance.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tabkhasun naasa ashyaaa 'ahum wa laa ta'saw fil ardi mufsideen
ayah.translation: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.

ayah.transliteration: Wattaqul lazee khalaqakum waljibillatal awwaleen
ayah.translation: And fear He who created you and the former creation."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo innamaa anta minal musahhareen
ayah.translation: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa anta illaa basharum mislunaa wa innazunnuka laminal kaazibeen
ayah.translation: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Fa asqit 'alainaa kisafam minas samaaa'i in kunta minas saadiqeen
ayah.translation: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbeee a'lamu bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."

ayah.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa akhazahum 'azaabu Yawmiz zullah; innahoo kaana 'azaaba Yawmin 'Azeem
ayah.translation: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika la Aayah; wa maa kaana aksaruhum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la huwal 'Azeezur Raheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo latanzeelu Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Nazala bihir Roohul Ameen
ayah.translation: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

ayah.transliteration: 'Alaa qalbika litakoona minal munzireen
ayah.translation: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -

ayah.transliteration: Bilisaanin 'Arabiyyim mubeen
ayah.translation: In a clear Arabic language.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo lafee Zuburil awwaleen
ayah.translation: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yakul lahum Aayatan ai ya'lamahoo 'ulamaaa'u Baneee Israaa'eel
ayah.translation: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

ayah.transliteration: Wa law nazzalnaahu 'alaa ba'dil a'jameen
ayah.translation: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

ayah.transliteration: Faqara ahoo 'alaihim maa kaanoo bihee mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika salaknaahu fee quloobil mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yu'minoona bihee hattaa yarawul 'azaabal aleem
ayah.translation: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Fayaatiyahum baghtatanw wa hum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

ayah.transliteration: Fa yaqooloo hal nahnu munzaroon
ayah.translation: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"

ayah.transliteration: Aafabi 'azaabinaa yasta'jiloon
ayah.translation: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

ayah.transliteration: Aara'aita im matta'naahum sineen
ayah.translation: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

ayah.transliteration: Summa jaaa'ahum maa kaanoo yoo'adoon
ayah.translation: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

ayah.transliteration: Maaa aghnaaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yumaatoo'oon
ayah.translation: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa ahlaknaa min qaryatin illaa lahaa munziroon
ayah.translation: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

ayah.transliteration: Zikraa wa maa kunnaa zaalimeen
ayah.translation: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa tanazzalat bihish Shayaateen
ayah.translation: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yambaghee lahum wa maa yastatee'oon
ayah.translation: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.

ayah.transliteration: Innahum 'anis sam'i lama'zooloon
ayah.translation: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa tad'u ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fatakoona minal mu'azzabeen
ayah.translation: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anzir 'asheeratakal aqrabeen
ayah.translation: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.

ayah.transliteration: Wakhfid janaahaka limanit taba 'aka minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Fa in asawka faqul innee bareee'um mimmmaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."

ayah.transliteration: Wa tawakkal alal 'Azeezir Raheem
ayah.translation: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

ayah.transliteration: Allazee yaraaka heena taqoom
ayah.translation: Who sees you when you arise

ayah.transliteration: Wa taqallubaka fis saajideen
ayah.translation: And your movement among those who prostrate.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Hal unabbi'ukum 'alaa man tanazzalush Shayaateen
ayah.translation: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

ayah.transliteration: Tanazzalu 'alaa kulli affaakin aseem
ayah.translation: They descend upon every sinful liar.

ayah.transliteration: Yulqoonas sam'a wa aksaruhum aaziboon
ayah.translation: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.

ayah.transliteration: Washshu 'araaa'u yattabi 'uhumul ghaawoon
ayah.translation: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annahum fee kulli waadiny yaheemoon
ayah.translation: Do you not see that in every valley they roam

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahum yaqooloona ma laa yaf'aloon
ayah.translation: And that they say what they do not do? -

ayah.transliteration: Illal lazeena aamanoo w a'amilus saalihaati wa zakarul laaha kaseeranw wantasaroo mim ba'di maa zulimoo; wa saya'lamul lazeena zalamooo aiya munqalbiny yanqaliboon
ayah.translation: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Taa-Seeen; tilka Aayaatul Qur-aani wa Kitaabim Mubeen
ayah.translation: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book

ayah.transliteration: Hudanw wa bushraa lil mu'mineen
ayah.translation: As guidance and good tidings for the believers

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yuqeemoonas Salaata wa yu'toonaz Zakaata wa hum bil Aakhirati hum yooqinoon
ayah.translation: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena laa yu'mimoona bil Aakhirati zaiyannaa lahum a'maalahum fahum ya'mahoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena lahum sooo'ul 'azaabi wa hum fil Aakhirati humul akhsaroon
ayah.translation: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaka latulaqqal Qur-aana mil ladun Hakeemin 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala Moosaa li ahliheee inneee aanastu naaran saaateekum minhaa bikhabarin aw aateekum bishihaabin qabasil la'allakum tastaloon
ayah.translation: [Mention] when Moses said to his family, "Indeed, I have perceived a fire. I will bring you from there information or will bring you a burning torch that you may warm yourselves."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'ahaa noodiya am boorika man finnnnaari wa man hawlahaa wa Subhaanal laahi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: But when he came to it, he was called, "Blessed is whoever is at the fire and whoever is around it. And exalted is Allah, Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa Moosaaa innahooo Anal laahul 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: O Moses, indeed it is I - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

ayah.transliteration: Wa alqi 'asaak; falammmaa ra aahaa tahtazzu ka annahaa jaaannunw wallaa mudbiranw wa lam yu'aqqib; yaa Moosaa laa takhaf innee laa yakhaafu ladaiyal mursaloon
ayah.translation: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it were a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, fear not. Indeed, in My presence the messengers do not fear.

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man zalama summa baddala husnam ba'da sooo'in fa innee Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa adkhil yadaka fee jaibika takhruj baidaaa'a min ghairisooo'in feetis'i Aayaatin ilaa Fir'awna wa qawmih; innahum kaanoo qawman faasiqeen
ayah.translation: And put your hand into the opening of your garment [at the breast]; it will come out white without disease. [These are] among the nine signs [you will take] to Pharaoh and his people. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'at hum Aayaatunaa mubsiratan qaaloo haazaa sihrum mubeen
ayah.translation: But when there came to them Our visible signs, they said, "This is obvious magic."

ayah.transliteration: Wa jahadoo bihaa wastaiqanat haaa anfusuhum zulmanw-wa 'uluwwaa; fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mufsideen
ayah.translation: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Daawooda wa sulaimaana 'ilmaa; wa qaalal hamdu lil laahil lazee faddalanaa 'alaa kaseerim min 'ibaadihil mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And We had certainly given to David and Solomon knowledge, and they said, "Praise [is due] to Allah, who has favored us over many of His believing servants."

ayah.transliteration: Wa warisa Sulaimaanu Daawooda wa qaala yaaa aiyuhan naasu 'ullimnaa mantiqat tairi wa ooteenaa min kulli shai'in inna haazaa lahuwal fadlul mubeen
ayah.translation: And Solomon inherited David. He said, "O people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have been given from all things. Indeed, this is evident bounty."

ayah.transliteration: Wa hushira Sulaimaana junooduhoo minal jinni wal insi wattairi fahum yooza'oon
ayah.translation: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.

ayah.transliteration: hattaaa izaaa ataw 'alaa waadin namli qaalat namlatuny yaaa aiyuhan namlud khuloo masaakinakum laa yahtimannakum Sulaimaanu wa junooduhoo wa hum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, an ant said, "O ants, enter your dwellings that you not be crushed by Solomon and his soldiers while they perceive not."

ayah.transliteration: Fatabassama daahikam min qawlihaa wa qaala Rabbi awzi'nee an ashkura ni'mata kal lateee an'amta 'alaiya wa 'alaa waalidaiya wa an a'mala saalihan tardaahu wa adkhilnee birahmatika fee 'ibaadikas saaliheen
ayah.translation: So [Solomon] smiled, amused at her speech, and said, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to do righteousness of which You approve. And admit me by Your mercy into [the ranks of] Your righteous servants."

ayah.transliteration: Wa tafaqqadat taira faqaala maa liya laaa aral hud hud, am kaana minal ghaaa'ibeen
ayah.translation: And he took attendance of the birds and said, "Why do I not see the hoopoe - or is he among the absent?

ayah.transliteration: La-u'azzibanahoo 'azaaban shadeedan aw la azbahannahoo aw layaatiyannee bisultaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or slaughter him unless he brings me clear authorization."

ayah.transliteration: Famakasa ghaira ba'eedin faqaala ahattu bimaa lam tuhit bihee wa ji'tuka min Sabaim binaba iny-yaqeen
ayah.translation: But the hoopoe stayed not long and said, "I have encompassed [in knowledge] that which you have not encompassed, and I have come to you from Sheba with certain news.

ayah.transliteration: Innee wajattum ra atan tamlikuhum wa ootiyat min kulli shai'inw wa lahaa 'arshun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.

ayah.transliteration: Wajattuhaa wa qawmahaa yasjudoona lishshamsi min doonil laahi wa zaiyana lahumush Shaitaanu a'maalahum fasaddahum 'anis sabeeli fahum laa yahtadoon
ayah.translation: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,

ayah.transliteration: Allaa yasjudoo lillaahil lazee yukhrijul khab'a fis samaawaati wal ardi wa ya'lamu maa tukhfoona wa maa tu'linoon
ayah.translation: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa Rabbul 'Arshil Azeem
ayah.translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Great Throne."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala sananzuru asadaqta am kunta minal kaazibeen
ayah.translation: [Solomon] said, "We will see whether you were truthful or were of the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Izhab bikitaabee haaza fa alqih ilaihim summma tawalla 'anhum fanzur maazaa yarji'oon
ayah.translation: Take this letter of mine and deliver it to them. Then leave them and see what [answer] they will return."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat yaaa aiyuhal mala'u innee ulqiya ilaiya kitaabun kareem
ayah.translation: She said, "O eminent ones, indeed, to me has been delivered a noble letter.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo min Sulaimaana wa innahoo bismil laahir Rahmaanir Raheem
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

ayah.transliteration: Allaa ta'loo 'alaiya waa toonee muslimeen
ayah.translation: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat yaaa aiyuhal mala'u aftoonee fee amree maa kuntu qaati'atan amran hattaa tashhhaddon
ayah.translation: She said, "O eminent ones, advise me in my affair. I would not decide a matter until you witness [for] me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo nahnu uloo quwwatinw wa uloo baasin shadeed; wal amru ilaiki fanzuree maazaa taamureen
ayah.translation: They said, "We are men of strength and of great military might, but the command is yours, so see what you will command."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat innal mulooka izaa dakhaloo qaryatan afsadoohaa wa ja'alooo a'izzata ahlihaaa azillah; wa kazaalika yaf'aloon
ayah.translation: She said, "Indeed kings - when they enter a city, they ruin it and render the honored of its people humbled. And thus do they do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innee mursilatun ilaihim bihadiyyatin fanaaziratum bima yarji'ul mursaloon
ayah.translation: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'a Sulaimaana qaala atumiddoonani bimaalin famaaa aataakum bal antum bihadiy yatikum tafrahoon
ayah.translation: So when they came to Solomon, he said, "Do you provide me with wealth? But what Allah has given me is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in your gift.

ayah.transliteration: Irji' ilaihim falanaatiyan nahum bijunoodil laa qibala lahum bihaa wa lanukhri jannahum minhaaa azillatanw wa hum saaghiroon
ayah.translation: Return to them, for we will surely come to them with soldiers that they will be powerless to encounter, and we will surely expel them therefrom in humiliation, and they will be debased."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala yaaa aiyuhal mala'u aiyukum yaateenee bi'arshihaa qabla ai yaatoonee muslimeen
ayah.translation: [Solomon] said, "O assembly [of jinn], which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala 'ifreetum minal jinni ana aateeka bihee qabla an taqooma mim maqaamika wa innee 'alaihi laqawiyyun ameen
ayah.translation: A powerful one from among the jinn said, "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place, and indeed, I am for this [task] strong and trustworthy."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalal lazee indahoo 'ilmum minal Kitaabi ana aateeka bihee qabla ai yartadda ilaika tarfuk; falammaa ra aahu mustaqirran 'indahoo qaala haazaa min fadli Rabbee li yabluwaneee 'a-ashkuru am akfuru wa man shakara fa innamaa yashkuru linafsihee wa man kafara fa inna Rabbee Ghaniyyun Kareem
ayah.translation: Said one who had knowledge from the Scripture, "I will bring it to you before your glance returns to you." And when [Solomon] saw it placed before him, he said, "This is from the favor of my Lord to test me whether I will be grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful - his gratitude is only for [the benefit of] himself. And whoever is ungrateful - then indeed, my Lord is Free of need and Generous."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala nakkiroo lahaa 'arshahaa nanzur atahtadeee am takoonu minal lazeena laa yahtadoon
ayah.translation: He said, "Disguise for her her throne; we will see whether she will be guided [to truth] or will be of those who is not guided."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'at qeela ahaakaza 'arshuki qaalat kaanna hoo; wa ooteenal 'ilma min qablihaa wa kunnaa muslimeen
ayah.translation: So when she arrived, it was said [to her], "Is your throne like this?" She said, "[It is] as though it was it." [Solomon said], "And we were given knowledge before her, and we have been Muslims [in submission to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa saddahaa maa kaanat ta'budu min doonil laahi innahaa kaanat min qawmin kaafireen
ayah.translation: And that which she was worshipping other than Allah had averted her [from submission to Him]. Indeed, she was from a disbelieving people."

ayah.transliteration: Qeela lahad khulis sarha falammaa ra at hu hasibat hu lujjatanw wa khashafat 'an saaqaihaa; qaala innahoo sarhum mumarradum min qawaareer; qaalat Rabbi innee zalamtu nafsee wa aslamtu ma'a Sulaimaana lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: She was told, "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a body of water and uncovered her shins [to wade through]. He said, "Indeed, it is a palace [whose floor is] made smooth with glass." She said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaaa ilaa Samoda akhaahum Saalihan ani'budul lahha fa izaa hum fareeqaani yakhtasimoon
ayah.translation: And We had certainly sent to Thamud their brother Salih, [saying], "Worship Allah," and at once they were two parties conflicting.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala yaa qawmi lima tasta'jiloona bissaiyi'ati qablal hasanati law laa tas taghfiroonal laaha la'allakum turhamoon
ayah.translation: He said, "O my people, why are you impatient for evil instead of good? Why do you not seek forgiveness of Allah that you may receive mercy?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalut taiyarnaa bika wa bimam ma'ak; qaala taaa'irukum 'indal laahi bal antum qawmun tuftanoon
ayah.translation: They said, "We consider you a bad omen, you and those with you." He said, "Your omen is with Allah. Rather, you are a people being tested."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaana fil madeenati tis'atu rahtiny yufsidoona fil ardi wa laa yuslihoon
ayah.translation: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo taqaasamoo billaahi lanubaiyitannahoo wa ahlahoo summaa lanaqoolana liwaliy yihee maa shahidnaa mahlika ahliee wa innaa lasaadiqoon
ayah.translation: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.' "

ayah.transliteration: Wa makaroo makranw wa makarnaa makranw wa hum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.

ayah.transliteration: Fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatu makrihim annaa dammar naahum wa qawmahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.

ayah.transliteration: Fatilka buyootuhum khaa wiyatam bimaa zalamoo; inna fee zaalika la Aayatal liqaw miny-ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anjainal lazeena aamanoo wa kaanoo yattaqoon
ayah.translation: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lootan iz qaala liqawmiheee ataatoonal faa hishata wa antum qawmun tajjhaloon
ayah.translation: And [mention] Lot, when he said to his people, "Do you commit immorality while you are seeing?

ayah.transliteration: A'innakum lataatoonar rijaala shahwatam min doonin nisaaa'; bal antum qawmun tajhaloon
ayah.translation: Do you indeed approach men with desire instead of women? Rather, you are a people behaving ignorantly."

ayah.transliteration: Fammaa kaana jawaaba qawmiheee illaaa an qaalooo akrijoon aalaa Lootim min qaryatikum innahum unaasuny yatatahharoon
ayah.translation: But the answer of his people was not except that they said, "Expel the family of Lot from your city. Indeed, they are people who keep themselves pure."

ayah.transliteration: Fa anjainaahu wa ahlahooo illam ra atahoo qaddarnaahaa minal ghaabireen
ayah.translation: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.

ayah.transliteration: Wa amtarnaa 'alaihimm mataran fasaaa'a matarul munzareen
ayah.translation: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

ayah.transliteration: Qulil hamdu lillaahi wa salaamun 'alaa 'ibaadihil lazeenas tafaa; aaallaahu khairun ammmaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Praise be to Allah, and peace upon His servants whom He has chosen. Is Allah better or what they associate with Him?"

ayah.transliteration: Amman khalaqas samaawaati wal arda wa anzala lakum minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa ambatnaa bihee hadaaa'iqa zaata bahjjah; maa kanna lakum an tumbitoo shajarahaa; 'a-ilaahum ma'al laah; bal hum qawmuny ya'diloon
ayah.translation: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

ayah.transliteration: Ammann ja'alal arda qaraaranw wa ja'ala khilaalahaaa anhaaranw wa ja'ala lahaa rawaasiya wa ja'ala bainal bahraini haajizaa; 'a-ilaahumma'allah; bal aksaruhum la ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Ammany-yujeebul mud tarra izaa da'aahu wa yakshifussooo'a wa yaj'alukum khula faaa'al ardi 'a-ilaahum ma'al laahi qaleelam maa tazak karoon
ayah.translation: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember.

ayah.transliteration: Ammany-yahdeekum fee zulumaatil barri wal bahri wa many yursilu riyaaha bushram baina yadai rahmatih; 'a-ilaahum ma'al laah; Ta'aalal laahu 'ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: Is He [not best] who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allah? High is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Ammmany-yabda'ul khalqa summa yu'eeduhoo wa many-yarzuqukum minas sammaaa'i wal ard; 'a-ilaahum ma'allah; qul haatoo burhaanakum in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Is He [not best] who begins creation and then repeats it and who provides for you from the heaven and earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Say, "Produce your proof, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Qul laa ya'lamu mman fis sammaawaati wal ardil ghaiba illal laah; wa maa yash'uroona aiyaana yub'asoon
ayah.translation: Say, "None in the heavens and earth knows the unseen except Allah, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected."

ayah.transliteration: Balid daaraka 'ilmuhum fil Aakhirah; bal hum fee shakkim minhaa bal hum minhaa 'amoon
ayah.translation: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt about it. Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafarooo 'a-izaa kunnaa turaabanw wa aabaaa'unaaa a'innaa lamukhrajoon
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "When we have become dust as well as our forefathers, will we indeed be brought out [of the graves]?

ayah.transliteration: Laqad wu'idnaa haazaa nahnu wa aabaaa'unaa min qablu in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen
ayah.translation: We have been promised this, we and our forefathers, before. This is not but legends of the former peoples."

ayah.transliteration: Qul seeroo fil ardi fanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mujremeen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of the criminals."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tahzan 'alaihim wa laa takun fee daiqim mimmaa yamkuroon
ayah.translation: And grieve not over them or be in distress from what they conspire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And they say, "When is [the fulfillment of] this promise, if you should be truthful?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul 'asaaa any-yakoona radifa lakum ba'dul lazee tasta'jiloon
ayah.translation: Say, "Perhaps it is close behind you - some of that for which you are impatient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innna Rabbaka lazoo fadlin 'alan naasi wa laakina aksarahum laa yashkuroon
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord is full of bounty for the people, but most of them do not show gratitude."

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Rabbaka la ya'lamu maa tukinnu sudooruhum wa maa yu'linoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa min ghaaa'ibatin fis samaaa'i wal ardi illaa fee kitaabimm mubeen
ayah.translation: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazal Qur-aana yaqussu 'alaa Baneee israaa'eela aksaral lazee hum feehi yakhtalifoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, this Qur'an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo lahudanw wa rahmatul lilmu'mineen
ayah.translation: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Rabbaka yaqdee bainahum bihukmih; wa Huwal 'Azeezul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His [wise] judgement. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Fatawakkal 'alal laahi innaka 'alal haqqil mubeen
ayah.translation: So rely upon Allah; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.

ayah.transliteration: Innaka laa tusmi'ul mawtaa wa laa tusmi'us summad du'aaa izaa wallaw mudbireen
ayah.translation: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs retreating.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa anta bihaadil 'umyi 'an dalaalatihim in tusmi'u illaa mai yu'minu bi aayaatinaa fahum muslimoon
ayah.translation: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [submitting to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa waqa'al qawhu 'alaihim akhrajnaa lahum daabbatam minal ardi tukal limuhum annan naasa kaanoo bi aayaatinaa laa yooqinoon
ayah.translation: And when the word befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma nahshuru min kulli ummmatin fawjam mim many-yukazzibu bi Aayaatinaa fahum yooza'oon
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'oo qaala akazzabtum bi Aayaatee wa lam tuheetoo bihaa 'ilman ammaazaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: Until, when they arrive [at the place of Judgement], He will say, "Did you deny My signs while you encompassed them not in knowledge, or what [was it that] you were doing?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa waqa'al qawlu 'alaihim bimaa zalamoo fahum laa yantiqoon
ayah.translation: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.

ayah.transliteration: Alam yaraw annaa ja'alnal laila li yaskunoo feehi wannahaara mubsiraa; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil liqaw miny-yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yunfakhu fis Soori fafazi'a man fis samaawaati wa man fil ardi illaa man shaaa'al laah; wa kullun atawhu daakhireen
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him humbled.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taral jibaala tahsabuhaa jaamidatanw wa hiya tamurru marras sahaab; sun'al laahil lazeee atqana kulla shai'; innahoo khabeerum bimaa taf'aloon
ayah.translation: And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allah, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Acquainted with that which you do.

ayah.transliteration: Man jaaa'a bilhasanati falahoo khairum minhaa wa hum min faza'iny Yawma'izin aaminoon
ayah.translation: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man jaaa'a bissai yi'ati fakubbat wujoohuhum fin Naari hal tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And whoever comes with an evil deed - their faces will be overturned into the Fire, [and it will be said], "Are you recompensed except for what you used to do?"

ayah.transliteration: Innamaaa umirtu an a'buda Rabba haazihil baldatil lazee harramahaa wa lahoo kullu shai'inw wa umirtu an akoona minal muslimeen
ayah.translation: [Say, O Muhammad], "I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city, who made it sacred and to whom [belongs] all things. And I am commanded to be of the Muslims [those who submit to Allah]

ayah.transliteration: Wa an atluwal Qur-aana famanih tadaa fa innnamaa yahtadee linafsihee wa man dalla faqul innamaaa ana minal munzireen
ayah.translation: And to recite the Qur'an." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qulil hamdu lillaahi sa yureekum Aayaatihee fata'ri foonahaa; wa maa Rabbuka bighaaflin 'ammaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And say, "[All] praise is [due] to Allah. He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is not unaware of what you do."

ayah.transliteration: Taa-Seeen-Meeem
ayah.translation: Ta, Seen, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tilka Aayaatul Kitaabil mubeen
ayah.translation: These are the verses of the clear Book.

ayah.transliteration: Natloo 'alaika min naba-i Moosaa wa Fi'awna bilhaqqi liqawminy yu'miinoon
ayah.translation: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Fir'awna 'alaa fil ardi wa ja'ala ahlahaa shiya'ai yastad'ifu taaa'ifatam minhum yuzabbihu abnaaa'ahum wa yastahyee nisaaa'ahum; innahoo kaana minal mufsideen
ayah.translation: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nureedu an namunna 'alal lazeenas tud'ifoo fil ardi wa naj'alahum a'immatanw wa naj'alahumul waariseen
ayah.translation: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

ayah.transliteration: Wa numakkina lahum fil ardi wa nuriya Fir'awna wa Haamaana wa junoodahumaa minhum maa kaanoo yahzaroon
ayah.translation: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

ayah.transliteration: Wa awhainaaa ilaaa ummi Moosaaa an ardi'eehi faizaa khifti 'alaihi fa alqeehi filyammi wa laa takhaafee wa laa tahzaneee innaa raaaddoohu ilaiki wa jaa'iloohu minal mursaleen
ayah.translation: And We inspired to the mother of Moses, "Suckle him; but when you fear for him, cast him into the river and do not fear and do not grieve. Indeed, We will return him to you and will make him [one] of the messengers."

ayah.transliteration: Faltaqatahooo Aalu Fir'awna li yakoona lahum 'aduwwanw wa hazanaa; inna Fir'awna wa Haamaana wa junooda humaa kaanoo khaati'een
ayah.translation: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalatim ra atu Fir'awna qurratu 'aynil lee wa lak; laa taqtuloohu 'asaaa aiyanfa'anaa aw nattakhizahoo waladanw wa hum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: And the wife of Pharaoh said, "[He will be] a comfort of the eye for me and for you. Do not kill him; perhaps he may benefit us, or we may adopt him as a son." And they perceived not.

ayah.transliteration: Wa asbaha fu'aadu ummi Moosaa faarighan in kaadat latubdee bihee law laaa arrabatnaa 'alaa qalbihaa litakoona minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalat li ukhtihee qusseehi fabasurat bihee 'an junubinw wahum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: And she said to his sister, "Follow him"; so she watched him from a distance while they perceived not.

ayah.transliteration: Wa harramnaa 'alaihil maraadi'a min qablu faqaalat hal adullukum 'alaaa ahli baitiny yakfuloonahoo lakum wa hum lahoo naasihoon
ayah.translation: And We had prevented from him [all] wet nurses before, so she said, "Shall I direct you to a household that will be responsible for him for you while they are to him [for his upbringing] sincere?"

ayah.transliteration: Faradadnaahu ilaa ummihee kai taqarra 'ainuhaa wa laa tahzana wa lita'lama anna wa'dal laahi haqqunw wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa balagha ashuddahoo wastawaaa aatai naahu hukmanw wa 'ilmaa; wa kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Wa dakhalal madeenata 'alaa heene ghaflatim min ahlihaa fawajada feeha raju laini yaqtatilaani haazaa min shee'atihee wa haaza min 'aduwwihee fastaghaasahul lazee min shee'atihee 'alal lazee min 'aduwwihee fawakazahoo Moosaa faqadaa 'alaihi qaala haaza min 'amalish Shaitaani innahoo 'aduwwum mmudillum mubeen
ayah.translation: And he entered the city at a time of inattention by its people and found therein two men fighting: one from his faction and one from among his enemy. And the one from his faction called for help to him against the one from his enemy, so Moses struck him and [unintentionally] killed him. [Moses] said, "This is from the work of Satan. Indeed, he is a manifest, misleading enemy."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi innee zalamtu nafsee faghfir lee faghafaralah; innahoo Huwal Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself, so forgive me," and He forgave him. Indeed, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi bimaaa an'amta 'alaiya falan akoona zaheeral lilmujrimeen
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be an assistant to the criminals."

ayah.transliteration: Fa asbaha fil madeenati khaaa'ifany yataraqqabu fa izal lazis tansarahoo bil amsi yastasrikhuh; qaala lahoo moosaaa innaka laghawiyyum mubeen
ayah.translation: And he became inside the city fearful and anticipating [exposure], when suddenly the one who sought his help the previous day cried out to him [once again]. Moses said to him, "Indeed, you are an evident, [persistent] deviator."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa an araada ai yabtisha billazee huwa 'aduwwul lahumaa qaala yaa Moosaaa atureedu an taqtulanee kamaa qatalta nafsam bil amsi in tureedu illaaa an takoona jabbaaram fil ardi wa maa tureedu an takoona minal musliheen
ayah.translation: And when he wanted to strike the one who was an enemy to both of them, he said, "O Moses, do you intend to kill me as you killed someone yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land and do not want to be of the amenders."

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a rajulum min aqsal madeenati yas'aa qaala yaa Moosaaa innal mala a yaa tamiroona bika liyaqtulooka fakhruj innee laka minan naasiheen
ayah.translation: And a man came from the farthest end of the city, running. He said, "O Moses, indeed the eminent ones are conferring over you [intending] to kill you, so leave [the city]; indeed, I am to you of the sincere advisors."

ayah.transliteration: Fakharaja minhaa khaaa 'ifany-yataraqqab; qaala Rabbi najjinee minal qawmiz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: So he left it, fearful and anticipating [apprehension]. He said, "My Lord, save me from the wrongdoing people."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa tawajjaha tilqaaa'a Madyana qaala 'asaa Rabbeee ai yahdiyanee Sawaaa'as Sabeel
ayah.translation: And when he directed himself toward Madyan, he said, "Perhaps my Lord will guide me to the sound way."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa warada maaa'a Madyana wajada 'alaihi ummatam minannaasi yasqoona wa wajada min doonihimum ra ataini tazoodaani qaala maa khatubkumaa qaalataa laa nasqee hataa yusdirar ri'aaa'u wa aboonaa shaikhun kabeer
ayah.translation: And when he came to the well of Madyan, he found there a crowd of people watering [their flocks], and he found aside from them two women driving back [their flocks]. He said, "What is your circumstance?" They said, "We do not water until the shepherds dispatch [their flocks]; and our father is an old man."

ayah.transliteration: Fasaqaa lahumaa summa tawallaaa ilaz zilli faqaala Rabbi innee limaaa anzalta ilaiya min khairin faqeer
ayah.translation: So he watered [their flocks] for them; then he went back to the shade and said, "My Lord, indeed I am, for whatever good You would send down to me, in need."

ayah.transliteration: Fajaaa'at hu ihdaahumaa tamshee 'alas tihyaaa'in qaalat inna abee yad'ooka li yajziyaka ajra maa saqaita lanaa; falammaa jaaa'ahoo wa qassa 'alaihil qasasa qaala laa takhaf najawta minal qawmiz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: Then one of the two women came to him walking with shyness. She said, "Indeed, my father invites you that he may reward you for having watered for us." So when he came to him and related to him the story, he said, "Fear not. You have escaped from the wrongdoing people."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalat ihdaahumaa yaaa abatis taajirhu inna khaira manistaajartal qawiyyul ameen
ayah.translation: One of the women said, "O my father, hire him. Indeed, the best one you can hire is the strong and the trustworthy."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innee ureedu an unkihaka ihdab nataiya haataini 'alaaa an taajuranee samaaniya hijaj; fa in atmamta 'ashran famin 'indika wa maaa ureedu an ashuqqa 'alaik; satajiduneee in shaaa'al laahu minas saaliheen
ayah.translation: He said, "Indeed, I wish to wed you one of these, my two daughters, on [the condition] that you serve me for eight years; but if you complete ten, it will be [as a favor] from you. And I do not wish to put you in difficulty. You will find me, if Allah wills, from among the righteous."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala zaalika bainee wa bainaka aiyamal ajalaini qadaitu falaa 'udwaana 'alaiya wallaahu 'alaa ma naqoolu Wakeel
ayah.translation: [Moses] said, "That is [established] between me and you. Whichever of the two terms I complete - there is no injustice to me, and Allah, over what we say, is Witness."

ayah.transliteration: Falammmaa qadaa Moosal ajala wa saara bi ahliheee aanasa min jaanibit Toori naaran qaala li ahlihim kusooo inneee aanastu naaral la 'alleee aateekum minhaa bikhabarin aw jazwatim minan naari la 'allakum tastaloon
ayah.translation: And when Moses had completed the term and was traveling with his family, he perceived from the direction of the mount a fire. He said to his family, "Stay here; indeed, I have perceived a fire. Perhaps I will bring you from there [some] information or burning wood from the fire that you may warm yourselves."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa ataahaa noodiya min shaati'il waadil aimani fil buq'atil muubaarakati minash shajarati ai yaa Moosaaa inneee Anal laahu Rabbul 'aalameen
ayah.translation: But when he came to it, he was called from the right side of the valley in a blessed spot - from the tree, "O Moses, indeed I am Allah, Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Wa an alqi 'asaaka falam maa ra aahaa tahtazzu ka annnahaa jaaannunw wallaa mudbiranw wa lam yu'aqqib; yaa Moosaa aqbil wa laa takhaf innaka minal aamineen
ayah.translation: And [he was told], "Throw down your staff." But when he saw it writhing as if it was a snake, he turned in flight and did not return. [Allah said], "O Moses, approach and fear not. Indeed, you are of the secure.

ayah.transliteration: Usluk yadaka fee jaibika takhruj baidaaa'a min ghairi sooo'inw wadmum ilaika janaahaka minar rahbi fazaanika burhaanaani mir Rabbika ilaa Fiw'awna wa mala'ih; innahum kaanoo qawman faasiqeen
ayah.translation: Insert your hand into the opening of your garment; it will come out white, without disease. And draw in your arm close to you [as prevention] from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his establishment. Indeed, they have been a people defiantly disobedient."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi innee qataltu minhum nafsan fa akhaafu ai yaqtuloon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, indeed, I killed from among them someone, and I fear they will kill me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa akhee Haaroonu huwa afsahu minnee lisaanan fa arsilhu ma'iya rid ai yusaddiquneee innee akhaafu ai yukazziboon
ayah.translation: And my brother Aaron is more fluent than me in tongue, so send him with me as support, verifying me. Indeed, I fear that they will deny me."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala sanashuddu 'adudaka bi akheeka wa naj'alu lakumaa sultaanan falaa yasiloona ilaikumaa; bi Aayaatinaa antumaa wa manit taba'akumal ghaaliboon
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "We will strengthen your arm through your brother and grant you both supremacy so they will not reach you. [It will be] through Our signs; you and those who follow you will be the predominant."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'ahum Moosaa bi Aayaatinaa baiyinaatin qaaloo maa haazaaa illaa sihrum muftaranw wa maa sami'naa bihaazaa feee aabaaa'inal awwaleen
ayah.translation: But when Moses came to them with Our signs as clear evidences, they said, "This is not except invented magic, and we have not heard of this [religion] among our forefathers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Moosaa Rabbeee a'alamu biman jaaa'a bilhudaa min 'indihee wa man takoonu lahoo 'aaqibatud daari innahoo laa yuflihuz zaalimoon
ayah.translation: And Moses said, "My Lord is more knowing [than we or you] of who has come with guidance from Him and to whom will be succession in the home. Indeed, wrongdoers do not succeed."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Fir'awnu yaaa aiyuhal mala-u maa 'alimtu lakum min ilaahin ghairee fa awqid lee yaa Haamaanu 'alatteeni faj'al lee sarhal la'alleee attali'u ilaaa ilaahi Moosaa wa innee la azunnuhoo minal kaazibeen
ayah.translation: And Pharaoh said, "O eminent ones, I have not known you to have a god other than me. Then ignite for me, O Haman, [a fire] upon the clay and make for me a tower that I may look at the God of Moses. And indeed, I do think he is among the liars."

ayah.transliteration: Wastakbara huwa wa junooduhoo fil ardi bighairil haqqi wa zannooo annahum ilainaa laa yurja'oon
ayah.translation: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhaznaahu wa junoo dahoo fanabaznaahum fil yammi fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatuz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaahum a'immatany yad'oona ilan Naari wa Yawmal Qiyaamati laa yunsaroon
ayah.translation: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

ayah.transliteration: Wa atba'naahum fee haazihid dunyaa la'natanw wa Yawmal Qiyaamati hum minal maqbooheen
ayah.translation: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba mim ba'di maaa ahlaknal quroonal oolaa basaaa'ira linnaasi wa hudanw wa rahmatal la'allahum yata zakkkaroon
ayah.translation: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kunta bijaanibil gharbiyyi iz qadainaaa ilaa Moosal amra wa maa kunta minash shaahideen
ayah.translation: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

ayah.transliteration: Wa laakinnaa anshaanaa quroonan fatataawala 'alaihimul 'umur; wa maa kunta saawiyan feee ahli Madyana tatloo 'alaihim Aayaatinaa wa laakinnaa kunnaa mursileen
ayah.translation: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kunta bijaanibit Toori iz naadainaa wa laakir rahmatam mir Rabbika litunzira qawmam maaa ataahum min nazeerim min qablika la'allahum yatazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa an tuseebahum museebatum bimaa qaddamat aideehim fa yaqooloo Rabbanaa law laaa arsalta ilainaa Rasoolan fanattabi'a Aayaatika wa nakoona minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And if not that a disaster should strike them for what their hands put forth [of sins] and they would say, "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"...

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'ahumul haqqu min 'indinaa qaaloo law laa ootiya misla maaa ootiyaa Moosaa; awalam yakfuroo bimaaa ootiya Moosaa min qablu qaaloo sihraani tazaaharaa wa qaalooo innaa bikullin kaafiroon
ayah.translation: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, "Why was he not given like that which was given to Moses?" Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to Moses before? They said, "[They are but] two works of magic supporting each other, and indeed we are, in both, disbelievers."

ayah.transliteration: Qul faatoo bi Kitaabim min 'indil laahi huwa ahdaa minhu maaa attabi'hu in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah which is more guiding than either of them that I may follow it, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Fa il lam yastajeeboo laka fa'lam annamaa yattabi'oona ahwaaa'ahum; w aman adallu mimmanit taba'a hawaahu bighari hudam minal laah; innal laaha laa yahdil qawmaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad wassalnaa lahumul qawla la'allahum yatazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena aatainaahu mul Kitaaba min qablihee hum bihee yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa yutlaa 'alaihim qaaloo aamannaa biheee innahul haqqu mir rabbinaaa innaa kunnaa min qablihee muslimeen
ayah.translation: And when it is recited to them, they say, "We have believed in it; indeed, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed we were, [even] before it, Muslims [submitting to Allah]."

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika yu'tawna ajrahum marratayni bimaa sabaroo wa yadra'oona bil hasanatis saiyi'ata wa mimmmaa razaq naahum yunfiqoon
ayah.translation: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa sami'ul laghwa a'radoo 'anhu wa qaaloo lanaaa a'maalunaa wa lakum a'maalukum salaamun 'alaikum laa nabtaghil jaahileen
ayah.translation: And when they hear ill speech, they turn away from it and say, "For us are our deeds, and for you are your deeds. Peace will be upon you; we seek not the ignorant."

ayah.transliteration: Innaka laa tahdee man ahbata wa laakinna laaha yahdee mai yashaaa'; wa Huwaa'lamu bilmuhtadeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalooo in nattabi'il hudaa ma'aka nutakhattaf min ardinaa; awalam numakkkil lahum haraman aaminany yujbaaa ilaihi samaraatu kulli shai'ir rizqam mil ladunnaa wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And they say, "If we were to follow the guidance with you, we would be swept from our land." Have we not established for them a safe sanctuary to which are brought the fruits of all things as provision from Us? But most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa min qaryatim batirat ma'eeshatahaa fatilka masaainuhum lam tuskam mim ba'dihim illaa qaleelaa; wa kunnaa Nahnul waariseen
ayah.translation: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kaana Rabbuka muhlikal quraa hattaa yab'asa feee ummihaa Rasoolany yatloo 'alaihim aayaatina; wa maa kunnaa muhlikil quraaa illaa wa ahluhaa zaalimoon
ayah.translation: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa ooteetum min shai'in famataa'ul hayaatid dunyaa wa zeenatuhaa; wa maa 'indal laahi khairunw wa abqaa; afalaa ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?

ayah.transliteration: Afamanw wa'adnaahu wa'dan hasanan fahuwa laaqeehi kamam matta'naahu mataa'al hayaatid dunyaa summa huwa Yawmal Qiyaamati minal muhdareen
ayah.translation: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yunaadeehim fa-yaqoolu aina shurakaaa 'iyal lazeena kuntum taz'umoon
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalal lazeena haqqa 'alaihimul qawlu Rabbanaa haaa'ulaaa'il lazeena aghwainaa aghwainaahu kamaa ghawainaa tabarraanaaa ilaika maa kaanoo iyyaanaa ya'budoon
ayah.translation: Those upon whom the word will have come into effect will say, "Our Lord, these are the ones we led to error. We led them to error just as we were in error. We declare our disassociation [from them] to You. They did not used to worship us."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeelad 'oo shurakaaa'akum fada'awhum falam yastajeeboo lahum wa ra awul 'azaab; law annahum kaanoo yahtadoon
ayah.translation: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yunaadeehim fa yaqoolu maazaaa ajabtumul mursaleen
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day He will call them and say, "What did you answer the messengers?"

ayah.transliteration: Fa'amiyat 'alaihimul ambaaa'u Yawma'izin fahum laa yatasaaa'aloon
ayah.translation: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

ayah.transliteration: Fa ammaa man taaba wa aamana wa 'amila saalihan fa'asaaa ai yakoona minal mufliheen
ayah.translation: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is promised by Allah that he will be among the successful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Rabbuka yakhuluqu maa yashaaa'u wa yakhtaar; maa kaana lahumul khiyarah; Subhannal laahi wa Ta'aalaa 'ammmaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Rabbuka ya'lamu maa tukinnu sudooruhum wa maa yu'linoon
ayah.translation: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal laahu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa lahul hamdu fil oolaa wal Aakhirati wa lahul hukmu wa ilaihi turja'oon
ayah.translation: And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Qul ara'aitum in ja'alal laahu 'alaikumul laila sarmadan ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati man ilaahun ghairul laahi yaa teekum bidiyaaa'in afalaa tasma'oon
ayah.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the night continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you light? Then will you not hear?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul ara'aitum in ja'alal laahu 'alaikumun nahaara sarmadan ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati man ilaahun ghairul laahi yaateekum bilailin taskunoona feehi afalaa tubsiroon
ayah.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if Allah should make for you the day continuous until the Day of Resurrection, what deity other than Allah could bring you a night in which you may rest? Then will you not see?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa mir rahmatihee ja'ala lakumul laila wannahaara litaskunoo feehi wa litabtaghoo min fadlihee wa la'allakum tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yunaadeehim fa yaqoolu aina shurakaaa'iyal lazeena kuntum tazz'umoon
ayah.translation: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa naza'naa min kulli ummatin shaheedan faqulnaa haatoo burhaanakum fa'alimooo annal haqqa lillaahi wa dalla 'anhum maa kaanoo yaftaroon
ayah.translation: And We will extract from every nation a witness and say, "Produce your proof," and they will know that the truth belongs to Allah, and lost from them is that which they used to invent.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Qaaroona kaana min qawmi Moosaa fabaghaaa 'alaihim wa aatainaahu minal kunoozi maaa inna mafaati hahoo latanooo'u bil'usbati ulil quwwati iz qaala lahoo qawmuhoo laa tafrah innal laahaa laa yuhibbul fariheen
ayah.translation: Indeed, Qarun was from the people of Moses, but he tyrannized them. And We gave him of treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men; thereupon his people said to him, "Do not exult. Indeed, Allah does not like the exultant.

ayah.transliteration: Wabtaghi feemaaa aataakal laahud Daaral Aakhirata wa laa tansa naseebaka minad dunyaa wa ahsin kamaaa ahsanal laahu ilaika wa laa tabghil fasaada fil ardi innal laaha laa yuhibbul mufsideen
ayah.translation: But seek, through that which Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innamaaa ootee tuhoo 'alaa 'ilmin 'indeee; awalam ya'lam annal laaha qad ahlaka min qablihee minal qurooni man huwa ashaddu minhu quwwatanw wa aksaru jam'aa; wa laa yus'alu 'an zunoobihimul mujrimoon
ayah.translation: He said, "I was only given it because of knowledge I have." Did he not know that Allah had destroyed before him of generations those who were greater than him in power and greater in accumulation [of wealth]? But the criminals, about their sins, will not be asked.

ayah.transliteration: Fakharaja 'alaa qawmihee fee zeenatih; qaalal lazeena yureedoonal hayaatad dunyaa yaalaita lanaa misla maaa ootiya Qaaroonu innahoo lazoo hazzin 'azeem
ayah.translation: So he came out before his people in his adornment. Those who desired the worldly life said, "Oh, would that we had like what was given to Qarun. Indeed, he is one of great fortune."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena ootul 'ilma wailakum sawaabul laahi khairul liman aamana wa 'amila saalihaa; wa laa yulaq qaahaaa illas saabiroon
ayah.translation: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for he who believes and does righteousness. And none are granted it except the patient."

ayah.transliteration: Fakhasafnaa bihee wa bidaarihil arda famaa kaana laho min fi'atiny yansuroo nahoo min doonil laahi wa maa kaana minal muntasireen
ayah.translation: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Wa asbahal lazeena tamannaw makaanahoo bil amsi yaqooloona waika annal laaha yabsutur rizqa limany ya shaaa'u min 'ibaadihee wa yaqdiru law laaa am mannal laahu 'alainaa lakhasafa binaa waika annahoo laa yuflihul kaafiroon
ayah.translation: And those who had wished for his position the previous day began to say, "Oh, how Allah extends provision to whom He wills of His servants and restricts it! If not that Allah had conferred favor on us, He would have caused it to swallow us. Oh, how the disbelievers do not succeed!"

ayah.transliteration: Tilkad Daarul Aakhiratu naj'aluhaa lillazeena laa yureedoona 'uluwwan fil ardi wa laa fasaadaa; wal 'aaqibatu lilmuttaqeen
ayah.translation: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Man jaaa'a bilhasanati falahoo khairum minhaa wa man jaaa'a bissaiyi'ati falaa yujzal lazeena 'amilus saiyiaati illaa maa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Innal azee farada 'alaikal Qur-aana laraaadduka ilaa ma'aad; qur Rabbeee a'lamu man jjaaa'a bil hudaa wa man huwa fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kunta tarjooo ai yulqaaa ilaikal Kitaabu illaa rahmatam mir Rabbika falaa takoonanna zaheeral lilkaafireen
ayah.translation: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yasuddunnaka 'an Aayaatil laahi ba'da iz unzilat ilaika wad'u ilaa Rabbika wa laa takonanna minal mushrikeen
ayah.translation: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tad'u ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhar; laaa ilaaha illaa Hoo; kullu shai'in haalikun illaa Wajhah; lahul hukkmu wa ilaihi turja'oon
