That is more suitable that they should be content and not grieve and that they should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. And ever is Allah Knowing and Forbearing.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yahillu lakan nisaaa'u mim ba'du wa laaa an tabaddala bihinna min azwaajinw wa law ajabaka husnuhunna illaa maa malakat yameenukk; wa kaanal laahu 'alaa kulli shai'ir Raqeeba
ayah.translation: Not lawful to you, [O Muhammad], are [any additional] women after [this], nor [is it] for you to exchange them for [other] wives, even if their beauty were to please you, except what your right hand possesses. And ever is Allah, over all things, an Observer.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa tadkhuloo bu yootan Nabiyyi ilaaa ai yu'zana lakum ilaa ta'aamin ghaira naazireena inaahu wa laakin izaa du'eetum fadkhuloo fa izaa ta'imtum fantashiroo wa laa mustaaniseena lihadees; inna zaalikum kaana yu'zin Nabiyya fa yastahyee minkum wallaahu laa yastahyee minal haqq; wa izaa sa altumoohunna mataa'an fas'aloohunna minw waraaa'i hijaab; zaalikum atharu liquloobikum wa quloobihinn; wa maa kaana lakum an tu'zoo Rasoolal laahi wa laaa an tankihooo azwaajahoo mim ba'diheee abadaa; inna zaalikum kaana 'indal laahi 'azeema
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But Allah is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of Allah or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be in the sight of Allah an enormity.

ayah.transliteration: In tubdoo shai'an aw tukhfoohu fa innal laaha kaana bikulli shai'in 'Aleemaa
ayah.translation: Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, indeed Allah is ever, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Laa junaaha 'alaihinna feee aabaaa'ihinna wa laaa abnaaa'ihinna wa laaa ikhwaanihinnna wa laaa abnaaa'i ikhwaanihinna wa laaa abnaaa'i akhawaatihinna wa laa nisaaa'i hinna wa laa Maa malakat aimaanuhunn; wattaqeenal laah; innal laaha kaana 'alaa kulli shai'in Shaheedaa
ayah.translation: There is no blame upon women concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess. And fear Allah. Indeed Allah is ever, over all things, Witness.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha wa malaaa'i katahoo yusalloona 'alan Nabiyy; yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo salloo 'alaihi wa sallimoo tasleemaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have believed, ask [Allah to confer] blessing upon him and ask [Allah to grant him] peace.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yu'zoonal laaha wa Rasoolahoo la'anahumul laahu fid dunyaa wal Aakhirati wa a'adda lahum 'azaabam muheenaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yu'zoonal mu'mineena almu'manaati bighairi mak tasaboo faqadih tamaloo buhtaananw wa ismam mubeenaa
ayah.translation: And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned have certainly born upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhan Nabiyyu qul li azwaajika wa banaatika wa nisaaa'il mu'mineena yudneena 'alaihinna min jalaabee bihinn; zaalika adnaaa ai yu'rafna falaa yu'zain; wa kaanal laahu Ghafoorar Raheemaa
ayah.translation: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. That is more suitable that they will be known and not be abused. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: La'il lam yantahil munaafiqoona wallazeena fee quloobihim maradunw walmur jifoona fil madeenati lanughri yannaka bihim summa laa yujaawiroonaka feehaaa illaa qaleela
ayah.translation: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and those who spread rumors in al-Madinah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little.

ayah.transliteration: Mal'ooneena ainamaa suqifoo ukhizoo wa quttiloo taqteelaa
ayah.translation: Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.

ayah.transliteration: Sunnatal laahi fil lazeena khalaw min qablu wa lan tajida lisunnatil laahi tabdeelaa
ayah.translation: [This is] the established way of Allah with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of Allah any change.

ayah.transliteration: Yas'alukan naasu 'anis Saa'ati qul innamaa 'ilmuhaa 'indal laah; wa maa yudreeka la'allas Saa'ata takoonu qareebaa
ayah.translation: People ask you concerning the Hour. Say," Knowledge of it is only with Allah. And what may make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near."

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha la'anal kaafireena wa a'adda lahum sa'eeraa
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Khaalideena feehaaa abadaa, laa yajidoona waliyyanw wa laa naseeraa
ayah.translation: Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tuqallabu wujoohuhum fin Naari yaqooloona yaa laitanaaa ata'nal laaha wa ata'nar Rasoolaa
ayah.translation: The Day their faces will be turned about in the Fire, they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo Rabbanaaa innaaa ata'naa saadatanaa wa kubaraaa'anaa fa adalloonas sabeelaa
ayah.translation: And they will say, "Our Lord, indeed we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries, and they led us astray from the [right] way.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbanaaa aatihim di'fai ni minal 'azaabi wal'anhum la nan kabeera
ayah.translation: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them with a great curse."

ayah.transliteration: yaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo las takoonoo kalla zeena aazaw Moosaa fa barra ahul laahu mimmmaa qaaloo; wa kaana 'indal laahi wajeehaa
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allah, was distinguished.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa aiyuhal lazeena aamanut taqul laaha wa qooloo qawlan sadeedaa
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.

ayah.transliteration: Yuslih lakum a'maalakum wa yaghfir lakum zunoobakum; wa mai yuti'il laaha wa Rasoolahoo faqad faaza fawzan 'azeemaa
ayah.translation: He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa 'aradnal amaanata 'alas samaawaati walardi wal jibaali fa abaina ai yahmil nahaa wa ashfaqna minhaa wa hamalahal insaanu innahoo kaana zalooman jahoolaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, we offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.

ayah.transliteration: Liyu 'azzibal laahul munaafiqeena wal munaafiqaati walmushrikeena wal mushrikaati wa yatoobal laahu 'alal mu'mineena walmu'minaat; wa kaanal laahu Ghafoorar Raheema
ayah.translation: [It was] so that Allah may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that Allah may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahil lazee lahoo maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi wa lahul hamdu fil aakhirah; wa Huwal Hakeemul Khabeer
ayah.translation: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu maa yaliju fil ardi wa maa yakhruju minhaa wa maa yanzilu minas samaaa'i wa maa ya'ruju feehaa; wa Huwar Raheemul Ghafoor
ayah.translation: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo laa taateenas Saa'ah; qul balaa wa Rabbee lataatiyannakum 'Aalimul Ghaib; laa ya'zubu 'anhu misqaalu zarratin fis samaawaati wa laa fil ardi wa laaa asgharu min zaalika wa laaa akbaru illaa fee kitaabim mubeen
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. [Allah is] the Knower of the unseen." Not absent from Him is an atom's weight within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear register -

ayah.transliteration: Liyajziyal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaat; ulaaa'ika lahum maghfiratunw wa rizqun kareem
ayah.translation: That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and noble provision.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena sa'aw feee aayaatinaa mu'aajizeena ulaaa 'ika lahum 'azaabum mir irjzin aleem
ayah.translation: But those who strive against Our verses [seeking] to cause failure - for them will be a painful punishment of foul nature.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaral lazeena utul 'Ilmal lazeee unzila ilaika mir Rabbika huwal haqqa wa yahdeee ilaaa siraatil 'Azeezil Hameed
ayah.translation: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo hal nadullukum 'alaa rajuliny yanabbi 'ukum izaa muzziqtum kulla mumazzaqin innakum lafee khalqin jadeed
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieve say, "Shall we direct you to a man who will inform you [that] when you have disintegrated in complete disintegration, you will [then] be [recreated] in a new creation?

ayah.transliteration: Aftaraa 'alal laahi kaziban am bihee jinnah; balil lazeena laa yu'minoona bil Aakhirati fil'azaabi waddad laalil ba'eed
ayah.translation: Has he invented about Allah a lie or is there in him madness?" Rather, they who do not believe in the Hereafter will be in the punishment and [are in] extreme error.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yaraw ilaa maa baina aydeehim wa maa khalfahum minas samaaa'i wal ard; in nashad nakhsif bihimul arda aw nusqit 'alaihim kisafam minas samaaa'; inna fee zaalika la Aayatal likulli 'abdim muneeb
ayah.translation: Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Daawooda minnaa fadlany yaa jibaalu awwibee ma'ahoo wattaira wa alannaa lahul hadeed
ayah.translation: And We certainly gave David from Us bounty. [We said], "O mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made pliable for him iron,

ayah.transliteration: Ani'mal saabighaatinw wa qaddir fis sardi wa'maloo saalihan innee bimaa ta'maloona Baseer
ayah.translation: [Commanding him], "Make full coats of mail and calculate [precisely] the links, and work [all of you] righteousness. Indeed I, of what you do, am Seeing."

ayah.transliteration: Wa li-Sulaimaanar reeha ghuduwwuhaa shahrunw wa ra-waahuhaa shahrunw wa asalnaa lahoo 'ainal qitr; wa minal jinni mai ya'malu baina yadaihi bi izni Rabbih; wa mai yazigh minhum 'an amrinaa nuziqhu min 'azaabis sa'eer
ayah.translation: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'maloona lahoo ma yashaaa'u mim mahaareeba wa tamaaseela wa jifaanin kaljawaabi wa qudoorir raasiyaat; i'maloo aala Daawooda shukraa; wa qaleelum min 'ibaadiyash shakoor
ayah.translation: They made for him what he willed of elevated chambers, statues, bowls like reservoirs, and stationary kettles. [We said], "Work, O family of David, in gratitude." And few of My servants are grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa qadainaa 'alaihil mawta ma dallahum 'alaa mawtiheee illaa daaabbatul ardi taakulu minsa atahoo falammaa kharra tabaiyanatil jinnu al law kaanoo ya'lamoonal ghaiba maa labisoo fil 'azaabil muheen
ayah.translation: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad kaana li Saba-in fee maskanihim Aayatun jannataani 'ai yameeninw wa shimaalin kuloo mir rizq Rabbikum washkuroolah; baldatun taiyibatunw wa Rabbun Ghafoor
ayah.translation: There was for [the tribe of] Saba' in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."

ayah.transliteration: Fa-a''radoo fa-arsalnaa 'alaihim Sailal 'Arimi wa baddalnaahum bijannataihim jannataini azwaatai ukulin khamtinw wa aslinw wa shai'im min sidrin qaleel
ayah.translation: But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika jazainaahum bimaa kafaroo wa hal nujaazeee illal kafoor
ayah.translation: [By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa bainahum wa bainal qural latee baaraknaa feehaa quran zaahiratanw wa qaddamaa feehas sayr; seeroo feehaa la yaalirya wa aiyaaman aamineen
ayah.translation: And We placed between them and the cities which We had blessed [many] visible cities. And We determined between them the [distances of] journey, [saying], "Travel between them by night or day in safety."

ayah.transliteration: Faqaaloo Rabbanaa baa'id baina asfaarinaa wa zalamooo anfusahum faja'alnaahum ahaadeesa wa mazzaq naahum kulla mumazzaq; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil likulli sabbaarin shakoor
ayah.translation: But [insolently] they said, "Our Lord, lengthen the distance between our journeys," and wronged themselves, so We made them narrations and dispersed them in total dispersion. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad saddaq 'alaihim Ibleesu zannnabhoo fattaba'oohu illaa fareeqam minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kaana lahoo 'alaihim min sultaanin illaa lina'lama mai yu minu bil Aakhirati mimman huwa minhaa fee shakk; wa Rabbuka 'alaa kulli shai'in Hafeez
ayah.translation: And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.

ayah.transliteration: Qulid 'ul lazeena za'amtum min doonil laahi laa yamlikoona misqaala zarratin fissamaawaati wa laa fil ardi wa maa lahum feehimaa min shirkinw wa maa lahoo minhum min zaheer
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides Allah." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tanfa'ush shafaa'atu 'indahooo illaa liman azina lah; hattaaa izaa fuzzi'a 'an quloobihim qaaloo maazaa qaala Rabbukum; qaalul haqq, wa Huwal 'Aliyul Kabeer
ayah.translation: And intercession does not benefit with Him except for one whom He permits. [And those wait] until, when terror is removed from their hearts, they will say [to one another], "What has your Lord said?" They will say, "The truth." And He is the Most High, the Grand.

ayah.transliteration: Qul mai yarzuqukum minas samaawaati wal ardi qulil laahu wa innaaa aw iyyaakum la'alaa hudan aw fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah. And indeed, we or you are either upon guidance or in clear error."

ayah.transliteration: Qul laa tus'aloona 'ammaaa ajramnaa wa laa nus'alu 'ammaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: Say, "You will not be asked about what we committed, and we will not be asked about what you do."

ayah.transliteration: Qul yajma'u bainanaa Rabbunaa summa yaftahu bainanaa bilhaqq; wa Huwal Fattaahul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Say, "Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us in truth. And He is the Knowing Judge."

ayah.transliteration: Qul arooniyal lazeena alhaqtum bihee shurakaaa'a kallaa; bal Huwal Laahul 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Say, "Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaaka illaa kaaffatal linnaasi basheeranw wa nazeeranw wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul lakum mee'aadu Yawmil laa tastaakhiroona 'anhu saa'atanw wa la tastaqdimoon
ayah.translation: Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo lan nu'mina bihaazal Quraani wa laa billazee baina yadayh; wa law taraaa iziz zaalimoona mawqoofoona 'inda Rabbihim yarji'u ba'duhum ilaa ba'dinil qawla yaqoolul lazeenas tud'ifoo lillazeenas takbaroo law laaa antum lakunnaa mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Qur'an nor in that before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each other's words... Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalal lazeenas takbaroo lillazeenas tud'ifooo anahnu sadadnaakum 'anil hudaa ba'da iz jaaa'akum bal kuntum mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeenastud'ifoo lillazeenas takbaroo bal makrul laili wannahaari iz taamuroonanaaa an nakfura billaahi wa naj'ala lahooo andaadaa; wa asarrun nadaamata lammaa ra awul 'azaab; wa ja'alnal aghlaala feee a'naaqil lazeena kafaroo; hal yujzawna illaa maa kanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allah and attribute to Him equals." But they will [all] confide regret when they see the punishment; and We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa arsalnaa' fee qaryatim min nazeerin illaa qaala mutrafooaa innaa bimaaa ursiltum bihee kaafiroon
ayah.translation: And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo nahnu aksaru amwaalanw wa awlaadanw wa maa nahnu bimu 'azzabeen
ayah.translation: And they said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."

ayah.transliteration: Qul inna Rabbee yabsutur rizqa limai yashaaa'u wa yaqdiru wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa amwaalukum wa laaa awlaadukum billatee tuqarribukum 'indanaa zulfaaa illaa man aamana wa 'amila saalihan fa ulaaa'ika lahum jazaaa'ud di'fi bimaa 'amiloo wa hum fil ghurufaati aaminoon
ayah.translation: And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yas'awna feee Aayaatinaa mu'aajizeena ulaaa'ika fil'azaabi muhdaroon
ayah.translation: And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

ayah.transliteration: Qul inna Rabbee yabsutur rizqa limai yashaaa'u min 'ibaadihee wa yaqdiru lah; wa maaa anfaqtum min shai'in fahuwa yukhlifuhoo wa Huwa khairur raaziqeen
ayah.translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yawma yahshuruhum jamee'an summa yaqoolu lilmalaaa'ikati a-haaa'ulaaa'i iyyaakum kaanoo ya'budoon
ayah.translation: And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Subhaanaka Anta waliyyunaa min doonihim bal kaanoo ya'budoonal jinna aksaruhum bihim mu'minoon
ayah.translation: They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O Allah], are our benefactor not them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them."

ayah.transliteration: Fal Yawma laa yamliku ba'dukum liba'din naf'anw wa laa darraa; wa naqoolu lilzeena zalamoo zooqoo 'azaaban Naaril latee kuntum bihaa tukazziboon
ayah.translation: But today you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa tutlaa 'alaihim Aayaatunaa baiyinaatin qaaloo maa haazaa illaa rajuluny yureedu ai-yasuddakum 'ammaa kaana ya'budu aabaaa'ukum wa qaaloo maa haazaaa illaaa ifkum muftaraa; wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo lilhaqqi lammaa jaaa'ahum in haazaaa illaa sihrum mubeen
ayah.translation: And when our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa aatainaahum min Kutubiny yadrusoonahaa wa maaa arsalnaaa ilaihim qablaka min nazeer
ayah.translation: And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muhammad], any warner.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazzabal lazeena min qablihim wa maa balaghoo mi'shaara maaa aatainaahum fakazzaboo Rusulee; fakaifa kaana nakeer
ayah.translation: And those before them denied, and the people of Makkah have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But the former peoples denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaaa a'izukum biwaahidatin an taqoomoo lillaahi masnaa wa furaadaa summa tatafakkaroo; maa bisaahibikum min jinnah; in huwa illaa nazeerul lakum baina yadai 'azaabin shadeed
ayah.translation: Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for Allah, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Qul maa sa-altukum min ajrin fahuwa lakum in ajriya illaa 'alal laahi wa Huwa 'alaa kullin shai-in Shaheed
ayah.translation: Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from Allah, and He is, over all things, Witness."

ayah.transliteration: Qul inna Rabbee yaqzifu bilhaqq 'Allaamul Ghuyoob
ayah.translation: Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth. Knower of the unseen."

ayah.transliteration: Qul jaaa'al haqqu wa maa yubdi'ul baatilu wa maa yu'eed
ayah.translation: Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."

ayah.transliteration: Qul in dalaltu fainnamaaa adillu 'alaa nafsee wa inih-tadaitu fabimaa yoohee ilaiya Rabbee; innahoo Samee'un Qareeb
ayah.translation: Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."

ayah.transliteration: Wa law taraaa iz fazi'oo falaa fawta wa ukhizoo mim makaanin qareeb
ayah.translation: And if you could see when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaloo aamannaa bihee wa annaa lahumut tanaawushu mim makaanim ba'eed
ayah.translation: And they will [then] say, "We believe in it!" But how for them will be the taking [of faith] from a place far away?

ayah.transliteration: Wa qad kafaroo bihee min qablu wa yaqzifoona bilghaibi mim makaanim ba'eed
ayah.translation: And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault the unseen from a place far away.

ayah.transliteration: Wa heela bainahum wa baina maa yashtahoona kamaa fu'ila bi-ashyaa'ihim min qabl; innahum kaanoo fee shakkim mureeb
ayah.translation: And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting denial.

ayah.transliteration: Alhamdu lillaahi faatiris samaawaati wal ardi jaa'ilil malaaa'ikati rusulan uleee ajnihatim masnaa wa sulaasa wa rubaa'; yazeedu fil khalqi maa yashaaa'; innal laaha 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yaftahil laahu linnaaasi mir rahmatin falaa mumsika lahaa wa maa yumsik falaa mursila lahoo mimb'dih; wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Whatever Allah grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasuzkuroo ni'matal laahi 'alaikum; hal min khaaliqin ghairul laahi yarzuqukum minas samaaa'i wal ard; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fa annaa tu'fakoon
ayah.translation: O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

ayah.transliteration: Wa iny yukazzibooka faqad kuzzibat Rusulum min qablik; wa ilal laahi turja'ul umoor
ayah.translation: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasu inna wa'dal laahi haqqun falaa taghurrannakumul hayaatud dunyaa; wa laa yaghurran nakum billaahil gharoor
ayah.translation: O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.

ayah.transliteration: Innash shaitaana lakum 'aduwwun fattakhizoohu 'aduwwaa; innamaa yad'oo hizbahoo liyakoonoo min ashaabis sa'eer
ayah.translation: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena kafaroo lahum 'azaabun shadeed; wallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati lahum maghfiratunw wa ajrun kabeer
ayah.translation: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Afaman zuyyina lahoo sooo'u 'amalihee fara aahu hasanaa; fa innal laaha yudillu mai yashaaa'u wa yahdee mai yahaaa'u falaa tazhab nafsuka 'alaihim hasaraat; innal laaha 'aleemun bimaa yasna'oon
ayah.translation: Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allah sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahul lazeee arsalar riyaaha fatuseeru shaaban fasuqnaahu ilaa baladim maiyitin fa ahyaynaa bihil arda ba'da mawtihaa; kazaalikan nushoor
ayah.translation: And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.

ayah.transliteration: Man kaana yureedul 'izzata falillaahil 'izzatu jamee'aa; ilaihi yas'adul kalimut taiyibu wal'amalus saalihu yarfa'uh; wallazeena yamkuroonas sayyiaati lahum 'azaabun shadeed; wa makru ulaaa'ika huwa yaboor
ayah.translation: Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu khalaqakum min turaabin summa min nutfatin summa ja'alakum azwaajaa; wa maa tahmilu min unsaa wa laa tada'u illaa bi'ilmih; wa maa yu'ammaru mim mu'ammarinw wa laa yunqasu min 'umuriheee illaa fee kitaab; inna zaalika 'alal laahi yaseer
ayah.translation: And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for Allah is easy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yastawil bahraani haaza 'azbun furaatun saaa'ighun sharaabuhoo wa haazaa milhun ujaaj; wa min kullin taakuloona lahman tariyyanw wa tastakhrijoona hilyatan talbasoonahaa wa taral fulka feehi mawaakhira litabtaghoo min fadlihee wa la'allakm tashkuroon
ayah.translation: And not alike are the two bodies of water. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Yoolijul laila fin nahaari wa yoolijun nahaara fil laili wa sakhkharash shamsa wal qamara kulluny yajree li ajalim musammaa; zaalikumul lahuu Rabbukum lahul mulk; wallazeena tad'oona min doonihee maa yamlikoona min qitmeer
ayah.translation: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.

ayah.transliteration: in tad'oohum laa yasma'oo du'aaa'akum wa law sami'oo mas tajaaboo lakum; wa Yawmal Qiyaamati Yakfuroona bishirkikum; wa laa yunabbi'uka mislu khabeer
ayah.translation: If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association. And none can inform you like [one] Acquainted [with all matters].

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyunhan naasu antumul fuqaraaa'u ilallaahi wallaahu Huwal Ghaniyyul Hameed
ayah.translation: O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Iny yashaa yuzhibkum wa yaati bikhalqin jadeed
ayah.translation: If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa zaalika 'alal laahi bi'azeez
ayah.translation: And that is for Allah not difficult.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taziru waaziratun wizra ukhraa; wa in tad'u musqalatun ilaa himlihaa laa yuhmal minhu shai'unw wa law kaana zaa qurbaa; innamaa tunzirul lazeena yakhshawna Rabbahum bilghaibi wa aqaamus Sallah; wa man tazakkaa fa innamaa yatazakkaa linafsih; wa ilal laahil maseer
ayah.translation: And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allah is the [final] destination.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa tastawil a'maa wal baseer
ayah.translation: Not equal are the blind and the seeing,

ayah.transliteration: Wa laz zulumaatu wa lannoon
ayah.translation: Nor are the darknesses and the light,

ayah.transliteration: Wa laz zillu wa lal haroor
ayah.translation: Nor are the shade and the heat,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yastawil ahyaaa'u wa lal amwaat; innal laaha yusmi'u mai yashaaa'u wa maaa anta bimusi'im man fil quboor
ayah.translation: And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.

ayah.transliteration: In anta illaa nazeer
ayah.translation: You, [O Muhammad], are not but a warner.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaak bil haqqi basheeranw wa nazeeraa; wa im min ummatin illaa khalaa feehaa nazeer
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inyukazzibooka faqad kazzabal lazeena min qablihim jaaa'at hum Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati wa biz Zuburi wa bil Kitaabil Muneer
ayah.translation: And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.

ayah.transliteration: Summa akhaztul lazeena kafaroo fakaifa kaana nakeer
ayah.translation: Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an fa akhrajnaa bihee samaraatim mukhtalifan alwaanuhaa; wa minal jibaali judadum beedunw wa humrum mukhtalifun alwaanuhaa wa gharaabeebu sood
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minan naasi wadda waaabbi wal an'aami mukhtalifun alwaanuhoo kazalik; innamaa yakhshal laaha min 'ibaadihil 'ulamaaa'; innal laaha 'Azeezun Ghafoor
ayah.translation: And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allah, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yatloona Kitabbal laahi wa aqaamus Salaata wa anfaqoo mimmaa razaqnaahum sirranw wa 'alaa niyatany yarjoona tijaaratal lan taboor
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a profit that will never perish -

ayah.transliteration: Liyuwaffiyahum ujoorahum wa yazeedahum min fadlih; innahoo Ghafoorun Shakoor
ayah.translation: That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaeee awhainaaa ilaika minal Kitaabi huwal haqqu musaddiqal limaa baina yadayh; innal laaha bi'ibaadihee la khabeerum Baseer
ayah.translation: And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed, Allah, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Summa awrasnal Kitaaballazeenas tafainaa min 'ibaadinaa faminhum zaalimul linafsihee wa minhum muqtasid, wa minhum saabiqum bilkhairaati bi iznil laah; zaalika huwal fadlul kabeer
ayah.translation: Then we caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants; and among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allah. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.

ayah.transliteration: jannaatu 'adniny yad khuloonahaa yuhallawna feeha min asaawira min zahabinw wa lu'lu'anw wa libaa suhum feehaa hareer
ayah.translation: [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalul hamdu lillaahil lazeee azhaba 'annal hazan; inna Rabbanaa la Ghafoorun Shakoor
ayah.translation: And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeee ahallanaa daaral muqaamati min fadlihee laa yamassunaa feehaa nasabunw wa laa yamassunaa feehaa lughoob
ayah.translation: He who has settled us in the home of duration out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena kafaroo lahum naaru Jahannama laa yuqdaa 'alaihim fa yamootoo wa laa yukhaffafu 'anhum min 'azaabihaa; kazaalika najzee kulla kafoor
ayah.translation: And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do we recompense every ungrateful one.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hum yastarikhoona feehaa Rabbanaa akhrijnaa na'mal saalihan ghairal lazee kunnaa na'mal; awa lamnu 'ammirkum maa yatazak karu feehi man tazakkara wa jaaa'akumun nazeeru fazooqoo famaa lizzaalimeena min naseer
ayah.translation: And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha 'aalimu ghaibis samaawaati wal ard; innahoo 'aleemum bizaatis sudoor
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee ja'alakum khalaaa'ifa fil ard; faman kafara fa'alaihi kufruhoo; wa laa yazeedul kaafireena kufruhum 'inda Rabbihim illaa maqtanw wa la yazeedul kaafireena kufruhum illaa khasaaraa
ayah.translation: It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.

ayah.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum shurakaaa'a kumul lazeena tad'oona min doonil laah; aroonee maazaa khalaqoo minal ardi am lahum shirkun fis samaawaati am aatainaahum Kitaaban fahum 'alaa baiyinatim minh; bal iny ya'iiduz zaalimoona ba 'duhum ba'dan illaa ghurooraa
ayah.translation: Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yumsikus samaawaati wal arda an tazoolaaa; wa la'in zaalataaa in amsa kahumaa min ahadim mim ba'dih; innahoo kaana Haleeman Ghafooraa
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqsamoo billaahi jahda aymaanihim la'in jaaa'ahum nazeerul layakoonunna ahdaa min ihdal umami falam maa jaaa'ahum nazeerum maa zaadahum illaa nufooraa
ayah.translation: And they swore by Allah their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion.

ayah.transliteration: Istakbaaran fil ardi wa makras sayyi'; wa laa yaheequl makrus sayyi'u illaa bi ahlih; fahal yanzuroona illaa sunnatal awwaleen; falan tajida lisunnatil laahi tabdeelanw wa lan tajida lisunnatil laahi tahweela
ayah.translation: [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaseeroo fil ardi fa yanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena min qblihim wa kaanoo ashadda minhum quwwah; wa maa kaanal laahu liyu'jizahoo min shai'in fis samaawaati wa laa fil ard; innahoo kaana 'Aleeman Qadeeraa
ayah.translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But Allah is not to be caused failure by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law yu'aakhizul laahun naasa bima kasaboo maa taraka 'alaa zahrihaa min daaabbatinw wa laakiny yu'akhkhiruhum ilaaa ajalim musamman fa izaa jaaa'a ajaluhum fa innal laaha kaana bi'ibaadihee Baseeraa
ayah.translation: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa-Seeen
ayah.translation: Ya, Seen.

ayah.transliteration: Wal-Qur-aanil-Hakeem
ayah.translation: By the wise Qur'an.

ayah.transliteration: Innaka laminal mursaleen
ayah.translation: Indeed you, [O Muhammad], are from among the messengers,

ayah.transliteration: 'Alaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: On a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelal 'Azeezir Raheem
ayah.translation: [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

ayah.transliteration: Litunzira qawmam maaa unzira aabaaa'uhum fahum ghaafiloon
ayah.translation: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad haqqal qawlu 'alaaa aksarihim fahum laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Already the word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa ja'alnaa feee a'naaqihim aghlaalan fahiya ilal azqaani fahum muqmahoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa mim baini aydeehim saddanw-wa min khalfihim saddan fa aghshai naahum fahum laa yubsiroon
ayah.translation: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.

ayah.transliteration: Wa sawaaa'un 'alaihim 'a-anzartahum am lam tunzirhum laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa tunziru manit taba 'az-Zikra wa khashiyar Rahmaana bilghaib, fabashshirhu bimaghfiratinw-wa ajrin kareem
ayah.translation: You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa Nahnu nuhyil mawtaa wa naktubu maa qaddamoo wa aasaarahum; wa kulla shai'in ahsainaahu feee Imaamim Mubeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.

ayah.transliteration: Wadrib lahum masalan Ashaabal Qaryatih; iz jaaa'ahal mursaloon
ayah.translation: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -

ayah.transliteration: Iz arsalnaaa ilaihimusnaini fakazzaboohumaa fa'azzaznaa bisaalisin faqaalooo innaaa ilaikum mursaloon
ayah.translation: When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened them with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo maaa antum illaa basharum mislunaa wa maaa anzalar Rahmaanu min shai'in in antum illaa takziboon
ayah.translation: They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Rabbunaa ya'lamu innaaa ilaikum lamursaloon
ayah.translation: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa 'alainaaa illal balaaghul mubeen
ayah.translation: And we are not responsible except for clear notification."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo innaa tataiyarnaa bikum la'il-lam tantahoo lanar jumannakum wa la-yamassan nakum minnaa 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo taaa'irukum ma'akum; a'in zukkirtum; bal antum qawmum musrifoon
ayah.translation: They said, "Your omen is with yourselves. Is it because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaaa'a min aqsal madeenati rajuluny yas'aa qaala yaa qawmit tabi'ul mursaleen
ayah.translation: And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Ittabi'oo mal-laa yas'alukum ajranw-wa hum muhtadoon
ayah.translation: Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa liya laaa a'budul lazee fataranee wa ilaihi turja'oon
ayah.translation: And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?

ayah.transliteration: 'A-attakhizu min dooniheee aalihatan iny-yuridnir Rahmaanu bidurril-laa tughni 'annee shafaa 'atuhum shai 'anw-wa laa yunqizoon
ayah.translation: Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?

ayah.transliteration: Inneee izal-lafee dalaa-lim-mubeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.

ayah.transliteration: Inneee aamantu bi Rabbikum fasma'oon
ayah.translation: Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."

ayah.transliteration: Qeelad khulil Jannnah; qaala yaa laita qawmee ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: It was said, "Enter Paradise." He said, "I wish my people could know

ayah.transliteration: Bimaa ghafara lee Rabbee wa ja'alanee minal mukrameen
ayah.translation: Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa anzalnaa 'alaa qawmihee mim ba'dihee min jundim minas-samaaa'i wa maa kunnaa munzileen
ayah.translation: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.

ayah.transliteration: In kaanat illaa saihatanw waahidatan fa-izaa hum khaamidoon
ayah.translation: It was not but one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa hasratan 'alal 'ibaad; maa yaateehim mir Rasoolin illaa kaanoo bihee yastahzi 'oon
ayah.translation: How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.

ayah.transliteration: Alam yaraw kam ahlak naa qablahum minal qurooni annahum ilaihim laa yarji'oon
ayah.translation: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them will not return?

ayah.transliteration: Wa in kullul lammaa jamee'ul-ladainaa muhdaroon
ayah.translation: And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Aayatul lahumul ardul maitatu ahyainaahaa wa akhrajnaa minhaa habban faminhu yaakuloon
ayah.translation: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa feehaa jannaatim min nakheelinw wa a'naabinw wa fajjarnaa feeha minal 'uyoon
ayah.translation: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -

ayah.transliteration: Liyaakuloo min samarihee wa maa 'amilat-hu aideehim; afalaa yashkuroon
ayah.translation: That they may eat of His fruit. And their hands have not produced it, so will they not be grateful?

ayah.transliteration: Subhaanal lazee khalaqal azwaaja kullahaa mimmaa tumbitul ardu wa min anfusihim wa mimmaa laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Exalted is He who created all pairs - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Aayatul lahumul lailu naslakhu minhun nahaara fa-izaa hum muzlimoon
ayah.translation: And a sign for them is the night. We remove from it [the light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.

ayah.transliteration: Wash-shamsu tajree limustaqarril lahaa; zaalika taqdeerul 'Azeezil Aleem
ayah.translation: And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Walqamara qaddarnaahu manaazila hattaa 'aada kal'ur joonil qadeem
ayah.translation: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.

ayah.transliteration: Lash shamsu yambaghee lahaaa an tudrikal qamara wa lal lailu saabiqun nahaar; wa kullun fee falaki yasbahoon
ayah.translation: It is not allowable for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Aayatul lahum annaa hamalnaa zurriyatahum fil fulkil mashhoon
ayah.translation: And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers in a laden ship.

ayah.transliteration: Wa khalaqnaa lahum mim-mislihee maa yarkaboon
ayah.translation: And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in nashaa nughriqhum falaa sareekha lahum wa laa hum yunqazoon
ayah.translation: And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved

ayah.transliteration: Illaa rahmatam minnaa wa mataa'an ilaa heen
ayah.translation: Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahumuttaqoo maa baina aideekum wa maa khalfakum la'allakum turhamoon
ayah.translation: But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you; perhaps you will receive mercy... "

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa taateehim min aayatim min ayataati Rabbihim illaa kaanoo 'anhaa mu'rideen
ayah.translation: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahum anfiqoo mimmaa razaqakumul laahu qaalal lazeena kafaroo lillazeena aamanooo anut'imu mal-law yashaaa'ul laahu at'amahooo in antum illaa fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which Allah has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if Allah had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona mataa haazal wa'du in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"

ayah.transliteration: Maa yanzuroona illaa saihatanw waahidatan taa khuzuhum wa hum yakhissimoon
ayah.translation: They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa yastatee'oona taw siyatanw-wa laaa ilaaa ahlihim yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nufikha fis-soori faizaa hum minal ajdaasi ilaa Rabbihim yansiloon
ayah.translation: And the Horn will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa wailanaa mam ba'asanaa mim marqadinaa; haaza maa wa'adar Rahmanu wa sadaqal mursaloon
ayah.translation: They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."

ayah.transliteration: In kaanat illaa saihatanw waahidatan fa-izaa hum jamee'ul ladainaa muhdaroon
ayah.translation: It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.

ayah.transliteration: Fal-Yawma laa tuzlamu nafsun shai'anw-wa laa tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Ashaabal jannatil Yawma fee shughulin faakihoon
ayah.translation: Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -

ayah.transliteration: Hum wa azwaajuhum fee zilaalin 'alal araaa'iki muttaki'oon
ayah.translation: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.

ayah.transliteration: Lahum feehaa faakiha tunw-wa lahum maa yadda'oon
ayah.translation: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]

ayah.transliteration: Salaamun qawlam mir Rabbir Raheem
ayah.translation: [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.

ayah.transliteration: Wamtaazul Yawma ayyuhal mujrimoon
ayah.translation: [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Alam a'had ilaikum yaa Baneee Aadama al-laa ta'budush Shaitaana innahoo lakum 'aduwwum mubeen
ayah.translation: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -

ayah.transliteration: Wa ani'budoonee; haazaa Siraatum Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad adalla minkum jibillan kaseeraa; afalam takoonoo ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?

ayah.transliteration: Haazihee Jahannamul latee kuntum too'adoon
ayah.translation: This is the Hellfire which you were promised.

ayah.transliteration: Islawhal Yawma bimaa kuntum takfuroon
ayah.translation: [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."

ayah.transliteration: Al-Yawma nakhtimu 'alaaa afwaahihim wa tukallimunaaa aideehim wa tashhadu arjuluhum bimaa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law nashaaa'u lata masna 'alaaa aiyunihim fasta baqus-siraata fa-annaa yubsiroon
ayah.translation: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?

ayah.transliteration: Wa law nashaaa'u lamasakhnaahum 'alaa makaanatihim famas-tataa'oo mudiyyanw-wa laa yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.

ayah.transliteration: Wa man nu 'ammirhu nunakkishu fil-khalq; afalaa ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa 'allamnaahush shi'ra wa maa yambaghee lah; in huwa illaa zikrunw-wa Qur-aanum mubeen
ayah.translation: And We did not give Prophet Muhammad, knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an

ayah.transliteration: Liyunzira man kaana haiyanw-wa yahiqqal qawlu 'alal-kaafireen
ayah.translation: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaraw annaa khalaqnaa lahum mimmaa 'amilat aideenaaa an'aaman fahum lahaa maalikoon
ayah.translation: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?

ayah.transliteration: Wa zallalnaahaa lahum faminhaa rakoobuhum wa minhaa yaakuloon
ayah.translation: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahum feehaa manaa fi'u wa mashaarib; afalaa yashkuroon
ayah.translation: And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?

ayah.transliteration: Wattakhazoo min doonil laahi aalihatal la'allahum yunsaroon
ayah.translation: But they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yastatee'oona nasrahum wa hum lahum jundum muhdaroon
ayah.translation: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa yahzunka qawluhum; innaa na'lamu maa yusirroona wa maa yu'linoon
ayah.translation: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaral insaanu annaa khalaqnaahu min nutfatin fa-izaa huwa khaseemum mubeen
ayah.translation: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?

ayah.transliteration: Wa daraba lanaa maslanw-wa nasiya khalqahoo qaala mai-yuhyil'izaama wa hiya rameem
ayah.translation: And he presents for Us an example and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul yuh yeehal lazeee ansha ahaaa awwala marrah; wa Huwa bikulli khalqin 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."

ayah.transliteration: Allazee ja'ala lakum minash shajaril akhdari naaran fa-izaaa antum minhu tooqidoon
ayah.translation: [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.

ayah.transliteration: Awa laisal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda biqaadirin 'alaaa ai-yakhluqa mislahum; balaa wa Huwal Khallaaqul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa amruhooo izaaa araada shai'an ai-yaqoola lahoo kun fa-yakoon
ayah.translation: His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.

ayah.transliteration: Fa Subhaanal lazee biyadihee malakootu kulli shai-inw-wa ilaihi turja'oon
ayah.translation: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wassaaaffaati saffaa
ayah.translation: By those [angels] lined up in rows

ayah.transliteration: Fazzaajiraati zajraa
ayah.translation: And those who drive [the clouds]

ayah.transliteration: Fattaaliyaati Zikra
ayah.translation: And those who recite the message,

ayah.transliteration: Inna Illaahakum la Waahid
ayah.translation: Indeed, your God is One,

ayah.transliteration: Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa wa Rabbul mashaariq
ayah.translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa zaiyannas samaaa 'ad dunyaa bizeenatinil kawaakib
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars

ayah.transliteration: Wa hifzam min kulli Shaitaanim maarid
ayah.translation: And as protection against every rebellious devil

ayah.transliteration: Laa yassamma 'oona ilal mala il a'alaa wa yuqzafoona min kulli jaanib
ayah.translation: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,

ayah.transliteration: Duhooranw wa lahum 'azaabunw waasib
ayah.translation: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man khatifal khatfata fa atba'ahoo shihaabun saaqib
ayah.translation: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].

ayah.transliteration: Fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnaa; innaa khalaqnaahum min teenil laazib
ayah.translation: Then inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created men from sticky clay.

ayah.transliteration: Bal'ajibta wa yaskharoon
ayah.translation: But you wonder, while they mock,

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa zukkiroo laa yazkuroon
ayah.translation: And when they are reminded, they remember not.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra aw Aayatinw yastaskhiroon
ayah.translation: And when they see a sign, they ridicule

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalooo in haazaa illaa sihrum mubeen
ayah.translation: And say, "This is not but obvious magic.

ayah.transliteration: 'A-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa 'izaaman 'ainnaa lamab'oosoon
ayah.translation: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

ayah.transliteration: Awa aabaa'unal awwaloon
ayah.translation: And our forefathers [as well]?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul na'am wa antum daakhiroon
ayah.translation: Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."

ayah.transliteration: Fa innamaa hiya zajra tunw waahidatun fa izaa hum yanzuroon
ayah.translation: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.

ayah.transliteration: Qa qaaloo yaa wailanaa haazaa Yawmud-Deen
ayah.translation: They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa Yawmul Faslil lazee kuntum bihee tukaziboon
ayah.translation: [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."

ayah.transliteration: Uhshurul lazeena zalamoo wa azwaajahum wa maa kaanoo ya'budoon
ayah.translation: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds, and what they used to worship

ayah.transliteration: Min doonil laahi fahdoohum ilaa siraatil Jaheem
ayah.translation: Other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire

ayah.transliteration: Wa qifoohum innahum mas'ooloon
ayah.translation: And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."

ayah.transliteration: Maa lakum laa tanaasaroon
ayah.translation: [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"

ayah.transliteration: Bal humul Yawma mustaslimoon
ayah.translation: But they, that Day, are in surrender.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqbala ba'duhum 'alaa ba'diny yatasaaa'aloon
ayah.translation: And they will approach one another blaming each other.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo innakum kuntum taatoonanaa 'anil yameen
ayah.translation: They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo bal lam takoonoo mu'mineen
ayah.translation: The oppressors will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kaana lanaa 'alaikum min sultaanim bal kuntum qawman taagheen
ayah.translation: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.

ayah.transliteration: Fahaqqa 'alainaa qawlu Rabbinaaa innaa lazaaa'iqoon
ayah.translation: So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].

ayah.transliteration: Fa aghwainaakum innaa kunnaa ghaaween
ayah.translation: And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."

ayah.transliteration: Fa innahum Yawma'izin fil'azaabi mushtarikoon
ayah.translation: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kazaalika naf'alu bil mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Innahum kaanooo izaa qeela lahum laaa ilaaha illal laahu yastakbiroon
ayah.translation: Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allah," were arrogant

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqooloona a'innaa lataarikooo aalihatinaa lishaa'irim majnoon
ayah.translation: And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"

ayah.transliteration: bal jaaa'a bilhaqqi wa saddaqal mursaleen
ayah.translation: Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Innakum lazaaa'iqul 'azaabil aleem
ayah.translation: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa tujzawna illaa maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadal laahil mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika lahum rizqum ma'loom
ayah.translation: Those will have a provision determined -

ayah.transliteration: Fa waakihu wa hum mukramoon
ayah.translation: Fruits; and they will be honored

ayah.transliteration: Fee jannaatin Na'eem
ayah.translation: In gardens of pleasure

ayah.transliteration: 'Alaa sururim mutaqaa bileen
ayah.translation: On thrones facing one another.

ayah.transliteration: Yutaafu 'alaihim bikaasim mim ma'een
ayah.translation: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,

ayah.transliteration: Baidaaa'a laz zatil lish shaaribeen
ayah.translation: White and delicious to the drinkers;

ayah.transliteration: Laa feehaa ghawlunw wa laa hum 'anhaa yunzafoon
ayah.translation: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'indahum qaasiraatut tarfi 'een
ayah.translation: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,

ayah.transliteration: Ka annahunna baidum maknoon
ayah.translation: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.

ayah.transliteration: Fa aqbala ba'duhum 'alaa badiny yatasaaa 'aloon
ayah.translation: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala qaaa'ilum minhum innee kaana lee qareen
ayah.translation: A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth]

ayah.transliteration: Yaqoolu a'innnaka laminal musaddiqeen
ayah.translation: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

ayah.transliteration: 'A-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa 'izaaman 'ainnaa lamadeenoon
ayah.translation: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala hal antum muttali'oon
ayah.translation: He will say, "Would you [care to] look?"

ayah.transliteration: Fattala'a fara aahu fee sawaaa'il Jaheem
ayah.translation: And he will look and see him in the midst of the Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala tallaahi in kitta laturdeen
ayah.translation: He will say, "By Allah, you almost ruined me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laa ni'matu Rabbee lakuntu minal muhdareen
ayah.translation: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].

ayah.transliteration: Afamaa nahnu bimaiyiteen
ayah.translation: Then, are we not to die

ayah.transliteration: Illa mawtatanal oola wa maa nahnu bimu'azzabeen
ayah.translation: Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazaa falya'ma lil'aamiloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, this is the great attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Limisli haaza falya'ma lil 'aamiloon
ayah.translation: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

ayah.transliteration: Azaalika khairun nuzulan am shajaratuz Zaqqom
ayah.translation: Is Paradise a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?

ayah.transliteration: Innaa ja'alnaahaa fitnatal lizzaalimeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Innahaa shajaratun takhruju feee aslil Jaheem
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,

ayah.transliteration: Tal'uhaa ka annahoo ru'oosush Shayaateen
ayah.translation: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

ayah.transliteration: Fa innahum la aakiloona minhaa famaali'oona minhal butoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.

ayah.transliteration: Summa inna lahum 'alaihaa lashawbam min hameem
ayah.translation: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.

ayah.transliteration: Summa inna marji'ahum la ilal Jaheem
ayah.translation: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Innahum alfaw aabaaa'ahum daaalleen
ayah.translation: Indeed they found their fathers astray.

ayah.transliteration: Fahum 'alaa aasaarihim yuhra'oon
ayah.translation: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad dalla qablahum aksarul awwaleen
ayah.translation: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa feehim munzireen
ayah.translation: And We had already sent among them warners.

ayah.transliteration: Fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul munzareen
ayah.translation: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadal laahil mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad naadaanaa Noohun falani'mal mujeeboon
ayah.translation: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.

ayah.transliteration: Wa jajainaahu wa ahlahoo minal karbil 'azeem
ayah.translation: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alnaa zurriyyatahoo hummul baaqeen
ayah.translation: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa 'alaihi fil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

ayah.transliteration: Salaamun 'alaa Noohin fil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo min 'ibaadinal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

ayah.transliteration: Summa aghraqnal aakhareen
ayah.translation: Then We drowned the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ina min shee'atihee la Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,

ayah.transliteration: Iz jaaa'a Rabbahoo bi qalbin saleem
ayah.translation: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala li abeehi wa qawmihee maazaa ta'budoon
ayah.translation: [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?

ayah.transliteration: A'ifkan aalihatan doonal laahi tureedoon
ayah.translation: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?

ayah.transliteration: Famaa zannukum bi Rabbil'aalameen
ayah.translation: Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"

ayah.transliteration: Fanazara nazratan finnujoom
ayah.translation: And he cast a look at the stars

ayah.transliteration: Faqaala inee saqeem
ayah.translation: And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."

ayah.transliteration: Fatawallaw 'anhu mudbireen
ayah.translation: So they turned away from him, departing.

ayah.transliteration: Faraagha ilaaa aalihatihim faqaala alaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?

ayah.transliteration: Maa lakum laa tantiqoon
ayah.translation: What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"

ayah.transliteration: Faraagha 'alaihim darbam bilyameen
ayah.translation: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.

ayah.transliteration: Fa aqbalooo ilaihi yaziffoon
ayah.translation: Then the people came toward him, hastening.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala ata'budoona maa tanhitoon
ayah.translation: He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu khalaqakum wa maa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: While Allah created you and that which you do?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalub noo lahoo bun yaanan fa alqoohu fil jaheem
ayah.translation: They said, "Construct for him a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."

ayah.transliteration: Fa araadoo bihee kaidan faja 'alnaahumul asfaleen
ayah.translation: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala innee zaahibun ilaa Rabbee sa yahdeen
ayah.translation: And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbi hab lee minas saaliheen
ayah.translation: My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."

ayah.transliteration: Fabashsharnaahu bighulaamin haleem
ayah.translation: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

ayah.transliteration: Falamma balagha ma'a hus sa'ya qaala yaa buniya inneee araa fil manaami anneee azbahuka fanzur maazaa taraa; qaala yaaa abatif 'al maa tu'maru satajidunee in shaaa'allaahu minas saabireen
ayah.translation: And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion, he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allah wills, of the steadfast."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa aslamaa wa tallahoo liljabeen
ayah.translation: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,

ayah.transliteration: Wa naadainaahu ai yaaaa Ibraheem
ayah.translation: We called to him, "O Abraham,

ayah.transliteration: Qad saddaqtar ru'yaa; innaa kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazaa lahuwal balaaa'ul mubeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, this was the clear trial.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fadainaahu bizibhin 'azeem
ayah.translation: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa 'alaihi fil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

ayah.transliteration: Salaamun 'alaaa Ibraaheem
ayah.translation: "Peace upon Abraham."

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo min 'ibaadinal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

ayah.transliteration: Wa bashsharnaahu bi Ishaaqa Nabiyayam minas saaliheen
ayah.translation: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa baaraknaa 'alaihi wa 'alaaa Ishaaq; wa min zurriyya tihimaa muhsinunw wa zaalimul linafshihee mubeen
ayah.translation: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad mananna alaa Moosaa wa Haaroon
ayah.translation: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.

ayah.transliteration: Wa najjainaahumaa wa qawmahumaa minal karbil 'azeem
ayah.translation: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,

ayah.transliteration: Wa nasarnaahum fakaanoo humul ghaalibeen
ayah.translation: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaahumal Kitaabal mustabeen
ayah.translation: And We gave them the explicit Scripture,

ayah.transliteration: Wa hadainaahumus Siraatal Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And We guided them on the straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa 'alaihimaa fil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:

ayah.transliteration: Salaamun 'alaa Moosaa wa Haaroon
ayah.translation: "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innahumaa min 'ibaadinal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Ilyaasa laminal mursaleen
ayah.translation: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala liqawmiheee alaa tattaqoon
ayah.translation: When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allah?

ayah.transliteration: Atad'oona Ba'lanw wa tazaroona ahsanal khaaliqeen
ayah.translation: Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators -

ayah.transliteration: Allaaha Rabbakum wa Rabba aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen
ayah.translation: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"

ayah.transliteration: Fakazzaboohu fa inna hum lamuhdaroon
ayah.translation: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadal laahil mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: Except the chosen servants of Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa 'alaihi fil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

ayah.transliteration: Salaamun 'alaaa Ilyaaseen
ayah.translation: "Peace upon Elias."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kazaalika najzil muhsineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo min 'ibaadinal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Lootal laminal mursaleen
ayah.translation: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Iz najjainaahu wa ahlahooo ajma'een
ayah.translation: [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ajoozan fil ghaabireen
ayah.translation: Except his wife among those who remained [with the evildoers].

ayah.transliteration: Summa dammarnal aakhareen
ayah.translation: Then We destroyed the others.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innakum latamurroona 'alaihim musbiheen
ayah.translation: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning

ayah.transliteration: Wa billail; afalaa ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: And at night. Then will you not use reason?

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna Yoonusa laminal mursaleen
ayah.translation: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Iz abaqa ilal fulkil mash hoon
ayah.translation: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.

ayah.transliteration: Fasaahama fakaana minal mudhadeen
ayah.translation: And he drew lots and was among the losers.

ayah.transliteration: Faltaqamahul hootu wa huwa muleem
ayah.translation: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Falaw laaa annahoo kaana minal musabbiheen
