ayah.translation: And had he not been of those who exalt Allah,

ayah.transliteration: Lalabisa fee batniheee ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon
ayah.translation: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: Fanabaznaahu bil'araaa'i wa huwa saqeem
ayah.translation: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ambatnaa 'alaihi shajaratam mai yaqteen
ayah.translation: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.

ayah.transliteration: Wa arsalnaahu ilaa mi'ati alfin aw yazeedoon
ayah.translation: And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.

ayah.transliteration: Fa aamanoo famatta' naahum ilaa heen
ayah.translation: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.

ayah.transliteration: Fastaftihim ali Rabbikal banaatu wa lahumul banoon
ayah.translation: So inquire of them, [O Muhammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?

ayah.transliteration: Am khalaqnal malaaa'i kata inaasanw wa hm shaahidoon
ayah.translation: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"

ayah.transliteration: Alaaa innahum min ifkihim la yaqooloon
ayah.translation: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,

ayah.transliteration: Waladal laahu wa innhum lakaaziboon
ayah.translation: " Allah has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.

ayah.transliteration: Astafal banaati 'alal baneen
ayah.translation: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

ayah.transliteration: Maa lakum kaifa tahkumoon
ayah.translation: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?

ayah.transliteration: Afalaa tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: Then will you not be reminded?

ayah.transliteration: Am lakum sultaanum mubeen
ayah.translation: Or do you have a clear authority?

ayah.transliteration: Faatoo bi Kitaabikum in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'aloo bainahoo wa bainal jinnati nasabaa; wa laqad 'alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuhdaroon
ayah.translation: And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [punishment].

ayah.transliteration: Subhaanal laahi 'ammaa yasifoon
ayah.translation: Exalted is Allah above what they describe,

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadal laahil mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: Except the chosen servants of Allah [who do not share in that sin].

ayah.transliteration: Fa innakum wa maa ta'ubdoon
ayah.translation: So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,

ayah.transliteration: Maaa antum 'alaihi befaaatineen
ayah.translation: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him

ayah.transliteration: Illaa man huwa saalil jaheem
ayah.translation: Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa minnasa illaa lahoo maqaamum ma'loom
ayah.translation: [The angels say], "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaa llanah nus saaffoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaa lanah nul musabbihoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, we are those who exalt Allah."

ayah.transliteration: Wa in kaanoo la yaqooloon
ayah.translation: And indeed, the disbelievers used to say,

ayah.transliteration: Law anna 'indana zikram minal awwaleen
ayah.translation: "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,

ayah.transliteration: Lakunna 'ibaadal laahil mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: We would have been the chosen servants of Allah."

ayah.transliteration: Fakafaroo bihee fasawfa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad sabaqat Kalimatunaa li'ibaadinal mursa leen
ayah.translation: And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,

ayah.transliteration: Innaa hum lahumul mansooroon
ayah.translation: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna jundana lahumul ghaaliboon
ayah.translation: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.

ayah.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum hatta heen
ayah.translation: So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.

ayah.transliteration: Wa absirhum fasawfa yubsiroon
ayah.translation: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.

ayah.transliteration: Afabi'azaabinaa yasta'jiloon
ayah.translation: Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

ayah.transliteration: Fa izaa nazala bisaahatihim fasaaa'a sabaahul munzareen
ayah.translation: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tawalla 'anhum hattaa heen
ayah.translation: And leave them for a time.

ayah.transliteration: Wa absir fasawfa yubsiroon
ayah.translation: And see, for they are going to see.

ayah.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbika Rabbil 'izzati 'amma yasifoon
ayah.translation: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa salaamun 'alalmursaleen
ayah.translation: And peace upon the messengers.

ayah.transliteration: Walhamdu lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Saaad; wal-Qur-aani ziz zikr
ayah.translation: Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder...

ayah.transliteration: Balil lazeena kafaroo fee 'izzatilnw wa shiqaaq
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.

ayah.transliteration: Kam ahlaknaa min qablihim min qarnin fanaadaw wa laata heena manaas
ayah.translation: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'ajibooo an jaaa'a hum munzirum minhum wa qaalal kaafiroona haazaa saahirun kazzaab
ayah.translation: And they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.

ayah.transliteration: Aja'alal aalihata Ilaahanw Waahidan inna haazaa lashai'un 'ujaab
ayah.translation: Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."

ayah.transliteration: Wantalaqal mala-u minhum anim shoo wasbiroo 'alaaa aalihatikum innna haazaa lashai 'uny yuraad
ayah.translation: And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.

ayah.transliteration: Maa sami'naa bihaazaa fil millatil aakhirati in haazaaa illakh tilaaq
ayah.translation: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.

ayah.transliteration: 'A-unzila 'alaihiz zikru mim baininaa; bal hum fee shakkim min Zikree bal lammaa yazooqoo 'azaab
ayah.translation: Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Am'indahum khazaaa 'inu rahmati Rabbikal 'Azeezil Wahhab
ayah.translation: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?

ayah.transliteration: Am lahum mulkus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa falyartaqoo fil asbaab
ayah.translation: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.

ayah.transliteration: Jundum maa hunaalika mahzoomum minal Ahzaab
ayah.translation: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Lootinw-wa 'Aadunw wa Fir'awnu zul awtaad
ayah.translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,

ayah.transliteration: Wa Samoodu wa qawmu Lootinw wa Ashaabul 'Aykah; ulaaa'ikal Ahzaab
ayah.translation: And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket. Those are the companies.

ayah.transliteration: In kullun illaa kazzabar Rusula fahaqqa 'iqaab
ayah.translation: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yanzuru haaa ulaaa'i illaa saihatanw waahidatam maa lahaa min fawaaq
ayah.translation: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo Rabbanaa 'ajjil lanaa qittanaa qabla Yawmil Hisaab
ayah.translation: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account"

ayah.transliteration: Isbir 'alaa maa yaqooloona wazkur 'abdanaa Daawooda zal aidi aidi innahooo awwaab
ayah.translation: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Innaa sakhkharnal jibaala ma'ahoo yusabbihna bil'ashaiyi wal ishraaq
ayah.translation: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.

ayah.transliteration: Wattayra mahshoorah; kullul lahooo awwaab
ayah.translation: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].

ayah.transliteration: Wa shadadnaa mulkahoo wa aatainaahul Hikmata wa faslal khitaab
ayah.translation: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hal ataaka naba'ul khasm; iz tasawwarul mihraab
ayah.translation: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

ayah.transliteration: Iz dakhaloo 'alaa Daawooda fafazi'a minhum qaaloo la takhaf khasmaani baghaa ba'dunaa 'alaa ba'din fahkum bainanaaa bilhaqqi wa laa tushtit wahdinaaa ilaa Sawaaa'is Siraat
ayah.translation: When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazaaa akhee lahoo tis'unw wa tis'oona na'jatanw wa liya na'jatunw waahidah; faqaala akfilneeha wa 'azzanee filkhitaab
ayah.translation: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laqad zalamaka bisu 'aali na'jatika ilaa ni'aajihee wa inna kaseeram minal khulataaa'i la-yabghee ba'duhum 'alaa ba'din illal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati wa qaleehum maa hum; wa zanna Daawoodu annamaa fatannaahu fastaghrara Rabbahoo wa kharra raaki'anw wa anaab
ayah.translation: [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Faghafarnaa lahoo zaalik; wa inna lahoo 'indanaa lazulfaa wa husna ma aab
ayah.translation: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa Daawoodu innaa ja'alnaaka khaleefatan fil ardi fahkum bainan naasi bilhaqqi wa laa tattabi'il hawaa fayudillaka 'an sabeelil laah; innal lazeena yadilloona 'an sabeelil laah; lahum 'azaabun shadeedum bimaa nasoo Yawmal Hisaab
ayah.translation: [We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allah." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of Allah will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ma khalaqnas samaaa'a wal arda wa maa bainahumaa baatilaa; zaalika zannul lazeena kafaroo; fawi lul lillazeena kafaroo minan Naar
ayah.translation: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Am naj'alul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati kalmufisdeena fil ardi am naj'alul muttaqeena kalfujjaar
ayah.translation: Or should we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allah like the wicked?

ayah.transliteration: Kitaabun anzalnaahu ilaika mubaarakul liyaddabbarooo Aayaatihee wa liyatazakkara ulul albaab
ayah.translation: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa wahabnaa li Daawooda Sulaimaan; ni'mal 'abd; innahoo awwaab
ayah.translation: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Iz 'urida 'alaihi bil'ashiy yis saafinaatul jiyaad
ayah.translation: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.

ayah.transliteration: Faqaala inneee ahbabtu hubbal khairi 'an zikri Rabbee hattaa tawaarat bilhijaab
ayah.translation: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."

ayah.transliteration: Ruddoohaa 'alaiya fatafiqa masham bissooqi wal a'naaq
ayah.translation: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking [their] legs and necks.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad fatannaa Sulaimaana wa alqainaa 'alaa kursiyyihee jasadan summa anaab
ayah.translation: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body; then he returned.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbigh fir lee wa hab lee mulkal laa yambaghee li ahadim mim ba'de inaka Antal Wahhab
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."

ayah.transliteration: Fasakhkharnaa lahur reeha tajree bi amrihee rukhaaa'an haisu asaab
ayah.translation: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,

ayah.transliteration: Wash Shayaateena kulla bannaaa'inw wa ghawwaas
ayah.translation: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver

ayah.transliteration: Wa aakhareena muqarraneena fil asfaad
ayah.translation: And others bound together in shackles.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa 'ataaa'unaa famnun aw amsik bighairi hisaab
ayah.translation: [We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna lahoo 'indanaa lazulfaa wa husna ma-aab
ayah.translation: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur 'abdanaaa Ayyoob; iz naada Rabbahooo annee massaniyash Shaitaanu binus binw wa 'azaab
ayah.translation: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."

ayah.transliteration: Urkud birijlika haaza mughtasalum baaridunw wa sharaab
ayah.translation: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for] a cool bath and drink."

ayah.transliteration: Wa wahabnaa lahoo ahlahoo wa mislahum ma'ahum rahmatam minna wa zikraa li ulil albaab
ayah.translation: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

ayah.transliteration: Wa khuz biyadika dighsan fadrib bihee wa laa tahnas, innaa wajadnaahu saabiraa; ni'mal 'abd; innahooo awwaab
ayah.translation: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath." Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur 'ibaadanaaa Ibraaheema wa Is-haaqa wa Ya'qooba ulil-aydee walabsaar
ayah.translation: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa akhlasnaahum bi khaalisatin zikrad daar
ayah.translation: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahum 'indanaa laminal mustafainal akhyaar
ayah.translation: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur Ismaa'eela wal Yasa'a wa Zal-Kifli wa kullum minal akhyaar
ayah.translation: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa zikr; wa inna lilmuttaqeena lahusna ma aab
ayah.translation: This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return

ayah.transliteration: Jannaati 'adnim mufat tahatal lahumul abwaab
ayah.translation: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.

ayah.transliteration: Muttaki'eena feehaa yad'oona feehaa bifaakihatin kaseeratinw wa sharaab
ayah.translation: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'indahum qaasiraatut tarfi atraab
ayah.translation: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.

ayah.transliteration: Haaza maa too'odoona li Yawmil Hisaab
ayah.translation: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazaa larizqunaa maa lahoo min nafaad
ayah.translation: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa; wa inna littaagheena lasharra ma-aab
ayah.translation: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

ayah.transliteration: Jahannama yaslawnahaa fai'sal mihaad
ayah.translation: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa falyazooqoohu hameemunw wa ghassaaq
ayah.translation: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aakharu min shak liheee azwaaj
ayah.translation: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa fawjum muqtahimum ma'akum laa marhabam bihim; innahum saalun Naar
ayah.translation: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo bal antum laa marhabam bikum; antum qaddamtumoohu lanaa fabi'sal qaraar
ayah.translation: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Rabbanaa man qaddama lanaa haaza fazidhu 'azaaban di'fan fin Naar
ayah.translation: They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo ma lanaa laa naraa rijaalan kunnaa na'udduhum minal ashraar
ayah.translation: And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?

ayah.transliteration: Attakhaznaahum sikh riyyan am zaaghat 'anhumul absaar
ayah.translation: Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"

ayah.transliteration: Inna zaalika lahaqqun takhaasumu Ahlin Naar
ayah.translation: Indeed, that is truth - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaaa ana munzirunw wa maa min ilaahim illal laahul Waahidul Qahhaar
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumal 'Azeezul Ghaffaar
ayah.translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."

ayah.transliteration: Qul huwa naba'un 'azeem
ayah.translation: Say, "It is great news

ayah.transliteration: Antum 'anhu mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: From which you turn away.

ayah.transliteration: Maa kaana liya min 'ilmim bilmala il a'laaa iz yakhtasimoon
ayah.translation: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

ayah.transliteration: Iny-yoohaaa ilaiya illaaa annnamaaa ana nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."

ayah.transliteration: Iz qaala Rabbuka lilmalaaa'ikati innee khaaliqum basharam min teen
ayah.translation: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-iza sawwaituhoo wa nafakhtu feehi mir roohee faqa'oo lahoo saajideen
ayah.translation: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."

ayah.transliteration: Fasajadal malaaa'ikatu kulluhum ajma'oon
ayah.translation: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.

ayah.transliteration: Illaaa Iblees; istakbara wa kaana minal kaafireen
ayah.translation: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Qaala yaaa Ibleesu maa man'aka an tasjuda limaa khalaqtu biyadai; astakbarta am kunta min 'aaleen
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaala ana khairum minah; khalaqtanee min naarinw wa khalaqtahoo min teen
ayah.translation: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fakhruj minhaa fainnaka rajeem
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "Then get out of Paradise, for indeed, you are expelled.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna 'alaika la'nateee ilaa Yawmid Deen
ayah.translation: And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala Rabbi fa anzirneee ilaa Yawmi yub'asoon
ayah.translation: He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fa innaka minal munzareen
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved

ayah.transliteration: Ilaa Yawmil waqtil ma'loom
ayah.translation: Until the Day of the time well-known."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala fabi'izzatika la ughwiyannahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: [Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all

ayah.transliteration: Illaa 'ibaadaka minhumul mukhlaseen
ayah.translation: Except, among them, Your chosen servants."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala falhaqq, walhaqqa aqool
ayah.translation: [Allah] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -

ayah.transliteration: La amla'annna Jahannama minka wa mimman tabi'aka minhum ajma'een
ayah.translation: [That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."

ayah.transliteration: Qul maaa as'alukum 'alaihi min ajrinw wa maaa ana minal mutakallifeen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment, and I am not of the pretentious

ayah.transliteration: In huwa illaa zikrul lil'aalameen
ayah.translation: It is but a reminder to the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lata'lamunna naba ahoo ba'da heen
ayah.translation: And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelul Kitaabi minal laahil 'Azeezil Hakeem
ayah.translation: The revelation of the Qur'an is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa anzalnaaa ilaikal Kitaaba bilhaqqi fa'budil laaha mukhlisal lahud deen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Muhammad], in truth. So worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

ayah.transliteration: Alaa lillaahid deenul khaalis; wallazeenat takhazoo min dooniheee awliyaaa'a maa na'buduhum illaa liyuqar riboonaaa ilal laahi zulfaa; innal laaha yahkumu baina hum fee maa hum feehi yakhtalifoon; innal laaha laa yahdee man huwa kaazibun kaffaar
ayah.translation: Unquestionably, for Allah is the pure religion. And those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We only worship them that they may bring us nearer to Allah in position." Indeed, Allah will judge between them concerning that over which they differ. Indeed, Allah does not guide he who is a liar and [confirmed] disbeliever.

ayah.transliteration: Law araadal laahu aiyattakhiza waladal lastafaa mimmaa yakhluqu maa yashaaa'; Subhaanahoo Huwal laahul Waahidul Qahhaar
ayah.translation: If Allah had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqas samaawaati wal arda bilhaqq; yukawwirul laila 'alan nahaari wa yukawwirun nahaara 'alaal laili wa sakhkharash shamsa walqamara kulluny yajree li ajalim musammaa; alaa Huwal 'Azeezul Ghaffaar
ayah.translation: He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqakum min nafsinw waahidatin summa ja'ala minhaa zawjahaa wa anzala lakum minal-an'aami samaani yata azwaaj; yakhuluqukum fee butooni ummahaatikum khalqam mim ba'di khalqin fee zulumaatin salaas; zaalikumul laahu Rabbukum lahul mulk; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fa annaa tusrafoon
ayah.translation: He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?

ayah.transliteration: In takfuroo fa innal laaha ghaniyyun 'ankum; wa laa yardaa li'ibaadihil kufra wa in tashkuroo yardahu lakum; wa laa taziru waaziratunw wizra ukhraa; summa ilaa Rabikum marji'ukum fa-yunabbi'ukum bimaa kuntum ta'maloon; innahoo 'aleemum bizaatissudoor
ayah.translation: If you disbelieve - indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa massal insaana durrun da'aa Rabbahoo muneeban ilaihi summa izaa khawwalahoo ni'matam minhu nasiya maa kaana yad'ooo ilaihi min qablu wa ja'ala lillaahi andaadal liyudilla 'ansabeelih; qul tamatta' bikufrika qaleelan innaka min Ashaabin Naar;
ayah.translation: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [alone]; then when He bestows on him a favor from Himself, he forgets Him whom he called upon before, and he attributes to Allah equals to mislead [people] from His way. Say, "Enjoy your disbelief for a little; indeed, you are of the companions of the Fire."

ayah.transliteration: Amman huwa qaanitun aanaaa'al laili saajidanw wa qaaa'imai yahzarul Aakhirata wa yarjoo rahmata Rabbih; qul hal yastawil lazeena ya'lamoona wallazeena laa ya'lamoon; innamaa yatazakkaru ulul albaab
ayah.translation: Is one who is devoutly obedient during periods of the night, prostrating and standing [in prayer], fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, [like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only they will remember [who are] people of understanding.

ayah.transliteration: Qul yaa 'ibaadil lazeena aamanut taqoo Rabbakum; lillazeena ahsanoo fee haazihid dunyaa hasanah; wa ardul laahi waasi'ah; innamaa yuwaffas saabiroona ajrahum bighayri hisab
ayah.translation: Say, "O My servants who have believed, fear your Lord. For those who do good in this world is good, and the earth of Allah is spacious. Indeed, the patient will be given their reward without account."

ayah.transliteration: Qul inneee umirtu an a'budal laaha mukhlisal lahud deen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been commanded to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

ayah.transliteration: Wa umirtu li an akoona awwalal muslimeen
ayah.translation: And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] of the Muslims."

ayah.transliteration: Qul inneee akhaafu in 'asaitu Rabbee 'azaaba Yawmin 'azeem
ayah.translation: Say, "Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

ayah.transliteration: Qulil laaha a'budu mukhlisal lahoo deenee
ayah.translation: Say, "Allah [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my religion,

ayah.transliteration: Fa'budoo maa shi'tum min doonih; qul innal khaasireenal lazeena khasirooo anfusahum wa ahleehim yawmal qiyaamah; alaa zaalika huwal khusraanul mubeen
ayah.translation: So worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Indeed, the losers are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, that is the manifest loss."

ayah.transliteration: Lahum min fawqihim zulalum minan Naari wa min tahtihim zulal; zaalika yukhaw wiful laahu bihee 'ibaadah; yaa 'ibaadi fattaqoon
ayah.translation: They will have canopies of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that Allah threatens His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeenaj tanabut Taaghoota ai ya'budoohaa wa anaabooo ilal laahi lahumul bushraa; fabashshir 'ibaad
ayah.translation: But those who have avoided Taghut, lest they worship it, and turned back to Allah - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yastami'oonal qawla fayattabi'oona ahsanah; ulaaa'ikal lazeena hadaahumul laahu wa ulaaa'ika hum ulul albaab
ayah.translation: Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allah has guided, and those are people of understanding.

ayah.transliteration: Afaman haqqa 'alaihi kalimatul 'azaab; afa anta tunqizu man fin Naar
ayah.translation: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?

ayah.transliteration: Laakinil lazeenat taqaw Rabbahum lahum ghurafum min fawqihaa ghurafum mabniyyatun tajree min tahtihal anhaar; wa'dal laah; laa yukhliful laahul mee'aad
ayah.translation: But those who have feared their Lord - for them are chambers, above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in [His] promise.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an fasalakahoo yanaabee'a fil ardi summa yukhriju bihee zar'am mukhtalifan alwaanuhoo summa yaheeju fatarahu musfarran summa yaj'aluhoo hutaamaa; inna fee zaalika lazikraa li ulil albaab
ayah.translation: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.

ayah.transliteration: Afaman sharahal laahu sadrahoo lil Islaami fahuwa 'alaa noorim mir Rabbih; fa wailul lilqaasiyati quloobuhum min zikril laah; ulaaa'ika fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: So is one whose breast Allah has expanded to [accept] Islam and he is upon a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah. Those are in manifest error.

ayah.transliteration: Allahu nazzala ahsanal hadeesi Kitaabam mutashaa biham masaaniy taqsha'irru minhu juloodul lazeena yakhshawna Rabbahum summa taleenu julooduhum wa quloo buhum ilaa zikril laah; zaalika hudal laahi yahdee bihee mai yashaaa'; wa mai yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo min haad
ayah.translation: Allah has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

ayah.transliteration: Afamai yattaqee biwaj hihee sooo'al 'azaabi Yawmal Qiyaamah; wa qeela lizzaali meena zooqoo maa kuntum taksiboon
ayah.translation: Then is he who will shield with his face the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection [like one secure from it]? And it will be said to the wrongdoers, "Taste what you used to earn."

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabal lazeena min qablihim fa ataahumul 'azaabu min haisu laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Those before them denied, and punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive.

ayah.transliteration: Fa azaaqahumul laahul khizya fil hayaatid dunyaa wa la'azaabul Aakirati akbar; law kaanoo ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: So Allah made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad darabnaa linnaasi fee haazal Qur-aani min kulli masalil la'allahum yatazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.

ayah.transliteration: Qur-aanan 'Arabiyyan ghaira zee 'iwajil la'allahum yattaqoon
ayah.translation: [It is] an Arabic Qur'an, without any deviance that they might become righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Darabal laahu masalar rajulan feehi shurakaaa'u mutashaakisoona wa rajulan salamal lirajulin hal tastawi yaani masalaa; alhamdu lillaah; bal aksaruhum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Allah presents an example: a slave owned by quarreling partners and another belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Innaka maiyitunw wa inna hum maiyitunw wa inna hum maiyitoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.

ayah.transliteration: Summa innakum Yawmal Qiyaamati 'inda Rabbikum takhtasimoon
ayah.translation: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.

ayah.transliteration: Faman azlamu mimman kazaba 'alal laahi wa kazzaba bissidqi iz jaaa'ah; alaisa fee Jahannama maswal lilkaafir
ayah.translation: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allah and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee jaaa'a bissidqi wa saddaqa biheee ulaaa'ika humul muttaqoon
ayah.translation: And the one who has brought the truth and [they who] believed in it - those are the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Lahum maa yashaaa'oona 'inda Rabbihim; zaalika jazaaa'ul muhsineen
ayah.translation: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good -

ayah.transliteration: Liyukaffiral laahu 'anhum aswa allazee 'amiloo wa yajziyahum ajrahum bi ahsanil lazee kaano ya'maloon
ayah.translation: That Allah may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Alaisal laahu bikaafin 'abdahoo wa yukhawwi foonaka billazeena min doonih; wa mai yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo min haad
ayah.translation: Is not Allah sufficient for His Servant [Prophet Muhammad]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yahdil laahu famalahoo mim mudlil; alai sal laahu bi'azeezin zin tiqaam
ayah.translation: And whoever Allah guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not Allah Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'in sa altahum man khalaqas samaawaati wal arda la yaqoolunal laah; qul afara'aitum maa tad'oona min doonil laahi in araadaniyal laahu bidurrin hal hunna kaashi faatu durriheee aw araadanee birahmatin hal hunna mumsikaatu rahmatih; qul hasbiyal laahu 'alaihi tatawakkalul mutawakkiloon
ayah.translation: And if you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "Allah." Say, "Then have you considered what you invoke besides Allah? If Allah intended me harm, are they removers of His harm; or if He intended me mercy, are they withholders of His mercy?" Say, "Sufficient for me is Allah; upon Him [alone] rely the [wise] reliers."

ayah.transliteration: Qul yaa qawmi'maloo 'alaa makaanatikum innee 'aamilun fasawfa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: Say, "O my people, work according to your position, [for] indeed, I am working; and you are going to know

ayah.transliteration: Mai yaateehi 'azaabuny yukhzeehi wa yahillu 'alaihi 'azaabum muqeem
ayah.translation: To whom will come a torment disgracing him and on whom will descend an enduring punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa anzalnaa 'alaikal Kitaaba linnaasi bilhaqq; famanih tadaa falinafsihee wa man dalla fa innamaa yadillu 'alaihaa wa maaa anta 'alaihim biwakeel
ayah.translation: Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu yatawaffal anfusa heena mawtihaa wallatee lam tamut fee manaamihaa fa yumsikul latee qadaa 'alaihal mawta wa yursilul ukhraaa ilaaa ajalim musammaa; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil liqawmai yatafakkarron
ayah.translation: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Amit takhazoo min doonillaahi shufa'aaa'; qul awalaw kaanoo laa yamlikoona shai'aw wa laa ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: Or have they taken other than Allah as intercessors? Say, "Even though they do not possess [power over] anything, nor do they reason?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul lillaahish shafaa'atu jamee'aa; lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ardi summa ilaihi turj'oon
ayah.translation: Say, "To Allah belongs [the right to allow] intercession entirely. To Him belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will be returned."

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa zukiral laahu wahdahush ma azzat quloobul lazeena laa yu'minoona bil Aakhirati wa izaa zukiral lazeena min dooniheee izaa hum yastabshiroon
ayah.translation: And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.

ayah.transliteration: Qulil laahumma faatiras samaawaati wal ardi 'Aalimal Ghaibi washshahaadati Anta tahkumu baina 'ibaadika fee maa kaanoo fee yakhtalifoon
ayah.translation: Say, "O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, You will judge between your servants concerning that over which they used to differ."

ayah.transliteration: Wa law anna lillazeena zalamoo maa fil ardi jamee'anw wa mislahoo ma'ahoo laftadaw bihee min sooo'il azaabi Yawmal Qiyaamah; wa badaa lahum minal laahi maa lam yakkoonoo yahtasiboon
ayah.translation: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allah that which they had not taken into account.

ayah.transliteration: Wa badaa lahum saiyiaatu maa kasaboo wa haaqa bihim maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Fa izaa massal insaana durrun da'aanaa summa izaa khawwalnaahu ni'matam minna qaala innamaaa ootee tuhoo 'alaa 'ilm; bal hiya fitna tunw wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And when adversity touches man, he calls upon Us; then when We bestow on him a favor from Us, he says, "I have only been given it because of [my] knowledge." Rather, it is a trial, but most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Qad qaalahul lazeena min qablihim famaaa aghnaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Fa asaabahum saiyi aatu maa kasaboo; wallazeena zalamoo min haaa'ulaaa'i sa yuzeebuhum saiyi aatu maa kasaboo wa maa hum bimu'jizeen
ayah.translation: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be afflicted by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam ya'lamooo annal laaha yabsutur rizqa limai yashaaa'u wa yaqdir; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil liqamai yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Do they not know that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

ayah.transliteration: Qul yaa'ibaadiyal lazeena asrafoo 'alaaa anfusihim laa taqnatoo mirrahmatil laah; innal laaha yaghfiruz zunooba jamee'aa; innahoo Huwal Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Say, "O My servants who have transgressed against themselves [by sinning], do not despair of the mercy of Allah. Indeed, Allah forgives all sins. Indeed, it is He who is the Forgiving, the Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Wa aneebooo ilaa Rabbikum wa aslimoo lahoo min qabli ai yaatiyakumul 'azaabu summ laa tunsaroon
ayah.translation: And return [in repentance] to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.

ayah.transliteration: Wattabi'ooo ahsana maaa unzila ilaikum mir Rabbikum min qabli aiyaatiyakumal 'azaabu baghtatanw wa antum laa tash'uroon
ayah.translation: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,

ayah.transliteration: An taqoola nafsuny yaahasrataa 'alaa maa farrattu fee jambil laahi wa in kuntu laminas saakhireen
ayah.translation: Lest a soul should say, "Oh [how great is] my regret over what I neglected in regard to Allah and that I was among the mockers."

ayah.transliteration: Aw taqoola law annal laaha hadaanee lakuntu minal muttaqeen
ayah.translation: Or [lest] it say, "If only Allah had guided me, I would have been among the righteous."

ayah.transliteration: Aw taqoola heena taral 'azaaba law anna lee karratan fa akoona minal muhsineen
ayah.translation: Or [lest] it say when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another turn so I could be among the doers of good."

ayah.transliteration: Balaa qad jaaa'atka Asyaatee fakazzabta bihaa wastak barta wa kunta minal kaafireen
ayah.translation: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawmal Qiyaamati taral lazeena kazaboo 'alallaahi wujoohuhum muswaddah; alaisa fee Hahannama maswal lilmutakabbireen
ayah.translation: And on the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about Allah [with] their faces blackened. Is there not in Hell a residence for the arrogant?

ayah.transliteration: Wa yunajjil laahul lazee nat taqaw bimafaazatihim laa yamassuhumus sooo'u wa laa hum uahzanoon
ayah.translation: And Allah will save those who feared Him by their attainment; no evil will touch them, nor will they grieve.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahu khaaliqu kulli shai'inw wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shai'inw Wakeel
ayah.translation: Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is, over all things, Disposer of affairs.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo maqaaleedus sa maawaati wal ard; wallazeena kafaroo bi ayaatil laahi ulaaa'ika humul khaasiroon
ayah.translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. And they who disbelieve in the verses of Allah - it is those who are the losers.

ayah.transliteration: Qul afaghairal laahi taamurooonneee a'budu ayyuhal jaahiloon
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Is it other than Allah that you order me to worship, O ignorant ones?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad oohiya ilaika wa ilal lazeena min qablika la in ashrakta la yahbatanna 'amalu ka wa latakoonanna minal khaasireen
ayah.translation: And it was already revealed to you and to those before you that if you should associate [anything] with Allah, your work would surely become worthless, and you would surely be among the losers."

ayah.transliteration: Balil laahha fa'bud wa kum minash shaakireen
ayah.translation: Rather, worship [only] Allah and be among the grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa qadarul laaha haqqa qadrihee wal ardu jamee 'an qabdatuhoo Yawmal Qiyaamit wassamaawaatu matwiyyaatum biyameenih; Subhaanahoo wa Ta'aalaa 'amma yushrikoon
ayah.translation: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal, while the earth entirely will be [within] His grip on the Day of Resurrection, and the heavens will be folded in His right hand. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nufikha fis Soori fas'iqa man fis samaawaati wa man fil ardi illaa man shaa'al lahu summa nufikha feehi ukhraa fa izaa hum qiyaamuny yanzuroon
ayah.translation: And the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will fall dead except whom Allah wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing, looking on.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ashraqatil ardu binoori Rabbihaa wa wudi'al Kitaabu wa jeee'a bin nabiyyeena wash shuhadaaa'i wa qudiya bainahum bilhaqqi wa hum laa yuzlamoon
ayah.translation: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord, and the record [of deeds] will be placed, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought, and it will be judged between them in truth, and they will not be wronged.

ayah.transliteration: Wa wuffiyat kullu nafsim maa 'amilat wa Huwa a'lamubimaa yaf'aloon
ayah.translation: And every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it did; and He is most knowing of what they do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa seeqal lazeena kafaroon ilaa jahannama zumaran battaaa izaa jaaa'oohaa futihat abwaabuhaa wa qaala lahum khazanatuhaaa alam yaatikum Rusulum minkum yatloona 'alaikum Aayaati Rabbikum wa yunziroonakum liqaaa'a Yawmikum haazaa; qaaloo balaa wa laakin haqqat kalimatul 'azaabi 'alal kaafireen
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieved will be driven to Hell in groups until, when they reach it, its gates are opened and its keepers will say, "Did there not come to you messengers from yourselves, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the word of punishment has come into effect upon the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Qeelad khuloo abwaaba jahannama khaalideena feeha fabi'sa maswal mutakabbireen
ayah.translation: [To them] it will be said, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

ayah.transliteration: Wa seeqal lazeenat taqaw Rabbahum ilal Jannati zumaran hattaaa izaa jaaa'oohaa wa futihat abwaabuhaa wa qaala lahum khazanatuhaa salaamun 'alaikum tibtum fadkhuloohaa khaalideen
ayah.translation: But those who feared their Lord will be driven to Paradise in groups until, when they reach it while its gates have been opened and its keepers say, "Peace be upon you; you have become pure; so enter it to abide eternally therein," [they will enter].

ayah.transliteration: Wa waalull hamdulillaahil lazee sadaqanaa wa'dahoo wa awrasanal arda natabaw wa-u minal jannati haisu nashaaa'u fani'ma ajrul 'aamileen
ayah.translation: And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has fulfilled for us His promise and made us inherit the earth [so] we may settle in Paradise wherever we will. And excellent is the reward of [righteous] workers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa taral malaaa'ikata haaaffeena min hawlil 'Arshi yusabbihoona bihamdi Rabbihim wa qudiya bainahum bilhaqqi wa qeelal hamdu lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And you will see the angels surrounding the Throne, exalting [Allah] with praise of their Lord. And it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said, "[All] praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Haa-Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelul Kitaabi minal laahil Azeezil 'Aleem
ayah.translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Ghaafiriz zambi wa qaabilit tawbi shadeedil 'iqaabi zit tawli laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa ilaihil maseer
ayah.translation: The forgiver of sin, acceptor of repentance, severe in punishment, owner of abundance. There is no deity except Him; to Him is the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yujaadilu feee Aayaatil laahi illal lazeena kafaroo falaa yaghrurka taqallubuhum fil bilaad
ayah.translation: No one disputes concerning the signs of Allah except those who disbelieve, so be not deceived by their [uninhibited] movement throughout the land.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohinw wal Ahzaabu mim ba'dihim wa hammat kullu ummatim bi Rasoolihim liyaa khuzoobhu wa jaadaloo bilbaatili liyudhidoo bihil haqqa fa akhaztuhum fakifa kaana 'iqaab
ayah.translation: The people of Noah denied before them and the [disbelieving] factions after them, and every nation intended [a plot] for their messenger to seize him, and they disputed by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth. So I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika haqqat Kalimatu Rabbika 'alal lazeena kafarooo annahum Ashaabun Naar
ayah.translation: And thus has the word of your Lord come into effect upon those who disbelieved that they are companions of the Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yahmiloonal 'Arsha wa man hawlahoo yusabbihoona bihamdi Rabbihim wa yu'minoona bihee wa yastaghfiroona lillazeena aamanoo Rabbanaa wasi'ta kulla shai'ir rahmantanw wa 'ilman faghfir lillazeena taaboo wattaba'oo sabeelaka wa qihim 'azaabal Jaheem
ayah.translation: Those [angels] who carry the Throne and those around it exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and believe in Him and ask forgiveness for those who have believed, [saying], "Our Lord, You have encompassed all things in mercy and knowledge, so forgive those who have repented and followed Your way and protect them from the punishment of Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbannaa wa adkhilhum Jannaati 'adninil latee wa'attahum wa man salaha min aabaaa'ihim wa azwaajihim wa zurriyyaatihim; innaka Antal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Our Lord, and admit them to gardens of perpetual residence which You have promised them and whoever was righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qihimus saiyi-aat; wa man taqis saiyi-aati Yawma'izin faqad rahimtah; wa zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem
ayah.translation: And protect them from the evil consequences [of their deeds]. And he whom You protect from evil consequences that Day - You will have given him mercy. And that is the great attainment."

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena kafaroo yunaadawna lamaqtul laahi akbaru mim maqtikum anfusakum iz tud'awna ilal eemaani fatakfuroon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve will be addressed, "The hatred of Allah for you was [even] greater than your hatred of yourselves [this Day in Hell] when you were invited to faith, but you refused."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo Rabbanaaa amat tanasnataini wa ahyaitanas nataini fa'tarafnaa bizunoo binaa fahal ilaa khuroojim min sabeel
ayah.translation: They will say, "Our Lord, You made us lifeless twice and gave us life twice, and we have confessed our sins. So is there to an exit any way?"

ayah.transliteration: Zaalikum bi annahooo izaa du'iyal laahu wahdahoo kafartum wa iny yushrak bihee tu'minoo; falhukmu lillaahil 'Aliyyil Kabeer
ayah.translation: [They will be told], "That is because, when Allah was called upon alone, you disbelieved; but if others were associated with Him, you believed. So the judgement is with Allah, the Most High, the Grand."

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee yureekum Aayaatihee wa yunazzilu lakum minas samaaa'i rizqaa; wa maa tatazakkaru illaa mai yuneeb
ayah.translation: It is He who shows you His signs and sends down to you from the sky, provision. But none will remember except he who turns back [in repentance].

ayah.transliteration: Fad'ul laaha mukhliseena lahud deena wa law karihal kaafiroon
ayah.translation: So invoke Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, although the disbelievers dislike it.

ayah.transliteration: Rafee'ud darajaati zul 'Arshi yulqir rooha min amrihee 'alaa mai yashaaa'u min 'ibaadihee liyunzira yawmat talaaq
ayah.translation: [He is] the Exalted above [all] degrees, Owner of the Throne; He places the inspiration of His command upon whom He wills of His servants to warn of the Day of Meeting.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma hum baarizoona laa yakhfaa 'alal laahi minhum shai; limanil mulkul Yawma lillaahil Waahidil Qahaar
ayah.translation: The Day they come forth nothing concerning them will be concealed from Allah. To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day? To Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

ayah.transliteration: Al-Yawma tujzaa kullu nafsim bimaa kasabat; laa zulmal Yawm; innal laaha saree'ul hisaab
ayah.translation: This Day every soul will be recompensed for what it earned. No injustice today! Indeed, Allah is swift in account.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anzirhum yawmal aazifati izil quloobu ladal hanaajiri kaazimeen; maa lizzaalimeena min hameeminw wa laa shafee'iny-yutaa'
ayah.translation: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Approaching Day, when hearts are at the throats, filled [with distress]. For the wrongdoers there will be no devoted friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu khaaa'inatal a'yuni wa maa tukhfis sudoor
ayah.translation: He knows that which deceives the eyes and what the breasts conceal.

ayah.transliteration: Wallaahu yaqdee bilhaqq, wallazeena yad'oona min doonihee laa yaqdoona bishai'; innal laaha Huwas Samee'ul Baseer
ayah.translation: And Allah judges with truth, while those they invoke besides Him judge not with anything. Indeed, Allah - He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaseeroo fil ardi fa yanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena kaanoo min qablihim; kaanoo hum ashadda minhum quwwatanw wa aasaaran fil ardi fa akhazahumul laahu bizunoobihim wa maa kaana lahum minal laahi minw waaq
ayah.translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those who were before them? They were greater than them in strength and in impression on the land, but Allah seized them for their sins. And they had not from Allah any protector.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahum kaanat taateehim Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati fakafaroo fa akhazahumul laah; innahoo qawiyyun shadeedul 'iqaab
ayah.translation: That was because their messengers were coming to them with clear proofs, but they disbelieved, so Allah seized them. Indeed, He is Powerful and severe in punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Moosaa bi Aayaatinaa wa sultaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

ayah.transliteration: Ilaa Fir'awna wa Haamaana qa Qaaroona faqaaloo saahirun kazzaab
ayah.translation: To Pharaoh, Haman and Qarun; but they said, "[He is] a magician and a liar."

ayah.transliteration: Falamuna jaaa'ahum bil haqqi min 'indinaa qaaluq tulooo abnaaa'al lazeena aamanoo ma'ahoo wastahyoo nisaaa'ahum; wa maa kaidul kaafireena illaa fee dalaal
ayah.translation: And when he brought them the truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and keep their women alive." But the plan of the disbelievers is not except in error.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Fir'awnu zarooneee aqtul Moosaa walyad'u Rabbahoo inneee akhaafu ai yubaddila deenakum aw ai yuzhira fil ardil fasaad
ayah.translation: And Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him call upon his Lord. Indeed, I fear that he will change your religion or that he will cause corruption in the land."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Moosaaaa innee 'uztu bi Rabbee wa Rabbikum min kulli mutakabbiril laayu'minu bi Yawmil Hisaab
ayah.translation: But Moses said, "Indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant one who does not believe in the Day of Account."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala rajulum mu'minummin Aali Fir'awna yaktumu eemaanahooo ataqtuloona rajulan ai yaqoola Rabbi yal laahu wa qad jaaa'akum bil haiyinaati mir Rabbikum wa iny yaku kaaziban fa'alaihi kazi buhoo wa iny yaku saadiqany yasibkum ba'dul lazee ya'idukum innal laaha laa yahdee man huwa musrifun kaazaab
ayah.translation: And a believing man from the family of Pharaoh who concealed his faith said, "Do you kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is Allah' while he has brought you clear proofs from your Lord? And if he should be lying, then upon him is [the consequence of] his lie; but if he should be truthful, there will strike you some of what he promises you. Indeed, Allah does not guide one who is a transgressor and a liar.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa qawmi lakumul mulkul yawma zaahireena fil ardi famai yansurunaa mim baasil laahi in jaaa'anaa; qaala Fir'awnu maaa ureekum illaa maaa araa wa maaa ahdeekum illaa sabeelar Rashaad
ayah.translation: O my people, sovereignty is yours today, [your being] dominant in the land. But who would protect us from the punishment of Allah if it came to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do not show you except what I see, and I do not guide you except to the way of right conduct."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazee aamana yaa qawmi inneee akhaafu 'alaikum misla yawmil Ahzaab
ayah.translation: And he who believed said, "O my people, indeed I fear for you [a fate] like the day of the companies -

ayah.transliteration: Misla daabi qawmi Noohinw wa 'aadinw wa Samooda wallazeena mim ba'dihim; wa mal laahu yureedu zulmal lil'ibaad
ayah.translation: Like the custom of the people of Noah and of 'Aad and Thamud and those after them. And Allah wants no injustice for [His] servants.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaa qawmi inneee akhaafu 'alaikum yawmat tanaad
ayah.translation: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tuwalloona mud bireena maa lakum minal laahi min 'aasim; wa mai yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo min haad
ayah.translation: The Day you will turn your backs fleeing; there is not for you from Allah any protector. And whoever Allah leaves astray - there is not for him any guide.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'akum Yoosufu min qablu bil baiyinaati famaa ziltum fee shakkim mimaa jaaa'akum bihee hattaaa izaa halaka qultum lai yab asal laahu mim ba'dihee Rasoolaa; kazaalika yudillul laahu man huwa Musrifum murtaab
ayah.translation: And Joseph had already come to you before with clear proofs, but you remained in doubt of that which he brought to you, until when he died, you said, 'Never will Allah send a messenger after him.' Thus does Allah leave astray he who is a transgressor and skeptic."

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yujaadiloona feee Aaayaatil laahi bighairi sultaanin ataahum kabura maqtan 'indal laahi wa 'indal lazeena aamanoo; kazaalika yatha'ul laahu 'alaa kulli qalbi mutakabbirin jabbaar
ayah.translation: Those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without an authority having come to them - great is hatred [of them] in the sight of Allah and in the sight of those who have believed. Thus does Allah seal over every heart [belonging to] an arrogant tyrant.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Fir'awnu yaa Haamaanub-ni lee sarhal la'alleee ablughul asbaab
ayah.translation: And Pharaoh said, "O Haman, construct for me a tower that I might reach the ways -

ayah.transliteration: Asbaabas samaawaati faattali'a ilaaa ilaahi Moosaa wa innee la azunnuhoo kaazibaa; wa kazaalika zuyyina li-Fir'awna sooo'u 'amalihee wa sudda 'anis sabeel; wa maa kaidu Fir'awna illaa fee tabaab
ayah.translation: The ways into the heavens - so that I may look at the deity of Moses; but indeed, I think he is a liar." And thus was made attractive to Pharaoh the evil of his deed, and he was averted from the [right] way. And the plan of Pharaoh was not except in ruin.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeee aamana yaa qawmit tabi'ooni ahdikum sabeelar rashaad
ayah.translation: And he who believed said, "O my people, follow me, I will guide you to the way of right conduct.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa qawmi innamaa haazihil hayaatud dunyaa mataa'unw wa innal Aakhirata hiya daarul qaraar
ayah.translation: O my people, this worldly life is only [temporary] enjoyment, and indeed, the Hereafter - that is the home of [permanent] settlement.

ayah.transliteration: Man 'amila saiyi'atan falaa yujzaaa illaa mislahaa wa man 'amila saaliham min zakarin aw unsaa wa huwa mu'minun fa ulaaa'ika yadkhuloonal Jannata yurzaqoona feehaa bighairi hisaab
ayah.translation: Whoever does an evil deed will not be recompensed except by the like thereof; but whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - those will enter Paradise, being given provision therein without account.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaa qawmi maa leee ad'ookum ilan najaati wa tad'oonaneee ilan Naar
ayah.translation: And O my people, how is it that I invite you to salvation while you invite me to the Fire?

ayah.transliteration: Tad'oonanee li-akfura billaahi wa ushrika bihee maa laisa lee bihee 'ilmunw wa ana ad'ookum ilal'Azeezil Ghaffaar
ayah.translation: You invite me to disbelieve in Allah and associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge, and I invite you to the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

ayah.transliteration: Laa jarama annamaa tad'oonanee ilaihi laisa lahoo da'watun fid dunyaa wa laa fil Aakhirati wa anna maraddanaaa ilal laahi wa annal musrifeenahum Ashaabun Naar
ayah.translation: Assuredly, that to which you invite me has no [response to a] supplication in this world or in the Hereafter; and indeed, our return is to Allah, and indeed, the transgressors will be companions of the Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Fasatazkuroona maaa aqoolu lakum; wa ufawwidu amreee ilal laah; innallaaha baseerum bil'ibaad
ayah.translation: And you will remember what I [now] say to you, and I entrust my affair to Allah. Indeed, Allah is Seeing of [His] servants."

ayah.transliteration: Fa waqaahul laahu saiyiaati maa makaroo wa haaqa bi Aali-Fir'awna sooo'ul 'azaab
ayah.translation: So Allah protected him from the evils they plotted, and the people of Pharaoh were enveloped by the worst of punishment -

ayah.transliteration: An Naaru yu'radoona 'alaihaa ghuduwwanw wa 'ashiyyanw wa Yawma taqoomus Saa'aatu adkhilooo Aala Fir'awna ashaddal 'azaab
ayah.translation: The Fire, they are exposed to it morning and evening. And the Day the Hour appears [it will be said], "Make the people of Pharaoh enter the severest punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz yatahaaajjoona fin Naari fa-yaqoolud du'afaaa'u lillazeenas takbarooo innaa kunnaa lakum taba'an fahal antum mughnoona annaa naseebam minan Naar
ayah.translation: And [mention] when they will argue within the Fire, and the weak will say to those who had been arrogant, "Indeed, we were [only] your followers, so will you relieve us of a share of the Fire?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalal lazeenas takbarooo innaa kullun feehaaa innal laaha qad hakama baynal'ibaad
ayah.translation: Those who had been arrogant will say, "Indeed, all [of us] are in it. Indeed, Allah has judged between the servants."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazena fin Naari likhazanati Jahannamad-'oo Rabbakum yukhaffif 'annaa yawmam minal 'azaab
ayah.translation: And those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Supplicate your Lord to lighten for us a day from the punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo awalam taku taateekum Rusulukum bilbaiyinaati qaaloo balaa' qaaloo fad'oo; wa maa du'aaa'ul kaafireena illaa fee dalaal
ayah.translation: They will say, "Did there not come to you your messengers with clear proofs?" They will say, "Yes." They will reply, "Then supplicate [yourselves], but the supplication of the disbelievers is not except in error."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa lanansuru Rusulanaa wallazeena aamanoo fil hayaatid dunyaa wa Yawma yaqoomul ashhaad
ayah.translation: Indeed, We will support Our messengers and those who believe during the life of this world and on the Day when the witnesses will stand -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma laa yanfa'uz zaalimeena ma'ziratuhum wa lahumul la'natu wa lahum soooud daar
ayah.translation: The Day their excuse will not benefit the wrongdoers, and they will have the curse, and they will have the worst home.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal hudaa wa awrasnaa Baneee Israaa 'eelal Kitaab
ayah.translation: And We had certainly given Moses guidance, and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit the Scripture

ayah.transliteration: Hudanw wa zikraa li ulil albaab
ayah.translation: As guidance and a reminder for those of understanding.

ayah.transliteration: Fasbir inna wa'dal laahi haqqunw wastaghfir lizambika wa sabbih bihamdi Rabbika bil'ashiyyi wal ibkaar
ayah.translation: So be patient, [O Muhammad]. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And ask forgiveness for your sin and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yujaadi loona feee Aayaatil laahi bighairi sultaanin ataahum in fee sudoorihim illaa kibrum maa hum bibaaligheeh; fasta'iz billaahi innahoo Huwas Samee'ul Baseer
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah without [any] authority having come to them - there is not within their breasts except pride, [the extent of] which they cannot reach. So seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, it is He who is the Hearing, the Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Lakhalqus samaawaati wal ardi akbaru min khalqin naasi wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: The creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of mankind, but most of the people do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yastawil a'maa walbaseeru wallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati wa lal museee'; qaleelam maa tatazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And not equal are the blind and the seeing, nor are those who believe and do righteous deeds and the evildoer. Little do you remember.

ayah.transliteration: Innas Saa'ata la aatiyatul laa raiba feehaa wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - but most of the people do not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala Rabbukumud 'ooneee astajib lakum; innal lazeena yastakbiroona an 'ibaadatee sa yadkhuloona jahannama daakhireen
ayah.translation: And your Lord says, "Call upon Me; I will respond to you." Indeed, those who disdain My worship will enter Hell [rendered] contemptible.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul laila litqaskunoo feehi wannahaara mubsiraa; innal laaha lazoo fadlin 'alan naasi wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa yashkuroon
ayah.translation: It is Allah who made for you the night that you may rest therein and the day giving sight. Indeed, Allah is full of bounty to the people, but most of the people are not grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalikumul laahu Rabbukum khaaliqu kulli shai'; laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fa annaa tu'fakoon
ayah.translation: That is Allah, your Lord, Creator of all things; there is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika yu'fakul loazeena kaanoo bi Aayaatil laahi yajhadoon
ayah.translation: Thus were those [before you] deluded who were rejecting the signs of Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul arda qaraaranw wassa maaa'a binaaa'anw wa sawwarakum fa ahsana suwarakum wa razaqakum minat taiyibaat; zaalikumul laahu Rabbukum fatabaarakal laahu Rabbul 'aalameen
ayah.translation: It is Allah who made for you the earth a place of settlement and the sky a ceiling and formed you and perfected your forms and provided you with good things. That is Allah, your Lord; then blessed is Allah, Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal Hayyu laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa fad'oohu mukh liseena lahudeen; alhamdu lillaahi Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: He is the Ever-Living; there is no deity except Him, so call upon Him, [being] sincere to Him in religion. [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Qul innee nuheetu an a'budal lazeena tad'oona min doonil laahi lammaa jaaa'a niyal biyinaatu mir Rabbee wa umirtu an uslima li Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, I have been forbidden to worship those you call upon besides Allah once the clear proofs have come to me from my Lord, and I have been commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee khalaqakum min turaabin summa min nutfatin summa min 'alaqatin summa yukhrijukum tiflan summa litablughooo ashuddakum summa litakoonoo shuyookhaa; wa minkum mai yutawaffaa min qablu wa litablughooo ajalam musam manw-wa la'allakum ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: It is He who created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot; then He brings you out as a child; then [He develops you] that you reach your [time of] maturity, then [further] that you become elders. And among you is he who is taken in death before [that], so that you reach a specified term; and perhaps you will use reason.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee yuhyee wa yumeetu fa izaa qadaaa amran fa innamaa yaqoolu lahoo kun fa yakon
ayah.translation: He it is who gives life and causes death; and when He decrees a matter, He but says to it, "Be," and it is.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara ilal lazeena yujaadiloona feee Aayaatil laahi annaa yusrafoon
ayah.translation: Do you not consider those who dispute concerning the signs of Allah - how are they averted?

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena kazzaboo bil Kitaabi wa bimaa arsalnaa bihee Rusulanaa fasawfa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Those who deny the Book and that with which We sent Our messengers - they are going to know,

ayah.transliteration: Izil aghlaalu feee a'naaqi-him wassalaasilu yashaboon
ayah.translation: When the shackles are around their necks and the chains; they will be dragged

ayah.transliteration: Fil hameemi summa fin Naari Yasjaroon
ayah.translation: In boiling water; then in the Fire they will be filled [with flame].

ayah.transliteration: Summaa qeela lahum ayna maa kuntum tushrikoon
ayah.translation: Then it will be said to them, "Where is that which you used to associate [with Him in worship]

ayah.transliteration: Min doonil laahi qaaloo dalloo 'annaa bal lam nakun nad'oo min qablu shai'aa; kazaalika yudillul laahul kaafireen
ayah.translation: Other than Allah?" They will say, "They have departed from us; rather, we did not used to invoke previously anything." Thus does Allah put astray the disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalikum bimaa kuntum tafrahoona fil ardi bighairil haqqi wa bimaa kuntum tamrahoon
ayah.translation: [The angels will say], "That was because you used to exult upon the earth without right and you used to behave insolently.

ayah.transliteration: Udkhulooo abwaaba Jahannama khaalideena feehaa fabi'sa maswal mutakabbireen
ayah.translation: Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and wretched is the residence of the arrogant."

ayah.transliteration: Fasbir inna wa'dal laahi haqq; fa immaa nuriyannak ba'dal lazee na'i duhum aw natawaffayannaka fa ilainaa yurja'oon
ayah.translation: So be patient, [O Muhammad]; indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We take you in death, it is to Us they will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Rusulam min qablika minhum man qasasnaa 'alaika wa minhum mal lam naqsus 'alaik; wa maa kaana li Rasoolin any yaatiya bi Aayatin illaa bi iznil laah; fa izaa jaaa'a amrul laahi qudiya bilhaqqi wa khasira hunaalikal mubtiloon
ayah.translation: And We have already sent messengers before you. Among them are those [whose stories] We have related to you, and among them are those [whose stories] We have not related to you. And it was not for any messenger to bring a sign [or verse] except by permission of Allah. So when the command of Allah comes, it will be concluded in truth, and the falsifiers will thereupon lose [all].

ayah.transliteration: Allaahul lazee ja'ala lakumul an'aama litarkaboo minhaa wa minhaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: It is Allah who made for you the grazing animals upon which you ride, and some of them you eat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lakum feehaa manaafi'u wa litablughoo 'alaihaa haajatan fee sudoorikum wa 'alaihaa wa 'alal fulki tuhmaloon
ayah.translation: And for you therein are [other] benefits and that you may realize upon them a need which is in your breasts; and upon them and upon ships you are carried.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yureekum Aayaatihee fa ayya Aayaatil laahi tunkiroon
ayah.translation: And He shows you His signs. So which of the signs of Allah do you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yaseeroo fil ardi fa yanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena min qablihim; kaanoo aksara minhum wa ashadda quwwatanw wa aasaaran fil ardi famaaa aghnaa 'anhum maa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? They were more numerous than themselves and greater in strength and in impression on the land, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa jaaa'at hum Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati farihoo bimaa 'indahum minal 'ilmi wa haaqa bihim maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And when their messengers came to them with clear proofs, they [merely] rejoiced in what they had of knowledge, but they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa ra aw baasanaa qaalooo aamannaa billaahi wahdahoo wa kafarnaa bimaa kunnaa bihee mushrikeen
ayah.translation: And when they saw Our punishment, they said," We believe in Allah alone and disbelieve in that which we used to associate with Him."

ayah.transliteration: Falam yaku tanfa 'uhum eemaanuhum lammaa ra-aw baasana sunnatal laahil latee qad khalat fee 'ibaadihee wa khasira hunaalikal kaafiroon
ayah.translation: But never did their faith benefit them once they saw Our punishment. [It is] the established way of Allah which has preceded among His servants. And the disbelievers thereupon lost [all].

ayah.transliteration: Haa Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelum Minar-Rahmaanir-Raheem
ayah.translation: [This is] a revelation from the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful -

ayah.transliteration: Kitaabun fussilat Aayaatuhoo Qur-aanan 'Arabiyyal liqawminy ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: A Book whose verses have been detailed, an Arabic Qur'an for a people who know,

ayah.transliteration: Basheeranw wa nazeeran fa-a'rada aksaruhum fahum laa yasma'oon
ayah.translation: As a giver of good tidings and a warner; but most of them turn away, so they do not hear.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo quloobunaa feee akinnatim mimmaa tad'oonaaa ilaihi wa feee aazaaninaa waqrunw wa mim baininaa wa bainika bijaabun fa'mal innanaa 'aamiloon
ayah.translation: And they say, "Our hearts are within coverings from that to which you invite us, and in our ears is deafness, and between us and you is a partition, so work; indeed, we are working."

ayah.transliteration: Qul innamaaa ana basharum mislukum yoohaaa ilaiya annamaaa ilaahukum Ilaahunw Waahidun fastaqeemooo ilaihi wastagfirooh; wa wailul lil mushrikeen
ayah.translation: Say, O [Muhammad], "I am only a man like you to whom it has been revealed that your god is but one God; so take a straight course to Him and seek His forgiveness." And woe to those who associate others with Allah -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena laa yu'toonaz Zakaata wa hum bil-Aakhiratihum kaafiroon
ayah.translation: Those who do not give zakah, and in the Hereafter they are disbelievers.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati lahum ajrun ghairu mamnoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them is a reward uninterrupted.

ayah.transliteration: Qul a'innakum latakfuroona billazee khalaqal arda fee yawmaini wa taj'aloona lahooo andaadaa; zaalika Rabbul 'aalameen
ayah.translation: Say, "Do you indeed disbelieve in He who created the earth in two days and attribute to Him equals? That is the Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'ala feehaa rawaa siya min fawqihaa wa baaraka feehaa wa qaddara feehaaaa aqwaatahaa feee arba'ati ayyaamin sawaaa'al lissaaa'ileen
ayah.translation: And He placed on the earth firmly set mountains over its surface, and He blessed it and determined therein its [creatures'] sustenance in four days without distinction - for [the information] of those who ask.

ayah.transliteration: Summas tawaaa ilas-samaaa'i wa hiya dukhaanun faqaala lahaa wa lil ardi'tiyaaa taw'an aw karhan qaalataaa atainaa taaa'i'een
ayah.translation: Then He directed Himself to the heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come [into being], willingly or by compulsion." They said, "We have come willingly."

ayah.transliteration: Faqadaahunna sab'a samaawaatin fee yawmaini wa awhaa fee kulli samaaa'in amarahaa; wa zaiyannassa maaa'ad dunyaa bimasaabeeha wa hifzaa; zaalika taqdeerul 'Azeezil 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And He completed them as seven heavens within two days and inspired in each heaven its command. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps and as protection. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-in a'radoo faqul anzartukum saa'iqatam misla saa'iqati 'Aadinw wa Samood
ayah.translation: But if they turn away, then say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt [that struck] 'Aad and Thamud.

ayah.transliteration: Iz jaaa'at humur Rusulu mim baini aydeehim wa min khalfihim allaa ta'budooo illal laaha qaaloo law shaaa'a Rabunaa la anzala malaaa 'ikatan fa innaa bimaaa ursiltum bihee kaafiroon
ayah.translation: [That occurred] when the messengers had come to them before them and after them, [saying], "Worship not except Allah." They said, "If our Lord had willed, He would have sent down the angels, so indeed we, in that with which you have been sent, are disbelievers."

ayah.transliteration: Fa ammaa 'Aadun fastak baroo fil ardi bighairul haqqi wa qaaloo man ashaddu minnaa quwwatan awalam yaraw annal laahal lazee khalaqahum Huwa ashaddu minhum quwwatanw wa kaanoo bi Aayaatinaa yajhadoon
ayah.translation: As for 'Aad, they were arrogant upon the earth without right and said, "Who is greater than us in strength?" Did they not consider that Allah who created them was greater than them in strength? But they were rejecting Our signs.

ayah.transliteration: Fa arsalnaa 'alaihim reehan sarsaran feee ayyaamin nahisaatil linuzeeqahum 'azaabal khizyi fil hayaatid dunyaa wa la'azaabul Aakhirati akhzaa wa hum laa yunsaroon
ayah.translation: So We sent upon them a screaming wind during days of misfortune to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in the worldly life; but the punishment of the Hereafter is more disgracing, and they will not be helped.
