ayah.transliteration: Wa ammaa Samoodu fahadinaahum fastahabbul 'ama 'alal huda fa akhazathum saa'iqatul 'azaabil hooni bimaa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: And as for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them for what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Wa najjainal lazeena aamanoo wa kaanoo yattaqoon
ayah.translation: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yawma yuhsharu a'daaa'ul laahi ilan Naari fahum yooza'oon
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day when the enemies of Allah will be gathered to the Fire while they are [driven] assembled in rows,

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa maa jaaa'oohaa shahida 'alaihim samu'uhum wa absaaruhum wa julooduhum bimaa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Until, when they reach it, their hearing and their eyes and their skins will testify against them of what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo lijuloodihim lima shahittum 'alainaa qaaloo antaqanal laahul lazeee antaqa kulla shai'inw wa Huwa khalaqakum awwala marratinw wa ilaihi turja'oon
ayah.translation: And they will say to their skins, "Why have you testified against us?" They will say, "We were made to speak by Allah, who has made everything speak; and He created you the first time, and to Him you are returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kuntum tastatiroona ai-yashhada 'alaikum sam'ukum wa laaa absaarukum wa laa juloodukum wa laakin zanantum annal laaha laa ya'lamu kaseeram mimmaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And you were not covering yourselves, lest your hearing testify against you or your sight or your skins, but you assumed that Allah does not know much of what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa zaalikum zannukumul lazee zanantum bi-Rabbikum ardaakum fa asbahtum minal khaasireen
ayah.translation: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers."

ayah.transliteration: Fa-iny yasbiroo fan Naaru maswal lahum wa iny-yasta'tiboo famaa hum minal mu'tabeen
ayah.translation: So [even] if they are patient, the Fire is a residence for them; and if they ask to appease [Allah], they will not be of those who are allowed to appease.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaiyadnaa lahum quranaaa'a fazaiyanoo lahum maa baina aideehim wa maa khalfahum wa haqqa 'alaihimul qawlu feee umamin qad khalat min qablihim minal jinni wal insi innahum kaanoo khaasireen
ayah.translation: And We appointed for them companions who made attractive to them what was before them and what was behind them [of sin], and the word has come into effect upon them among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo laa tasma'oo lihaazal Quraani walghaw feehi la'allakum taghlihoon
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say, "Do not listen to this Qur'an and speak noisily during [the recitation of] it that perhaps you will overcome."

ayah.transliteration: Falanuzeeqannal lazeena kafaroo 'azaaban shadeedanw wa lanajziyannahum aswallazee kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: But We will surely cause those who disbelieve to taste a severe punishment, and We will surely recompense them for the worst of what they had been doing.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika jazaaa'u a'daaa'il laahin Naaru lahum feehaa daarul khuld, jazaaa'am bimaa kaanoo bi aayaatinaa yajhdoon
ayah.translation: That is the recompense of the enemies of Allah - the Fire. For them therein is the home of eternity as recompense for what they, of Our verses, were rejecting.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo Rabbanaaa arinal lazaini adal laanaa minal jinni wal insi naj'alhumaa tahta aqdaaminaa liyakoonaa minal asfaleen
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieved will [then] say, "Our Lord, show us those who misled us of the jinn and men [so] we may put them under our feet that they will be among the lowest."

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena qaaloo Rabbunal laahu summas taqaamoo tatanazzalu 'alaihimul malaaa 'ikatu allaa takhaafoo wa laa tahzanoo wa abshiroo bil Jannnatil latee kuntum too'adoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allah " and then remained on a right course - the angels will descend upon them, [saying], "Do not fear and do not grieve but receive good tidings of Paradise, which you were promised.

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu awliyaaa'ukum fil hayaatid dunyaa wa fil Aakhirati wa lakum feehaa maa tashtaheee anfusukum wa lakum feehaa ma tadda'oon
ayah.translation: We [angels] were your allies in worldly life and [are so] in the Hereafter. And you will have therein whatever your souls desire, and you will have therein whatever you request [or wish]

ayah.transliteration: Nuzulam min Ghafoorir Raheem
ayah.translation: As accommodation from a [Lord who is] Forgiving and Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Wa man ahsanu qawlam mimman da'aaa ilal laahi wa 'amila saalihanw wa qaala innanee minal muslimeen
ayah.translation: And who is better in speech than one who invites to Allah and does righteousness and says, "Indeed, I am of the Muslims."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa tastawil hasanatu wa las saiyi'ah; idfa' billatee hiya ahsanu fa'izal lazee bainaka wa bainahoo 'adaawatun ka'annahoo waliyun hameem
ayah.translation: And not equal are the good deed and the bad. Repel [evil] by that [deed] which is better; and thereupon the one whom between you and him is enmity [will become] as though he was a devoted friend.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yulaqqaahaaa illal lazeena sabaroo wa maa yulaqqaahaaa illaa zoo hazzin 'azeem
ayah.translation: But none is granted it except those who are patient, and none is granted it except one having a great portion [of good].

ayah.transliteration: Wa immaa yanzaghannaka minash Shaitaani nazghun fasta'iz billaahi innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And if there comes to you from Satan an evil suggestion, then seek refuge in Allah. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min Aayaatihil lailu wannahaaru washshamsu walqamar; laa tasjudoo lishshamsi wa laa lilqamari wasjudoo lillaahil lazee khala qahunna in kuntum iyyaahu ta'budoon
ayah.translation: And of His signs are the night and day and the sun and moon. Do not prostrate to the sun or to the moon, but prostate to Allah, who created them, if it should be Him that you worship.

ayah.transliteration: Fa inis-takbaroo fallazee na 'inda Rabbika yusabbihoona lahoo billaili wannnahaari wa hum laa yas'amoon
ayah.translation: But if they are arrogant - then those who are near your Lord exalt Him by night and by day, and they do not become weary.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min Aayaatiheee annaka taral arda khaashi'atan fa izaaa anzalna 'alaihal maaa'ah tazzat wa rabat; innal lazeee ahyaahaa lamuhiyil mawtaa; innahoo 'alaa kulli shai-in Qadeer
ayah.translation: And of His signs is that you see the earth stilled, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and grows. Indeed, He who has given it life is the Giver of Life to the dead. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yulhidoona feee Aayaatina laa yakhfawna 'alainaa' afamai yulqaa fin Naari khayrun am mai yaateee aaminai Yawmal Qiyaamah; i'maloo ma shi'tum innahoo bimaa ta'maloona Baseer
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who inject deviation into Our verses are not concealed from Us. So, is he who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you will; indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Inna Lazeena kafaroo biz Zikri lammaa jaa'ahum wa innahoo la Kitaabun 'Azeez
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who disbelieve in the message after it has come to them... And indeed, it is a mighty Book.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yaateehil baatilu mim baini yadaihi wa laa min khalfihee tanzeelum min Hakeemin Hameed
ayah.translation: Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it; [it is] a revelation from a [Lord who is] Wise and Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yuqaalu laka illaa maa qad qeela lir Rusuli min qablik; inna Rabbaka lazoo maghfiratinw wa zoo 'iqaabin aleem
ayah.translation: Nothing is said to you, [O Muhammad], except what was already said to the messengers before you. Indeed, your Lord is a possessor of forgiveness and a possessor of painful penalty.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law ja'alnaahu Qur-aanan A'jamiyyal laqaaloo law laa fussilat Aayaatuhoo 'a A'jamiyyunw wa 'Arabiyy; qul huwa lillazeena aamanoo hudanw wa shifaaa'unw wallazeena la yu'minoona feee aazaanihim waqrunw wa huwa 'alaihim 'amaa; ulaaa'ika yunaadawna mim maakaanim ba'eed
ayah.translation: And if We had made it a non-Arabic Qur'an, they would have said, "Why are its verses not explained in detail [in our language]? Is it a foreign [recitation] and an Arab [messenger]?" Say, "It is, for those who believe, a guidance and cure." And those who do not believe - in their ears is deafness, and it is upon them blindness. Those are being called from a distant place.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Moosal Kitaaba fakhtulifa fee; wa lawlaa Kalimatun sabaqat mir Rabbika laqudiya bainahum; wa innahum lafee shakkim minhu mureeb
ayah.translation: And We had already given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.

ayah.transliteration: Man 'amila salihan falinafshihee wa man asaaa'a fa'alaihaa; wamaa rabbuka bizallaamil lil 'abeed
ayah.translation: Whoever does righteousness - it is for his [own] soul; and whoever does evil [does so] against it. And your Lord is not ever unjust to [His] servants.

ayah.transliteration: Ilaihi yuraddu 'ilmus Saaa'ah; wa maa takhruju min samaraatim min akmaamihaa wa maa tahmilu min unsaa wa laa tada'u illaa bi'ilmih; wa Yawma yunaadeehim aina shurakaaa'ee qaalooo aazannaaka maa minnaa min shaheed
ayah.translation: To him [alone] is attributed knowledge of the Hour. And fruits emerge not from their coverings nor does a female conceive or give birth except with His knowledge. And the Day He will call to them, "Where are My 'partners'?" they will say, "We announce to You that there is [no longer] among us any witness [to that]."

ayah.transliteration: Wa dalla 'anhum maa kaanoo yad'oona min qablu wa zannoo maa lahum mim mahees
ayah.translation: And lost from them will be those they were invoking before, and they will be certain that they have no place of escape.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yas'amul insaanu min du'aaa'il khairi wa im massa hush sharru fa ya'oosun qanoot
ayah.translation: Man is not weary of supplication for good [things], but if evil touches him, he is hopeless and despairing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la in azaqnaahu rahmatam minnaa mim ba'di dar raaa'a massat hu la yaqoolanna haazaa lee wa maaa azunnus Saa'ata qaaa'imatanw wa la'in ruji'tu ilaa Rabbeee inna lee 'indahoo lalhusnaa; falanu nabbi'annal lazeena kafaroo bimaa 'amiloo wa lanuzeeqan nahum min 'azaabin ghaleez
ayah.translation: And if We let him taste mercy from Us after an adversity which has touched him, he will surely say, "This is [due] to me, and I do not think the Hour will occur; and [even] if I should be returned to my Lord, indeed, for me there will be with Him the best." But We will surely inform those who disbelieved about what they did, and We will surely make them taste a massive punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaaa an'amnaa 'alal insaani a'rada wa na-aa bijaani bihee wa izaa massahush sharru fazoo du'aaa'in 'areed
ayah.translation: And when We bestow favor upon man, he turns away and distances himself; but when evil touches him, then he is full of extensive supplication.

ayah.transliteration: Qul araiaitum in kaana min 'indil laahi summa kafar tum bihee man adallu mimman huwa fee shiqaqim ba'eed
ayah.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if the Qur'an is from Allah and you disbelieved in it, who would be more astray than one who is in extreme dissension?"

ayah.transliteration: Sanureehim Aayaatinaa fil aafaaqi wa feee anfusihim hattaa yatabaiyana lahum annahul haqq; awa lam yakfi bi Rabbika annahoo 'alaa kulli shai-in Shaheed
ayah.translation: We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves until it becomes clear to them that it is the truth. But is it not sufficient concerning your Lord that He is, over all things, a Witness?

ayah.transliteration: Alaaa innahum fee miryatim mil liqaaa'i Rabbihim; alaaa innahoo bikulli shai'im muheet
ayah.translation: Unquestionably, they are in doubt about the meeting with their Lord. Unquestionably He is, of all things, encompassing.

ayah.transliteration: Haa Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: 'Ayyyn Seeen Qaaaf
ayah.translation: 'Ayn, Seen, Qaf.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika yooheee ilaika wa ilal lazeena min qablikal laahul 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Thus has He revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and to those before you - Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo maa fis samaa waati wa maa fil ardi wa Huwal 'Aliyul 'Azeem
ayah.translation: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and He is the Most High, the Most Great.

ayah.transliteration: Takaadus samaawaatu yatafattarna min fawqihinn; walmalaaa'ikatu yusabbihoona bihamdi Rabbihim wa yastaghfiroona liman fil ard; alaaa innal laaha huwal Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: The heavens almost break from above them, and the angels exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord and ask forgiveness for those on earth. Unquestionably, it is Allah who is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeenat takhazoo min dooniheee awliyaaa'al laahu hafeezun 'alaihim wa maaa anta 'alaihim biwakeel
ayah.translation: And those who take as allies other than Him - Allah is [yet] Guardian over them; and you, [O Muhammad], are not over them a manager.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika awhainaaa llaika Qur-aanan 'Arabiyyal litunzir aUmmal Quraa wa man hawlahaa wa tunzira Yawmal Jam'ilaa raiba feeh; fareequn fil jannati wa fareequn fissa'eer
ayah.translation: And thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn the Mother of Cities [Makkah] and those around it and warn of the Day of Assembly, about which there is no doubt. A party will be in Paradise and a party in the Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law shaaa'al laahu laja'alahum ummatanw waahi datanw walaakiny yudkhilumany yashaaa'u fee rahmatih; waz zaalimoona maa lahum minw waliyyinw wa laa naseer
ayah.translation: And if Allah willed, He could have made them [of] one religion, but He admits whom He wills into His mercy. And the wrongdoers have not any protector or helper.

ayah.transliteration: Amit takhazoo min dooniheee awliyaaa'a fallaahu Huwal Waliyyu wa Huwa yuhyil mawtaa wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: Or have they taken protectors [or allies] besides him? But Allah - He is the Protector, and He gives life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa makh-talaftum feehi min shai'in fahukmuhooo ilallaah; zaalikumul laahu Rabbee 'alaihi tawakkaltu wa ilaihi uneeb
ayah.translation: And in anything over which you disagree - its ruling is [to be referred] to Allah. [Say], "That is Allah, my Lord; upon Him I have relied, and to Him I turn back."

ayah.transliteration: Faatirus samaawaati wal ard; ja'ala lakum min anfusikum azwaajanw wa minal an'aami azwaajany yazra'ukum feeh; laisa kamislihee shai'unw wa Huwas Samee'ul Baseer
ayah.translation: [He is] Creator of the heavens and the earth. He has made for you from yourselves, mates, and among the cattle, mates; He multiplies you thereby. There is nothing like unto Him, and He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo maqaaleedus samaawaati wal ardi yabsutur rizqa limany yashaaa'u wa yaqdir; innahoo bikulli shai'unw wa Huwas Samee'ul Baseer
ayah.translation: To Him belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. He extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Shara'a lakum minad deeni maa wassaa bihee Noohanw wallazeee awhainaaa ilaika wa maa wassainaa biheee Ibraaheema wa Moosa wa 'Eesaaa an aqeemud adeena wa laa tatafarraqoo feeh; kabura 'alal mushrikeena maa tad'oohum ilaih; Allaahu yajtabee ilaihi many yashaaa'u wa yahdeee ilaihi mai yuneeb
ayah.translation: He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and not be divided therein. Difficult for those who associate others with Allah is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him].

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa tafarraqooo illaa mim ba'di maa jaaa'ahumul 'ilmu baghyam bainahum; wa law laa Kalimatun sabaqat mir Rabbika ilaaa ajalim musammal laqudiya bainahum; wa innal lazeena oorisul Kitaaba mim ba'dihim lafee shakkim minhu mureeb
ayah.translation: And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord [postponing the penalty] until a specified time, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, those who were granted inheritance of the Scripture after them are, concerning it, in disquieting doubt.

ayah.transliteration: Falizaalika fad'u wastaqim kamaaa umirta wa laa tattabi' ahwaaa'ahum wa qul aamantu bimaaa anzalal laahu min Kitaab, wa umirtu li a'dila bainakum Allaahu Rabbunaa wa Rabbukum lanaaa a'maa lunaa wa lakum a'maalukim laa hujjata bainanaa wa baina kumul laahu yajma'u bainanaa wa ilaihil maseer
ayah.translation: So to that [religion of Allah] invite, [O Muhammad], and remain on a right course as you are commanded and do not follow their inclinations but say, "I have believed in what Allah has revealed of the Qur'an, and I have been commanded to do justice among you. Allah is our Lord and your Lord. For us are our deeds, and for you your deeds. There is no [need for] argument between us and you. Allah will bring us together, and to Him is the [final] destination."

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yuhaaajjoona fil laahi mim ba'di mastujeeba lahoo hujjatuhum daahidatun 'inda Rabbihim wa 'alaihim ghadabunw wa lahum 'azaabun shadeed
ayah.translation: And those who argue concerning Allah after He has been responded to - their argument is invalid with their Lord, and upon them is [His] wrath, and for them is a severe punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Allahul lazeee anzalal Kitaaba bilhaqqi wal Meezaan; wa ma yudreeka la'allas Saa'ata qareeb
ayah.translation: It is Allah who has sent down the Book in truth and [also] the balance. And what will make you perceive? Perhaps the Hour is near.

ayah.transliteration: Yasta'jilu bihal lazeena laa yu'minoona bihaa wallazeena aamanoo mushfiqoona minhaa wa ya'lamoona annahal haqq; alaaa innal lazeena yumaaroona fis Saa'ati lafee dalaalim ba'eed
ayah.translation: Those who do not believe in it are impatient for it, but those who believe are fearful of it and know that it is the truth. Unquestionably, those who dispute concerning the Hour are in extreme error.

ayah.transliteration: Allahu lateefum bi'ibaadihee yarzuqu mai yashaaa'u wa Huwal Qawiyyul 'Azeez
ayah.translation: Allah is Subtle with His servants; He gives provisions to whom He wills. And He is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.

ayah.transliteration: Man kaana yureedu harsal Aakhirati nazid lahoo fee harsihee wa man kaana yureedu harsad dunyaa nu'tihee mnhaa wa maa lahoo fil Aakhirati min naseeb
ayah.translation: Whoever desires the harvest of the Hereafter - We increase for him in his harvest. And whoever desires the harvest of this world - We give him thereof, but there is not for him in the Hereafter any share.

ayah.transliteration: Am lahum shurakaaa'u shara'oo lahum minad deeni maa lam yaazam bihil laah; wa law laa kalimatul fasli laqudiya bainahum; wa innaz zaalimeena lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: Or have they other deities who have ordained for them a religion to which Allah has not consented? But if not for the decisive word, it would have been concluded between them. And indeed, the wrongdoers will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Taraz zaalimeena mushfiqeena mimmaa kasaboo wa huwa waaqi'um bihim; wallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati fee rawdaatil jannaati lahum maa yashaaa'oona 'inda Rabbihim; zaalika huwal fadlul kabeer
ayah.translation: You will see the wrongdoers fearful of what they have earned, and it will [certainly] befall them. And those who have believed and done righteous deeds will be in lush regions of the gardens [in Paradise] having whatever they will in the presence of their Lord. That is what is the great bounty.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalikal lazee yubash shirul laahu 'ibaadahul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaat; qul laaa as'alukum 'alaihi ajran illal mawaddata fil qurbaa; wa mai yaqtarif hasanatan nazid lahoo feehaa husnaa; innal laaha Ghafoorun Shakoor
ayah.translation: It is that of which Allah gives good tidings to His servants who believe and do righteous deeds. Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for this message any payment [but] only good will through kinship." And whoever commits a good deed - We will increase for him good therein. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Appreciative.

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloonaf tara 'alal laahi kaziban fa-iny yasha il laahu yakhtim 'alaa qalbik; wa yamhul laahul baatila wa yuhiqqul haqqa bi Kalimaatih; innahoo 'Aleemum bizaatis sudoor
ayah.translation: Or do they say, "He has invented about Allah a lie"? But if Allah willed, He could seal over your heart. And Allah eliminates falsehood and establishes the truth by His words. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee yaqbalut tawbata 'an 'ibaadihee wa ya'foo 'anis saiyiaati wa ya'lamu maa taf'aloon
ayah.translation: And it is He who accepts repentance from his servants and pardons misdeeds, and He knows what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yastajeebul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilu saalihaati wa yazeeduhum min fadlih; wal kaafiroona lahum 'azaabun shadeed
ayah.translation: And He answers [the supplication of] those who have believed and done righteous deeds and increases [for] them from His bounty. But the disbelievers will have a severe punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law basatal laahur rizqa li'ibaadihee labaghaw fil ardi wa laakiny yunazzilu biqadarim maa yashaaa'; innahoo bi'ibaadihee Khabeerum Baseer
ayah.translation: And if Allah had extended [excessively] provision for His servants, they would have committed tyranny throughout the earth. But He sends [it] down in an amount which He wills. Indeed He is, of His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee yunazzilul ghaisa mim ba'di maa qanatoo wa yanshuru rahmatah; wa Huwal Waliyyul Hameed
ayah.translation: And it is He who sends down the rain after they had despaired and spreads His mercy. And He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min Aayaatihee khalqus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bassa feehimaa min daaabbah; wa Huwa 'alaa jam'ihim izaa yashaaa'u Qadeer
ayah.translation: And of his signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and what He has dispersed throughout them of creatures. And He, for gathering them when He wills, is competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa asaabakum mim museebatin fabimaa kasabat aydeekum wa ya'foo 'an kaseer
ayah.translation: And whatever strikes you of disaster - it is for what your hands have earned; but He pardons much.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa antum bimu'jizeena fil ardi wa maa lakum min doonil laahi minw wa liyyinw wa laa naseer
ayah.translation: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth. And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min Aayaatihil ja waarifil bahri kal a'lam
ayah.translation: And of His signs are the ships in the sea, like mountains.

ayah.transliteration: Iny yashaaa yuskinir reeha fa yazlalna rawaakida 'alaa zahirh; inna fee zaalika la Aayaatil likulli sabbaarin shakoor
ayah.translation: If He willed, He could still the wind, and they would remain motionless on its surface. Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Aw yoobiqhunna bimaa kasaboo wa ya'fu 'an kaseer
ayah.translation: Or He could destroy them for what they earned; but He pardons much.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ya'lamal lazeena yujaadiloona feee Aayaatinaa maa lahum mim mahees
ayah.translation: And [that is so] those who dispute concerning Our signs may know that for them there is no place of escape.

ayah.transliteration: Famaa ooteetum min shai'in famataa'ul hayaatid dunyaa wa maa 'indal laahi khairunw wa abqaa lillazeena aamanoo wa 'alaa Rabbihim yatawakkaloon
ayah.translation: So whatever thing you have been given - it is but [for] enjoyment of the worldly life. But what is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who have believed and upon their Lord rely

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yajtaniboona kabaaa'iral ismi wal fawaa hisha wa izaa maa ghadiboo hum yaghfiroon
ayah.translation: And those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, and when they are angry, they forgive,

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeenas tajaaboo li Rabbhim wa aqaamus Salaata wa amruhum shooraa bainahum wa mimmaa razaqnaahum yunfiqoon
ayah.translation: And those who have responded to their lord and established prayer and whose affair is [determined by] consultation among themselves, and from what We have provided them, they spend.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena izaa asaabahumul baghyu hum yantasiroon
ayah.translation: And those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves,

ayah.transliteration: Wa jazaaa'u saiyi'atin saiyi'tum misluha faman 'afaa wa aslaha fa ajruhoo 'alal laah; innahoo laa yuhibbuz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And the retribution for an evil act is an evil one like it, but whoever pardons and makes reconciliation - his reward is [due] from Allah. Indeed, He does not like wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lamanin tasara ba'da zulmihee fa ulaaa'ika maa 'alaihim min sabeel
ayah.translation: And whoever avenges himself after having been wronged - those have not upon them any cause [for blame].

ayah.transliteration: Innamas sabeelu 'alal lazeena yazlimoonan naasa wa yabghoona fil ardi bighairil haqq; ulaaa'ika lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: The cause is only against the ones who wrong the people and tyrannize upon the earth without right. Those will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laman sabara wa ghafara inna zaalika lamin 'azmil umoor
ayah.translation: And whoever is patient and forgives - indeed, that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo minw waliyyim mim ba'dih; wa taraz zaalimeena lammaa ra awul 'azaaba yaqooloona hal ilaa maraddim min sabeel
ayah.translation: And he whom Allah sends astray - for him there is no protector beyond Him. And you will see the wrongdoers, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there for return [to the former world] any way?"

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraahum yu'radoona 'alaihaa khaashi'eena minazzulli yanzuroona min tarfin khaifiyy; wa qaalal lazeena aamanooo innal khaasireenal lazeena khasiroon anfusahum wa ahleehim Yawmal Qiyaamah; alaaa innaz zaalimeena fee'azaabim muqeem
ayah.translation: And you will see them being exposed to the Fire, humbled from humiliation, looking from [behind] a covert glance. And those who had believed will say, "Indeed, the [true] losers are the ones who lost themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, the wrongdoers are in an enduring punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kaana lahum min awliyaaa'a yansuroonahum min doonil laah; wa mai yudlilil laahu famaa lahoo min sabeel
ayah.translation: And there will not be for them any allies to aid them other than Allah. And whoever Allah sends astray - for him there is no way.

ayah.transliteration: Istajeeboo li Rabbikum min qabli any yaatiya Yawmul laa maradda lahoo minal laah; maa lakum mim malja iny yawma'izinw wa maa lakum min nakeer
ayah.translation: Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. No refuge will you have that day, nor for you will there be any denial.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-in a'radoo famaaa arsalnaaka 'alaihim hafeezan in 'alaika illal balaagh; wa innaaa izaaa azaqnal insaana minnaa rahmatan fariha bihaa wa in tusibhum saiyi'atum bimaa qaddamat aydeehim fa innal insaana kafoor
ayah.translation: But if they turn away - then We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a guardian; upon you is only [the duty of] notification. And indeed, when We let man taste mercy from us, he rejoices in it; but if evil afflicts him for what his hands have put forth, then indeed, man is ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Lillaahi mulkus samaawaati wal ard; yakhluqu maa yashaaa'; yahabu limai yashaaa'u inaasanw wa yahabu limai yashaaa'uz zukoor
ayah.translation: To Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth; He creates what he wills. He gives to whom He wills female [children], and He gives to whom He wills males.

ayah.transliteration: Aw yuzawwijuhum zukraananw wa inaasanw wa yaj'alu mai yashaaa'u 'aqeemaa; innahoo 'Aleemun Qadeer
ayah.translation: Or He makes them [both] males and females, and He renders whom He wills barren. Indeed, He is Knowing and Competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa kaana libasharin any yukallimahul laahu illaa wahyan aw minw waraaa'i hijaabin aw yursila Rasoolan fa yoohiya bi iznuhee maa yashaaa'; innahoo 'Aliyyun Hakeem
ayah.translation: And it is not for any human being that Allah should speak to him except by revelation or from behind a partition or that He sends a messenger to reveal, by His permission, what He wills. Indeed, He is Most High and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika awhainaaa ilaika rooham min amrinaa; maa kunta tadree mal Kitaabu wa lal eemaanu wa laakin ja'alnaahu nooran nahdee bihee man nashaaa'u min 'ibaadinaa; wa innaka latahdeee ilaaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And thus We have revealed to you an inspiration of Our command. You did not know what is the Book or [what is] faith, but We have made it a light by which We guide whom We will of Our servants. And indeed, [O Muhammad], you guide to a straight path -

ayah.transliteration: Siraatil laahil lazee lahoo maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ard; alaaa ilal laahi taseerul umoor
ayah.translation: The path of Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unquestionably, to Allah do [all] matters evolve.

ayah.transliteration: Haa-Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Wal Kitaabil Mubeen
ayah.translation: By the clear Book,

ayah.transliteration: Innaa ja'alnaahu Quraanan 'Arabiyyal la'allakum ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have made it an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo feee Ummil Kitaabi Ladainaa la'aliyyun hakeem
ayah.translation: And indeed it is, in the Mother of the Book with Us, exalted and full of wisdom.

ayah.transliteration: Afanadribu 'ankumuz Zikra safhan an kuntum qawmam musrifeen
ayah.translation: Then should We turn the message away, disregarding you, because you are a transgressing people?

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam arsalnaa min Nabiyyin fil awwaleen
ayah.translation: And how many a prophet We sent among the former peoples,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yaateehim min Nabiyyin illaa kaanoo bihee yasahzi'oon
ayah.translation: But there would not come to them a prophet except that they used to ridicule him.

ayah.transliteration: Fa ahlaknaaa ashadda minhum batshanw wa madaa masalul lawwaleen
ayah.translation: And We destroyed greater than them in [striking] power, and the example of the former peoples has preceded.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'in sa altahum man khalaqas samaawaati wal arda la yaqoolunna khalaqa hunnal 'Azeezul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: And if you should ask them, "Who has created the heavens and the earth?" they would surely say, "They were created by the Exalted in Might, the Knowing."

ayah.transliteration: Allazee ja'ala lakumul arda mahdanw wa ja'ala lakum feehaa subulal la'allakum tahtadoon
ayah.translation: [The one] who has made for you the earth a bed and made for you upon it roads that you might be guided

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee nazzala minas samaaa'i maaa'am biqadarin fa anshamaa bihee baldatam maitaa' kazaalika tukhrajoon
ayah.translation: And who sends down rain from the sky in measured amounts, and We revive thereby a dead land - thus will you be brought forth -

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee khalaqal azwaaja kullahaa wa ja'ala lakum minal fulki wal-an'aami maa tarkaboon
ayah.translation: And who created the species, all of them, and has made for you of ships and animals those which you mount.

ayah.transliteration: Litastawoo 'alaa zuhoorihee summa tazkuroo ni'mata Rabbikum izastawaitum 'alaihi wa taqooloo Subhaanal lazee sakhkhara lana haaza wa maa kunnaa lahoo muqrineen
ayah.translation: That you may settle yourselves upon their backs and then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled upon them and say. "Exalted is He who has subjected this to us, and we could not have [otherwise] subdued it.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innaaa ilaa Rabbinaa lamunqaliboon
ayah.translation: And indeed we, to our Lord, will [surely] return."

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'aloo lahoo min 'ibaadihee juz'aa; innal insaana lakafoorum mubeen
ayah.translation: But they have attributed to Him from His servants a portion. Indeed, man is clearly ungrateful.

ayah.transliteration: Amit takhaza mimmaa yakhluqu banaatinw wa asfaakum bilbaneen
ayah.translation: Or has He taken, out of what He has created, daughters and chosen you for [having] sons?

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa bushshira ahaduhum bimaa daraba lir Rahmaani masalan zalla wajhuhoo muswaddanw wa hua kazeem
ayah.translation: And when one of them is given good tidings of that which he attributes to the Most Merciful in comparison, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

ayah.transliteration: Awa mai yunashsha'u fil hilyati wa huwa fil khisaami ghairu mubeen
ayah.translation: So is one brought up in ornaments while being during conflict unevident [attributed to Allah]?

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alul malaaa'ikatal lazeena hum 'ibaadur Rahmaani inaasaa; a shahidoo khalaqhum; satuktabu shahaa datuhum wa yus'aloon
ayah.translation: And they have made the angels, who are servants of the Most Merciful, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded, and they will be questioned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo law shaaa'ar Rahmaanu maa 'abadnaahum; maa lahum bizaalika min 'ilmin in hum illaa yakhrusoon
ayah.translation: And they said, "If the Most Merciful had willed, we would not have worshipped them." They have of that no knowledge. They are not but falsifying.

ayah.transliteration: Am aatainaahum Kitaabam min qablihee fahum bihee mustamsikoon
ayah.translation: Or have We given them a book before the Qur'an to which they are adhering?

ayah.transliteration: Bal qaalooo innaa wajadnaaa aabaaa'anaa 'alaaa ummatinw wa innaa 'alaaa aasaarihim muhtadoon
ayah.translation: Rather, they say, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are in their footsteps [rightly] guided."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazaalika maaa arsalnaa min qablika fee qaryatim min nazeerin illaa qaala mutrafoohaaa innaa wajadnaaa aabaaa'anaa 'alaaa ummatinw wa innaa 'alaaa aasaarihim muqtadoon
ayah.translation: And similarly, We did not send before you any warner into a city except that its affluent said, "Indeed, we found our fathers upon a religion, and we are, in their footsteps, following."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala awa law ji'tukum bi ahdaa mimmaa wajattum 'alaihi aabaaa'akum qaalooo innaa bimaaa ursiltum bihee kaafiroon
ayah.translation: [Each warner] said, "Even if I brought you better guidance than that [religion] upon which you found your fathers?" They said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."

ayah.transliteration: Fantaqamnaa minhum fanzur kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul mukazzibeen
ayah.translation: So we took retribution from them; then see how was the end of the deniers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qaala Ibraaheemu liabeehi wa qawmiheee innane baraaa'um mimmaa ta'budo
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Abraham said to his father and his people, "Indeed, I am disassociated from that which you worship

ayah.transliteration: Illal lazee fataranee innahoo sa yahdeen
ayah.translation: Except for He who created me; and indeed, He will guide me."

ayah.transliteration: Wa ja'alahaa Kalimatam baaqiyatan fee 'aqibihee la'al lahum yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And he made it a word remaining among his descendants that they might return [to it].

ayah.transliteration: Bal matta'tu haaa'ulaaa'i wa aabaaa'ahum hattaa jaaa'a humul haqqu wa Rasoolum mubeen
ayah.translation: However, I gave enjoyment to these [people of Makkah] and their fathers until there came to them the truth and a clear Messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa jaaa'ahumul haqqu qaaloo haazaa sihrunw wa innaa bihee kaafiroon
ayah.translation: But when the truth came to them, they said, "This is magic, and indeed we are, concerning it, disbelievers."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo law laa nuzzila haazal Quraanu 'alaa rajulim minal qaryataini 'azeem
ayah.translation: And they said, "Why was this Qur'an not sent down upon a great man from [one of] the two cities?"

ayah.transliteration: Ahum yaqsimoona rahmata Rabbik; Nahnu qasamnaa bainahum ma'eeshatahum fil hayaatid dunyaa wa rafa'naa ba'dahum fawqa ba'din darajaatil liyattakhiza ba'duhum ba'dan sukhriyyaa; wa rahmatu Rabbika khairum mimmaa yajma'oon
ayah.translation: Do they distribute the mercy of your Lord? It is We who have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of this world and have raised some of them above others in degrees [of rank] that they may make use of one another for service. But the mercy of your Lord is better than whatever they accumulate.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa any yakoonan naasu ummatanw waahidatal laja'alnaa limany yakfuru bir Rahmaani libu yootihim suqufam min fiddatinw wa ma'aarija 'alaihaa yazharoon
ayah.translation: And if it were not that the people would become one community [of disbelievers], We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Merciful - for their houses - ceilings and stairways of silver upon which to mount

ayah.transliteration: Wa libu yootihim abwaabanw wa sururan 'alaihaa yattaki'oon
ayah.translation: And for their houses - doors and couches [of silver] upon which to recline

ayah.transliteration: Wa zukhrufaa; wa in kullu zaalika lammaa mataa'ul hayaatid dunyaa; wal aakhiratu 'inda Rabbika lilmuttaqeen
ayah.translation: And gold ornament. But all that is not but the enjoyment of worldly life. And the Hereafter with your Lord is for the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mai ya'shu 'an zikrir Rahmaani nuqaiyid lahoo Shaitaanan fahuwa lahoo qareen
ayah.translation: And whoever is blinded from remembrance of the Most Merciful - We appoint for him a devil, and he is to him a companion.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahum la yasuddoo nahum 'anis sabeeli wa yahsaboona annahum muhtadoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, the devils avert them from the way [of guidance] while they think that they are [rightly] guided

ayah.transliteration: Hattaaa izaa jaaa'anaa qaala yaa laita bainee wa bainaka bu'dal mashriqaini fabi'sal qareen
ayah.translation: Until, when he comes to Us [at Judgement], he says [to his companion], "Oh, I wish there was between me and you the distance between the east and west - how wretched a companion."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lai yanfa'akumul Yawma iz zalamtum annakum fil 'azaabi mushtarikoon
ayah.translation: And never will it benefit you that Day, when you have wronged, that you are [all] sharing in the punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Afa anta tusmi'us summa aw tahdil 'umya wa man kaana fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: Then will you make the deaf hear, [O Muhammad], or guide the blind or he who is in clear error?

ayah.transliteration: Fa immaa nazhabanna bika fa innaa minhum muntaqimoon
ayah.translation: And whether [or not] We take you away [in death], indeed, We will take retribution upon them.

ayah.transliteration: Aw nuriyannakal lazee wa'adnaahum fa innaa 'alaihim muqtadiroon
ayah.translation: Or whether [or not] We show you that which We have promised them, indeed, We are Perfect in Ability.

ayah.transliteration: Fastamsik billazeee oohi ya ilaika innaka 'alaa Siraatim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: So adhere to that which is revealed to you. Indeed, you are on a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo lazikrul laka wa liqawmika wa sawfa tus'aloon
ayah.translation: And indeed, it is a remembrance for you and your people, and you [all] are going to be questioned.

ayah.transliteration: Was'al man arsalnaa min qablika mir Rusulinaaa aja'alnaa min doonir Rahmaani aalihatany yu badoon
ayah.translation: And ask those We sent before you of Our messengers; have We made besides the Most Merciful deities to be worshipped?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Moosaa bi aayaatinaaa ilaa Fir'awna wa mala'ihee faqaala innee Rasoolu Rabbil 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And certainly did We send Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his establishment, and he said, "Indeed, I am the messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Falammma jaaa'ahum bi aayaatinaaa izaa hum minhaa yadhakoon
ayah.translation: But when he brought them Our signs, at once they laughed at them.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa nureehim min aayatin illaa hiya akbaru min ukhtihaa wa akhaznaahum bil'azaabi la'allahum yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And We showed them not a sign except that it was greater than its sister, and We seized them with affliction that perhaps they might return [to faith].

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo yaaa ayyuhas saahirud'u lanaa Rabbaka bimaa 'ahida 'indaka innanaa lamuhtadoon
ayah.translation: And they said [to Moses], "O magician, invoke for us your Lord by what He has promised you. Indeed, we will be guided."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa kashafnaa 'anhumul 'azaaba izaa hum yankusoon
ayah.translation: But when We removed from them the affliction, at once they broke their word.

ayah.transliteration: Wa naadaa Fir'awnu fee qawmihee qaala yaa qawmi alaisa lee mulku Misra wa haazihil anhaaru tajree min tahtee afalaa tubsiroon
ayah.translation: And Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "O my people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers flowing beneath me; then do you not see?

ayah.transliteration: Am ana khairum min haazal lazee huwa maheenunw wa laa yuakaadu yubeen
ayah.translation: Or am I [not] better than this one who is insignificant and hardly makes himself clear?

ayah.transliteration: Falaw laa ulqiya 'alaihi aswiratum min zahabin awjaaa'a ma'ahul malaaa'ikatu muqtarineen
ayah.translation: Then why have there not been placed upon him bracelets of gold or come with him the angels in conjunction?"

ayah.transliteration: Fastakhaffa qawmahoo fa ataa'ooh; innahum kaanoo qawman faasiqeen
ayah.translation: So he bluffed his people, and they obeyed him. Indeed, they were [themselves] a people defiantly disobedient [of Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Falammaaa aasafoonan taqamnaa minhum fa aghraqnaahum ajma'een
ayah.translation: And when they angered Us, We took retribution from them and drowned them all.

ayah.transliteration: Faja'alnaahum salafanw wa masalal lil aakhireen
ayah.translation: And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa duribab nu Maryama masalan izaa qawmu ka minhu yasidoon
ayah.translation: And when the son of Mary was presented as an example, immediately your people laughed aloud.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalooo 'a-aalihatunaa khairun am hoo; maa daraboohu laka illaa jadalaa; balhum qawmun khasimoon
ayah.translation: And they said, "Are your gods better, or is he?" They did not present the comparison except for [mere] argument. But, [in fact], they are a people prone to dispute.

ayah.transliteration: In huwa illaa 'abdun an'amnaa 'alaihi wa ja'alnaahu masalal li Baneee Israaa'eel
ayah.translation: Jesus was not but a servant upon whom We bestowed favor, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law nashaaa'u laja'alnaa minkum malaaa'ikatan fil ardi yakhlufoon
ayah.translation: And if We willed, We could have made [instead] of you angels succeeding [one another] on the earth.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo la'ilmul lis Saa'ati fala tamtarunna bihaa wattabi'oon; haazaa Siraatum Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: And indeed, Jesus will be [a sign for] knowledge of the Hour, so be not in doubt of it, and follow Me. This is a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yasuddan nakumush Shaitaanu innahoo lakum 'aduwwum mubeen
ayah.translation: And never let Satan avert you. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lammaa jaaa'a 'Eesaa bilbaiyinaati qaala qad ji'tukum bil Hikmati wa li-ubaiyina lakum ba'dal lazee takhtalifoona feehi fattaqul laaha wa atee'oon
ayah.translation: And when Jesus brought clear proofs, he said, "I have come to you with wisdom and to make clear to you some of that over which you differ, so fear Allah and obey me.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha Huwa Rabbee wa Rabbukum fa'budooh; haaza Siraatum Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path."

ayah.transliteration: Fakhtalafal ahzaabu mim bainihim fawailul lillazeena zalamoo min 'azaabi Yawmin aleem
ayah.translation: But the denominations from among them differed [and separated], so woe to those who have wronged from the punishment of a painful Day.

ayah.transliteration: Hal yanzuroona illas Saa'ata an taatiyahum baghtatanw wa hum laa yash'uroon
ayah.translation: Are they waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly while they perceive not?

ayah.transliteration: Al akhillaaa'u Yawma'izim ba'duhum liba'din 'aduwwun illal muttaqeen
ayah.translation: Close friends, that Day, will be enemies to each other, except for the righteous

ayah.transliteration: Yaa 'ibaadi laa khawfun 'alaikumul Yawma wa laaa antum tahzanoon
ayah.translation: [To whom Allah will say], "O My servants, no fear will there be concerning you this Day, nor will you grieve,

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena aamanoo bi Aayaatinaa wa kaanoo muslimeen
ayah.translation: [You] who believed in Our verses and were Muslims.

ayah.transliteration: Udkhulul Jannata antum wa azwaajukum tuhbaroon
ayah.translation: Enter Paradise, you and your kinds, delighted."

ayah.transliteration: Yutaafu 'alaihim bishaa fim min zahabinw wa akwaab, wa feehaa maatashtaheehil anfusu wa talazzul a'yunu wa antum feehaa khaalidoon
ayah.translation: Circulated among them will be plates and vessels of gold. And therein is whatever the souls desire and [what] delights the eyes, and you will abide therein eternally.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tilkal jannatul lateee ooristumoohaa bimaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And that is Paradise which you are made to inherit for what you used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Lakum feehaa faakihatun kaseeratum minhaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: For you therein is much fruit from which you will eat.

ayah.transliteration: Innal mujrimeena fee 'azaabi jahannama khaalidoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, the criminals will be in the punishment of Hell, abiding eternally.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yufattaru 'anhum wa hum feehi mublisoon
ayah.translation: It will not be allowed to subside for them, and they, therein, are in despair.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa zalamnaahum wa laakin kaanoo humuz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa naadaw yaa Maaliku liyaqdi 'alainaa Rabbuka qaala innakum maakisson
ayah.translation: And they will call, "O Malik, let your Lord put an end to us!" He will say, "Indeed, you will remain."

ayah.transliteration: Laqad ji'naakum bilhaqqi wa laakinna aksarakum lilhaqqi kaarihoon
ayah.translation: We had certainly brought you the truth, but most of you, to the truth, were averse.

ayah.transliteration: Am abramooo amran fainnaa mubrimoon
ayah.translation: Or have they devised [some] affair? But indeed, We are devising [a plan].

ayah.transliteration: Am yahsaboona annaa laa nasma'u sirrahum wa najwaahum; balaa wa Rusulunaa ladaihim yaktuboon
ayah.translation: Or do they think that We hear not their secrets and their private conversations? Yes, [We do], and Our messengers are with them recording.

ayah.transliteration: Qul in kaana lir Rahmaani walad; fa-ana awwalul 'aabideen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "If the Most Merciful had a son, then I would be the first of [his] worshippers."

ayah.transliteration: Subhaana Rabbis samaawaati wal ardi Rabbil Arshi 'ammaa yasifoon
ayah.translation: Exalted is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

ayah.transliteration: Fazarhum yakhoodoo wa yal'aboo hattaa yulaaqoo Yawmahumul lazee yoo'adoon
ayah.translation: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee fissamaaa'i Ilaahunw wa fil ardi Ilaah; wa Huwal Hakeemul'Aleem
ayah.translation: And it is Allah who is [the only] deity in the heaven, and on the earth [the only] deity. And He is the Wise, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa tabaarakal lazee lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa wa 'indahoo 'ilmus Saa'ati wa ilaihi turja'oon
ayah.translation: And blessed is He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them and with whom is knowledge of the Hour and to whom you will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yamlikul lazeena yad'oona min doonihish shafaa'ata illaa man shahida bilhaqqi wa hum ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And those they invoke besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa la'in sa altahum man khalaqahum la yaqoolun nallaahu fa annaa yu'fakoon
ayah.translation: And if you asked them who created them, they would surely say, "Allah." So how are they deluded?

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeelihee yaa Rabbi inna haa'ulaaa'i qawmul laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: And [Allah acknowledges] his saying, "O my Lord, indeed these are a people who do not believe."

ayah.transliteration: Fasfah 'anhum wa qul salaam; fasawfa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: So turn aside from them and say, "Peace." But they are going to know.

ayah.transliteration: Haa Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Wal Kitaabil Mubeen
ayah.translation: By the clear Book,

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa anzalnaahu fee lailatim mubaarakah; innaa kunnaa munzireen
ayah.translation: Indeed, We sent it down during a blessed night. Indeed, We were to warn [mankind].

ayah.transliteration: Feehaa yufraqu kullu amrin hakeem
ayah.translation: On that night is made distinct every precise matter -

ayah.transliteration: Amram min 'indinaaa; innaa kunnaa mursileen
ayah.translation: [Every] matter [proceeding] from Us. Indeed, We were to send [a messenger]

ayah.transliteration: Rahmatam mir rabbik; innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem
ayah.translation: As mercy from your Lord. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbis samaawaati wal ardi wa maa bainahumaa; in kuntum mooqineen
ayah.translation: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them, if you would be certain.

ayah.transliteration: Laaa ilaaha illaa Huwa yuhyee wa yumeetu Rabbukum wa Rabbu aabaaa'ikumul awwaleen
ayah.translation: There is no deity except Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers.

ayah.transliteration: Bal hum fee shakkiny yal'aboon
ayah.translation: But they are in doubt, amusing themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Fartaqib Yawma taatis samaaa'u bidukhaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke.

ayah.transliteration: Yaghshan naasa haazaa 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: Covering the people; this is a painful torment.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbanak shif 'annal 'azaaba innaa mu'minoon
ayah.translation: [They will say], "Our Lord, remove from us the torment; indeed, we are believers."

ayah.transliteration: Annaa lahumuz zikraa wa qad jaaa'ahum Rasoolum mubeen
ayah.translation: How will there be for them a reminder [at that time]? And there had come to them a clear Messenger.

ayah.transliteration: Summaa tawallaw 'anhu wa qaaloo mu'allamum majnoon
ayah.translation: Then they turned away from him and said, "[He was] taught [and is] a madman."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kaashiful 'azaabi qaleelaa; innakum 'aaa'indoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, We will remove the torment for a little. Indeed, you [disbelievers] will return [to disbelief].

ayah.transliteration: Yawma nabtishul batsha tal kubraa innaa muntaqimoon
ayah.translation: The Day We will strike with the greatest assault, indeed, We will take retribution.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad fatannaa qablahum qawma Fir'awna wa jaaa'ahum Rasoolun kareem
ayah.translation: And We had already tried before them the people of Pharaoh, and there came to them a noble messenger,

ayah.transliteration: An addooo ilaiya 'ibaadal laahi innee lakum Rasoolun ameen
ayah.translation: [Saying], "Render to me the servants of Allah. Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger,"

ayah.transliteration: Wa al laa ta'loo 'alal laahi innee aateekum bisultaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: And [saying], "Be not haughty with Allah. Indeed, I have come to you with clear authority.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innee 'uztu bi Rabbee wa rabbikum an tarjumoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, I have sought refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me.

ayah.transliteration: Wa il lam tu'minoo lee fa'taziloon
ayah.translation: But if you do not believe me, then leave me alone."

ayah.transliteration: Fada'aa rabbahooo anna haaa'ulaaa'i qawmum mujrimoon
ayah.translation: And [finally] he called to his Lord that these were a criminal people.

ayah.transliteration: Fa asri bi'ibaadee lailan innakum muttaba'oon
ayah.translation: [Allah said], "Then set out with My servants by night. Indeed, you are to be pursued.

ayah.transliteration: Watrukil bahra rahwan innahum jundum mughraqoon
ayah.translation: And leave the sea in stillness. Indeed, they are an army to be drowned."

ayah.transliteration: Kam tarakoo min jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: How much they left behind of gardens and springs

ayah.transliteration: Wa zuroo'inw wa maqaa min kareem
ayah.translation: And crops and noble sites

ayah.transliteration: Wa na'matin kaanoo feehaa faakiheen
ayah.translation: And comfort wherein they were amused.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika wa awrasnaahaa qawman aakhareen
ayah.translation: Thus. And We caused to inherit it another people.

ayah.transliteration: Famaa bakat 'alaihimus samaaa'u wal ardu wa maa kaanoo munzareen
ayah.translation: And the heaven and earth wept not for them, nor were they reprieved.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad najjainaa Baneee Israaa'eela minal'azaabil muheen
ayah.translation: And We certainly saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating torment -

ayah.transliteration: Min Fir'awn; innahoo kaana 'aaliyam minal musrifeen
ayah.translation: From Pharaoh. Indeed, he was a haughty one among the transgressors.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqadikh tarnaahum 'alaa 'ilmin 'alal 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And We certainly chose them by knowledge over [all] the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaahum minal aayaati maa feehi balaaa'um mubeen
ayah.translation: And We gave them of signs that in which there was a clear trial.

ayah.transliteration: Inna haaa'ulaaa'i la yaqooloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, these [disbelievers] are saying,

ayah.transliteration: In hiya illaa mawtatunal oolaa wa maa nahnu bimun shareen
ayah.translation: "There is not but our first death, and we will not be resurrected.

ayah.transliteration: Faatoo bi aabaaa'inaaa inkuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Then bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Ahum khayrun am qawmu Tubba'inw wallazeena min qablihim; ahlaknaahum innahum kaanoo mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Are they better or the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] indeed, they were criminals.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqnas samaawaati wal arda wa maa baina humaa laa'ibeen
ayah.translation: And We did not create the heavens and earth and that between them in play.

ayah.transliteration: Maa khalaqnaahumaaa illaa bilhaqqi wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: We did not create them except in truth, but most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Inna yawmal fasli meeqaatuhum ajma'een
ayah.translation: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is the appointed time for them all -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma laa yughnee mawlan 'am mawlan shai'anw wa laa hum yunsaroon
ayah.translation: The Day when no relation will avail a relation at all, nor will they be helped -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa mar rahimal laah' innahoo huwal 'azeezur raheem
ayah.translation: Except those [believers] on whom Allah has mercy. Indeed, He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Inna shajarataz zaqqoom
ayah.translation: Indeed, the tree of zaqqum

ayah.transliteration: Ta'aamul aseem
ayah.translation: Is food for the sinful.

ayah.transliteration: Kalmuhli yaghlee filbutoon
ayah.translation: Like murky oil, it boils within bellies

ayah.transliteration: Kaghalyil hameem
ayah.translation: Like the boiling of scalding water.

ayah.transliteration: Khuzoohu fa'tiloohu ilaa sawaaa'il Jaheem
ayah.translation: [It will be commanded], "Seize him and drag him into the midst of the Hellfire,

ayah.transliteration: Summa subboo fawqa raasihee min 'azaabil hameem
ayah.translation: Then pour over his head from the torment of scalding water."

ayah.transliteration: Zuq innaka antal 'azeezul kareem
ayah.translation: [It will be said], "Taste! Indeed, you are the honored, the noble!

ayah.transliteration: Inna haazaa maa kuntum bihee tamtaroon
ayah.translation: Indeed, this is what you used to dispute."

ayah.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee maqaamin ameen
ayah.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place;

ayah.transliteration: Fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: Within gardens and springs,

ayah.transliteration: Yalbasoona min sundusinw wa istbraqim mutaqaabileen
ayah.translation: Wearing [garments of] fine silk and brocade, facing each other.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika wa zawwajnaahum bihoorin 'een
ayah.translation: Thus. And We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

ayah.transliteration: Yad'oona feehaa bikulli faakihatin aamineen
ayah.translation: They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yazooqoona feehal mawtaa illal mawtatal oolaa wa qaqaahum 'azaabal jaheem
ayah.translation: They will not taste death therein except the first death, and He will have protected them from the punishment of Hellfire

ayah.transliteration: Fadlam mir rabbik; zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem
ayah.translation: As bounty from your Lord. That is what is the great attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Fa innamaa yassarnaahu bilisaanika la'allahum yatazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And indeed, We have eased the Qur'an in your tongue that they might be reminded.

ayah.transliteration: Fartaqib innahum murta qiboon
ayah.translation: So watch, [O Muhammad]; indeed, they are watching [for your end].

ayah.transliteration: Haa-Meeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelul Kitaabi minal laahil 'Azeezil Hakeem
ayah.translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa fis samaawaati wal ardi la Aayaatil lilmu'mineen
ayah.translation: Indeed, within the heavens and earth are signs for the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fee khalaqikum wa maa yabussu min daaabbatin Aayaatul liqawminy-yooqinoon
ayah.translation: And in the creation of yourselves and what He disperses of moving creatures are signs for people who are certain [in faith].

ayah.transliteration: Wakhtilaafil laili wannahaari wa maaa anzalal laahu minas samaaa'i mir rizqin fa ahyaa bihil arda ba'da mawtihaa wa tasreefir riyaahi Aayaatul liqawminy ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: And [in] the alternation of night and day and [in] what Allah sends down from the sky of provision and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness and [in His] directing of the winds are signs for a people who reason.

ayah.transliteration: Tilka Aayatul laahi natloohaa 'alika bilhaqq, fabiayyi hadeesim ba'dal laahi wa Aayaatihee yu'minoon
ayah.translation: These are the verses of Allah which We recite to you in truth. Then in what statement after Allah and His verses will they believe?

ayah.transliteration: Wailul likulli affaakin aseem
ayah.translation: Woe to every sinful liar

ayah.transliteration: Yasma'u Aayaatil laahi tutlaa 'alaihi summa yusirru mustakbiran ka-al lam yasma'haa fabashshirhu bi'azaabin aleem
ayah.translation: Who hears the verses of Allah recited to him, then persists arrogantly as if he had not heard them. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa 'alima min Aayaatinaa shai'anit takhazahaa huzuwaa; ulaaa'ika lahum 'azaabum muheen
ayah.translation: And when he knows anything of Our verses, he takes them in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Minw waraaa'ihim Jahannamu wa laa yughnee 'anhum maa kasaboo shai'anw wa laa mat takhazoo min doonil laahi awliyaaa'a wa lahum 'azaabun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Before them is Hell, and what they had earned will not avail them at all nor what they had taken besides Allah as allies. And they will have a great punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa hudanw wal lazeena kafaroo bi aayaati Rabbihim lahum 'azaabum mir rijzin aleem
ayah.translation: This [Qur'an] is guidance. And those who have disbelieved in the verses of their Lord will have a painful punishment of foul nature.

ayah.transliteration: Allaahul lazee sahkhara lakumul bahra litajriyal fulku feehi bi amrihee wa litabtaghoo min fadlihee wa la'allakum tashkuroon
ayah.translation: It is Allah who subjected to you the sea so that ships may sail upon it by His command and that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa sakhkhara lakum maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi jamee'am minh; inna feezaalika la Aayaatil liqawminy yatafakkaroon
ayah.translation: And He has subjected to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth - all from Him. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Qul lillazeena aamanoo yaghfiroo lillazeena laa yarjoona ayyaamal laahi liyajziya qawmam bimaa kaanoo yaksiboon
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], to those who have believed that they [should] forgive those who expect not the days of Allah so that He may recompense a people for what they used to earn.

ayah.transliteration: Maa 'amila saalihan falinafsihee wa man asaaa'a fa'alaihaa summa ilaa Rabbikum turja'oon
ayah.translation: Whoever does a good deed - it is for himself; and whoever does evil - it is against the self. Then to your Lord you will be returned.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad aatainaa Baneee Israaa'eelal Kitaaba walhukma wan Nubuwwata wa razaqnaahum minat taiyibaati wa faddalnaahum;alal 'aalameen
ayah.translation: And We did certainly give the Children of Israel the Scripture and judgement and prophethood, and We provided them with good things and preferred them over the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aatainaahum baiyinaatim minal amri famakh talafooo illaa mim ba'di maa jaaa'ahumul 'ilmu baghyam bainahum; inna Rabbaka yaqdee bainahum Yawmal Qiyaamati feemaa kaanoo feehi yakhtalifoon
ayah.translation: And We gave them clear proofs of the matter [of religion]. And they did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

ayah.transliteration: Summa ja'alnaaka 'alaa sharee'atim minal amri fattabi'haa wa laa tattabi'ahwaaa'al-lazeena laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Then We put you, [O Muhammad], on an ordained way concerning the matter [of religion]; so follow it and do not follow the inclinations of those who do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Innahum lany yughnoo 'anka minal laahi shai'aa; wa innaz zaalimeena ba'duhum awliyaaa'u ba'dinw wallaahu waliyyul muttaqeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, they will never avail you against Allah at all. And indeed, the wrongdoers are allies of one another; but Allah is the protector of the righteous.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa basaaa'iru linnaasi wa hudanw wa rahmatul liqawminy yooqinoon
ayah.translation: This [Qur'an] is enlightenment for mankind and guidance and mercy for a people who are certain [in faith].

ayah.transliteration: Am hasibal lazeenaj tarahus saiyiaati an naj'alahum kallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilu saalihaati sawaaa'am mahyaahum wa mamaatuhum; saaa'a maa yahkumoon
ayah.translation: Or do those who commit evils think We will make them like those who have believed and done righteous deeds - [make them] equal in their life and their death? Evil is that which they judge.

ayah.transliteration: Wa khalaqal laahus samaawaati wal arda bilhaqqi wa litujzaa kullu nafsim bimaa kasabat wa hum laa yuzlamoon
ayah.translation: And Allah created the heavens and earth in truth and so that every soul may be recompensed for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

ayah.transliteration: Afara'ayta manit takhaza ilaahahoo hawaahu wa adal lahul laahu 'alaa 'ilminw wa khatama 'alaa sam'ihee wa qalbihee wa ja'ala 'alaa basarihee ghishaawatan famany yahdeehi mim ba'dil laah; afalaa tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: Have you seen he who has taken as his god his [own] desire, and Allah has sent him astray due to knowledge and has set a seal upon his hearing and his heart and put over his vision a veil? So who will guide him after Allah? Then will you not be reminded?

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaaloo maa hiya illaa hayaatunad dunyaa namootu wa nahyaa wa maa yuhlikunaaa illad dahr; wa maa lahum bizaalika min 'ilmin in hum illaayazunnoon
ayah.translation: And they say, "There is not but our worldly life; we die and live, and nothing destroys us except time." And they have of that no knowledge; they are only assuming.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa tutlaa 'alaihim aayaatuna baiyinaatim maa kaana hujjatahum illaaa an qaalu'too bi aabaaa'inaaa in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, their argument is only that they say, "Bring [back] our forefathers, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Qulil laahu yuhyeekum summa yumeetukum summa yajma'ukum ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati laa raiba feehi wa laakinna aksaran naasi laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Say, "Allah causes you to live, then causes you to die; then He will assemble you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt, but most of the people do not know."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi mulkus samaawaati wal ard; wa Yawma taqoomus Saa'atu Yawma 'iziny yakhsarul mubtiloon
ayah.translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And the Day the Hour appears - that Day the falsifiers will lose.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraa kulla ummatin jaasiyah; kullu ummatin tud'aaa ilaa kitaabihaa al Yawma tujzawna maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: And you will see every nation kneeling [from fear]. Every nation will be called to its record [and told], "Today you will be recompensed for what you used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa kitaabunaa yantiqu 'alaikum bilhaqq; innaa kunnaa nastansikhu maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: This, Our record, speaks about you in truth. Indeed, We were having transcribed whatever you used to do."

ayah.transliteration: Fa ammal lazeena aamaanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati fayudkhiluhum Rabbuhum fee rahmatih; zaalika huwal fawzul mubeen
ayah.translation: So as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is what is the clear attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ammal lazeena kafarooo afalam takun Aayaatee tutlaa 'alaikum fastakbartum wa kuntum qawmam mujrimeen
ayah.translation: But as for those who disbelieved, [it will be said], "Were not Our verses recited to you, but you were arrogant and became a people of criminals?

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela inna wa'dallaahi haqqunw was Saa'atu laa raiba feehaa qultum maa nadree mas Saa'atu in nazunnu illaa zannanw wa maa nahnu bimustaiqineen
ayah.translation: And when it was said, 'Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth and the Hour [is coming] - no doubt about it,' you said, 'We know not what is the Hour. We assume only assumption, and we are not convinced.' "

ayah.transliteration: Wa badaa lahum saiyiaatu maa 'amiloo wa haaqa bihim maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And the evil consequences of what they did will appear to them, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qeelal yawma nansaakum kamaa naseetum liqaaa'a yawmikum haazaa wa maawaakumun Naaru wa maa lakum min naasireen
ayah.translation: And it will be said, "Today We will forget you as you forgot the meeting of this Day of yours, and your refuge is the Fire, and for you there are no helpers.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalikum bi annakumut takhaztum aayaatil laahi huzuwanw wa gharratkumul hayaatud dunyaa; fal yawma laa yukhrajoona minhaa wa laahum yusta'taboon
ayah.translation: That is because you took the verses of Allah in ridicule, and worldly life deluded you." So that Day they will not be removed from it, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Falillaahil hamdu Rabbis samaawaati wa Rabbil ardi Rabbil-'aalameen
ayah.translation: Then, to Allah belongs [all] praise - Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahul kibriyaaa'u fissamaawaati wal ardi wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: And to Him belongs [all] grandeur within the heavens and the earth, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Haa-Meeeem
ayah.translation: Ha, Meem.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelul Kitaabi minal laahil-'Azeezil Hakeem
ayah.translation: The revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Maa khalaqnas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaaa illaa bilhaqqi wa ajalim musammaa; wallazeena kafaroo 'ammaaa unziroo mu'ridoon
ayah.translation: We did not create the heavens and earth and what is between them except in truth and [for] a specified term. But those who disbelieve, from that of which they are warned, are turning away.

ayah.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum maa tad'oona min doonil laahi aroonee maazaa khalaqoo minal ardi am lahum shirkun fis samaawaati eetoonee bi kitaabim min qabli haazaaa aw asaaratim min 'ilmin in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Have you considered that which you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created of the earth; or did they have partnership in [creation of] the heavens? Bring me a scripture [revealed] before this or a [remaining] trace of knowledge, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Wa man adallu mimmany yad'oo min doonil laahi mallaa yastajeebu lahooo ilaa Yawmil Qiyaamati wa hum'an du'aaa'ihim ghaafiloon
ayah.translation: And who is more astray than he who invokes besides Allah those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection, and they, of their invocation, are unaware.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa hushiran naasu kaanoo lahum a'daaa'anw wa kaanoo bi'ibaadatihim kaafireen
ayah.translation: And when the people are gathered [that Day], they [who were invoked] will be enemies to them, and they will be deniers of their worship.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa tutlaa 'alaihim Aayaatunaa baiyinaatin qaalal lazeena kafaroo lilhaqqi lammaa jaaa'ahum haazaa sihrum mubeen
ayah.translation: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is obvious magic."

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloonaf taraahu qul inif taraituhoo falaa tamlikoona lee minal laahi shai'an Huwa a'lamu bimaa tufeedoona feehi kafaa bihee shaheedam bainee wa bainakum wa Huwal Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, you will not possess for me [the power of protection] from Allah at all. He is most knowing of that in which you are involved. Sufficient is He as Witness between me and you, and He is the Forgiving the Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Qul maa kuntu bid'am minal Rusuli wa maaa adreee ma yuf'alu bee wa laa bikum in attabi'u illaa maa yoohaaa ilaiya ya maaa ana illaa nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: Say, "I am not something original among the messengers, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow that which is revealed to me, and I am not but a clear warner."

ayah.transliteration: Qul ara'aytum in kaana min 'indil laahi wa kafartum bihee wa shahida shaahidum mim Banee Israaa'eela 'alaa mislihee fa aamana wastak bartum innal laaha laa yahdil qawmaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: Say, "Have you considered: if the Qur'an was from Allah, and you disbelieved in it while a witness from the Children of Israel has testified to something similar and believed while you were arrogant...?" Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaalal lazeena kafaroo lillazeena aamanoo law kaana khairam maa sabaqoonaaa ilyh; wa iz lam yahtadoo bihee fasa yaqooloona haazaaa ifkun qadeem
ayah.translation: And those who disbelieve say of those who believe, "If it had [truly] been good, they would not have preceded us to it." And when they are not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient falsehood."

ayah.transliteration: Wa min qablihee kitaabu Moosaaa imaamanw-wa rahmah; wa haazaa Kitaabum musad diqul lisaanan 'Arabiyyal liyunziral lazeena zalamoo wa bushraa lilmuhsineen
ayah.translation: And before it was the scripture of Moses to lead and as a mercy. And this is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who have wronged and as good tidings to the doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena qaaloo Rabbunal laahu summas taqaamoo falaa khawfun 'alaihim wa laahum yahzanoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who have said, "Our Lord is Allah," and then remained on a right course - there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve.

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ika Ashabul Jannati khaalideena feehaa jazaaa'am bimaa kaano ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Those are the companions of Paradise, abiding eternally therein as reward for what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa wassainal insaana biwaalidaihi ihsaanan hamalathu ummuhoo kurhanw-wa wada'athu kurhanw wa hamluhoo wa fisaaluhoo salaasoona shahraa; hattaaa izaa balagha ashuddahoo wa balagho arba'eena sanatan qaala Rabbi aqzi'neee an ashkura ni'matakal lateee an'amta 'alaiya wa 'alaa waalidaiya wa an a'mala saalihan tardaahu wa aslih lee fee zurriyyatee innee tubtu ilaika wa innee minal muslimeen
ayah.translation: And We have enjoined upon man, to his parents, good treatment. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship, and his gestation and weaning [period] is thirty months. [He grows] until, when he reaches maturity and reaches [the age of] forty years, he says, "My Lord, enable me to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents and to work righteousness of which You will approve and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I have repented to You, and indeed, I am of the Muslims."

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena nata qabbalu 'anhum ahsana maa 'amiloo wa natajaawazu 'an saiyiaatihim feee Ashaabil jannati Wa'das sidqil lazee kaanoo yoo'adoon
ayah.translation: Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they did and overlook their misdeeds, [their being] among the companions of Paradise. [That is] the promise of truth which they had been promised.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazee qaala liwaali daihi uffil lakumaaa ata'idanineee an ukhraja wa qad khalatil quroonu min qablee wa humaa yastagheesaanil laaha wailaka aamin inna wa'dal laahi haqq, fa yaqoolu maa haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen
ayah.translation: But one who says to his parents, "Uff to you; do you promise me that I will be brought forth [from the earth] when generations before me have already passed on [into oblivion]?" while they call to Allah for help [and to their son], "Woe to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth." But he says, "This is not but legends of the former people" -

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena haqqa 'alaihimul qawlu feee umamin qad khalat min qablihim minal jinni wal insi innahum kaanoo khaasireen
ayah.translation: Those are the ones upon whom the word has come into effect, [who will be] among nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they [all] were losers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa likullin darajaatum mimmaa 'amiloo wa liyuwaf fiyahum a'maalahum wa hum laa yuzlamoon
ayah.translation: And for all there are degrees [of reward and punishment] for what they have done, and [it is] so that He may fully compensate them for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yu'radul lazeena kafaroo 'alan Naai azhabtum taiyibaatikum fee hayaatikumud dunyaa wastam ta'tum bihaa fal Yawma tujzawna 'azaabal hooni bimaa kuntum tastakbiroona fil ardi bighairil haqqi wa bimaa kuntum tafsuqoon
ayah.translation: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "You exhausted your pleasures during your worldly life and enjoyed them, so this Day you will be awarded the punishment of [extreme] humiliation because you were arrogant upon the earth without right and because you were defiantly disobedient."

ayah.transliteration: Wazkur akhaa 'Aad, iz anzara qawmahoo bil Ahqaafi wa qad khalatin nuzuru mim baini yadaihi wa min khalfiheee allaa ta'budooo illal laaha inneee akhaafu 'alaikum 'azaaba Yawmin 'azeem
ayah.translation: And mention, [O Muhammad], the brother of 'Aad, when he warned his people in the [region of] al-Ahqaf - and warners had already passed on before him and after him - [saying], "Do not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo aji'tanaa litaa fikanaa 'an aalihatinaa faatinaa bimaa ta'idunaaa in kunta minas saadiqeen
