ayah.translation: They said, "Have you come to delude us away from our gods? Then bring us what you promise us, if you should be of the truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala innamal 'ilmu indal laahi wa uballighukum maaa uriltu bihee wa laakinneee araakum qawman tajhaloon
ayah.translation: He said, "Knowledge [of its time] is only with Allah, and I convey to you that with which I was sent; but I see you [to be] a people behaving ignorantly."

ayah.transliteration: Falammaa ra awhu 'aaridam mustaqbila awdiyatihim qaaloo haazaa 'aaridum mumtirunaa; bal huwa masta'jaltum bihee reehun feehaa 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: And when they saw it as a cloud approaching their valleys, they said, "This is a cloud bringing us rain!" Rather, it is that for which you were impatient: a wind, within it a painful punishment,

ayah.transliteration: Tudammiru kulla shai'im bi-amri Rabbihaa fa asbahoo laa yuraaa illaa masaakinuhum; kazaalika najzil qawmal mujrimeen
ayah.translation: Destroying everything by command of its Lord. And they became so that nothing was seen [of them] except their dwellings. Thus do We recompense the criminal people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad makkannaahum feemaaa im makkannaakum feehi waj'alnaa lahum sam'anw wa absaaranw wa af'idatan famaaa aghnaa 'anhum samu'uhum wa laaa absaaruhum wa laaa af'idatuhum min shai'in iz kaanoo yajhadoona bi Aayaatil laahi wa haaqa bihim maa kaanoo bihee yastahzi'oon
ayah.translation: And We had certainly established them in such as We have not established you, and We made for them hearing and vision and hearts. But their hearing and vision and hearts availed them not from anything [of the punishment] when they were [continually] rejecting the signs of Allah; and they were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ahlaknaa ma hawlakum minal quraa wa sarrafnal Aayaati la'allahum yarji'oon
ayah.translation: And We have already destroyed what surrounds you of [those] cities, and We have diversified the signs [or verses] that perhaps they might return [from disbelief].

ayah.transliteration: Falaw laa nasarahumul lazeenat takhazoo min doonil laahi qurbaanan aalihatam bal dalloo 'anhum' wa zaalika ifkuhum wa maa kaanoo yaftaroon
ayah.translation: Then why did those they took besides Allah as deities by which to approach [Him] not aid them? But they had strayed from them. And that was their falsehood and what they were inventing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz sarafinaaa ilaika nafaram minal jinni yastami'oonal Quraana falammaa hadaroohu qaalooo ansitoo falammaa qudiya wallaw ilaa qawmihim munzireen
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We directed to you a few of the jinn, listening to the Qur'an. And when they attended it, they said, "Listen quietly." And when it was concluded, they went back to their people as warners.

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo yaa qawmanaaa innaa sami'naa Kitaaban unzila mim ba'di Moosa musaddiqal limaa baina yadihi yahdeee ilal haqqi wa ilaa Tareeqim Mustaqeem
ayah.translation: They said, "O our people, indeed we have heard a [recited] Book revealed after Moses confirming what was before it which guides to the truth and to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa qawmanaaa ajeeboo daa'iyal laahi wa aaminoo bihee yaghfir lakum min zunoobikum wa yujirkum min 'azaabin aleem
ayah.translation: O our people, respond to the Messenger of Allah and believe in him; Allah will forgive for you your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa mal laa yujib daa'iyal laahi falaisa bimu'jizin fil ardi wa laisa lahoo min dooniheee awliyaaa'; ulaaa ika fee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: But he who does not respond to the Caller of Allah will not cause failure [to Him] upon earth, and he will not have besides Him any protectors. Those are in manifest error."

ayah.transliteration: Awalam yaraw annal laahal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal larda wa lam ya'ya bikhal qihinna biqaadirin 'alaaa anyyuhiyal mawtaa; balaaa innahoo 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth and did not fail in their creation, is able to give life to the dead? Yes. Indeed, He is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Yawma yu'radul lazeena kafaroo 'alan naari alaisa haaza bil haqq; qaaloo balaa wa Rabbinaa; qaala fazooqul 'azaaba bimaa kuntum takfuroon
ayah.translation: And the Day those who disbelieved are exposed to the Fire [it will be said], "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment because you used to disbelieve."

ayah.transliteration: Fasbir kamaa sabara ulul 'azmi minar Rusuli wa laa tasta'jil lahum; ka annahum Yawma yarawna maa yoo'adoona lam yalbasooo illaa saa'atam min nahaar; balaagh; fahal yuhlaku illal qawmul faasiqoon
ayah.translation: So be patient, [O Muhammad], as were those of determination among the messengers and do not be impatient for them. It will be - on the Day they see that which they are promised - as though they had not remained [in the world] except an hour of a day. [This is] notification. And will [any] be destroyed except the defiantly disobedient people?

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena kafaroo wa saddoo'an sabeelil laahi adalla a'maalahum
ayah.translation: Those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah - He will waste their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati wa aamanoo bimaa nuzzila 'alaa Muhammadinw-wa huwal haqqu mir Rabbihim kaffara 'anhum saiyiaatihim wa aslaha baalahum
ayah.translation: And those who believe and do righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muhammad - and it is the truth from their Lord - He will remove from them their misdeeds and amend their condition.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annal lazeena kafarut taba'ul baatila wa annal lazeena aamanut taba'ul haqqa mir Rabbihim; kazaalika yadribul laahu linnaasi amsaalahum
ayah.translation: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood, and those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allah present to the people their comparisons.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-izaa laqeetumul lazeena kafaroo fadarbar riqaab, hattaaa izaa askhan tumoohum fashuddul wasaaq, fa immaa mannnam ba'du wa immaa fidaaa'an hattaa tada'al harbu awzaarahaa; zaalika wa law yashaaa'ul laahu lantasara minhum wa laakil laiyabluwa ba'dakum biba'd; wallazeena qutiloo fee sabeelil laahi falany yudilla a'maalahum
ayah.translation: So when you meet those who disbelieve [in battle], strike [their] necks until, when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then secure their bonds, and either [confer] favor afterwards or ransom [them] until the war lays down its burdens. That [is the command]. And if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance upon them [Himself], but [He ordered armed struggle] to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the cause of Allah - never will He waste their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Sa-yahdeehim wa yusihu baalahum
ayah.translation: He will guide them and amend their condition

ayah.transliteration: Wa yudkhiluhumul jannata 'arrafahaa lahum
ayah.translation: And admit them to Paradise, which He has made known to them.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanooo in tansurul laaha yansurkum wa yusabbit aqdaamakum
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena kafaroo fata's al lahum wa adalla a'maalahum
ayah.translation: But those who disbelieve - for them is misery, and He will waste their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahum karihoo maaa anzalal laahu faahbata a'maalahum
ayah.translation: That is because they disliked what Allah revealed, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yaseeroo fil ardi fayanzuroo kaifa kaana 'aaqibatul lazeena min qablihim; dammaral laahu 'alaihim wa lilkaafireena amsaaluhaa
ayah.translation: Have they not traveled through the land and seen how was the end of those before them? Allah destroyed [everything] over them, and for the disbelievers is something comparable.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annal laaha mawlal lazeena aamanoo wa annal kaafireena laa mawlaa lahum
ayah.translation: That is because Allah is the protector of those who have believed and because the disbelievers have no protector.

ayah.transliteration: Innal-laaha yudkhilul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati Jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wallazeena kafaroo yatamatta'oona wa yaakuloona kamaa taakuluian'aamu wan Naaru maswallahum
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah will admit those who have believed and done righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow, but those who disbelieve enjoy themselves and eat as grazing livestock eat, and the Fire will be a residence for them.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ka ayyim min qaryatin hiya ashaddu quwwatam min qaryatikal lateee akhrajatka ahlaknaahum falaa naasira lahum
ayah.translation: And how many a city was stronger than your city [Makkah] which drove you out? We destroyed them; and there was no helper for them.

ayah.transliteration: Afaman kaana 'alaa baiyinatim mir Rabbihee kaman zuyyina lahoo sooo'u 'amalihee wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum
ayah.translation: So is he who is on clear evidence from his Lord like him to whom the evil of his work has been made attractive and they follow their [own] desires?

ayah.transliteration: Masalul jannatil latee wu'idal muttaqoona feehaaa anhaarum mim maaa'in ghayri aasininw wa anhaarum mil labanil lam yataghaiyar ta'muhoo wa anhaarum min khamril lazzatil lishshaaribeena wa anhaarum min 'asalim musaffanw wa lahum feeha min kullis samaraati wa maghfiratum mir Rabbihim kaman huwa khaalidun fin naari wa suqoo maaa'an hameeman faqatta'a am'aaa'ahum
ayah.translation: Is the description of Paradise, which the righteous are promised, wherein are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey, in which they will have from all [kinds of] fruits and forgiveness from their Lord, like [that of] those who abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink scalding water that will sever their intestines?

ayah.transliteration: Wa minhum mai yastami' ilaika hattaaa izaa kharajoo min 'indika qaaloo lillazeena ootul 'ilma maazaa qaala aanifaa; ulaaa'ikal lazeena taba'al laahu 'alaa quloobihim wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum
ayah.translation: And among them, [O Muhammad], are those who listen to you, until when they depart from you, they say to those who were given knowledge, "What has he said just now?" Those are the ones of whom Allah has sealed over their hearts and who have followed their [own] desires.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeenah tadaw zaadahum hudanw wa aataahum taqwaahum
ayah.translation: And those who are guided - He increases them in guidance and gives them their righteousness.

ayah.transliteration: Fahal yanzuroona illas Saa'ata an taatiyahum baghtatan faqad jaaa'a ashraatuhaa; fa-annnaa lahum izaa jaaa'at hum zikraahum
ayah.translation: Then do they await except that the Hour should come upon them unexpectedly? But already there have come [some of] its indications. Then what good to them, when it has come, will be their remembrance?

ayah.transliteration: Fa'lam annahoo laaa ilaaha illal laahu wastaghfir lizambika wa lilmu'mineena walmu'minaat; wallaahu ya'lamu mutaqallabakum wa maswaakum
ayah.translation: So know, [O Muhammad], that there is no deity except Allah and ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women. And Allah knows of your movement and your resting place.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yaqoolul lazeena aamanoo law laa nuzzilat Sooratun fa izaaa unzilat Sooratum Muhkamatunw wa zukira feehal qitaalu ra aytal lazeena fee quloobihim maraduny yanzuroona ilaika nazaral maghshiyyi 'alaihi minal mawti fa'awlaa lahum
ayah.translation: Those who believe say, "Why has a surah not been sent down? But when a precise surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, you see those in whose hearts is hypocrisy looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. And more appropriate for them [would have been]

ayah.transliteration: Taa'atunw wa qawlum ma'roof; fa izaa 'azamal amru falaw sadaqul laaha lakaana khairal lahum
ayah.translation: Obedience and good words. And when the matter [of fighting] was determined, if they had been true to Allah, it would have been better for them.

ayah.transliteration: Fahal 'asaitum in tawallaitum an tufsidoo fil ardi wa tuqatti'ooo arhaamakum
ayah.translation: So would you perhaps, if you turned away, cause corruption on earth and sever your [ties of] relationship?

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal lazeena la'anahumul laahu fa asammahum wa a'maaa absaarahum
ayah.translation: Those [who do so] are the ones that Allah has cursed, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

ayah.transliteration: Afalaa yatadabbaroonal Qur-aana am 'alaa quloobin aqfaaluhaa
ayah.translation: Then do they not reflect upon the Qur'an, or are there locks upon [their] hearts?

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeenar taddoo 'alaaa adbaarihim mim ba'di maa tabaiyana lahumul hudash Shaitaanu sawwala lahum wa amlaa lahum
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who reverted back [to disbelief] after guidance had become clear to them - Satan enticed them and prolonged hope for them.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahum qaaloo lillazeena karihoo maa nazzalal laahu sanutee'ukum fee ba'dil amri wallaahu ya'lamu israarahum
ayah.translation: That is because they said to those who disliked what Allah sent down, "We will obey you in part of the matter." And Allah knows what they conceal.

ayah.transliteration: Fakaifa izaa tawaffat humul malaaa'ikatu yadriboona wujoohahum wa adbaa rahum
ayah.translation: Then how [will it be] when the angels take them in death, striking their faces and their backs?

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahumut taba'oo maaa askhatal laaha wa karihoo ridwaanahoo fa ahbata a'maalahum
ayah.translation: That is because they followed what angered Allah and disliked [what earns] His pleasure, so He rendered worthless their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Am hasibal lazeena fee quloobihim maradun al lan yukhrijal laahu adghaanahum
ayah.translation: Or do those in whose hearts is disease think that Allah would never expose their [feelings of] hatred?

ayah.transliteration: Wa law nashaaa'u la-arainaakahum fala 'araftahum bi seemaahum; wa lata'rifan nahum fee lahnil qawl; wallaahu ya'lamu a'maalakum
ayah.translation: And if We willed, We could show them to you, and you would know them by their mark; but you will surely know them by the tone of [their] speech. And Allah knows your deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lanabluwannakum hattaa na'lamal mujaahideena minkum wassaabireena wa nabluwa akhbaarakum
ayah.translation: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs.

ayah.transliteration: Innnal lazeena kafaroo wa saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi wa shaaaqqur Rasoola mim ba'di maa tabaiyana lahumul hudaa lany yadurrul laaha shai'anw wa sa yuhbitu a'maalahum
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allah and opposed the Messenger after guidance had become clear to them - never will they harm Allah at all, and He will render worthless their deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo atee'ul laaha wa atee'ur Rasoola wa laa tubtilooo a'maalakum
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, obey Allah and obey the Messenger and do not invalidate your deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena kafaroo wa saddoo 'an sabeelil laahi summa maatoo wa hum kuffaarun falany yaghfirallaahu lahum
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who disbelieved and averted [people] from the path of Allah and then died while they were disbelievers - never will Allah forgive them.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa tahinoo wa tad'ooo ilas salmi wa antumul a'lawna wallaahu ma'akum wa lany yatirakum a'maalakum
ayah.translation: So do not weaken and call for peace while you are superior; and Allah is with you and will never deprive you of [the reward of] your deeds.

ayah.transliteration: Innamal hayaatud dunyaa la'ibunw wa lahw; wa in to'minoo wa tattaqoo yu'tikum ujoorakum wa laa yas'alkum amwaalakum
ayah.translation: [This] worldly life is only amusement and diversion. And if you believe and fear Allah, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.

ayah.transliteration: Iny yas'alkumoohaa fa yuhfikum tabkhaloo wa yukhrij adghaanakum
ayah.translation: If He should ask you for them and press you, you would withhold, and He would expose your unwillingness.

ayah.transliteration: haaa antum haaa'ulaaa'i tud'awna litunfiqoo fee sabeelillaahi faminkum many yabkhalu wa many yabkhal fa innamaa yabkhalu 'an nafsih; wallaahu Ghaniyyu wa antumul fuqaraaa'; wa in tatwal law yastabdil qawman ghairakum summa laa yakoonooo amsaalakum
ayah.translation: Here you are - those invited to spend in the cause of Allah - but among you are those who withhold [out of greed]. And whoever withholds only withholds [benefit] from himself; and Allah is the Free of need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people; then they will not be the likes of you.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa fatahnaa laka Fatham Mubeenaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have given you, [O Muhammad], a clear conquest

ayah.transliteration: Liyaghfira lakal laahu maa taqaddama min zambika wa maa ta akhkhara wa yutimma ni'matahoo 'alaika wa yahdiyaka siraatam mustaqeema
ayah.translation: That Allah may forgive for you what preceded of your sin and what will follow and complete His favor upon you and guide you to a straight path

ayah.transliteration: Wa yansurakal laahu nasran 'azeezaa
ayah.translation: And [that] Allah may aid you with a mighty victory.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazeee anzalas sakeenata fee quloobil mu'mineena liyazdaadooo eemaanamma'a eemaanihim; wa lillaahi junoodus samawaati wal ard; wa kaanal laahu 'Aleeman Hakeemaa
ayah.translation: It is He who sent down tranquillity into the hearts of the believers that they would increase in faith along with their [present] faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth, and ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Liyudkhilal mu'mineena walmu'minaati jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaa wa yukaffira 'anhum saiyi aatihim; wa kaana zaalika 'indal laahi fawzan 'azeemaa
ayah.translation: [And] that He may admit the believing men and the believing women to gardens beneath which rivers flow to abide therein eternally and remove from them their misdeeds - and ever is that, in the sight of Allah, a great attainment -

ayah.transliteration: Wa yu'azzibal munaafiqeena walmunaafiqaati wal mushrikeena walmushrikaatiz zaaanneena billaahi zannas saw'; 'alaihim daaa'iratus saw'i wa ghadibal laahu 'alaihim wa la'anahum wa a'adda lahum jahannama wa saaa' at maseeraa
ayah.translation: And [that] He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the polytheist men and polytheist women - those who assume about Allah an assumption of evil nature. Upon them is a misfortune of evil nature; and Allah has become angry with them and has cursed them and prepared for them Hell, and evil it is as a destination.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi junoodus samaawaati wal ard; wa kaanal laahu 'azeezan hakeema
ayah.translation: And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaaka shaahi danw wa mubashshiranw wa nazeera
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner

ayah.transliteration: Litu minoo billaahi wa Rasoolihee wa tu'azziroohu watuwaqqiroohu watusabbi hoohu bukratanw wa aseelaa
ayah.translation: That you [people] may believe in Allah and His Messenger and honor him and respect the Prophet and exalt Allah morning and afternoon.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yubaayi'oonaka innamaa yubaayi'oonal laaha yadul laahi fawqa aydehim; faman nakasa fainnamaa yuankusu 'alaa nafsihee wa man awfaa bimaa 'aahada 'alihul laaha fasa yu'teehi ajran 'azeemaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you, [O Muhammad] - they are actually pledging allegiance to Allah. The hand of Allah is over their hands. So he who breaks his word only breaks it to the detriment of himself. And he who fulfills that which he has promised Allah - He will give him a great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Sa yaqoolu lakal mukhal lafoona minal-A'raabi shaighalatnaaa amwaalunaa wa ahloonaa fastaghfir lanaa; yaqooloona bi alsinatihim maa laisa fee quloobihim; qul famany yamliku lakum minal laahi shai'an in araada bikum darran aw araada bikum naf'aa; bal kaanal laahu bimaa ta'maloona Khabeeraa
ayah.translation: Those who remained behind of the bedouins will say to you, "Our properties and our families occupied us, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not within their hearts. Say, "Then who could prevent Allah at all if He intended for you harm or intended for you benefit? Rather, ever is Allah, with what you do, Acquainted.

ayah.transliteration: Bal zanantum al lany yanqalibar Rasoolu walmu'minoona ilaaa ahleehim abadanw wa zuyyina zaalika fee quloobikum wa zanantum zannnas saw'i wa kuntum qawmam booraa
ayah.translation: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, ever, and that was made pleasing in your hearts. And you assumed an assumption of evil and became a people ruined."

ayah.transliteration: Wa mal lam yu'mim billaahi wa Rasoolihee fainnaaa a'tadnaa lilkaafireena sa'eeraa
ayah.translation: And whoever has not believed in Allah and His Messenger - then indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blaze.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahii mulkus samaawaati wal ard; yaghfiru limany yashaaa'u wa yu'azzibu many yashaaa'; wa kaanal laahu Ghafoorar Raheemaa
ayah.translation: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Sa yaqoolul mukhalla foona izan talaqtum ilaa maghaanima litaakhuzoohaa zaroonaa nattabi'kum yureedoona any yubaddiloo Kalaamallaah; qul lan tattabi'oonaa kazaalikum qaalal laahu min qablu fasa yaqooloona bal tahsudoonanna; bal kaanoo laa yafqahoona illaa qaleela
ayah.translation: Those who remained behind will say when you set out toward the war booty to take it, "Let us follow you." They wish to change the words of Allah. Say, "Never will you follow us. Thus did Allah say before." So they will say, "Rather, you envy us." But [in fact] they were not understanding except a little.

ayah.transliteration: Qul lilmukhallafeena minal A'raabi satud'awna ilaa qawmin ulee baasin shadeedin tuqaati loonahum aw yuslimoona fa in tutee'oo yu'tikumul laahu ajran hasananw wa in tatawallaw kamaa tawallaitum min qablu yu'azzibkum 'azaaban aleemaa
ayah.translation: Say to those who remained behind of the bedouins, "You will be called to [face] a people of great military might; you may fight them, or they will submit. So if you obey, Allah will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Laisa 'alal a'maa harajunw wa laa 'alal a'raji harajunw wa laa 'alal mareedi haraj' wa many yutil'il laaha wa Rasoolahoo yudkhilhu jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wa many yatawalla yu'azzibhu 'azaaban aleemaa
ayah.translation: There is not upon the blind any guilt or upon the lame any guilt or upon the ill any guilt [for remaining behind]. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger - He will admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow; but whoever turns away - He will punish him with a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad radiyal laahu 'anil mu'mineena iz yubaayi 'oonaka tahtash shajarati fa'alima maa fee quloobihim fa anzalas sakeenata 'alaihim wa asaa bahum fat han qareebaa
ayah.translation: Certainly was Allah pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, [O Muhammad], under the tree, and He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquillity upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest

ayah.transliteration: Wa maghaanima kaseera tany yaakhuzoonahaa; wa kaanal laahu 'Azeezan Hakeemaa
ayah.translation: And much war booty which they will take. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa'adakumul laahu ma ghaanima kaseeratan taakhuzoo nahaa fa'ajjala lakum haazihee wa kaffa aydiyan naasi 'ankum wa litakoona aayatal lilmu'mineena wa yahdiyakum siraatam mustaqeema
ayah.translation: Allah has promised you much booty that you will take [in the future] and has hastened for you this [victory] and withheld the hands of people from you - that it may be a sign for the believers and [that] He may guide you to a straight path.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ukhraa lam taqdiroo 'alaihaa qad ahaatal laahu bihaa; wa kaanal laahu 'alaa kulli shai'in qadeera
ayah.translation: And [He promises] other [victories] that you were [so far] unable to [realize] which Allah has already encompassed. And ever is Allah, over all things, competent.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law qaatalakumul lazeena kafaroo la wallawul adbaara summa laa yajidoona waliyanw-wa laa naseeraa
ayah.translation: And if those [Makkans] who disbelieve had fought you, they would have turned their backs [in flight]. Then they would not find a protector or a helper.

ayah.transliteration: Sunnatal laahil latee qad khalat min qablu wa lan tajida lisunnatil laahi tabdeelaa
ayah.translation: [This is] the established way of Allah which has occurred before. And never will you find in the way of Allah any change.

ayah.transliteration: Wa Huwal lazee kaffa aydiyahum 'ankum wa aydiyakum 'anhum bibatni Makkata mim ba'di an azfarakum 'alaihim; wa kaanal laahu bimaa ta'maloona Baseera
ayah.translation: And it is He who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them within [the area of] Makkah after He caused you to overcome them. And ever is Allah of what you do, Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Humul lazeena kafaroo wa saddookum 'anil-Masjidil-Haraami walhadya ma'koofan any yablugha mahillah; wa law laa rijaalum mu'minoona wa nisaaa'um mu'minaatul lam ta'lamoohum an tata'oohum fatuseebakum minhum ma'arratum bighairi 'ilmin liyud khilal laahu fee rahmatihee many yashaaa'; law tazayyaloo la'azzabnal lazeena kafaroo minhum 'azaaban aleema
ayah.translation: They are the ones who disbelieved and obstructed you from al-Masjid al-Haram while the offering was prevented from reaching its place of sacrifice. And if not for believing men and believing women whom you did not know - that you might trample them and there would befall you because of them dishonor without [your] knowledge - [you would have been permitted to enter Makkah]. [This was so] that Allah might admit to His mercy whom He willed. If they had been apart [from them], We would have punished those who disbelieved among them with painful punishment

ayah.transliteration: Iz ja'alal lazeena kafaroo fee quloobihimul hamiyyata hamiyyatal jaahiliyyati fa anzalal laahu sakeenatahoo 'alaa Rasoolihee wa 'alal mu mineena wa alzamahum kalimatat taqwaa wa kaanooo ahaqqa bihaa wa ahlahaa; wa kaanal laahu bikulli shai'in Aleema
ayah.translation: When those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism - the chauvinism of the time of ignorance. But Allah sent down His tranquillity upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad sadaqal laahu Rasoolahur ru'yaa bilhaqq, latadkhulunnal Masjidal-Haraama in shaaa'al laahu aamineena muhalliqeena ru'oosakum wa muqassireena laa takhaafoona fa'alima maa lam ta'lamoo faja'ala min dooni zaalika fathan qareebaa
ayah.translation: Certainly has Allah showed to His Messenger the vision in truth. You will surely enter al-Masjid al-Haram, if Allah wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and [hair] shortened, not fearing [anyone]. He knew what you did not know and has arranged before that a conquest near [at hand].

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazeee arsala Rasoolahoo bilhudaa wa deenil haqqi liyuzhirahoo 'alad deeni kullih; wa kafaa billaahi Shaheeda
ayah.translation: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.

ayah.transliteration: Muhammadur Rasoolul laah; wallazeena ma'ahooo ashiddaaa'u 'alal kuffaaari ruhamaaa'u bainahum taraahum rukka'an sujjadany yabtaghoona fadlam minal laahi wa ridwaanan seemaahum fee wujoohihim min asaris sujood; zaalika masaluhum fit tawraah; wa masaluhum fil Injeeli kazar'in akhraja shat 'ahoo fa 'aazarahoo fastaghlaza fastawaa 'alaa sooqihee yu'jibuz zurraa'a liyagheeza bihimul kuffaar; wa'adal laahul lazeena aamanoo wa 'amilus saalihaati minhum maghfiratanw wa ajran 'azeemaa
ayah.translation: Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah; and those with him are forceful against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating [in prayer], seeking bounty from Allah and [His] pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers - so that Allah may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo la tuqaddimoo baina yada yil laahi wa Rasoolihee wattaqul laah; innal laaha samee'un 'Aleem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not put [yourselves] before Allah and His Messenger but fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa tarfa'ooo aswaatakum fawqa sawtin Nabiyi wa laa tajharoo lahoo bilqawli kajahri ba'dikum liba 'din an tahbata a 'maalukum wa antum laa tash'uroon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be loud to him in speech like the loudness of some of you to others, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yaghud doona aswaatahum 'inda Rasoolil laahi ulaaa'ikal lazeenam tah anal laahu quloobahum littaqwaa; lahum maghfiratunw waajrun 'azeem
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allah - they are the ones whose hearts Allah has tested for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yunaadoo naka minw waraaa'il hujuraati aksaruhum laa ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who call you, [O Muhammad], from behind the chambers - most of them do not use reason.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law annahum sabaroo hatta takhruja ilaihim lakaana khairal lahum; wallaahu Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: And if they had been patient until you [could] come out to them, it would have been better for them. But Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo in jaaa'akum faasqum binaba in fatabaiyanooo an tuseeboo qawmam bijahalatin fatusbihoo 'alaa maa fa'altum naadimeen
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, investigate, lest you harm a people out of ignorance and become, over what you have done, regretful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa'lamooo anna feekum Rasoolal laah; law yutee'ukum fee kaseerim minal amrila'anittum wa laakinnal laaha habbaba ilaikumul eemaana wa zaiyanahoo fee quloobikum wa karraha ilaikumul kufra walfusooqa wal'isyaan; ulaaaika humur raashidoon
ayah.translation: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allah. If he were to obey you in much of the matter, you would be in difficulty, but Allah has endeared to you the faith and has made it pleasing in your hearts and has made hateful to you disbelief, defiance and disobedience. Those are the [rightly] guided.

ayah.transliteration: Fadlam minal laahi wa ni'mah; wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem
ayah.translation: [It is] as bounty from Allah and favor. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in taaa'ifataani minal mu'mineenaq tataloo faaslihoo bainahumaa fa-im baghat ih daahumaa 'alal ukhraa faqaatilul latee tabhee hattaa tafeee'a ilaaa amril laah; fa-in faaa't fa aslihoo bainahumaa bil'adli wa aqsitoo innal laaha yuhibbul muqsiteen
ayah.translation: And if two factions among the believers should fight, then make settlement between the two. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight against the one that oppresses until it returns to the ordinance of Allah. And if it returns, then make settlement between them in justice and act justly. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.

ayah.transliteration: Innamal mu'minoona ikhwatun fa aslihoo baina akhawaykum wattaqul laaha la'allakum tuhamoon
ayah.translation: The believers are but brothers, so make settlement between your brothers. And fear Allah that you may receive mercy.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa yaskhar qawmum min qawmin 'asaaa anyyakoonoo khairam minhum wa laa nisaaa'um min nisaaa'in 'Asaaa ay yakunna khairam minhunna wa laa talmizooo bil alqaab; bi'sal ismul fusooqu ba'dal eemaan; wa mal-lam yatub fa-ulaaa'ika humuz zaalimoon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, let not a people ridicule [another] people; perhaps they may be better than them; nor let women ridicule [other] women; perhaps they may be better than them. And do not insult one another and do not call each other by [offensive] nicknames. Wretched is the name of disobedience after [one's] faith. And whoever does not repent - then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanuj taniboo kaseeram minaz zanni inna ba'daz zanniismunw wa laa tajassasoo wa la yaghtab ba'dukum ba'daa; a yuhibbu ahadukum any yaakula lahma akheehi maitan fakarih tumooh; wattaqul laa; innal laaha tawwaabur Raheem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, avoid much [negative] assumption. Indeed, some assumption is sin. And do not spy or backbite each other. Would one of you like to eat the flesh of his brother when dead? You would detest it. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is Accepting of repentance and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan naasu innaa khalaqnaakum min zakarinw wa unsaa wa ja'alnaakum shu'oobanw wa qabaaa'ila lita'aarafoo inna akramakum 'indal laahi atqaakum innal laaha 'Aleemun khabeer
ayah.translation: O mankind, indeed We have created you from male and female and made you peoples and tribes that you may know one another. Indeed, the most noble of you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous of you. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalatil-A 'raabu aamannaa qul lam tu'minoo wa laakin qoolooo aslamnaa wa lamma yadkhulil eemaanu fee quloobikum wa in tutee'ul laaha wa Rasoolahoo laa yalitkum min a'maalikum shai'aa; innal laaha Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: The bedouins say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not [yet] believed; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. And if you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will not deprive you from your deeds of anything. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Innamal muu'minoonal lazeena aamanoo billaahi wa Rasoolihee summa lam yartaaboo wa jaahadoo biamwaalihim wa anfusihim fee sabeelil laah; ulaaaika humus saadiqoon
ayah.translation: The believers are only the ones who have believed in Allah and His Messenger and then doubt not but strive with their properties and their lives in the cause of Allah. It is those who are the truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Qul atu'allimoonal laaha bideenikum wallaahu ya'lamu maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ard; wallaahu bikulli shai'in 'Aleem
ayah.translation: Say, "Would you acquaint Allah with your religion while Allah knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth, and Allah is Knowing of all things?"

ayah.transliteration: Yamunnoona 'alaika an aslamoo qul laa tamunnoo 'alaiya Islaamakum balillaahu yamunnu 'alaikum an hadaakum lil eemaani in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: They consider it a favor to you that they have accepted Islam. Say, "Do not consider your Islam a favor to me. Rather, Allah has conferred favor upon you that He has guided you to the faith, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha ya'lamu ghaibas samaawaati wal ard; wallaahu baseerum bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah knows the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Qaaaf; wal Qur aanil Majeed
ayah.translation: Qaf. By the honored Qur'an...

ayah.transliteration: Bal 'ajibooo an jaa'ahum munzirum minhum faqaalal kaafiroona haazaa shai'un 'ajeeb
ayah.translation: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

ayah.transliteration: 'A-izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaaban zaalika raj'um ba'eed
ayah.translation: When we have died and have become dust, [we will return to life]? That is a distant return."

ayah.transliteration: Qad 'alimnaa maa tanqu-sul-ardu minhum wa 'indanaa Kitaabun Hafeez
ayah.translation: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.

ayah.transliteration: Bal kazzaboo bilhaqqi lammaa jaaa'ahum fahum feee amrim mareej
ayah.translation: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.

ayah.transliteration: Afalam yanzurooo ilas samaaa'i fawqahum kaifa banainaahaa wa zaiyannaahaa wa maa lahaa min furooj
ayah.translation: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?

ayah.transliteration: Wal arda madadnaahaa wa alqainaa feehaa rawaasiya wa ambatnaa feehaa min kulli zawjim baheej
ayah.translation: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,

ayah.transliteration: Tabsiratanw wa zikraa likulli 'abdim muneeb
ayah.translation: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Wa nazzalnaa minas samaaa'i maaa'am mubaarakan fa ambatnaa bihee jannaatinw wa habbal haseed
ayah.translation: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest

ayah.transliteration: Wannakhla baasiqaatil laha tal'un nadeed
ayah.translation: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -

ayah.transliteration: Rizqal lil'ibaad, wa ahyainaa bihee baldatam maitaa; kazaalikal khurooj
ayah.translation: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohinw wa Ashaabur Rassi wa Samood
ayah.translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud

ayah.transliteration: Wa 'Aadunw wa Fir'awnu wikhwaanu loot
ayah.translation: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot

ayah.transliteration: Wa Ashaabul Aykati wa qawmu Tubba'; kullun kazzabar Rusula fahaqqa wa'eed
ayah.translation: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

ayah.transliteration: Afa'a yeenaa bilkhalqil awwal; bal hum fee labsim min khalqin jadeed
ayah.translation: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion over a new creation.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnal insaana wa na'lamu maa tuwaswisu bihee nafsuhoo wa Nahnu aqrabu ilaihi min hablil wareed
ayah.translation: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein

ayah.transliteration: 'Iz yatalaqqal mutalaqqi yaani 'anil yameeni wa 'anish shimaali qa'eed
ayah.translation: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yalfizu min qawlin illaa ladaihi raqeebun 'ateed
ayah.translation: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaaa'at kullu nafsim ma'ahaa saaa'iqunw wa shaheed
ayah.translation: And the intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nufikha fis Soor; zaalika yawmul wa'eed
ayah.translation: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.

ayah.transliteration: Wa jaaa'at kullu nafsim ma'ahaa saaa'iqunw wa shaheed
ayah.translation: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad kunta fee ghaf latim min haazaa fakashafnaa 'anka ghitaaa'aka fabasarukal yawma hadeed
ayah.translation: [It will be said], "You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp."

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaala qareenuhoo haazaa maa ladaiya 'ateed
ayah.translation: And his companion, [the angel], will say, "This [record] is what is with me, prepared."

ayah.transliteration: Alqiyaa fee Jahannama kulla kaffaarin 'aneed
ayah.translation: [Allah will say], "Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,

ayah.transliteration: Mannaa'il lilkhayri mu'tadim mureeb
ayah.translation: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,

ayah.transliteration: Allazee ja'ala ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara fa alqiyaahu fil'azaabish shadeed
ayah.translation: Who made [as equal] with Allah another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala qareenuhoo Rabbanaa maaa atghaituhoo wa laakin kaana fee dalaahim ba'eed
ayah.translation: His [devil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala laa takhtasimoo ladaayya wa qad qaddamtu ilaikum bilwa'eed
ayah.translation: [Allah] will say, "Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.

ayah.transliteration: Maa yubaddalul qawlu ladaiya wa maaa ana bizal laamil lil'abeed
ayah.translation: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants."

ayah.transliteration: Yawma naqoolu li'jahannama halim talaati wa taqoolu hal mim mazeed
ayah.translation: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Have you been filled?" and it will say, "Are there some more,"

ayah.transliteration: Wa uzlifatil jannatu lil muttaqeena ghaira ba'eed
ayah.translation: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,

ayah.transliteration: Haaza maa too'adoona likulli awwaabin hafeez
ayah.translation: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]

ayah.transliteration: Man khashiyar Rahmaana bilghaibi wa jaaa'a biqalbim muneeb
ayah.translation: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].

ayah.transliteration: Udkhuloohaa bisalaamin zaalika yawmul khulood
ayah.translation: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

ayah.transliteration: Lahum maa yashaaa'oona feehaa wa ladainaa mazeed
ayah.translation: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam ahlaknaa qablahum min qarnin hum ashaddu minhum batshan fanaqqaboo fil bilaad, hal mim mahees
ayah.translation: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?

ayah.transliteration: Inna fee zaalika lazikraa liman kaana lahoo qalbun aw alqas sam'a wa huwa shaheed
ayah.translation: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad khalaqnas samaawaati wal arda wa maa bainahumaa fee sittati ayyaamin wa maa massanaa mil lughoob
ayah.translation: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.

ayah.transliteration: Fasbir 'alaa maa yaqooloona wa sabbih bihamdi Rabbika qabla tuloo'ish shamsi wa qablal ghuroob
ayah.translation: So be patient, [O Muhammad], over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

ayah.transliteration: Wa minal laili fasabbih hu wa adbaaras sujood
ayah.translation: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.

ayah.transliteration: Wastami' yawma yunaa dil munaadi mim makaanin qareeb
ayah.translation: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yasmaoonas sai hata bilhaqq zaalika yawmul khurooj
ayah.translation: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

ayah.transliteration: Innaa Nahnu nuhyee wa numeetu wa ilainal maseer
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tashaqqaqul ardu 'anhum siraa'aa; zaalika hashrun 'alainaa yaseer
ayah.translation: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [and they emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu a'lamu bimaa yaqooloona wa maaa anta 'alihim bijabbaarin fazakkir bil quraani many yakhaafu wa'eed
ayah.translation: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.

ayah.transliteration: Waz-zaariyaati zarwaa
ayah.translation: By those [winds] scattering [dust] dispersing

ayah.transliteration: Falhaamilaati wiqraa
ayah.translation: And those [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

ayah.transliteration: Faljaariyaati yusraa
ayah.translation: And those [ships] sailing with ease

ayah.transliteration: Falmuqassimaati amraa
ayah.translation: And those [angels] apportioning [each] matter,

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa too'adoona la-saadiq
ayah.translation: Indeed, what you are promised is true.

ayah.transliteration: Wa innad deena la waaqi'
ayah.translation: And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

ayah.transliteration: Wassamaaa'i zaatil hubuk
ayah.translation: By the heaven containing pathways,

ayah.transliteration: Innakum lafee qawlim mukhtalif
ayah.translation: Indeed, you are in differing speech.

ayah.transliteration: Yu'faku 'anhu man ufik
ayah.translation: Deluded away from the Qur'an is he who is deluded.

ayah.transliteration: Qutilal kharraasoon
ayah.translation: Destroyed are the falsifiers

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena hum fee ghamratin saahoon
ayah.translation: Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

ayah.transliteration: Yas'aloona ayyaana yawmud Deen
ayah.translation: They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

ayah.transliteration: Yawma hum 'alan naari yuftanoon
ayah.translation: [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

ayah.transliteration: Zooqoo fitnatakum haa zal lazee kuntum bihee tas ta'jiloon
ayah.translation: [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

ayah.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa 'uyoon
ayah.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

ayah.transliteration: Aakhizeena maaa aataahum Rabbuhum; innahum kaanoo qabla zaalika muhsineen
ayah.translation: Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

ayah.transliteration: kaanoo qaleelam minal laili maa yahja'oon
ayah.translation: They used to sleep but little of the night,

ayah.transliteration: Wa bilashaari hum yastaghfiroon
ayah.translation: And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

ayah.transliteration: Wa feee amwaalihim haqqul lissaaa'ili walmahroom
ayah.translation: And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fil ardi aayaatul lilmooqineen
ayah.translation: And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

ayah.transliteration: Wa feee anfusikum; afalaa tubsiroon
ayah.translation: And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

ayah.transliteration: Wa fissamaaa'i rizqukum wa maa too'adoon
ayah.translation: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

ayah.transliteration: Fawa Rabbis samaaa'i wal ardi innahoo lahaqqum misla maa annakum tantiqoon
ayah.translation: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

ayah.transliteration: Hal ataaka hadeesu daifi Ibraaheemal mukrameen
ayah.translation: Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham? -

ayah.transliteration: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala salaamun qawmum munkaroon
ayah.translation: When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace, [you are] a people unknown.

ayah.transliteration: Faraagha ilaaa ahlihee fajaaa'a bi'ijlin sameen
ayah.translation: Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

ayah.transliteration: Faqarrabahooo ilaihim qaala alaa taakuloon
ayah.translation: And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

ayah.transliteration: Fa awjasa minhm khee fatan qaaloo laa takhaf wa bashsharoohu bighulaamin 'aleem
ayah.translation: And he felt from them apprehension. They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

ayah.transliteration: Fa aqbalatim ra-atuhoo fee sarratin fasakkat wajhahaa wa qaalat 'ajoozun 'aqeem
ayah.translation: And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

ayah.transliteration: Qaaloo kazaaliki qaala Rabbuki innahoo huwal hakeemul 'aleem
ayah.translation: They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

ayah.transliteration: Qaala famaa khatbukum ayyuhal mursaloon
ayah.translation: [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen
ayah.translation: They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals

ayah.transliteration: Linursila 'alaihim hijaa ratam min teen
ayah.translation: To send down upon them stones of clay,

ayah.transliteration: Musawwamatan 'inda rabbika lilmusrifeen
ayah.translation: Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhrajnaa man kaana feehaa minal mu'mineen
ayah.translation: So We brought out whoever was in the cities of the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Famaa wajadnaa feehaa ghaira baitim minal muslimeen
ayah.translation: And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.

ayah.transliteration: Wa taraknaa feehaaa aayatal lillazeena yakhaafoonal 'azaabal aleem
ayah.translation: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fee Moosaaa iz arsalnaahu ilaa Fir'wna bisultaa nim mubeen
ayah.translation: And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

ayah.transliteration: Fatawalla biruknihee wa qaala saahirun aw majnoon
ayah.translation: But he turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."

ayah.transliteration: Fa akhaznaahu wa junoo dahoo fanabaznaahum fil yammi wa huwa muleem
ayah.translation: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fee 'Aadin iz arsalnaa 'alaihimur reehal'aqeem
ayah.translation: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.

ayah.transliteration: Maa tazaru min shai'in atat 'alaihi illaa ja'alat hu karrameem
ayah.translation: It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

ayah.transliteration: Wa fee Samooda iz qeela lahum tamatta''oo hattaa heen
ayah.translation: And in Thamud, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

ayah.transliteration: Fa'ataw 'an amri Rabbihim fa akhazal humus saa'iqatu wa hum yanzuroon
ayah.translation: But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

ayah.transliteration: Famas tataa'oo min qiyaaminw wa maa kaanoo muntasireen
ayah.translation: And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaano qawman faasiqeen
ayah.translation: And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Wassamaaa'a banainaa haa bi aydinw wa innaa lamoosi'oon
ayah.translation: And the heaven We constructed with strength, and indeed, We are [its] expander.

ayah.transliteration: Wal arda farashnaahaa fani'mal maahidoon
ayah.translation: And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

ayah.transliteration: Wa min kulli shai'in khalaqnaa zawjaini la'allakum tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will remember.

ayah.transliteration: Fafirrooo ilal laahi innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa taj'aloo ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen
ayah.translation: And do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

ayah.transliteration: Kazaalika maaa atal lazeena min qablihim mir Rasoolin illaa qaaloo saahirun aw majnoon
ayah.translation: Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

ayah.transliteration: Atawaasaw bih; bal hum qawmun taaghoon
ayah.translation: Did they suggest it to them? Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.

ayah.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum famaaa anta bimaloom
ayah.translation: So leave them, [O Muhammad], for you are not to be blamed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa zakkir fa innaz zikraa tanfa'ul mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa khalaqtul jinna wal insa illaa liya'budoon
ayah.translation: And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa ureedu minhum mir rizqinw wa maaa ureedu anyyut'imoon
ayah.translation: I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha Huwar Razzaaqu Zul Quwwatil Mateen
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is Allah who is the [continual] Provider, the firm possessor of strength.

ayah.transliteration: Fa inna lillazeena zalamoo zanoobam misla zanoobi ashaabihim falaa yasta'jiloon
ayah.translation: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their predecessors, so let them not impatiently urge Me.

ayah.transliteration: Fawailul lillazeena kafaroo miny yawmihimul lazee yoo'adoon
ayah.translation: And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.

ayah.transliteration: Wat-Toor
ayah.translation: By the mount

ayah.transliteration: Wa kitaabim mastoor
ayah.translation: And [by] a Book inscribed

ayah.transliteration: Fee raqqim manshoor
ayah.translation: In parchment spread open

ayah.transliteration: Wal baitil ma'moor
ayah.translation: And [by] the frequented House

ayah.transliteration: Wassaqfil marfoo'
ayah.translation: And [by] the heaven raised high

ayah.transliteration: Wal bahril masjoor
ayah.translation: And [by] the sea filled [with fire],

ayah.transliteration: Inna 'azaaba Rabbika lawaaqi'
ayah.translation: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.

ayah.transliteration: Maa lahoo min daafi'
ayah.translation: Of it there is no preventer.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma tamoorus samaaa'u mawraa
ayah.translation: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion

ayah.transliteration: Wa taseerul jibaalu sairaa
ayah.translation: And the mountains will pass on, departing -

ayah.transliteration: Fawailuny yawma 'izil lil mukaazzibeen
ayah.translation: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena hum fee khawdiny yal'aboon
ayah.translation: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yuda'-'oona ilaa naari jahannama da'-'aa
ayah.translation: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],

ayah.transliteration: Haazihin naarul latee kuntum bihaa tukazziboon
ayah.translation: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.

ayah.transliteration: Afasihrun haazaaaa am antum laa tubsiroon
ayah.translation: Then is this magic, or do you not see?

ayah.transliteration: Islawhaa fasbirooo aw laa tasbiroo sawaaa'un 'alaikum innamaa tujzawna maa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."

ayah.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa na'eem
ayah.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,

ayah.transliteration: Faakiheena bimaaa aataahum rabbuhum wa waqaahum rabbuhum 'azaabal jaheem
ayah.translation: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: Kuloo washraboo haneee 'am bimaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."

ayah.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaa sururim masfoofatinw wa zawwaj naahum bihoorin 'een
ayah.translation: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena aamanoo wattaba'at hum zurriyyatuhum bieemaanin alhaqnaa bihim zurriyyatahum wa maaa alatnaahum min 'amalihim min shai'; kullum ri'im bimaa kasaba raheen
ayah.translation: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.

ayah.transliteration: Wa amdadnaahum bifaa kihatinw wa lahmim mimmaa yashtahoon
ayah.translation: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.

ayah.transliteration: Yatanaaza'oona feehaa kaasal laa laghwun feehaa wa laa taaseem
ayah.translation: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

ayah.transliteration: Wa yatoofu 'alaihim ghilmaanul lahum ka annahum lu'lu'um maknoon
ayah.translation: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqbala ba'duhum 'alaa ba'diny yatasaaa'aloon
ayah.translation: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

ayah.transliteration: Qaalooo innaa kunnaa qablu feee ahlinaa mushfiqeen
ayah.translation: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Famannnal laahu 'alainaa wa waqaanaa 'azaabas samoom
ayah.translation: So Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kunnaa min qablu nad'oohu innahoo huwal barrur raheem
ayah.translation: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Fazakkir famaaa anta bini'mati rabbika bikaahininw wa laa majnoon
ayah.translation: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloona shaa'irun natarabbasu bihee raibal manoon
ayah.translation: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul tarabbasoo fa innee ma'akum minal mutarabbiseen
ayah.translation: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."

ayah.transliteration: Am taamuruhum ahlaamuhum bihaazaaa am hum qawmun taaghoon
ayah.translation: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloona taqawwalah; bal laa yu'minoon
ayah.translation: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.

ayah.transliteration: Falyaatoo bihadeesim misliheee in kaanoo saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Am khuliqoo min ghairi shai'in am humul khaaliqoon
ayah.translation: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

ayah.transliteration: Am khalaqus samaawaati wal ard; bal laa yooqinoon
ayah.translation: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.

ayah.transliteration: Am'indahum khazaaa'inu rabbika am humul musaitiroon
ayah.translation: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?

ayah.transliteration: Am lahum sullamuny yastami'oona feehi falyaati mustami'uhum bisultaanim mubeen
ayah.translation: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority.

ayah.transliteration: Am lahul banaatu wa lakumul banoon
ayah.translation: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

ayah.transliteration: Am tas'aluhum ajran fahum mim maghramim musqaloon
ayah.translation: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

ayah.transliteration: Am 'indahumul ghaibu fahum yaktuboon
ayah.translation: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

ayah.transliteration: Am yureedoona kaidan fallazeena kafaroo humul makeedoon
ayah.translation: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.

ayah.transliteration: Am lahum ilaahun ghairul laa; subhaanal laahi 'ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: Or have they a deity other than Allah? Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iny yaraw kisfam minas samaaa'i saaqitany yaqooloo sahaabum markoom
ayah.translation: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."

ayah.transliteration: Fazarhum hatta yulaaqoo yawmahumul lazee feehi yus'aqoon
ayah.translation: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -

ayah.transliteration: Yawma laa yughnee 'anhum kaidumhum shai'anw wa laa hum yunsaroon
ayah.translation: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.

ayah.transliteration: Wa inna lillazeena zalamoo 'azaaban doona zalika wa laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment before that, but most of them do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wasbir lihukmi rabbika fa innaka bi-a'yuninaa wa sabbih bihamdi rabbika heena taqoom
ayah.translation: And be patient, [O Muhammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord when you arise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa minal laili fasabbihhu wa idbaaran nujoom
ayah.translation: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.

ayah.transliteration: Wannajmi izaa hawaa
ayah.translation: By the star when it descends,

ayah.transliteration: Maa dalla saahibukum wa maa ghawaa
ayah.translation: Your companion [Muhammad] has not strayed, nor has he erred,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa yyantiqu 'anilhawaaa
ayah.translation: Nor does he speak from [his own] inclination.

ayah.transliteration: In huwa illaa Wahyuny yoohaa
ayah.translation: It is not but a revelation revealed,

ayah.transliteration: 'Allamahoo shadeedul quwaa
ayah.translation: Taught to him by one intense in strength -

ayah.transliteration: Zoo mirratin fastawaa
ayah.translation: One of soundness. And he rose to [his] true form

ayah.transliteration: Wa huwa bil ufuqil a'laa
ayah.translation: While he was in the higher [part of the] horizon.

ayah.transliteration: Summa danaa fatadalla
ayah.translation: Then he approached and descended

ayah.transliteration: Fakaana qaaba qawsaini aw adnaa
ayah.translation: And was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer.

ayah.transliteration: Fa awhaaa ilaa 'abdihee maaa awhaa
ayah.translation: And he revealed to His Servant what he revealed.

ayah.transliteration: Maa kazabal fu'aadu maa ra aa
ayah.translation: The heart did not lie [about] what it saw.

ayah.transliteration: Afatumaaroonahoo 'alaa maayaraa
ayah.translation: So will you dispute with him over what he saw?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ra aahu nazlatan ukhraa
ayah.translation: And he certainly saw him in another descent

ayah.transliteration: 'Inda sidratil muntaha
ayah.translation: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -

ayah.transliteration: 'Indahaa jannatul maawaa
ayah.translation: Near it is the Garden of Refuge -

ayah.transliteration: Iz yaghshas sidrata maa yaghshaa
ayah.translation: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered [it].

ayah.transliteration: Maa zaaghal basaru wa maa taghaa
ayah.translation: The sight [of the Prophet] did not swerve, nor did it transgress [its limit].

ayah.transliteration: Laqad ra aa min aayaati Rabbihil kubraaa
ayah.translation: He certainly saw of the greatest signs of his Lord.

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytumul laata wal 'uzzaa
ayah.translation: So have you considered al-Lat and al-'Uzza?

ayah.transliteration: Wa manaatas saalisatal ukhraa
ayah.translation: And Manat, the third - the other one?

ayah.transliteration: A-lakumuz zakaru wa lahul unsaa
ayah.translation: Is the male for you and for Him the female?

ayah.transliteration: Tilka izan qismatun deezaa
ayah.translation: That, then, is an unjust division.

ayah.transliteration: In hiya illaaa asmaaa'un sammaitumoohaaa antum wa aabaaa'ukum maaa anzalal laahu bihaa min sultaan; inyyattabi'oona illaz zanna wa maa tahwal anfusu wa laqad jaaa'ahum mir Rabbihimul hudaa
ayah.translation: They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allah has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.

ayah.transliteration: Am lil insaani maa taman naa
ayah.translation: Or is there for man whatever he wishes?

ayah.transliteration: Falillaahil aakhiratu wal oolaa
ayah.translation: Rather, to Allah belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

ayah.transliteration: Wa kam mim malakin fissamaawaati laa tughnee shafaa'atuhum shai'an illaa mim ba'di anyyaazanal laahu limany yashaaa'u wa yardaa
ayah.translation: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allah has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.

ayah.transliteration: innal lazeena laa yu'minoona bil aakhirati la yusammoonal malaaa'ikata tasmiyatal unsaa
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa lahum bihee min 'ilmin iny yattabi'oona illaz zanna wa innaz zanna laa yughnee minal haqqi shai'aa
ayah.translation: And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.

ayah.transliteration: Fa a'rid 'am man tawallaa 'an zikrinaa wa lam yurid illal hayaatad dunyaa
ayah.translation: So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.

ayah.transliteration: Zalika mablaghuhum minal 'ilm; inna rabbaka huwa a'lamu biman dalla 'an sabee lihee wa huwa a'lamu bimanih tadaa
ayah.translation: That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.

ayah.transliteration: Wa lillaahi maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi liyajziyal lazeena asaaa'oo bimaa 'amiloo wa yajziyal lazeena ahsanoo bilhusnaa
ayah.translation: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yajtaniboona kabaaa'iral ismi walfawaa hisha illal lamam; inna rabbaka waasi'ul maghfirah; huwa a'lamu bikum iz ansha akum minal ardi wa iz antum ajinnatun fee butooni umma haatikum falaa tuzakkooo anfusakum huwa a'lamu bimanit taqaa
ayah.translation: Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.

ayah.transliteration: Afara'ayatal lazee tawallaa
ayah.translation: Have you seen the one who turned away

ayah.transliteration: Wa a'taa qaleelanw wa akdaa
ayah.translation: And gave a little and [then] refrained?

ayah.transliteration: A'indahoo 'ilmul ghaibi fahuwa yaraa
ayah.translation: Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?

ayah.transliteration: Am lam yunabbaa bimaa fee suhuhfi Moosa
ayah.translation: Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses

ayah.transliteration: Wa Ibraaheemal lazee waffaaa
ayah.translation: And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -

ayah.transliteration: Allaa taziru waaziratunw wizra ukhraa
ayah.translation: That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another

ayah.transliteration: Wa al laisa lil insaani illaa maa sa'aa
ayah.translation: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives

ayah.transliteration: Wa anna sa'yahoo sawfa yuraa
ayah.translation: And that his effort is going to be seen -

ayah.transliteration: Summa yujzaahul jazaaa 'al awfaa
ayah.translation: Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense

ayah.transliteration: Wa anna ilaa rabbikal muntahaa
ayah.translation: And that to your Lord is the finality

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa adhaka wa abkaa
ayah.translation: And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa amaata wa ahyaa
ayah.translation: And that it is He who causes death and gives life

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahoo khalaqaz zawjainiz zakara wal unsaa
ayah.translation: And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -

ayah.transliteration: Min nutfatin izaa tumnaa
ayah.translation: From a sperm-drop when it is emitted

ayah.transliteration: Wa anna 'alaihin nash atal ukhraa
ayah.translation: And that [incumbent] upon Him is the next creation

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa aghnaa wa aqnaa
ayah.translation: And that it is He who enriches and suffices

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahoo huwa rabbush shi'raa
ayah.translation: And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius

ayah.transliteration: Wa annahooo ahlak a 'Aadanil oolaa
ayah.translation: And that He destroyed the first [people of] 'Aad

ayah.transliteration: Wa samooda famaaa abqaa
ayah.translation: And Thamud - and He did not spare [them] -

ayah.transliteration: Wa qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaanoo hum azlama wa atghaa
ayah.translation: And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.

ayah.transliteration: Wal mu'tafikata ahwaa
ayah.translation: And the overturned towns He hurled down

ayah.transliteration: Faghashshaahaa maa ghashshaa
ayah.translation: And covered them by that which He covered.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbika tatamaaraa
ayah.translation: Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa nazeerum minan nuzuril oolaa
ayah.translation: This [Prophet] is a warner like the former warners.

ayah.transliteration: Azifatil laazifah
ayah.translation: The Approaching Day has approached.

ayah.transliteration: Laisa lahaa min doonil laahi kaashifah
ayah.translation: Of it, [from those] besides Allah, there is no remover.

ayah.transliteration: Afamin hazal hadeesi ta'jaboon
ayah.translation: Then at this statement do you wonder?

ayah.transliteration: Wa tadhakoona wa laa tabkoon
ayah.translation: And you laugh and do not weep

ayah.transliteration: Wa antum saamidoon
ayah.translation: While you are proudly sporting?

ayah.transliteration: Fasjudoo lillaahi wa'budoo
ayah.translation: So prostrate to Allah and worship [Him].

ayah.transliteration: Iqtarabatis Saa'atu wsan shaqqal qamar
ayah.translation: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].

ayah.transliteration: Wa iny yaraw aayatany yu'ridoo wa yaqooloo sihrum mustamirr
ayah.translation: And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."

ayah.transliteration: Wa kazzaboo wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum; wa kullu amrim mustaqirr
ayah.translation: And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'ahum minal ambaaa'i maa feehi muzdajar
ayah.translation: And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence -

ayah.transliteration: Hikmatum baalighatun famaa tughnin nuzur
ayah.translation: Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].

ayah.transliteration: Fatawalla 'anhum; yawma yad'ud daa'i ilaa shai 'in nukur
ayah.translation: So leave them, [O Muhammad]. The Day the Caller calls to something forbidding,

ayah.transliteration: khushsha'an absaaruhum yakrujoona minal ajdaasi ka annahum jaraadum muntashir
ayah.translation: Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,

ayah.transliteration: Muhti'eena ilad daa'i yaqoolul kafiroona haazaa yawmun 'asir
ayah.translation: Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohin fakazzaboo 'abdanaa wa qaaloo majnoo nunw wazdujir
ayah.translation: The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.

ayah.transliteration: Fada'aa Rabbahooo annee maghloobun fantasir
ayah.translation: So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."

ayah.transliteration: Fafatahnaaa abwaabas sa maaa'i bimaa'im munhamir
ayah.translation: Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down

ayah.transliteration: Wa fajjamal arda 'uyoonan faltaqal maaa'u 'alaaa amrin qad qudir
ayah.translation: And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hamalnaahu 'alaa zaati alwaahinw wa dusur
ayah.translation: And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,

ayah.transliteration: Tajree bi a'yuninaa jazaaa 'al liman kaana kufir
ayah.translation: Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqat taraknaahaad aayatan fahal mim muddakir
ayah.translation: And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad yassamal Quraana liz zikri fahal mimmuddakir
ayah.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat 'Aadun fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: 'Aad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim reehan sarsaran fee Yawmi nahsim mustamirr
ayah.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,

ayah.transliteration: Tanzi;un naasa ka anna huma'jaazu nakhlim munqa'ir
ayah.translation: Extracting the people as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.

ayah.transliteration: 'Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad yassamal Quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir
ayah.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat Samoodu binnuzur
ayah.translation: Thamud denied the warning

ayah.transliteration: Faqaalooo a-basharam minnaa waahidan nattabi'uhooo innaa izal lafee dalaalinw wa su'ur
ayah.translation: And said, "Is it one human being among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.

ayah.transliteration: 'A-ulqiyaz zikru 'alaihi mim baininaa bal huwa kazzaabun ashir
ayah.translation: Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."

ayah.transliteration: Sa-ya'lamoona ghadam manil kazzaabul ashir
ayah.translation: They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa mursilun naaqati fitnatal lahum fartaqibhum wastabir
ayah.translation: Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa nabbi'hum annal maaa'a qismatum bainahum kullu shirbim muhtadar
ayah.translation: And inform them that the water is shared between them, each [day of] drink attended [by turn].

ayah.transliteration: Fanaadaw saahibahum fata'aataa fa'aqar
ayah.translation: But they called their companion, and he dared and hamstrung [her].

ayah.transliteration: Fakaifa kaana 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa arsalnaa 'alaihim saihatanw waahidatan fakaano kahasheemil muhtazir
ayah.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them one blast from the sky, and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad yassarnal quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir
ayah.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Kazzabat qawmu lootim binnuzur
ayah.translation: The people of Lot denied the warning.

ayah.transliteration: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim haasiban illaaa aala Loot najjainaahum bisahar
ayah.translation: Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn

ayah.transliteration: Ni'matam min 'indinaa; kazaalika najzee man shakar
ayah.translation: As favor from us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad anzarahum batshatanaa fatamaaraw binnuzur
ayah.translation: And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad raawadoohu 'andaifee fatamasnaaa a'yunahum fazooqoo 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad sabbahahum bukratan 'azaabum mustaqirr
ayah.translation: And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Fazooqoo 'azaabee wa nuzur
ayah.translation: So taste My punishment and warning.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad yassarnal Quraana liz zikri fahal mim muddakir
