ayah.translation: And We have certainly made the Qur'an easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad jaaa'a Aala Fir'awnan nuzur
ayah.translation: And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.

ayah.transliteration: Kazzaboo bi Aayaatinaa kullihaa fa akhaznaahum akhza 'azeezim muqtadir
ayah.translation: They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.

ayah.transliteration: Akuffaarukum khairum min ulaaa'ikum am lakum baraaa'atun fiz Zubur
ayah.translation: Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scripture?

ayah.transliteration: Am yaqooloona nahnu jamee'um muntasir
ayah.translation: Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?

ayah.transliteration: Sa yuhzamul jam'u wa yuwalloonad dubur
ayah.translation: [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].

ayah.transliteration: Balis Saa'atu maw'iduhum was Saa'atu adhaa wa amarr
ayah.translation: But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.

ayah.transliteration: Innal mujrimeena fee dalaalinw wa su'ur
ayah.translation: Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yushaboona fin Naari'alaa wujoohimim zooqoo massa saqar
ayah.translation: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."

ayah.transliteration: Innaa kulla shai'in khalaqnaahu biqadar
ayah.translation: Indeed, all things We created with predestination.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa amrunaaa illaa waahidatun kalamhim bilbasar
ayah.translation: And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad ahlaknaaa ashyaa'akum fahal mim muddakir
ayah.translation: And We have already destroyed your kinds, so is there any who will remember?

ayah.transliteration: Wa kullu shai'in fa'aloohu fiz Zubur
ayah.translation: And everything they did is in written records.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kullu sagheerinw wa kabeerim mustatar
ayah.translation: And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.

ayah.transliteration: Innal muttaqeena fee jannaatinw wa nahar
ayah.translation: Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,

ayah.transliteration: Fee maq'adi sidqin 'inda Maleekim Muqtadir
ayah.translation: In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.

ayah.transliteration: Ar Rahmaan
ayah.translation: The Most Merciful

ayah.transliteration: 'Allamal Quran
ayah.translation: Taught the Qur'an,

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqal insaan
ayah.translation: Created man,

ayah.transliteration: 'Allamalhul bayaan
ayah.translation: [And] taught him eloquence.

ayah.transliteration: Ashshamsu walqamaru bihusbaan
ayah.translation: The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,

ayah.transliteration: Wannajmu washshajaru yasjudan
ayah.translation: And the stars and trees prostrate.

ayah.transliteration: Wassamaaa'a rafa'ahaa wa wada'al Meezan
ayah.translation: And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance

ayah.transliteration: Allaa tatghaw fil meezaan
ayah.translation: That you not transgress within the balance.

ayah.transliteration: Wa aqeemul wazna bilqisti wa laa tukhsirul meezaan
ayah.translation: And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.

ayah.transliteration: Wal arda wada'ahaa lilanaame
ayah.translation: And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.

ayah.transliteration: Feehaa faakihatunw wan nakhlu zaatul akmaam
ayah.translation: Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]

ayah.transliteration: Walhabbu zul 'asfi war Raihaanu
ayah.translation: And grain having husks and scented plants.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqal insaana min salsaalin kalfakhkhaari
ayah.translation: He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.

ayah.transliteration: Wa khalaqal jaaan mim maarijim min naar
ayah.translation: And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Rabbul mashriqayni wa Rabbul maghribayni
ayah.translation: [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Marajal bahrayni yalta qiyaani
ayah.translation: He released the two seas, meeting [side by side];

ayah.transliteration: Bainahumaa barzakhul laa yabghiyaan
ayah.translation: Between them is a barrier [so] neither of them transgresses.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Yakhruju minhumal lu 'lu u wal marjaanu
ayah.translation: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahul jawaaril mun sha'aatu fil bahri kal a'laam
ayah.translation: And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Kullu man 'alaihaa faan
ayah.translation: Everyone upon the earth will perish,

ayah.transliteration: Wa yabqaa wajhu rabbika zul jalaali wal ikraam
ayah.translation: And there will remain the Face of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Yas'aluhoo man fissamaawaati walard; kulla ywmin huwa fee shaan
ayah.translation: Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is bringing about a matter.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Sanafrughu lakum ayyuhas saqalaan
ayah.translation: We will attend to you, O prominent beings.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ma'sharal jinni wal insi inis tata'tum an tanfuzoo min aqtaaris samaawaati wal ardi fanfuzoo; laa tanfuzoona illaa bisultaan
ayah.translation: O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allah].

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Yursalu 'alaikumaa shuwaazum min naarifiw-wa nuhaasun falaa tantasiraan
ayah.translation: There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke, and you will not defend yourselves.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Fa-izan shaqqatis samaaa'u fakaanat wardatan kaddihaan
ayah.translation: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Fa-yawma'izil laa yus'alu 'an zambiheee insunw wa laa jaann
ayah.translation: Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Yu'raful mujrimoona biseemaahum fa'yu'khazu binna waasi wal aqdaam
ayah.translation: The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Haazihee jahannamul latee yukazzibu bihal mujrimoon
ayah.translation: This is Hell, which the criminals deny.

ayah.transliteration: Yatoofoona bainahaa wa baina hameemim aan
ayah.translation: They will go around between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Wa liman khaafa maqaama rabbihee jannataan
ayah.translation: But for he who has feared the position of his Lord are two gardens -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Zawaataaa afnaan
ayah.translation: Having [spreading] branches.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehimaa 'aynaani tajriyaan
ayah.translation: In both of them are two springs, flowing.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehimaa min kulli faakihatin zawjaan
ayah.translation: In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaa furushim bataaa'inuhaa min istabraq; wajanal jannataini daan
ayah.translation: [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehinna qaasiratut tarfi lam yatmishunna insun qablahum wa laa jaaann
ayah.translation: In them are women limiting [their] glances, untouched before them by man or jinni -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: ka annahunnal yaaqootu wal marjaan
ayah.translation: As if they were rubies and coral.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Hal jazaaa'ul ihsaani illal ihsaan
ayah.translation: Is the reward for good [anything] but good?

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Wa min doonihimaa jannataan
ayah.translation: And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Mudhaaammataan
ayah.translation: Dark green [in color].

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehimaa 'aynaani nad daakhataan
ayah.translation: In both of them are two springs, spouting.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehimaa faakihatunw wa nakhlunw wa rummaan
ayah.translation: In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Feehinna khairaatun hisaan
ayah.translation: In them are good and beautiful women -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Hoorum maqsooraatun fil khiyaam
ayah.translation: Fair ones reserved in pavilions -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Lam yatmis hunna insun qablahum wa laa jaaann
ayah.translation: Untouched before them by man or jinni -

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -

ayah.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaa rafratin khudrinw wa 'abqariyyin hisaan
ayah.translation: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.

ayah.transliteration: Fabi ayyi aalaaa'i Rabbikumaa tukazzibaan.
ayah.translation: So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?

ayah.transliteration: Tabaarakasmu Rabbika Zil-Jalaali wal-Ikraam
ayah.translation: Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.

ayah.transliteration: Izaa waqa'atil waaqi'ah
ayah.translation: When the Occurrence occurs,

ayah.transliteration: Laisa liwaq'atihaa kaazibah
ayah.translation: There is, at its occurrence, no denial.

ayah.transliteration: Khafidatur raafi'ah
ayah.translation: It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].

ayah.transliteration: Izaa rujjatil ardu rajjaa
ayah.translation: When the earth is shaken with convulsion

ayah.transliteration: Wa bussatil jibaalu bassaa
ayah.translation: And the mountains are broken down, crumbling

ayah.transliteration: Fakaanat habaaa'am mumbassaa
ayah.translation: And become dust dispersing.

ayah.transliteration: Wa kuntum azwaajan salaasah
ayah.translation: And you become [of] three kinds:

ayah.transliteration: Fa as haabul maimanati maaa as haabul maimanah
ayah.translation: Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?

ayah.transliteration: Wa as haabul mash'amati maaa as haabul mash'amah
ayah.translation: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?

ayah.transliteration: Wassaabiqoonas saabiqoon
ayah.translation: And the forerunners, the forerunners -

ayah.transliteration: Ulaaa'ikal muqarraboon
ayah.translation: Those are the ones brought near [to Allah]

ayah.transliteration: Fee Jannaatin Na'eem
ayah.translation: In the Gardens of Pleasure,

ayah.transliteration: Sullatum minal awwaleen
ayah.translation: A [large] company of the former peoples

ayah.transliteration: Wa qaleelum minal aa khireen
ayah.translation: And a few of the later peoples,

ayah.transliteration: 'Alaa sururim mawdoonah
ayah.translation: On thrones woven [with ornament],

ayah.transliteration: Muttaki'eena 'alaihaa mutaqabileen
ayah.translation: Reclining on them, facing each other.

ayah.transliteration: Yatoofu 'alaihim wildaa num mukkhalladoon
ayah.translation: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal

ayah.transliteration: Bi akwaabinw wa abaareeq, wa kaasim mim ma'een
ayah.translation: With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -

ayah.transliteration: Laa yusadda'oona 'anhaa wa laa yunzifoon
ayah.translation: No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -

ayah.transliteration: Wa faakihatim mimmaa yatakhaiyaroon
ayah.translation: And fruit of what they select

ayah.transliteration: Wa lahmi tairim mimmaa yashtahoon
ayah.translation: And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.

ayah.transliteration: Wa hoorun'een
ayah.translation: And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,

ayah.transliteration: Ka amsaalil lu'lu'il maknoon
ayah.translation: The likenesses of pearls well-protected,

ayah.transliteration: Jazaaa'am bimaa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: As reward for what they used to do.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yasma'oona feehaa laghwanw wa laa taaseemaa
ayah.translation: They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -

ayah.transliteration: Illaa qeelan salaaman salaamaa
ayah.translation: Only a saying: "Peace, peace."

ayah.transliteration: Wa as haabul yameeni maaa as haabul Yameen
ayah.translation: The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?

ayah.transliteration: Fee sidrim makhdood
ayah.translation: [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed

ayah.transliteration: Wa talhim mandood
ayah.translation: And [banana] trees layered [with fruit]

ayah.transliteration: Wa zillim mamdood
ayah.translation: And shade extended

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa'im maskoob
ayah.translation: And water poured out

ayah.transliteration: Wa faakihatin kaseerah
ayah.translation: And fruit, abundant [and varied],

ayah.transliteration: Laa maqtoo'atinw wa laa mamnoo'ah
ayah.translation: Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,

ayah.transliteration: Wa furushim marfoo'ah
ayah.translation: And [upon] beds raised high.

ayah.transliteration: Innaaa anshaanaahunna inshaaa'aa
ayah.translation: Indeed, We have produced the women of Paradise in a [new] creation

ayah.transliteration: Faja'alnaahunna abkaaraa
ayah.translation: And made them virgins,

ayah.transliteration: 'Uruban atraabaa
ayah.translation: Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,

ayah.transliteration: Li as haabil yameen
ayah.translation: For the companions of the right [who are]

ayah.transliteration: Sullatum minal awwa leen
ayah.translation: A company of the former peoples

ayah.transliteration: Wa sullatum minal aakhireen
ayah.translation: And a company of the later peoples.

ayah.transliteration: Wa as haabush shimaali maaa as haabush shimaal
ayah.translation: And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?

ayah.transliteration: Fee samoominw wa hameem
ayah.translation: [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water

ayah.transliteration: Wa zillim miny yahmoom
ayah.translation: And a shade of black smoke,

ayah.transliteration: Laa baaridinw wa laa kareem
ayah.translation: Neither cool nor beneficial.

ayah.transliteration: Innaahum kaanoo qabla zaalika mutrafeen
ayah.translation: Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaanoo yusirroona 'alal hinsil 'azeem
ayah.translation: And they used to persist in the great violation,

ayah.transliteration: Wa kaanoo yaqooloona a'izaa mitnaa wa kunnaa turaabanw wa izaaman'ainnaa lamab'oosoon
ayah.translation: And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

ayah.transliteration: Awa aabaaa'unal awwaloon
ayah.translation: And our forefathers [as well]?"

ayah.transliteration: Qul innal awwaleena wal aakhireen
ayah.translation: Say, [O Muhammad], "Indeed, the former and the later peoples

ayah.transliteration: Lamajmoo'oona ilaa meeqaati yawmim ma'loon
ayah.translation: Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."

ayah.transliteration: summa innakum ayyuhad daaalloonal mukazziboon
ayah.translation: Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,

ayah.transliteration: La aakiloona min shaja rim min zaqqoom
ayah.translation: Will be eating from trees of zaqqum

ayah.transliteration: Famaali'oona minhal butoon
ayah.translation: And filling with it your bellies

ayah.transliteration: Fashaariboona 'alaihi minal hameem
ayah.translation: And drinking on top of it from scalding water

ayah.transliteration: Fashaariboona shurbal heem
ayah.translation: And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.

ayah.transliteration: Haazaa nuzuluhum yawmad deen
ayah.translation: That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu khalaqnaakum falaw laa tusaddiqoon
ayah.translation: We have created you, so why do you not believe?

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytum maa tumnoon
ayah.translation: Have you seen that which you emit?

ayah.transliteration: 'A-antum takhluqoo nahooo am nahnul khaaliqoon
ayah.translation: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu qaddarnaa baina kumul mawta wa maa nahnu bimasbooqeen
ayah.translation: We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone

ayah.transliteration: 'Alaaa an nubaddila amsaalakum wa nunshi'akum fee maa laa ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad 'alimtumun nash atal oolaa falaw laa tazakkaroon
ayah.translation: And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytum maa tahrusoon
ayah.translation: And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?

ayah.transliteration: 'A-antum tazra'oonahooo am nahnuz zaari'ooon
ayah.translation: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?

ayah.transliteration: Law nashaaa'u laja'al naahu hutaaman fazaltum tafakkahoon
ayah.translation: If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,

ayah.transliteration: Innaa lamughramoon
ayah.translation: [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;

ayah.transliteration: Bal nahnu mahroomoon
ayah.translation: Rather, we have been deprived."

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytumul maaa'allazee tashraboon
ayah.translation: And have you seen the water that you drink?

ayah.transliteration: 'A-antum anzaltumoohu minal muzni am nahnul munziloon
ayah.translation: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?

ayah.transliteration: Law nashaaa'u ja'alnaahu ujaajan falaw laa tashkuroon
ayah.translation: If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?

ayah.transliteration: Afara'aytumun naaral latee tooroon
ayah.translation: And have you seen the fire that you ignite?

ayah.transliteration: 'A-antum anshaatum shajaratahaaa am nahnul munshi'oon
ayah.translation: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?

ayah.transliteration: Nahnu ja'alnaahaa tazkira tanw wa mataa'al lilmuqween
ayah.translation: We have made it a reminder and provision for the travelers,

ayah.transliteration: Fasabbih bismi Rabbikal 'azeem
ayah.translation: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

ayah.transliteration: Falaa uqsimu bimaawaa qi'innujoom
ayah.translation: Then I swear by the setting of the stars,

ayah.transliteration: Wa innahoo laqasamul lawta'lamoona'azeem
ayah.translation: And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.

ayah.transliteration: Innahoo la quraanun kareem
ayah.translation: Indeed, it is a noble Qur'an

ayah.transliteration: Fee kitaabim maknoon
ayah.translation: In a Register well-protected;

ayah.transliteration: Laa yamassuhooo illal mutahharoon
ayah.translation: None touch it except the purified.

ayah.transliteration: Tanzeelum mir Rabbil'aalameen
ayah.translation: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

ayah.transliteration: Afabihaazal hadeesi antum mudhinoon
ayah.translation: Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent

ayah.transliteration: Wa taj'aloona rizqakum annakum tukazziboon
ayah.translation: And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?

ayah.transliteration: Falaw laaa izaa balaghatil hulqoom
ayah.translation: Then why, when the soul at death reaches the throat

ayah.transliteration: Wa antum heena'izin tanzuroon
ayah.translation: And you are at that time looking on -

ayah.transliteration: Wa nahnu aqrabu ilaihi minkum wa laakil laa tubsiroon
ayah.translation: And Our angels are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -

ayah.transliteration: Falaw laaa in kuntum ghira madeeneen
ayah.translation: Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,

ayah.transliteration: Tarji'oonahaaa in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Bring it back, if you should be truthful?

ayah.transliteration: Fa ammaaa in kaana minal muqarrabeen
ayah.translation: And if the deceased was of those brought near to Allah,

ayah.transliteration: Farawhunw wa raihaa nunw wa jannatu na'eem
ayah.translation: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ammaaa in kaana min as haabil yameen
ayah.translation: And if he was of the companions of the right,

ayah.transliteration: Fasalaamul laka min as haabil yameen
ayah.translation: Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."

ayah.transliteration: Wa ammaaa in kaana minal mukazzibeenad daaalleen
ayah.translation: But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,

ayah.transliteration: Fanuzulum min hameem
ayah.translation: Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water

ayah.transliteration: Wa tasliyatu jaheem
ayah.translation: And burning in Hellfire

ayah.transliteration: Inna haaza lahuwa haqqul yaqeen
ayah.translation: Indeed, this is the true certainty,

ayah.transliteration: Fasabbih bismi rabbikal 'azeem
ayah.translation: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

ayah.transliteration: Sabbaha lillaahi maa fissamaawaati wal ardi wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ardi yuhyee wa yumeetu wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal Awwalu wal'Aakhiru waz Zaahiru wal Baatinu wa huwa bikulli shai'in Aleem
ayah.translation: He is the First and the Last, the Ascendant and the Intimate, and He is, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal arda fee sittati ayyaamin summas tawaa 'alal 'Arsh; ya'lamu maa yaliju filardi wa maa yakhruju minhaa wa maa yanzilu minas samaaa'i wa maa ya'ruju feeha wa Huwa ma'akum ayna maa kuntum; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Baseer
ayah.translation: It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you wherever you are. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Lahoo mulkus samaawaati wal ard; wa ilal laahi turja'ul umoor
ayah.translation: His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.

ayah.transliteration: Yoolijul laila fin nahaari wa yoolijun nahaara fil lail; wa Huwa 'Aleemum bizaatis sudoor
ayah.translation: He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and he is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Aaaminoo billaahi wa Rasoolihee wa anfiqoo mimmaa ja'alakum mustakh lafeena feehi fallazeena aamanoo minkum wa anfaqoo lahum ajrun kabeer
ayah.translation: Believe in Allah and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successors. For those who have believed among you and spent, there will be a great reward.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa lakum laa tu'minoona billaahi war Rasoolu yad'ookum lituu'minoo bi Rabbikum wa qad akhaza meesaaqakum in kuntum mu'mineen
ayah.translation: And why do you not believe in Allah while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee yunazzilu 'alaa 'abdiheee Aayaatim baiyinaatil liyukhrijakum minaz zulumaati ilan noor; wa innal laaha bikum la Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muhammad] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allah is to you Kind and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maa lakum allaa tunfiqoo fee sabeelil laahi wa lillaahi meeraasus samaawaati wal-ard; laa yastawee minkum man anfaqa min qablil fat-hi wa qaatal; ulaaaika a'zamu darajatam minal lazeena anfaqoo mim ba'du wa qaataloo; wa kullanw wa'adallaahul husnaa; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Khabeer
ayah.translation: And why do you not spend in the cause of Allah while to Allah belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allah has promised the best [reward]. And Allah, with what you do, is Acquainted.

ayah.transliteration: man zal lazee yuqridul laaha qardan hasanan fa yudaa'ifahoo lahoo wa lahooo ajrun kareem
ayah.translation: Who is it that would loan Allah a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?

ayah.transliteration: Yawma taral mu'mineena walmu'minaati yas'aa nooruhum baina aydeehim wa biaymaanihim bushraakumul yawma jannaatun tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feeha; zaalika huwal fawzul 'azeem
ayah.translation: On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yaqoolul munaa fiqoona walmunaafiqaatu lillazeena aamanun zuroonaa naqtabis min noorikum qeelarji'oo waraaa'akum faltamisoo nooran faduriba bainahum bisooril lahoo baab, baatinuhoo feehir rahmatu wa zaahiruhoo min qibalihi-'azaab
ayah.translation: On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.

ayah.transliteration: Yunaadoonahum alam nakum ma'akum qaaloo balaa wa laakinnakum fatantum anfusakum wa tarabbastum wartabtum wa gharratkumul amaaniyyu hatta jaaa'a amrul laahi wa gharrakum billaahil gharoor
ayah.translation: The hypocrites will call to the believers, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allah. And the Deceiver deceived you concerning Allah.

ayah.transliteration: Fal Yawma laa yu'khazu minkum fidyatunw wa laa minal lazeena kafaroo; maawaakumun Naaru hiya maw laakum wa bi'sal maseer
ayah.translation: So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Alam yaani laillzeena aamanooo an takhsha'a quloo buhum lizikril laahi wa maa nazala minal haqqi wa laa yakoonoo kallazeena ootul Kitaaba min qablu fataala 'alaihimul amadu faqasat quloobuhum wa kaseerum minhum faasiqoon
ayah.translation: Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allah and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: I'lamooo annal laaha yuhyil arda ba'da mawtihaa; qad baiyannaa lakumul Aayaati la'allakum ta'qiloon
ayah.translation: Know that Allah gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.

ayah.transliteration: Innal mussaddiqeena wal mussaddiqaati wa aqradul laaha qardan hassanany yudaa'afu lahum wa lahum ajrun kareem
ayah.translation: Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned Allah a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena aamanoo billaahi wa Rusuliheee ulaaa'ika humus siddeeqoona wash shuhadaaa'u 'inda Rabbihim lahum ajruhum wa nooruhum wallazeena kafaroo wa kazzaboo bi aayaatinaaa ulaaaika As haabul jaheem
ayah.translation: And those who have believed in Allah and His messengers - those are [in the ranks of] the supporters of truth and the martyrs, with their Lord. For them is their reward and their light. But those who have disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of Hellfire.

ayah.transliteration: I'lamooo annamal hayaa tud dunyaa la'ibunw wa lahwunw wa zeenatunw wa takaasurun bainakum wa takaasurn fil amwaali wal awlaad, kamasali ghaisin a'jabal kuffaara nabaatuhoo summa yaheeju fataraahu musfaaran summa yakoonu hutaamaa; wa fil aakhirati 'azaabun shadeedunw wa magh firatum minal laahi wa ridwaan; wa mal haiyaa tuddun yaaa illaa mataa'ul ghuroor
ayah.translation: Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allah and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.

ayah.transliteration: Saabiqooo ilaa maghfiratim mir Rabbikum wa jannatin 'arduhaa ka-'ardis samaaa'i wal ardi u'iddat lillazeena aamanoo billaahi wa Rusulih; zaalika fadlul laahi yu'teehi many yashaaa'; wal laahu zul fadlil 'azeem
ayah.translation: Race toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allah and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allah which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa asaaba mim musee batin fil ardi wa laa feee anfusikum illaa fee kitaabim min qabli an nabra ahaa; innaa zaalika 'alal laahi yaseer
ayah.translation: No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allah, is easy -

ayah.transliteration: Likailaa taasaw 'alaa maa faatakum wa laa tafrahoo bimaaa aataakum; wallaahu laa yuhibbu kulla mukhtaalin fakhoor
ayah.translation: In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -

ayah.transliteration: Allazeeena yabkhaloona wa yaamuroonan naasa bil bukhl; wa many yatawalla fa innal laaha Huwal Ghaniyyul Hameed
ayah.translation: [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Laqad arsalnaa Rusulanaa bilbaiyinaati wa anzalnaa ma'ahumul Kitaaba wal Meezaana liyaqooman naasu bilqist, wa anzalnal hadeeda feehi baasun shadeedunw wa manaafi'u linnaasi wa liya'lamal laahu many yansuruhoo wa Rusulahoo bilghaib; innal laaha Qawiyyn 'Azeez
ayah.translation: We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allah may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laqad arsalnaa Noohanw wa Ibraaheema wa ja'alnaa fee zurriyyatihiman nubuwwata wal Kitaaba faminhum muhtad; wa kaseerum minhum faasiqoon
ayah.translation: And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Summa qaffainaa 'alaa aasaarihim bi Rusulinaa wa qaffainaa be 'Eesab ni Maryama wa aatainaahul Injeela wa ja'alnaa fee quloobil lazeenat taba' oohu raafatanw wa rahmatanw wa rahbaaniyyatanib tada' oohaa maa katanaahaa 'alaihim illab tighaaa'a ridwaanil laahi famaa ra'awhaa haqqa ri'aayatihaa fa aatainal lazeena aamanoo minhum ajrahum wa kaseerum minhum faasiqoon
ayah.translation: Then We sent following their footsteps Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allah. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamaanut taqullaaha wa aaminoo bi Rasoolihee yu'tikum kiflaini mir rahmatihee wa yaj'al lakum nooran tamshoona bihee wa yaghfir lakum; wallaahu Ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Li'alla ya'lama Ahlul kitaabi allaa yaqdiroona 'alaa shai'im min fadlil laahi wa annal fadla bi Yadil laahi u'teehi many yashaaa'; wallaahu Zul fadilil 'azeem
ayah.translation: [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allah and that [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

ayah.transliteration: Qad sami'al laahu qawlal latee tujaadiluka fee zawjihaa wa tashtakeee ilal laahi wallaahu yasma'u tahaawurakumaa; innal laaha samee'um baseer
ayah.translation: Certainly has Allah heard the speech of the one who argues with you, [O Muhammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allah. And Allah hears your dialogue; indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Allazeena yuzaahiroona minkum min nisaaa'ihim maa hunnaa ummahaatihim in ummahaatuhum illal laaa'ee waladnahum; wa innaahum la yaqooloona munkaram minal qawli wa zooraa; wa innal laaha la'afuwwun ghafoor
ayah.translation: Those who pronounce thihar among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena yuzaahiroona min nisaaa'ihim summa ya'oodoona limaa qaaloo fatabreeru raqabatim min qabli any-yatamaaassaa; zaalikum too'azoona bih; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona khabeer
ayah.translation: And those who pronounce thihar from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Famal lam yajid fa siyaamu shahraini mutataabi'ayni min qabli any-yatamaaassaa famal lam yastati' fa-it'aamu sitteena miskeena; zaalika litu'minoo billaahi wa rasoolih'wa tilka hudoodul laah; wa lilkaafireena 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allah and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allah. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yuhaaaddoonal laaha wa Rasoolahoo kubitoo kamaa kubital lazeena min qablihim; wa qad anzalnaaa aayaatim baiyinaat; wa lilkaa fireena 'azaabum muheen
ayah.translation: Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yab'asuhumul laahu jamee'an fayunabbi'uhum bimaa 'amiloo; ahsaahul laahu wa nasooh; wallaahu 'alaa kulli shai'in shaheed
ayah.translation: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allah had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allah is, over all things, Witness.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara annal laaha ya'lamu maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi maa yakoonu min najwaa salaasatin illaa Huwa raabi'uhum wa laa khamsatin illaa huwa saadisuhum wa laaa adnaa min zaalika wa laaa aksara illaa huwa ma'ahum ayna, maa kaanoo summa yunabbi'uhum bimaa 'amiloo yawmal qiyaamah; innal laaha bikulli shai'in aleem
ayah.translation: Have you not considered that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There is in no private conversation three but that He is the fourth of them, nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did, on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara ilal lazeena nuhoo 'anin najwaa summa ya'oodoona limaa nuhoo 'anhu wa yatanaajawna bil ismi wal'udwaani wa ma'siyatir rasooli wa izaa jaaa'ooka haiyawka bimaa lam yuhai yika bihil laahu wa yaqooloona fee anfusihim law laa yu'azzibunal laahu bimaa naqool; hasbuhum jahannnamu yaslawnahaa fabi'sal maseer
ayah.translation: Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation, then they return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allah does not greet you and say among themselves, "Why does Allah not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo izaa tanaajaytum falaa tatanaajaw bil ismi wal 'udwaani wa ma'siyatir rasooli wa tanaajaw bil birri wattaqwaa wattaqul laahal lazeee ilaihi tuhsharoon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allah, to whom you will be gathered.

ayah.transliteration: Innaman najwaa minash shaitaani liyahzunal lazeena aamanoo wa laisa bidaaarrihim shai'an illaa bi-iznil laah; wa 'alal laahi falyatawakkalil mu'minoon
ayah.translation: Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed, but he will not harm them at all except by permission of Allah. And upon Allah let the believers rely.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo izaa qeela lakum tafassahoo fil majaalisi fafsahoo yafsahil laahu lakum wa izaa qeelan shuzoo fanshuzoo yarfa'il laahul lazeena aamanoo minkum wallazeena ootul 'ilma darajaat; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona khabeer
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; Allah will make space for you. And when you are told, "Arise," then arise; Allah will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanooo izaa naajitumur Rasoola faqaddimoo baina yadai najwaakum sadaqah; zaalika khairul lakum wa athar; fa il lam tajidoo fa innal laaha ghafoorur Raheem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: 'A-ashfaqtum an tuqaddimoo baina yadai najwaakum sadaqaat; fa-iz lam taf'aloo wa taabal laahu 'alaikum fa aqeemus Salaata wa aatuz Zakaata wa atee'ul laaha wa rasoolah; wallaahu khabeerum bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allah has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara ilal lazeena tawallaw qawman ghadibal laahu 'alaihim maa hum minkum wa laa minhum wa yahlifoona 'alal kazibi wa hum ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].

ayah.transliteration: A'addal laahu lahum 'azaaban shadeedan innahum saaa'a maa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

ayah.transliteration: Ittakhazooo aymaanahum junnatan fasaddoo 'an sabeelil laahi falahum 'azaabum muheen
ayah.translation: They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah, and for them is a humiliating punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Lan tughniya 'anhum amwaaluhum wa laaa awladuhum minal laahi shai'aa; ulaaa 'ika As haabun Naari hum feehaa khaalidoon
ayah.translation: Never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally

ayah.transliteration: Yawma yab'asuhumul laahujamee'an fa yahlifoona lahoo kamaa yahlifoona lakum wa yahsaboona annahum 'alaa shai'; alaaa innahum humul kaaziboon
ayah.translation: On the Day Allah will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something. Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.

ayah.transliteration: Istahwaza 'alaihimush shaitaanu fa ansaahum zikral laah; ulaaa'ika hizbush shaitaaan; alaaa innaa hizbash shaitaani humul khaasiroon
ayah.translation: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allah. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.

ayah.transliteration: Innal lazeena yuhaaaddoonal laaha wa Rasoolahooo ulaaa'ika fil azalleen
ayah.translation: Indeed, the ones who oppose Allah and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.

ayah.transliteration: Katabal laahu la aghlibanna ana wa Rusulee; innal laaha qawiyyun 'Azeez
ayah.translation: Allah has written, "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

ayah.transliteration: Laa tajidu qawmany yu'minoona billaahi wal yawmil aakhiri yuwaaaddoona man haaaddal laaha wa Rasoolahoo wa law kaanooo aabaaa'ahum aw abnaaa'ahum aw ikhwaa nahum aw 'asheeratahum; ulaaa'ika kataba fee quloobihi mul eemaana wa ayyadahum biroohimminhu wa yudkhilu hum jannatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaa; radiyal laahu 'anhum wa radoo 'anh; ulaaa 'ika hizbul laah; alaaa inna hizbal laahi humul muflihoon
ayah.translation: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allah. Unquestionably, the party of Allah - they are the successful.

ayah.transliteration: Sabbaha lillaahi maa fissamaawaati wa maa fil ardi wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazeee akharajal lazeena kafaroo min ahlil kitaabi min diyaarihim li awwalil Hashr; maa zanantum any yakhrujoo wa zannooo annahum maa ni'atuhum husoonuhum minal laahi faataahumul laahu min haisu lam yahtasiboo wa qazafa fee quloobihimur ru'ba yukhriboona bu yootahum bi aydeehim wa aydil mu'mineena fa'tabiroo yaaa ulil absaar
ayah.translation: It is He who expelled the ones who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.

ayah.transliteration: Wa law laaa an katabal laahu 'alaihimul jalaaa'a la'azzabahum fid dunyaa wa lahum fil Aakhirati 'azaabun Naar
ayah.translation: And if not that Allah had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahum shaaqqul laaha wa Rasoolahoo wa many yushaaaqqil laaha fa innal laaha shadeedul-'iqaab
ayah.translation: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allah - then indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

ayah.transliteration: Maa qata'tum mil leenatin aw taraktumoohaa qaaa'imatan'alaaa usoolihaa fabi iznil laahi wa liyukhziyal faasiqeen
ayah.translation: Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of Allah and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Wa maaa afaaa'al laahu 'alaaa Rasoolihee minhum famaaa awjaftum 'alaihi min khailiinw wa laa rikaabinw wa laakinnal laaha yusallitu Rusulahoo 'alaa many yashaaa'; wallaahu 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: And what Allah restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels, but Allah gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and Allah is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Maaa afaaa'al laahu 'alaa Rasoolihee min ahlil quraa falillaahi wa lir Rasooli wa lizil qurbaa wal yataamaa walmasaakeeni wabnis sabeeli kai laa yakoona doolatam bainal aghniyaaa'i minkum; wa maaa aataakumur Rasoolu fakhuzoohu wa maa nahaakum 'anhu fantahoo; wattaqul laaha innal laaha shadeedul-'iqaab
ayah.translation: And what Allah restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allah and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives and orphans and the [stranded] traveler - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allah; indeed, Allah is severe in penalty.

ayah.transliteration: Lilfuqaraaa'il Muhaaji reenal lazeena ukhrijoo min diyaarihim wa amwaalihim yabtaghoona fadlam minal laahi wa ridwaananw wa yansuroonal laaha wa Rasoolah; ulaaa'ika humus saadiqoon
ayah.translation: For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allah and [His] approval and supporting Allah and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the truthful.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena tabawwa'ud daara wal eemaana min qablihim yuhibboona man haajara ilaihim wa laa yajidoona fee sudoorihim haajatam mimmaa ootoo wa yu'siroona 'alaa anfusihim wa law kaana bihim khasaasah; wa many yooqa shuhha nafsihee fa ulaaa'ika humul muflihoon
ayah.translation: And [also for] those who were settled in al-Madinah and [adopted] the faith before them. They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what the emigrants were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.

ayah.transliteration: Wallazeena jaaa'oo min ba'dihim yaqooloona Rabbanagh fir lanaa wa li ikhwaani nal lazeena sabqoonaa bil eemaani wa laa taj'al fee quloobinaa ghillalil lazeena aamanoo rabbannaaa innaka Ra'oofur Raheem
ayah.translation: And [there is a share for] those who came after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."

ayah.transliteration: Alam tara ilal lazeena naafaqoo yaqooloona li ikhwaanihimul lazeena kafaroo min ahlil kitaabi la'in ukhrijtum lanakhrujanna ma'akum wa laa nutee'u feekum ahadan abadanw-wa in qootiltum lanansuran nakum wallaahu yashhadu innahum lakaaziboon
ayah.translation: Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But Allah testifies that they are liars.

ayah.transliteration: La'in ukhrijoo laa yakhrujoona ma'ahum wa la'in qootiloo laa yansuroonahum wa la'in nasaroohum la yuwallunnal adbaara summa laa yunsaroon
ayah.translation: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.

ayah.transliteration: La antum ashaddu rahbatan fee sudoorihim minal laah; zaalika bi annahum qawmul laa yafqahoon
ayah.translation: You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than Allah. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yuqaatiloonakum jamee'an illaa fee quram muhas sanatin aw minw waraaa'i judur; baasuhum bainahum shadeed; tahsabuhum jamee'anw-wa quloobuhum shatta; zaalika biannahum qawmul laa ya'qiloon
ayah.translation: They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.

ayah.transliteration: Kamasalil lazeena min qablihim qareeban zaaqoo wabaala amrihim wa lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Kamasalish shaitaani izqaala lil insaanik fur falammaa kafara qaala innee bareee'um minka inneee akhaaful laaha rabbal 'aalameen
ayah.translation: [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds."

ayah.transliteration: Fakaana 'aaqibatahumaaa annahumaa fin naari khaalidaini feehaa; wa zaalika jazaaa'uz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrong-doers.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanut taqul laa; waltanzur nafsum maa qaddamat lighadiw wattaqual laah; innal laaha khabeerum bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, fear Allah. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa takoonoo kallazeena nasul laaha fa ansaahum anfusahum; ulaaa'ika humul faasiqoon
ayah.translation: And be not like those who forgot Allah, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yastaweee as-haabun naari wa ashaabul jannah; as haabul jannati humul faaa'izoon
ayah.translation: Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].

ayah.transliteration: Law anzalnaa haazal quraana 'alaa jabilil lara aytahoo khaashi'am muta saddi'am min khashiyatil laah; wa tilkal amsaalu nadribuhaa linnaasi la'allahum yatafakkaroon
ayah.translation: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and coming apart from fear of Allah. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal-laahul-lazee laaa Ilaaha illaa Huwa 'Aalimul Ghaibi wash-shahaada; Huwar Rahmaanur-Raheem
ayah.translation: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed. He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal-laahul-lazee laaa Ilaaha illaa Huwal-Malikul Quddoosus-Salaamul Muminul Muhaiminul-'aAzeezul Jabbaarul-Mutakabbir; Subhaanal laahi 'Ammaa yushrikoon
ayah.translation: He is Allah, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Perfection, the Bestower of Faith, the Overseer, the Exalted in Might, the Compeller, the Superior. Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal Laahul Khaaliqul Baari 'ul Musawwir; lahul Asmaaa'ul Husnaa; yusabbihu lahoo maa fis samaawaati wal ardi wa Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner; to Him belong the best names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa tattakhizoo 'aduwwee wa 'aduwaakum awliyaaa'a tulqoona ilaihim bilmawaddati wa qad kafaroo bima jaaa'akum minal haqq, yukhrijoonar Rasoola wa iyyaakum an tu'minoo billaahi rabbikum in kuntum kharajtum jihaadan fee sabeelee wabtighaaa'a mardaatee; tusirroona ilaihim bilma waddati wa ana a'alamu bimaaa akhfaitum wa maaa a'lantum; wa many yaf'alhu minkum faqad dalla sawaaa'as sabeel
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not take My enemies and your enemies as allies, extending to them affection while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth, having driven out the Prophet and yourselves [only] because you believe in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking means to My approval, [take them not as friends]. You confide to them affection, but I am most knowing of what you have concealed and what you have declared. And whoever does it among you has certainly strayed from the soundness of the way.

ayah.transliteration: Iny yasqafookum yakoonoo lakum a'daaa'anw wa yabsutooo ilaikum aydiyahum wa alsinatahum bissooo'i wa waddoo law takfuroon
ayah.translation: If they gain dominance over you, they would be to you as enemies and extend against you their hands and their tongues with evil, and they wish you would disbelieve.

ayah.transliteration: Lan tanfa'akum arhaamukum wa laaa awlaadukum; yawmal qiyaamati yafsilu bainakum; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloon baseer
ayah.translation: Never will your relatives or your children benefit you; the Day of Resurrection He will judge between you. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Qad kaanat lakum uswatun basanatun feee Ibraaheema wallazeena ma'ahoo iz qaaloo liqawmihim innaa bura'aaa'u minkum wa mimmaa ta'budoona min doonil laahi kafarnaa bikum wa badaa bainanaa wa bainakumul 'adaawatu wal baghdaaa'u abadan hattaa tu'minoo billaahi wahdahooo illaa qawla Ibraheema li abeehi la astaghfiranna laka wa maaa amliku laka minal laahi min shai; rabbanaa 'alaika tawakkalnaa wa ilaika anabnaa wa ilaikal maseer
ayah.translation: There has already been for you an excellent pattern in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "Indeed, we are disassociated from you and from whatever you worship other than Allah. We have denied you, and there has appeared between us and you animosity and hatred forever until you believe in Allah alone" except for the saying of Abraham to his father, "I will surely ask forgiveness for you, but I have not [power to do] for you anything against Allah. Our Lord, upon You we have relied, and to You we have returned, and to You is the destination.

ayah.transliteration: Rabbana laa taj'alnaa fitnatal lillazeena kafaroo waghfir lanaa rabbanaa innaka antal azeezul hakeem
ayah.translation: Our Lord, make us not [objects of] torment for the disbelievers and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, it is You who is the Exalted in Might, the Wise."

ayah.transliteration: Laqad kaana lakum feehim uswatunhasanatul liman kaana yarjul laaha wal yawmal aakhir; wa many yatawalla fa innal laaha huwal ghaniyyul hameed
ayah.translation: There has certainly been for you in them an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever turns away - then indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Asal laahu any yaj'ala bainakum wa bainal lazeena 'aadaitum minhum mawaddah; wallahu qadeer; wallahu ghafoorur raheem
ayah.translation: Perhaps Allah will put, between you and those to whom you have been enemies among them, affection. And Allah is competent, and Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Laa yanhaakumul laahu 'anil lazeena lam yuqaatilookum fid deeni wa lam yukhrijookum min diyaarikum an tabarroohum wa tuqsitooo ilaihim; innal laaha yuhibbul muqsiteen
ayah.translation: Allah does not forbid you from those who do not fight you because of religion and do not expel you from your homes - from being righteous toward them and acting justly toward them. Indeed, Allah loves those who act justly.

ayah.transliteration: Innamaa yanhaakumul laahu 'anil lazeena qaatalookum fid deeni wa akhrajookum min diyaarikum wa zaaharoo 'alaa ikhraajikum an tawallawhum; wa many yatawallahum faulaaa'ika humuz zaalimoon
ayah.translation: Allah only forbids you from those who fight you because of religion and expel you from your homes and aid in your expulsion - [forbids] that you make allies of them. And whoever makes allies of them, then it is those who are the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo izaa jaaa'akumul mu'minaatu muhaajiraatin famtah inoohunna Allaahu a'lamu bieemaanihinna fa in 'alimtumoohunna mu'minaatin falaa tarji'oohunna ilal kuffaar; laa hunna hillul lahum wa laa hum uahilloona lahunna wa aatoohum maa anfaqoo wa laa junaaha 'alaikum an tankihoohunna izaaa aataitumoohunna ujoorahunn; wa laa tumsikoo bi 'isamil kawaafiri was'aloo maaa anfaqtum walyas'aloo maaa anfaqoo zaalikum hukmul laahi yahkumu bainakum wallaahu 'aleemun hakeem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, when the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah is most knowing as to their faith. And if you know them to be believers, then do not return them to the disbelievers; they are not lawful [wives] for them, nor are they lawful [husbands] for them. But give the disbelievers what they have spent. And there is no blame upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due compensation. And hold not to marriage bonds with disbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgement of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Wa in faatakum shai'um min azwaajikum ilal kuffaari fa'aaqabtum fa aatul lazeena zahabat azwaajuhum misla maaa anfaqoo; wattaqul laahal lazeee antum bihee mu'minoon
ayah.translation: And if you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers and you subsequently obtain [something], then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent. And fear Allah, in whom you are believers.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhan nabbiyyu izaa jaaa'akal mu'minaau yubaai naka 'alaaa allaa yushrikna billaahi shai 'anw wa laa yasriqna wa laa yazneena wa laa yaqtulna awlaadahunna wa laa yaateena bibuhtaaniny yaftaree nahoo baina aydeehinna wa arjulihinna wa laa ya'seenaka fee ma'roofin fabaayi'hunna wastaghfir lahunnal laaha innnal laaha ghafoorur raheem
ayah.translation: O Prophet, when the believing women come to you pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, nor will they steal, nor will they commit unlawful sexual intercourse, nor will they kill their children, nor will they bring forth a slander they have invented between their arms and legs, nor will they disobey you in what is right - then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena amanoo laa tatawallaw qawman ghadibal laahu 'alaihim qad ya'isoo minal aakhirati kamaa ya'isal kuffaaru min as haabil quboor
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, do not make allies of a people with whom Allah has become angry. They have despaired of [reward in] the Hereafter just as the disbelievers have despaired of [meeting] the inhabitants of the graves.

ayah.transliteration: Sabbaha lillaahi maa fisamaawaati wa maa fil ardi wa huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem
ayah.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allah, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Yaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo lima taqooloona maa laa taf'aloon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, why do you say what you do not do?

ayah.transliteration: Kabura maqtan 'indal laahi an taqooloo maa laa taf'aloon
ayah.translation: Great is hatred in the sight of Allah that you say what you do not do.

ayah.transliteration: Innal laaha yuhibbul lazeena yuqaatiloona fee sabeelihee saffan kaannahum bunyaanum marsoos
ayah.translation: Indeed, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in a row as though they are a [single] structure joined firmly.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qaala Moosa liqawmihee yaa qawmi lima tu'zoonanee wa qat ta'lamoona annee Rasoolul laahi ilaikum falammaa zaaghooo azaaghal laahu quloobahum; wallaahu laa yahdil qawmal faasiqeen
ayah.translation: And [mention, O Muhammad], when Moses said to his people, "O my people, why do you harm me while you certainly know that I am the messenger of Allah to you?" And when they deviated, Allah caused their hearts to deviate. And Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

ayah.transliteration: Wa iz qaala 'Eesab-nu-Mayama yaa Banee Israaa'eela innee Rasoolul laahi ilaikum musaddiqal limaa baina yadayya minat Tawraati wa mubashshiram bi Rasooliny yaatee mim ba'dis muhooo Ahmad; falammaa jaaa'ahum bil baiyinaati qaaloo haazaa sihrum mubeen
ayah.translation: And [mention] when Jesus, the son of Mary, said, "O children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you confirming what came before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger to come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidences, they said, "This is obvious magic."

ayah.transliteration: Wa man azlamu mimma nif taraa 'alal laahil kaziba wa huwa yad'aaa ilal Islaam; wallaahu laa yahdil qawmaz zaalimeen
ayah.translation: And who is more unjust than one who invents about Allah untruth while he is being invited to Islam. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

ayah.transliteration: Yureedoona liyutfi'oo nooral laahi bi afwaahimim wallaahu mutimmu noorihee wa law karihal kaafiroon
ayah.translation: They want to extinguish the light of Allah with their mouths, but Allah will perfect His light, although the disbelievers dislike it.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee arsala Rasoolahoo bilhudaa wa deenil haqqi liyuzhirahoo 'alad deeni kullihee wa law karihal mushrikoon
ayah.translation: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of truth to manifest it over all religion, although those who associate others with Allah dislike it.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aammano hal adullukum 'alaa tijaaratin tunjeekum min 'azaabin aleem
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?

ayah.transliteration: Tu'minoona billaahi wa Rasoolihee wa tujaahidoona fee sabeelil laahi bi amwaalikum wa anfusikum; zaalikum khairul lakum in kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: [It is that] you believe in Allah and His Messenger and strive in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That is best for you, if you should know.

ayah.transliteration: Yaghfir lakum zunoobakum wa yudkhilkum Jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru wa masaakina taiyibatan fee Jannaati 'Ad; zaalikal fawzul 'Azeem
ayah.translation: He will forgive for you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow and pleasant dwellings in gardens of perpetual residence. That is the great attainment.

ayah.transliteration: Wa ukhraa tuhibboonahaa nasrum minal laahi wa fat hun qaree; wa bashshiril mu 'mineen
ayah.translation: And [you will obtain] another [favor] that you love - victory from Allah and an imminent conquest; and give good tidings to the believers.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamaanoo koonooo ansaaral laahi kamaa qaala 'Eesab-nu-Maryama lil Hawaariyyeena man ansaareee ilal laah; qaalal Hawaariyyoona nahnu ansaa rul laahi fa aamanat taaa'ifatum mim Bannee Israaa'eela wa kafarat taaa'ifatun fa ayyadnal lazeena aammanoo 'alaa 'aduwwihim fa asbahoo zaahireen
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, be supporters of Allah, as when Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters for Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters of Allah." And a faction of the Children of Israel believed and a faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.

ayah.transliteration: Yusabbihu lilaahi maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardil Malikil Quddoosil 'Azeezil Hakeem
ayah.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah, the Sovereign, the Pure, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee ba'asa fil ummiyyeena Rasoolam min hum yatloo 'alaihim aayaatihee wa yuzakkeehim wa yu'allimuhumul Kitaaba wal Hikmata wa in kaano min qablu lafee dalaalim mubeen
ayah.translation: It is He who has sent among the unlettered a Messenger from themselves reciting to them His verses and purifying them and teaching them the Book and wisdom - although they were before in clear error -

ayah.transliteration: Wa aakhareena minhum lammaa yalhaqoo bihim wa huwal 'azeezul hakeem
ayah.translation: And [to] others of them who have not yet joined them. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika fadlul laahi yu'teehi many-yashaaa; wallaahu zul fadil 'azeem
ayah.translation: That is the bounty of Allah, which He gives to whom He wills, and Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

ayah.transliteration: Masalul lazeena hum milut tawraata summa lam yahmiloonhaa kamasalil himaari yah milu asfaaraa; bi'sa masalul qawmil lazeena kaazzaboo bi aayaatil laah; wallaahu laa yahdil qawmazzaalimeen
ayah.translation: The example of those who were entrusted with the Torah and then did not take it on is like that of a donkey who carries volumes [of books]. Wretched is the example of the people who deny the signs of Allah. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

ayah.transliteration: Qul yaaa ayyuhal lazeena haadoo in za'amtum annakum awliyaaa'u lilaahi min doonin naasi fatamannawul mawta in kuntum saadiqeen
ayah.translation: Say, "O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are allies of Allah, excluding the [other] people, then wish for death, if you should be truthful."

ayah.transliteration: Wa laa yatamannaw nahooo abadam bimaa qaddamat aydeehim; wallaahu 'aleemum bix zaalimeen
ayah.translation: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have put forth. And Allah is Knowing of the wrongdoers.

ayah.transliteration: Qul innal mawtal lazee tafirroona minhu fa innahoo mulaaqeekum summa turaddoona ilaa 'Aalimil Ghaibi wash shahaadati fa yunabbi'ukum bimaa kuntum ta'maloon
ayah.translation: Say, "Indeed, the death from which you flee - indeed, it will meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, and He will inform you about what you used to do."

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo izaa noodiya lis-Salaati miny yawmil Jumu'ati fas'aw ilaa zikril laahi wa zarul bai'; zaalikum khayrul lakum in kuntum ta'lamoon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, when [the adhan] is called for the prayer on the day of Jumu'ah [Friday], then proceed to the remembrance of Allah and leave trade. That is better for you, if you only knew.

ayah.transliteration: Fa-izaa qudiyatis Salaatu fantashiroo fil ardi wabtaghoo min fadlil laahi wazkurul laaha kaseeral la'allakum tuflihoon
ayah.translation: And when the prayer has been concluded, disperse within the land and seek from the bounty of Allah, and remember Allah often that you may succeed.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra'aw tijaaratan aw lahwanin faddooo ilaihaa wa tarakooka qaaa'imaa; qul maa 'indal laahi khairum minal lahwi wa minat tijaarah; wallaahu khayrur raaziqeen
ayah.translation: But when they saw a transaction or a diversion, [O Muhammad], they rushed to it and left you standing. Say, "What is with Allah is better than diversion and than a transaction, and Allah is the best of providers."

ayah.transliteration: Izaa jaaa'akal munaafiqoona qaaloo nashhadu innaka la rasoolul laah; wallaahu ya'lamu innaka la rasooluhoo wallaahu yashhadu innal munaafiqeena lakaaziboon
ayah.translation: When the hypocrites come to you, [O Muhammad], they say, "We testify that you are the Messenger of Allah." And Allah knows that you are His Messenger, and Allah testifies that the hypocrites are liars.

ayah.transliteration: Ittakhazoo aymaanahum junnatan fasaddoo 'an sabeelil laah; innahum saaa'a maa kaanoo ya'maloon
ayah.translation: They have taken their oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allah. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahum aamanoo summa kafaroo fatubi'a 'alaa quloobihim fahum laa yafqahoon
ayah.translation: That is because they believed, and then they disbelieved; so their hearts were sealed over, and they do not understand.

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa ra aytahum tu'jibuka ajsaamuhum wa iny yaqooloo tasma' liqawlihim kaannahum khushubum musannadah; yahsaboona kulla saihatin 'alaihim; humul 'aduwwu fahzarhum; qaatalahumul laahu annaa yu'fakoon
ayah.translation: And when you see them, their forms please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech. [They are] as if they were pieces of wood propped up - they think that every shout is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May Allah destroy them; how are they deluded?

ayah.transliteration: Wa izaa qeela lahum ta'aalaw yastaghfir lakum rasoolul laahi lawwaw ru'oo sahum wa ra aytahum yasuddoona wa hum mustakbiroon
ayah.translation: And when it is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside and you see them evading while they are arrogant.

ayah.transliteration: Sawaaa'un 'alaihim as taghfarta lahum am lam tastaghfir lahum lany yaghfiral laahu lahum; innal laaha laa yahdil qawmal faasiqeen
ayah.translation: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; never will Allah forgive them. Indeed, Allah does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

ayah.transliteration: Humul lazeena yaqooloona laa tunfiqoo 'alaa man inda Rasoolil laahi hatta yanfaddoo; wa lillaahi khazaaa' inus samaawaati wal ardi wa laakinnal munaafiqeena la yafqahoon
ayah.translation: They are the ones who say, "Do not spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah until they disband." And to Allah belongs the depositories of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

ayah.transliteration: Yaqooloona la'ir raja'naaa ilal madeenati la yukhrijanal a'azzu minhal azall; wa lillaahil 'izzatu wa li Rasoolihee wa lilmu'mineena wa laakinnal munaafiqeena laa ya'lamoon
ayah.translation: They say, "If we return to al-Madinah, the more honored [for power] will surely expel therefrom the more humble." And to Allah belongs [all] honor, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.

ayah.transliteration: Yaaa ayyuhal lazeena aamanoo la tulhikum amwaalukum wa laa awlaadukum 'anzikril laah; wa mai-yaf'al zaalika fa-ulaaa'ika humul khaasiroon
ayah.translation: O you who have believed, let not your wealth and your children divert you from remembrance of Allah. And whoever does that - then those are the losers.

ayah.transliteration: Wa anifqoo mim maa razaqnaakum min qabli any-yaatiya ahadakumul mawtu fa yaqoola rabbi law laaa akhkhartaneee ilaaa ajalin qareebin fa assaddaqa wa akum minassaaliheen
ayah.translation: And spend [in the way of Allah] from what We have provided you before death approaches one of you and he says, "My Lord, if only You would delay me for a brief term so I would give charity and be among the righteous."

ayah.transliteration: Wa lany yu 'akhkhiral laahu nafsan izaa jaaa'a ajaluhaa; wallaahu khabeerum bimaa ta'maloon
ayah.translation: But never will Allah delay a soul when its time has come. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Yusabbihu lillaahi maa fis samaawaati wa maa fil ardi lahul mulku wa lahul hamd, wa Huwa 'alaa kulli shai 'in Qadeer
ayah.translation: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth is exalting Allah. To Him belongs dominion, and to Him belongs [all] praise, and He is over all things competent.

ayah.transliteration: Huwal lazee khalaqakum faminkum kaafirunw wa min kum mu'min ; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Baseer
ayah.translation: It is He who created you, and among you is the disbeliever, and among you is the believer. And Allah, of what you do, is Seeing.

ayah.transliteration: Khalaqas samaawaati wal arda bilhaqqi wa sawwarakum fa ahsana suwarakum wa ilaihil maseer
ayah.translation: He created the heavens and earth in truth and formed you and perfected your forms; and to Him is the [final] destination.

ayah.transliteration: Ya'lamu maa fis samaawaati wal ardi wa ya'lamu maa tusirroona wa maa tu'linoon; wallaahu 'Aleemum bizaatis sudoor
ayah.translation: He knows what is within the heavens and earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.

ayah.transliteration: Alam yaatikum naba'ul lazeena kafaroo min qablu fazaaqoo wabaala amrihim wa lahum 'azaabun aleem
ayah.translation: Has there not come to you the news of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.

ayah.transliteration: Zaalika bi annahoo kaanat taateehim Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati faqaaloo a basharuny yahdoonanaa fakafaroo wa tawallaw; wastaghnal laah; wallaahu ghaniyyun hameed
ayah.translation: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said, "Shall human beings guide us?" and disbelieved and turned away. And Allah dispensed [with them]; and Allah is Free of need and Praiseworthy.

ayah.transliteration: Za'amal lazeena kafarooo al-lany yub'asoo; qul balaa wa rabbee latub'asunna summa latunabba'unna bimaa 'amiltum; wa zaalika 'alal laahi yaseer
ayah.translation: Those who disbelieve have claimed that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes, by my Lord, you will surely be resurrected; then you will surely be informed of what you did. And that, for Allah, is easy."

ayah.transliteration: Fa-aaminoo billaahi wa rasoolihee wannooril lazeee anzalnaa; wallaahu bima ta'maloona khabeer
ayah.translation: So believe in Allah and His Messenger and the Qur'an which We have sent down. And Allah is Acquainted with what you do.

ayah.transliteration: Ywma yajma'ukum li yawmil jam'i zaalika yawmut taghaabun; wa many-yumim billaahi wa ya'mal saalihany yukaffir 'anhu sayyi aatihee wa yudkhilhu jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaaa abadaa; zaalikal fawzul 'azeem
ayah.translation: The Day He will assemble you for the Day of Assembly - that is the Day of Deprivation.
